Consumer complaint narrative:
Purchased an item through XXXX on XX/XX/year> and paid via debit card through PayPal. I had to cancel the order immediately due to incorrect shipping and then re-order. My bank ( since the item was purchased via debit card via third party ) didnt reflect the charge as the item hadnt been processed yet ( it was cancelled ) but the second order had gone through, item was shipped and was received promptly. 

Fast forward to XXXX XXXX I was charged by PayPal again for the item I had already paid for ( debited transaction proof in statements ) and received the item. I understand that due to the cancellation, their payment systems go wonky so I figured this would be an easy fix. 

I open a support ticket for PayPal, XXXX, and my bank providing all necessary proof with statements and a detailed description describing what had happened. My bank investigated and obliged my request. XXXX looked through the transactions and explained it was nearly a hold and the funds will be returned ( which they were ). 

PayPal responded by locking my account, claiming I reversed a charge. They closed my support ticket and found their records to be correct. They left me XXXX option for rebuttal or even a means to contact a customer service rep so I can explain the situation. I have a strong feeling that my case wasnt even heard/reviewed and I was penalized in spite of being a long-time customer. With that, I was charged a dispute fee which they do not mention until you read their fine print. It was not even shown in my recent activity/balance as a deducted charge, money was just missing. 

Becoming increasingly fed up, I decided that I was going to close my PayPal account. Doing so has been a near impossibility. Their instructions detail that you can do this easily through their app, but when you click close account it takes you to their support page FAQ and when you type in close account on the search bar, they provide instructions that take you right back to step one. Their close account button isnt even a real action on their app, its just there for show.

The first appointment I made ( XX/XX/24 ) I was contacted the next day to inform me that no one had the expertise at that location to assist me with opening a business account. So I made another appointment the same day for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was contacted by phone by the Personal Banker, XXXX XXXX XXXX, who immediate told me that if I didnt have an EIN number that I could not open a business account. She kept insisting that I email her what I had so she could verify if I could open an account. I explained to her that I was at work and I needed to come into the bank so that I could fully understand because I was new at starting a business. I went online the same day and got an EIN number for my LLC. When I arrive for my appointment, XXXX XXXX XXXX stated that I was unable to open a business account due to my address. She sat for over 30 minutes doing and saying nothing to assist me. I stated that she just spoke to me and said all I needed was an EIN number. She told me that she didnt tell me that. I requested the EIN number just minutes after getting off the phone with her. It was clear that she did not want to help me and XXXX XXXX XXXX filed a complaint, without asking me, about me being misinformed on opening a business account. I told her that I felt unwelcome at my own bank and that I was filing a complaint because I have no trust in someone that lack professionalism and treats me with the lack of respect of my time, with my account and money in bank. I scheduled another appointment on XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a detailed complaint against Popular Bank concerning an ATM deposit discrepancy and the bank 's subsequent handling of my claims. On XX/XX/XXXX, at approximately XXXXXXXX XXXX, I attempted to deposit three XXXX bills ( {$300.00} in total ) into my account ( ID XXXX ) at ATM # XXXX. The machine only processed two of the bills, resulting in a deposit of only {$100.00} into my account, despite all bills being genuine. ( The machine kept two {$100.00} bills and returned back one to me. ) Upon noticing the error of only {$100.00} being credited to my account, I filed a claim with Popular Bank within 48 hours of the incident, on XX/XX/XXXX. I was assigned claim number XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a response via regular mail in which the bank acknowledged the possibility of an error but concluded that the claimed error did not occur. The letter 's contradictory nature and the repeated mention of an " error '' raised concerns about the thoroughness of the investigation. 

Following the bank 's advice, I requested the documents used to base their decision. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received truncated documents. However, with my background as a XXXX XXXX, I identified two distinct timestamps that corroborated my claim : genuine notes were detected at XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, validating that two {$100.00} bills were accepted by the ATM. 

I contacted the bank again on XX/XX/XXXX, speaking with an employee named XXXX XXXX. I explained how the documents supported my claim and requested a further review of my case. XXXX XXXX opened a new claim, number XXXX. However, the response to this claim was a dismissive letter that failed to address the specific facts of my situation and stated that the case was closed. 

In-Person Visit and Lack of Follow-Up : As a last resort, on XX/XX/XXXX, I visited the " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' branch of Popular Bank and discussed my situation with the branch manager, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Despite acknowledging the discrepancy highlighted by the timestamps, she informed me that the ATMs are managed by a third-party and implied that the branch could not resolve the issue directly. This visit, recommended by one of the bank 's letters, resulted in further disappointment due to misdirection and lack of subsequent communication promised by the branch manager. 

Current Status : As of today, XX/XX/XXXX, there has been no follow-up contact from the bank or any progress toward resolving my complaint. This series of interactions not only highlights the financial loss but also illustrates a pattern of disregard for customer concerns and a lack of accountability from Popular Bank. 

The bank 's handling of my claims has been disdainful and unempathetic, causing significant distress and loss of productive hours. The lack of professionalism and failure to adequately investigate and address the discrepancy has compelled me to seek assistance from the CFPB. 

I respectfully request the CFPB 's intervention to ensure a comprehensive investigation is conducted and to help facilitate a fair resolution. The evidence I have provided clearly supports my claim, and I believe that my rights as a consumer have been violated.

Consumer complaint narrative: The morning of XXXX  the XXXX I called my bank chime inc to request a new card. I called the number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX outgoing call and they called me back at XXXX and I was under the impression that I was talking to the bank, and I was not I was talking to a scammer. They informed me they were real. They wasnt going to take my money. They were chime. Informed me multiple times after telling me I could trust them. I then downloaded an app. They told me that It was protocol to verify my identity for chime. I then proceeded to download the app XXXX  XXXX XXXX. they then proceeded to tell me to send money through my checking and savings account to verify I was real while I was on the phone the whole time they were taking my money. The man on the phone was still saying he could be trusted. I sent the money forcefully not knowing it wasnt my bank. It was a security breach through chime. I called my bank and my bank called me back. I was under the impression the whole time I was talking to my bank and when my money was gone in all accounts checking savings and credit builder. He hung up the phone. I then called back immediately and the number was disconnected. I was very very upset. I cried and cried. I had no other options. I just got paid my paycheck the day before. All of my money missing. XXXX in every account. I called chime begging and pleading to dispute my charges and please please help me. I have a family to feed and babies to take care of. They told me there was nothing they could do. It was all my fault. I sent the money. They couldnt dispute my charges and nor did they want too no one could help me get my money back. I then had to go take a title loan out to be able to survive the next XXXX weeks without any money for me or my children. I could only get a small loan with a XXXX percent interest rate. All because I had got scammed. I called the police right after and made a police report. I will add that below. I contacted chime and those emails will also be below. I made a police report and a chime fraud report and still couldnt get my money back. I have yet to get any money or any help through chime. I then saw the news article about chime inc being found guilty of illegally forcing consumers to waive their legal right and failing to provide security to consumers. As a result chime is required to refund affected consumers XXXX XXXX dollars to CFPBs victims relief fund. I am a victim of this crime and I will do everything in my power to get my hard working money back for me and my childrens sake.

I tried to send XXXX  Complaints/Disputes through its Online Message Center beginning on XX/XX/year>. For one week, it was not operational for me. Finally, on XX/XX/XXXX it worked. The following two messages ( previously composed ) were submitted.

1 ) I received an email from the bank this afternoon ( XX/XX/year> ) that there was a CARD NOT PRESENT TRANSACTION made on my account today. Both the merchant 's name and location were identified only with a code of letters and/or numbers, impossible to determine who or where the merchant is. I have not used my credit card, not ordered or purchased anything, for the past two weeks. I logged in to my account, clicked report fraud several times but the bank 's website would not open. XXXX without identification of a merchant name. Only XXXX was posted as a description. XXXX XXXX ) Continued ..... I then tried to send an online message to the bank also several times, but appeared " ERROR Unfortunately, we are experiencing technical difficulties at this time. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause you. There is nothing to click on the bank 's website to dispute a charge. The bank must accept my dispute of this transaction ; and, reverse the charge of {$10.00}. XXXX Because there was no merchant identified and because I had no idea what XXXX was, I attempted to dispute the charge online. However, XXXX INTENTIONALLY discourages from consumers from disputing by having no way to do so online unlike most credit card issuers and servicers. 
And, XXXX has faulty IT online. 
In any case, XXXX did not respond to my two messages! 
Finally, I called XXXX and stated that I wanted to dispute the charge, and informed XXXX that there was neither a way to submit a dispute online or, for that matter, to report possible fraud. I asked XXXX to take a dispute from me. XXXX refused to do so, but stated that it would close my account and would refer the matter to its fraud department. 
Dated XX/XX/XXXX XXXX sent me a generic letter stating a Fraud Investigatorwill call you. XXXX Fraud Department never called! XXXX did not give me the opportunity to provide any information or ask any questions whatsoever. 
Dated XXXX XXXX XXXX sent me another generic letter stating we have denied your claim due to the fact that you participated in the transaction. Not only did I not only never participate, but XXXX XXXX, the XXXX employee who signed the letter, never provided any proof whatsoever of the NON-EXISTENT participation with a still UNKNOWN MERCHANT. XXXX XXXX XXXX LIED!!! Neither my card ( which XXXX admits ) was present, nor I. 
Furthermore, she wrote that I could contact the merchant about the product or service provided. XXXX XXXX did not investigate anything, as she clearly did not know whether the charge was a product or service. Similarly, I do not know, owing to XXXX FAKE INVESTIGATION. 
When XXXX HIRES EMPLOTYEES, using only WOKE CRITERIA, but not evaluating QUALIFICATIONS, it harms the consuming public. Failing to properly train newly hired or promoted WOKE EMPLOYEES also harms the consuming public. 
I have found that UNKNOWN EMPLOYEE ( S ) at XXXX have CRIMINALLY added the same charge TWICE MORE. In short, the original disputed erroneous charge is now tripled! 
XXXX XXXX, XXXX of XXXX, has been asleep at the wheel. Its technology is failing, its employees are lying and stealing. XXXX is a danger to Americans.

Consumer complaint narrative: I recently opened a new business account with Citibank in XXXX XXXX, XXXX branch. Successfully made a deposit and got everything setup. Before I received the debit card, I went on vacation outside of the country. When I returned, I went to branch and told them that I never received the debit card, they helped me filed a replacement card which is supposed to come in the mail. In the mean time they told me I could just come to the counter anytime I need to withdraw. It was only the 3rd time that I had to go in and withdraw cash and make an international wire, the lady who was helping me with the wire had to speak with someone at the back office. They were on the phone, I was right in front of the counter. The person from the back office asked a few questions, and I replied honestly. Next thing the lady told they decided to not allow the international wire and put my account for review. Next thing, they gave me a number to call fraud protection department. I called and waited for 1 hour. A rep simply told me that the decision of account closure was made and theres no further information he can provide. Made a second call to customer service, same answer. Made a third call to their small business service, waited another hour. I was redirected, and same answer. Now ALL my business funds are being withheld by this company for no legal reason and the potential of damage they bring to me is devastating. And after long hours of searching the internet for help, this seems like to only thing I can do at the moment. I just had a new born daughter, she is everything to me. Im under heavy financial burden as a regular person and a father. I cant believe a international bank can do things like this to harm a client and our trust. Please help. Please.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX XXXX XXXX I used Chase Online Pill Pay to make a payment in the amount of XXXX from my checking account. On that date the funds were debited from my account. Last week, the payee indicated that he did not receive the funds. The bank is unable to prove the funds were deposited in another account, if the check was cashed, or tell me who has the funds. They have not provided me with proof of payment or proof that the transaction had completion due to this being older than 13 months. This dispute is ongoing. It is also a violation of the EFTA. The notice I see on my end is that the transaction is COMPLETE but I nor the payee has the funds and the payee wants me to pay it still. Ive checked the State Treasury website for unclaimed property to see if escheatment process has initiated but do not see any reported unclaimed property to myself or the payee from Chase Bank. The money has fallen into a black hole, i.e. to Chase Bank. There is definitely a problem in the banking system that is allowing uncashed online bill pay checks to be debited regardless if it remains uncashed. There is also no way for me to know that the payment was never received unless the payee brings it to my attention. The online system does not have a pending status for guaranteed funds that do not get deposited on their online Bill Pay. Who else uses Chase Online Bill Pay to send money to grandchildren, long distance friends and relatives, or any individual who are not merchants? Who else may have funds debited for their accounts but nobody actually received it?

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX account created XXXX XXXX XXXX This letter is regarding the account listed above, which you claim is a collection that I have with your company. This is a formal notice that your claim is disputed. 
I am requesting validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please note that I am requesting " validation* ; that is competent evidence bearing my signature, showing that I have ( or ever had ) some contractual obligation to pay you. 
Please also be aware that any negative mark found on my credit reports ( including XXXX, Transunion and XXXX ) from your company or any company that you represent, for a debt that I don't owe, is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act FDCPA 807 [ 15 USC 1962e ] ; therefore, if you can not validate the debt, you must request that all credit reporting agencies delete the entry.

Pending the outcome of my investigation of any evidence that you submit, you are instructed to take ne action that could be detrimental to any of my credit reports. 
Failure to respond within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter will result in small claims legal actinike against your company at my local venue. I will be seeking up to {$5000.00} in damages for : 1 ) Defamation 2 ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3 ) Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act Dislike You will be required to appear in a court venue local to me, since you are clearly doing business in my For the purposes of 15 USC 1692 et seq, this Notice has the same effect as a dispute to the validity alleged debt and a dispute to the validity of your claims. 
Please Note : This notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you wO be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request for information only. and is not a statement, election, or waiver of status.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXXResolution SpecialistRegulatory ComplaintsBank of America Dear XXXX XXXX, My grandfather always taught me to get to the root of an issue, and his advice resonates now more than ever : " If you want the truth, let the person speak. '' I appreciate the time you took to document Bank of Americas response on XX/XX/year>, but there are several inaccuracies in your timeline and handling of this matter that must be addressed. 

First, your claim that we first contacted Bank of America ( BOA ) on XX/XX/year>, is incorrect. Our initial contact with BOA occurred around XX/XX/year>, regarding our concerns with XXXX. This timeline is critical to our case, as it establishes the prolonged efforts we made to resolve the matter directly with XXXX and the subsequent delays caused by BOAs handling of our claim. I personally spoke to a BOA representative on XX/XX/XXXX, explaining in detail that we paid XXXX directly for services that were never rendered by the vendors promoted on their platform. I also emphasized that we had a thorough paper trail documenting our attempts to resolve the issue with XXXX, which included numerous emails over the course of four months. 

Despite XXXX claim of responding within 72 hours, they failed to provide any meaningful support or resolution. It wasnt until late XX/XX/year>, after repeated follow-ups and escalating frustration, that XXXX finally respondedonly after I used strong language to prompt a reply. These emails, including timestamps, were submitted to BOA as part of our case documentation. 

Second, your statement that I contacted BOA on XX/XX/year>, to dispute multiple claims is also incorrect. I called on that date because a BOA supervisor advised me to follow up for an update on my XX/XX/XXXX claim. To my dismay, the agent I spoke with on XX/XX/XXXX informed me that no record of the claim submitted on XX/XX/XXXX could be found. I was asked to resend the claim to the same fax number I had used previously, for which I have proof of receipt. This mishandling of my claim caused unnecessary delays and further exacerbated my frustration. 

Third, your assertion that my XX/XX/year>, submission fell outside the dispute timeframe lacks clarity and transparency. I have repeatedly requested a written explanation of the specific timeframe BOA follows, yet none has been provided. Based on our timeline, this process began on XX/XX/year>, when your agent advised us to continue seeking resolution with XXXX. BOA had more than sufficient documentation to begin the claim process at that time. Penalizing us for following your agents advice and exhausting all avenues with XXXX is unjust. 

To clarify, during the span of this dispute, we incurred {$14000.00} in payments to XXXX. Despite this, we limited our claim to {$6000.00}, focusing only on the services we paid for but did not receive. Your denial of Claim # XXXX on XX/XX/year>, citing the merchant proving the validity of the transaction, is flawed. The validity of the transaction has never been in question. The issue is that services paid for were not rendered, which is the basis of our claim. The distinction is critical : the transaction occurred, but the services promised were never delivered. 

In closing, we demand resolution. Specifically, we request that BOA pay the remaining balance of our original claim, {$6000.00}. Additionally, we urge you to stop issuing generic responses and address the core issue of this dispute with transparency and fairness. Our paper trail and documentation substantiate our position, and we expect BOA to act with integrity and accountability. 

Please ensure that this matter is addressed promptly and thoroughly. We will escalate our complaint further if necessary, as we are committed to seeking justice. 

We also demand any further communication be directed by a Supervisor of the Regulatory department. We have loss faith with the many claims that have been handle by agents, We demand a Supervisor call and/or respond to this complaint. Nothing less will be accepted.

Chase said they would stop payment since everything was pending and credit back all of the claims I filed, totaling about XXXX XXXX I had just opened the account and had only had my debit card for about a week or soso after the claims are filed, a new debit card is sent out, etc, I got credits back from chase in the amount for each fraudulent charge.. and tonight XX/XX/23, I check my checking account via the chase app and notice a CLAIM REVERSAL IN THE AMOUNT OF XXXX $!!!! So idk how claims work, but it appears that chase is leaping to a conclusion that because I ordered expensive shoes similarly to the fraudulent charge, that I must have submitted a false claim???? WHICH IS NOT TRUE!! Im just absolutely disgusted by this entire process..I have XXXX children, Im a XXXX at a local restaurant, I decided to bank with chase because its very close to my new work and was convenient for me to do nightly cash deposits after workbut since this has happened, I transferred all but a small amount to my old bank, whom I never had not one issue with in 4 years of being a customerTwo weeks with chase and theres fraudulent activity and then this? Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023, I ordered a portable air conditioner from XXXX for {$470.00}. It was marked delivered at around XXXX on XX/XX/2023, but the picture attached to the XXXX  tracking number provided was not at my house. I have cameras and no delivery driver ( or anyone for that matter ) came onto my property. I searched around my house and immediate neighbors houses just to be sure, with no luck. After reaching out to the Merchant ( XXXX ) they informed me since XXXX provided a proof of delivery ( even with it being at the incorrect house ) they would not be able to help me with a refund and I should dispute this charge with my credit card company, American Express. I put in the dispute ( Ref. NoXXXX  ) the next day, providing a detailed written explanation as to why this charge was being disputed, along with photos of my house both in person and on XXXX XXXX to corroborate the fact that it was NOT delivered to my house, the house in the photo XXXX  provided does NOT match. I expected a prompt and easy resolution, what I have recieved couldn't be further from that. The dispute has been continuously closed in XXXX favor over and over, NONE of the agents will look at the proof I have provided to them. They are taking the " proof of delivery '' from XXXX, provided by XXXX, and claiming that since XXXX says the item is delivered I am not entitled to a refund. This is not what the dispute process is for/about. I have already reached out to the merchant myself, and was unable to reach a resolution. The product was never recieved, THUS the dispute. It is supposed to be their job to investigate this incident, and instead of doing any investigation of the proof ALREADY PROVIDED they just keep continuing to reach out to XXXX and ask them if I deserve a refund. This is absolutely frivolous. Of course, the merchant is not going to say I should be refunded when I have already reached out and asked for a refund that they denied. The whole point is for an investigation to take place, to look at the evidence available. I have provided evidence while XXXX has nothing but a page saying " yes it was delivered to this address '' I am absolutely shocked at this process and the outcome. I will continue to dispute the charge with Amex as long as I have to, I will NOT be paying almost XXXX dollars for an item I never recieved. 

I will include the pictures mentioned previously ( of my house and the XXXX  delivery photo to the INCORRECT house ) with this complaint. These photos have already been submitted to Amex and they do not review them.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I observed a {$9.00} charge on my BMO credit card ending in XXXX. Upon inquiry, I was told the card was closed without my knowledge. I was transferred 6 times between customer service and rewards. Neither party was able to articulate which transactions led to the {$9.00} charge. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted BMO again. BMO said a supervisor will call me to explain the charge. I waited. No one called. 

To prevent debt, I logged in to ensure my automatic payment is working. However, upon log-in, I received conflicting messages. The page went from you will not be charged, to no automatic payment will be processed, to 500 Internal Server Error, to a BMO homepage with no access to any credit card accounts given their closed status.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Can't use card to make purchases
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year> my husband and I were traveling for almost a month through XXXX hitting multiple major cities in XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. Part of this trip was by land and part via a cruise. 

Upon arriving in XXXX we attempted to book train tickets to XXXX to reach as a stopover to XXXX. 

When attempting to purchase we never hit submit or anything on the site but were still charged and never received our tickets. 

Worried we got scammed we contacted Capital One to try to claw back the {$600.00} or so dollars we were charged for the XXXX tickets. 

We mentioned we were concerned we XXXX have encountered fraud and they now had our cc information. 

Without proper warning or talking us through any sort of process Capital One prematurely cancelled my credit card. This left my husband and I stranded without additional funds since we primarily use XXXX in the States but a lot of countries don't accept XXXX ( we use them for checking and for XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 

They then offered to ship the new card to my location which wouldn't work because we were spending XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX in each location until we hopped on a cruise ship. 

Fast forward to when we finally had our parents send us the new card details so we could use XXXX XXXX with the new card while still traveling Capital One decided to pause my account due to " potential fraudulent activity. '' Their reasoning was since my account was closed and a new card issued they had to pause my account since there was spending on it ( mainly hotel and taxi costs ). However, I never heard back from their frud department on this " case. '' Capital One was also knowledgeable about my travels as I had mentioned on every single call, with every single rep that we would be traveling for a month and even stated to which countries. 

I submitted documents to prove my identity while in XXXX and my account was supposedly " lifted. '' When trying to pay for out hotel stay ( again because XXXX is not widely accepted ) my card was declined. 

When I called to ask why they said because the hotel was processing the payment as a cash advance and not a transaction and that the requested cash advance amount was over the limit my card allows. My husband on the other hand was able to process all hotel transactions just fine on either his XXXX or using his own lower-tier Capital One card and never had ANY of these issues. 

We were assured that when using the card for normal purchases and taxi 's it should work just fine. 

When we arrived in XXXX we went to make a purchase at a local antique dealer and again my card was declined. When I called this time they said my account was on hold yet again due to fraudulent activity. They requested even more information ( bank statements, utility bills, etc ) to prove my identity a second time. I was in XXXX so there way little I could do and since most bills are in my husband 's name this proved difficult. When explaining this I was offered an insincere apology and told unless provided my account would remain locked. 

This all took place in XX/XX/year>. It's not XX/XX/year> and I still do not have access to my account. Every document we send is not approved, they are unwilling to tell me why my account is suspended or what triggered so many locks on my account when my husband hasn't received XXXX despite having a lower-tier Capital One card he used the entire trip. Never once flagged for fraud. 

I find it to be extremely frustrating to have to continue to prove my identity despite supplying bank statements, account details, bills, my license, etc. I should be able to know exactly what triggered my account, why I'm being targeted etc before going through this nonsense, and be allowed to offer other ways to verify identity other than a utility bill like passport, social security card, etc that are LEGAL documents proving I am who I am. 

I am disgusted with Capital One and will never open another account with them Do not sign up for the XXXX XXXX  as it is NOT a travel card despite how they market it.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
My husband and I were targets of a phishing / phone spoof scam. 

On the evening of XX/XX/2025, I was targeted by a sophisticated scam that resulted in a fraudulent {$5900.00} USD transaction through my PayPal account. A scammer spoofed my banks caller ID, making it appear as a legitimate call from my bank, and claimed to be from their fraud protection team. They falsely stated that someone had taken a {$5900.00} loan in my name via PayPal and tricked me into protecting my funds by sending the money through PayPal, assuring me I wouldnt be held accountable. During the call, they phished my husbands bank login credentials, which they used to further deceive us. I the account holder, did not authorize this transaction my husband made the transfer under the scammers deception. We realized the scam shortly after and took immediate action : I pulled funds from our bank account to prevent the transfer, reported it to our banks fraud team, and filed a police report. The banks investigation verified suspicious activity related to the spoofed call and stolen credentials but ultimately closed their case, refusing to cover the loss. I also opened a fraud claim with PayPal the same day, explaining the situation. However, PayPal closed my claim within a week, stating that I still owe the {$5900.00} because it was an authorized transaction, despite it being under fraudulent pretenses. They have not allowed me to appeal through their app. On or around XX/XX/2025, PayPal sent a notice stating my account has a negative balance of {$5900.00} USD, which is now due, and provided a contact number ( XXXX ) .This transaction was not truly authorized I, the account holder, did not approve it, and it was only made because we were deceived by a scammer impersonating my bank. I have substantial evidence : a police report documenting the scam and bank documents verifying the suspicious activity, including the spoofed bank number. PayPals refusal to acknowledge this as fraud is unfair and violates consumer protection standards. My husband and I have excellent credit, and we are extremely concerned this negative balance will be sent to collections, damaging her credit. We are unable to pay this amount under any circumstances due to financial hardship.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request to Match Higher Opening Bonus for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Chase Customer Service, I am writing to request a match for the new XXXX XXXX card offer of XXXX bonus miles on my newly applied and recently upgraded XXXX XXXX card. 

In XXXX, I applied for the XXXX XXXX Chase credit card through a flight attendant referral code and was approved for an opening bonus of XXXX miles. Shortly after my approval, this credit card product got " upgraded '' to a new version by Chase Bank and the bank has been promoting it to the public with a debut offer of XXXX miles ( see attachment ). Around the same time, I received notification from Chase bank about my card has been automatically upgraded by the bank to this new version, with a significant increase on the card 's annual fee, raising it from {$95.00} to {$150.00} ( see attachment ). 

After a careful comparison, I realize that my XXXX XXXX card after this involuntary upgrade became exactly the same card as the " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' card that is currently being promoted by Chase bank with a much higher opening bonus of XXXX miles ; and their annual fees are the same as well. It is absolutely not fair for certain customers to receive XXXX fewer miles at the same annual cost for the same credit card product. 

I would greatly appreciate it if you would consider matching your current promotion - an open bonus of XXXX miles, for my card. Such a gesture would ensure my satisfaction and encourage my future enrollment as a Chase Private Client.

Thank you for your understanding and consideration. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I enrolled in a payment program with Amex on XX/XX/XXXX. They requested I made a payment that would be for the month of XXXX. They confirmed as I asked that the payment was for XXXX and no other payment would be required until XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I noticed my account saying I had a payment due for XXXX so I contacted them, they told me the system would take some days to reflect my payment. From there on, I contacted Amex 2-3 a week and every time they confirmed my payment for XXXX was done and the system was having a glitch, would fix itself and so forth. 
After the due date I started getting emails saying I missed my payment and the system doubled my payment for XXXX. I contacted Amex, again they said was a system error. 
Finally they said the person that took my payment posted it before my statement close date and they should have waited a day. They said another department had to fix it and would call me in 3-4 days. It's been over 2 weeks since that and I already called Amex another 5-6 times since as I never got a call. Every time they say the same, they are escalating and someone will call me in 1 days, 2-3 days, 3-5 days.. and I never get a call. I am exhausted and this is unacceptable in every possible way. I first told them about the issue on XX/XX/XXXX, it will be a month next week and they have lead me on, given me wrong information and I have spent over 15-20 hours on calls and chats with them. Will they compensate my for all the hours I have used due to their lack of competence? This issue should have been fixed when I first brought it up to their attention.

Consumer complaint narrative: My complaint point is about facing undue hardship, regularly communicating with capital one. Paying paymentplans timely and still ending up with a restricted account because capital one failed to communicate and ensure that as a customer reaching out for help, specifically communicate to me where I fall within the120 days when initiating a payment plan. The dates of my payment plan should have been adjusted where the terms allowed for the payment plan to be resolved and balance paid withing the 120 days. The consequences of making a payment plan that resolves the balance outside of the 120 days should have been specifically communicated to me also. Holding capital one accountable for their falure to uphold offer to help customers to get their account back on track, as advertised. Their failure to communicate my pastdue timelibe, ensure the payment plan would resolve my balance to prevent further delinquency and restriction resulted in a payment plan sceduled outside of the 120 day rule by 3 days yeilding restriction to my account. To be clear account was restricted 3 days before my last payment in the payment plan was completed. This could have been avoided. I hold captialone responsible for failure to communicate and ensure the support that they offer with helping you get back on track if youve faced hardship, does infact get you back on track to a positive standing with capital one. I have reached out directly to capital one on this. Their representatives seems to have trouble following the timeline of my account, I've had to prove I was in a payment plan and paid timely. I requested transcript of calls to prove that terms and past due timeline was discussed. This has not been provided. I requested restriction to be lifted and a case was opened. A rep left a voicemail to report the status of my case but when I returned the call capital one refused to transferred me to that department and told me the case was closed restriction lift was refused, no explanation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Ref : XXXX Dear American Express XXXX I, XXXX XXXX XXXX the consumer and natural person, was denied credit by American Express when I applied for a Blue Cash Preferred from American Express credit card. 
Adverse action against a consumer is AGAINST THE LAW according to the Equal Credit Opportunity Act which is codified in 15 U.S.C 1691c and is pursuant to civil liability under 15 U.S.C 1692k.

American Express is subject to criminally liability for violating 15 U.S.C 1691 as I have proof that I was discriminated against by American Express due to the response I received.

American Express is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1642, U.S.C 1681m AND 12 cfr 1002 because I, the consumer, made an application in good faith, but credit was not issued. 
Furthermore, because my social security number ( credit card ) was used and I received NO benefit, this is proof of fraudulent activity ( unauthorized use of credit card ) on behalf of American Express.

I purchased furniture from Ashley furniture store in XXXX of XXXX for {$4200.00}. The XXXX and XXXX at the time convinced me to purchase the furniture by taking out a line of credit with 0 % apr which was on promotion from Synchrony. I informed them several times I did not want a credit card, and was assured that this was not a credit card. I signed the paper work for this promotion, and a few weeks later I received a credit card in the mail... I was angry, but it was not worth fighting at the time, given it was still 0 % interest. 

2.5 years later, On XX/XX/XXXX, I looked at my account expecting to see that I owed less than {$1000.00}. What I found instead was that my balance was {$4000.00} with {$3100.00} payed in interest! According to them, they had deferred all my payments to interest and said that I was notified via my statements. For 2.5 years I payed my bill with autopay setup, which they apparently set for less money than what was required to meet their requirements for deferred interest. Its a scam, and they used deceitful and confusing tactics. The last 6 months I payed {$900.00} with XXXX going straight to interest! And I was unaware! 

My receipt first page states that I signed up for synchrony XXXX XXXX XXXX payments, which I assume mean XXXX XXXX XXXX  payments, however that is not what I got. My first few statements were steady, then drastically dropped off each month. Again, another tactic to make me miss the XXXX XXXX mark ( which I was unaware of ). On the second page of my receipt, the salesman wrote that I had Synchrony for 12 months. I think he got lost in his own deceit. To further add to this deceit, I have no documentation of the " loan '' /credit card itself. Nothing explaining this apparent XXXX XXXX deferred interest promotion. My account on the Synchrony website also has no documentation or explanation of the terms of this account. With no available documentation, how can this be legal!?!?! 

I spoke to countless Synchrony customer support specialists, and worked my way to the final person. Explaining the situation to each one. Each and everyone said I was wrong, and owed them the money regardless of what I was told. They said all that mattered was what I signed and I owed them an additional {$4000.00} regardless of what I said or who I talked to. 

I immediately paid the balance to prevent any further interest charges, but still feel like I am owed all of that interest back, {$3100.00}!

Hello, I had purchased a couch with two ottomons online at XXXX XXXX, based off of XXXX WA on XX/XX/24. The company website says guaranteed to ship in 7days but the couch didn't arrive until XX/XX/24. When the product arrived one of the pieces of couch was missing and they shipped a wrong item instead of it. I took pictures and immediately emailed the evidence to the company. I signed the BOL that the delivery team presented on their device which showed missing item. I rejected the wrong piece. I wasn't given the opportunity to selected the options on that device. ( This added info is missing from BOL that merchant provided to the bank ) I requested the company a expedited replacement for the missing piece but the company couldn't deliver it within a reasonable amount of time. So, I requested a full return and refund after the merchandise gets picked-up for which the company started to threaten me and said they will charge me for shipping costs and sue me if they find anything negative about the transaction on social media. They presented the condition of my silence on social media in exchange for a full return and refund. This evidence is in the email i submitted to CHASE bank and I uploaded it here also. 

I disputed the charge on my credit card with CHASE on XX/XX/24 and provided mountain of evidence pictures and email correspondence. 
The merchant later on XX/XX/24 after I submitted the dispute sent return labels but will not address my concern about refunding original shipping costs in the scenario that the items shipped were incorrect. 
CHASE Bank today XX/XX/24 closed the dispute saying the charge was valid. They requested more info yesterday XX/XX/24 after merchant review, which I provided with the Bill of lading of the return that I did on XX/XX/24. When I spoke to them on XX/XX/24, they assured me that they will continue to dispute based on the evidence of return of merchandise but they did not. The person I spoke to XXXX will not transfer me to the supervisor. They have ignored all my evidence and spent no time looking at the evidence I uploaded. 

Now I do not have the merchandise and have a credit card bill for {$3400.00} to pay. Original Transaction amount XXXX. 

Please help. As a consumer I feel lost, violated of my rights and unheard. I have more evidence if needed.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I fell victim to a horrific incident where I was XXXX XXXX, and XXXX assaulted by an individual wanted by the FBI. 

During the robbery, the perpetrator illicitly conducted bank transfers from my personal phone using the Chase app. 

Despite providing Chase Bank with extensive evidence, including official documents related to the case, they have refused to refund my money. 

Chase Bank 's reasoning for denying my claim is based on the fact that the transfers were authorized using Face ID. However, I was unconscious at the time, rendering their argument baseless and absurd. 

Regrettably, I find myself in a situation where Chase has declined to refund the funds that were fraudulently taken from my account. Despite exhausting all avenues within the fraud department and other conventional channels, including numerous hours spent on calls, my efforts have proved fruitless. 

The unauthorized transactions in question involve XXXX XXXX transfers made on XX/XX/2023, totaling {$4300.00}. These transfers comprised three charges from my personal account and XXXX from my business account. I have attached copies of the charges for your reference. 

Chase 's reasoning for refusing the refund is perplexing. They contend that, as the transfers were conducted via XXXX and authenticated with Face ID, they are absolved from responsibility. However, I have diligently provided them with all relevant documents substantiating the details of the case, to no avail. 

For your reference, the case has been assigned the following number : XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On multiple occasions Prosper declines my payment on my recurring water bill. I have called on multiple occasions to authorize the payment. I'm told it is rectified to then find out within a month or so it happens again. My card gets locked, I have to call each time and deal with this nonsense. 

Each time they decline the payment I'm charged a {$25.00} NSF fee even though I have sufficient credit and I have authorized the water company. 

Approximately XX/XX/year>, the day my first granddaughter came home, I had 2 guys walking around my front yard. I opened the door and asked what they were doing and they were going to turn my water off. I was caught up with the baby and didn't realize the payment had been declined multiple times. I have proof of the charges which have cost over {$100.00} now. 

What is stemming this complaint is I'm tired of having to pay the NSF fee when it is Prospers system. So I called and asked them to credit my account the {$25.00} as I do not think it is fair for me to suffer the fee when this continues to be a Prosper problem. 

I was informed today by XXXX, a supervisor at Prosper, said there is absolutely nothing I can do. I asked who I could speak with, she said no one. I asked, you're telling me that I can authorize the payment with my water company, and Prosper declines, I'm charged a fee, and I have to just deal with it. How is this fair? 

I have spent months trying to get this resolved. My water company thinks I am a deadbeat. I'm embarrassed, Prosper has defamed my character, the anguish, distress and the hours I have wasted is simply not fair and as far as I am concerned Prosper is unwilling to do anything about it.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/, I purchased an engine for {$1000.00} via XXXX using PayPal but immediately canceled the order due to a shipping issue. PayPal confirmed the cancellation and marked the payment as refunded on XX/XX/XXXX. However, on XX/XX/XXXX, PayPal withdrew the funds anywayafter I had already placed a corrected orderresulting in a total of {$2100.00} withdrawn 2 days after the transaction was marked as " refunded ''. This duplicate withdrawal overdrew my bank account by nearly {$800.00}, freezing our only means of accessing food, gas, and other essentials. 

I contacted PayPal multiple times, but they consistently failed to understand or address the situation. Support staff gave conflicting explanations, cited unrelated policies, and repeatedly blamed me without offering any meaningful resolution. They refused to clarify refund timelines, used vague terms like transaction complete, and kept changing dates with no transparency or accountability. 

It has now been more than five business days since the duplicate charge. The refund, which was supposedly processed on XX/XX/XXXX, has not been returned. Most recently, I was told I would need to wait until XX/XX/XXXX, but even that timeline has passed with no update or change in my account. 

I am now caught between conflicting information from PayPal, my account dashboard, and my bankwith no clear indication of where my money is. The financial and emotional toll has been severe. PayPals system failure and lack of transparency have caused avoidable and damaging consequences to me and my family.

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising about the credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Capital One was offering a promotional offer for a welcome bonus for their capital savor one card. The promotional offer is advertised on their website and through credit karma declaring there is a {$200.00} welcome bonus for new account member sign-ups for this particular card, if they spend {$500.00} within 3-months. 

I have complied with their terms and conditions, and reached out to their customer service inquiring the status of when I would receive the welcome bonus but was notified I was not eligible. 

The customer service member failed to declare why I was not eligible for the reward offer based on the terms and Conditions. 

I requested the terms and conditions and was notified that they did not have the terms and conditions to share with me and that no one would be able to supply me the terms or conditions or explain why I was not eligible. 

I opened up my account on XX/XX/2023 and have exceeded the {$500.00} requirement by early XXXX which fulfilled their requirement prior to XXXX. 

Capital One refuses to provide any additional information indicating why I was not eligible for the welcome bonus and refuses to provide me the terms and conditions to show that I was not eligible for the welcome bonus that was bring offered on their capital savor one card.

I'm trying to open an online account with Citizens Bank. It asks for personal information - Social Security number, birthday, etc. But when I enter my the information, it does NOT hide my typing with *** asterisks *** as it should. I don't have internet at home and use library computers where anyone walking by can see what I'm typing ; also, librarians can see my screen from their computers in the office. 

This is VERY insecure and puts the customer at risk of having his identity stolen. And it's probably illegal. Doesn't the law require banks to safeguard customers ' private information? 

When Citizens informs me that this problem has been fixed, I'll open an account online. 

If Citizens refuses to fix this problem, or tells me that I must waste my time going into a branch to open an account, I will file further complaints with the XXXX  and AG.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I booked a vacation package with XXXX over the phone. I was clearly told by their representative that I could cancel the entire package ( hotel and flight ) within XXXX hours without penalty. Due to an urgent immigration concern, I attempted to canceled the package on XX/XX/year>, approximately XXXX hours later. 

Sensing from the Priceline representative that there might be an issue with honoring the cancellation, I immediately called Barclaysthe issuer of my credit cardto warn them that the upcoming charge from Priceline was unauthorized. At that time, the charge had not yet posted to my account. I specifically requested that the transaction be flagged and that my account be closed to prevent further unauthorized activity. 

Despite this proactive and timely effort, Barclays allowed the charge to post. I later filed a formal dispute, but they only temporarily and partially refunded the amount. I have since received conflicting responses from Priceline about the hotel portion being non-refundablecontrary to the terms I was promised. 

I previously filed a complaint with the CFPB, but it was closed with a conclusion that I had not provided enough proof. I am now re-filing this complaint because : I was never given a chance to explain that the cancellation was made by phone, so I never received a written confirmation. 

I acted in good faith to cancel and dispute the charge before it was posted. 

I closed my account specifically to protect myself, and yet the charge was still processed. 

Barclays failed to protect me as a consumer. I am asking CFPB to reopen or reconsider this case, and to hold Barclays accountable for not blocking an unauthorized transaction, despite timely notice. I also request a full and permanent refund of the charge and confirmation that my rights under the Fair Credit Billing Act were honored.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I went into a XXXX to purchase a money order for {$2700.00}. {$1000.00} was paid in cash and {$1700.00} was purchased in my Chime debit card to pay rent. The money order machine was not working and the employee voided the transaction. The XXXX employee assured me that the transaction would not go past pending on my debit card since it was voided shortly after and refunded the cash immediately. On XX/XX/year> the transaction posted. I disputed the transaction with Chime the same day XX/XX/year> and provided the voided receipt as evidence. The claim was denied. I asked for documentation as to why it was denied which was promised but never sent. The only documentation they provided ( sent on XX/XX/XXXX ) didnt make sense as to why it was proof ( its included as an attachment to this complaint ). They said I could file a rebuttal with more proof. I filed the dispute again on XX/XX/XXXX and this time went back to the XXXX store where I attempted to purchase the money order and asked if they could reprint my receipt and if a manager could write a letter verifying that the transaction was indeed voided. The manager checked security footage, transaction records, then talked to the employee who helped me. After this research he agreed to write me a letter to help my dispute because it was clear I should have received a refund. This letter included his name and the phone number of the store if follow up was needed. ( All evidence I provided has also been uploaded ) the claim was again denied on XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted Chime and asked why it was again denied. They stated that the dispute was filed under the wrong category and would be filed under transaction not refunded. On XX/XX/XXXX an email was sent requesting to answer questions about the transaction. Which I responded to in a typed letter and uploaded via a link. On XX/XX/XXXX the request was denied again.

My account or card ( I've received mixed information ) has been placed on hold and my account has been under review since XX/XX/year> ( 2 days ago ). 

I was attempting to move funds to my external investment accounts when I began receiving declined transactions. 

I have been on the phone with them twice - today and yesterday - and even spoke to their review department, which I was originally told was not possible. I have given them all verification needed, and have informed them that the transactions are not fraudulent. 
They have refused to give me any information regarding the hold, or an eta for its release. It has now been 2 full days. I have bills to pay, automatic payments that will accrue late fees, and investments to purchase which are fluctuating by the day. And every day they withhold MY money, they are costing me!

>>> They do NOT own my account. I do. They manage it. And they are refusing to inform me or allow access to MY funds, without any valid reason. <<< I have already submitted a complaint to them directly, am listing this complaint, and after 11 years of banking with them, I will be closing both my business and personal accounts.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My wife was checking our home email and noticed 2 emails from Chase. One email was notification of changing my contact information, the other stated that the credit card application was pending. I immediately called Chase and spoke with their Fraud department to inform them that I had not applied for a credit card with them. They informed me that the application had been denied and that I should file a Identity Theft claim. I asked them to provide me with the name of the person ( s ) who had applied for the card and was told that I had to send them a letter requesting this information and to include a photograph of either my driving license or passport.

I explained that this was ridiculous since I was only asking for information that pertained to my credit. Chase said they would be sending an Identity Theft Kit to our address and it explained all that was needed. I then text a police investigator that is looking into a Scam matter for me, and he said that I should try and get as much information as possible. Luckily we have frozen our credit and also blocked our credit cards, which contributed to the application being denied. I am now filing a complaint with the CFPB.

Her daughter was part of the culprit. She has embezzleling her money and assets. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  was also involved in the audit and a billing specialist was fired. 

The current embezzlement specifics including writing checks to pay property taxes, mismanaging certificate of deposits, insurance benefits, and much more. 

I opened a joint account at PNC bank to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  in XXXX. It have been part of her estate plan since and is required for it to function without concern. 

She and I also use it for person reasons, as She had a separate checking account she used primarily for retirement, pre XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

There is one long in. I use it and it is attached to my phone number and my email. The joint account holder does not have a log in. 

I informed PNC of the fraud and initiated guardianship proceedings after XXXX  abused continued. 

The XXXX  abuse continues today and have reached into personal matters, legal issues, finances, and estate. 

This past weekend, someone has changed log in, allowed access to the account while waiting for guardianship, and not informed me.

PNC has been unable to assist and does not have a fraud unit and allowed elder abuse, embezzlement, and theft occurred.

A sum over {$2000.00}! Finally Well, you can understand that I needed to pay my landlord from these funds when the 1st of the month came, so on XX/XX/year> I initiated a transfer from my unemployment card ( administered by US Bank as a debit card ) to send {$970.00} to my XXXX XXXX  account on my debit card, which is where I get my direct deposits from work without any problems. 

No one told me this bank card is firewalled off XXXX and prohibited from contacting my bank account associated with my XXXX debit card account. I have followed every procedure, nothing is mysterious about this failed transaction but US Bank is dragging their heels in reversing the refused transaction. 

I have done the tracing number routine w/ both parties. XXXX has never seen the money on their money transfer docket. I certainly never saw a cent from this attempted transaction. The money went exactly nowhere. There is no compelling reason why US Bank can not just reclaim my {$970.00} as I began the transfer on a Monday morning, XX/XX/XXXX and here it is 28 days later on a Monday, XX/XX/XXXX and US Bank has not reinstalled my missing {$970.00} This is completely unacceptable! US Bank said last week that they would need to conduct a XXXX day investigation of where my funds went. This is the dumbest, most outrageous laziness & obstinance I have ever encountered. 

It isnt my fault that, for whatever reason between XXXX and the XXXX of Louisiana that unemployment funds may never be transferred between these two financial entities. Nothing dreadful or scheming happened, and after a month ( especially since the state of Louisiana screwed up my initial unemployment funds resulting in back pay of over {$2.00} to begin this problem! ) I deserve my {$970.00} put immediately back into my US Bank card!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Discover credit card advertise that there are no foreign transaction fees. 
But on the day of the transaction they show a pending charge of a lower amount and then process it to show a higher charge after a few days. 
They are masking the transaction fees by having a higher currency charges then other credit cards. 
I called Discover card and they said there is no bait and switch or currency manipulation. 
Talked to XXXX ( supervisor ) at Discover on XX/XX/year> at XXXX pm - Ticket # : XXXX opened by her to investigate if there is an issue. 
No one will call or inform anything about it, but if there is an issue they will correct the transactions. They said there is no manipulation. They give excuses like the vendor will be charging fees or something so it is more. Nothing is true. 

The XXXX charged at the vendor is EUR XXXX which shows pending charge of {$3.00} and then adjusted after processing to {$3.00} So, initial currency conversion rate is {$1.00} = XXXX and then after processing it is {$1.00} = XXXX The currency conversion on XXXX is XXXX {$1.00} = XXXX At the same time of discover card transaction, we have another card transaction with visa from Bank of XXXX XXXX 
They have a foreign transaction fee, but they do not manipulate conversion rate or show a different charge as pending and after processing. 

The charge of EUR XXXX is shown as {$3.00} ( which is a conversion rate of {$1.00} = XXXX After processing the charge is still {$3.00} and a transaction fee added ( which they advertise, so not an issue ). 

Discover card ( now part of XXXX XXXX XXXX ) does currency manipulation and mask transaction fees. 

The total charges for discover card were {$91.00} XXXX XXXX card charges were {$39.00} The amount is not the issue. But the mal practice, currency manipulation, and putting blame on vendor is the issue. 

Please look into this and get back to me. 
May be there is an unfair trade practice issue.

May be I could be compensated by government following up on this and uncovering much larger benefit that discover gains with all combined charges for all users and bigger transactions.

Consumer complaint narrative:
1- I am a well established customer of BofA and have several checking accounts.

2- I have a credit card with BofA . For the past 3 months my balance with this Credit Card was negative.

3- I had tried online to transfer the credit to my checking account, but this feature is not available on line.

4-Two days ago I realized that BofA made a transfer of the credit and I was checking to identify which of my accounts was credited with this balance.

5- I couldn't find it and called the Customer Service of BofA .

6- They advised me that they CUT a check and put it in the Mail. It takes 7-10 days to receive the check!

7- My complain is ( a ) why BofA didn't do an electronic transfer to my accounts? The funds would be credited immediately. 
( b ) Instead, by cutting the check and mail it BofA is using the funds for a period of 5-10days until the check is delivered and another 2-3 days after the fuds are available in the deposited account, i for a total of approx 7-13days the bank is using the funds for her own purpose. 
If BofA practices this method of refund, is it legal? 
Are such practices legit and conform with laws? 
The sums are extremely big, considering the amount of customers who expect daily such refunds.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased a pair of white jeans from an XXXX XXXX that popped up on my feed. The item was from a US company called XXXX. The price was {$49.00} plus {$6.00} for shipping for a total of {$56.00} on XXXX at around XXXX. When I checked my email three hours later, I see three emails that all arrived at XXXX. 

The first from XXXX confirming the purchase in the amount provided prior. 
The second also from XXXX, but changing the purchase price to {$56.00} and adding {$2.00} for handling and tax. The email included language as follows : In the event that you experience any of the following issues with your order : Your order did not arrive. 
Your item was not as described. 
Theres any billing error Youve not authorized the payment. 
XXXX is exempt from sales tax on clothing under {$110.00}. The language used made me concerned and suspicious of fraud/scam. 
And, the third email was from a XXXX company through PayPal for {$96.00} showing {$49.00} for the garment, {$3.00} for compatible packaging, {$4.00} for shipping protection, {$27.00} for shipping and handling, and {$12.00} for insurance. 

At this point, I emailed the vendor to cancel the order. The vendor refused to cancel the order saying there is no cancellation policy. A policy that would have had to be told to me prior to payment of the item. The vendor also offered a credit of {$39.00}. I requested that the vendor cancel the item. I placed the charge in dispute with PayPal. They requested information, I forwarded the response in email with all communication. They then asked for a receipt for credit. I did not receive a credit, so I showed them the charge that was still pending in my credit card card, but which has been charged now. This morning PayPal denied the dispute saying the transaction was processed correctly, which makes me doubt that PayPal looked at any of my documents. When PayPal do not hold this vendors accountable, customers lose. I have told the vendor who has been emailing me that I am rejecting the item if it arrives.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, California XXXX SS # : XXXX  Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally dispute several violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ), Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ), Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ), and Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ). The inaccuracies and unauthorized actions of the involved creditors have had a profound impact on my life, causing undue stress, emotional turmoil, and unjust financial consequences. 

I want to share a personal story that vividly illustrates how these violations have affected me. Over the past year, I have been tirelessly working towards securing a mortgage for my dream home. As a hardworking individual, I meticulously managed my finances, always making timely payments and ensuring my credit history remained impeccable. However, my dreams were shattered when I discovered that certain creditors had reported inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. 

One particular instance that deeply resonates with me pertains to an account with the creditor XXXX, account number XXXX. Under the protection of the FCBA, I found it disheartening to learn that they inaccurately reported late payments, tarnishing my otherwise impeccable payment history. This erroneous reporting has unjustly diminished my credit score and has put my dream of homeownership in jeopardy. It is deeply distressing to realize that despite my efforts to maintain financial responsibility, I find myself facing these unwarranted challenges due to the creditors ' negligence. 

Furthermore, the unauthorized inquiries made by various creditors, including XXXX ( account number XXXX ), XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX/XXXX, have cast doubts on my financial credibility and have made it substantially more challenging to secure favorable terms for my mortgage application. These unauthorized inquiries represent a clear violation of the FCRA, a law designed to safeguard consumers ' privacy and control over their credit information. 

In light of the aforementioned violations, I kindly request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's intervention to ensure the enforcement of my legal rights and protection under the applicable laws. I implore your assistance in urging the involved creditors to promptly and thoroughly investigate the discrepancies and inaccuracies reported on my credit profile. Specifically, I ask that they verify and validate the accounts mentioned in this dispute, and subsequently, remove any unverified or inaccurately reported information from my credit report. 

I firmly believe that these actions will not only rectify the injustices I have faced but also restore my faith in the credit reporting system. My aspiration for a stable financial future and the ability to provide a comfortable home for my family hinge on the resolution of these matters. With your intervention, I am hopeful that the errors can be rectified, allowing me to pursue my dreams and aspirations with renewed vigor. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I appreciate your dedication to upholding consumer rights and ensuring fair treatment in the financial sector. I eagerly await your response and look forward to a positive resolution that will pave the way for a brighter and more secure financial future. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request for Assistance Regarding Incorrect Reporting of Credit Delinquency I, XXXX XXXX, am writing to address a series of issues related to my account, previously held with XXXX XXXXXXXX under the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, which subsequently transitioned to Goldman Sachs in XX/XX/2022. 

For a period of eight years prior to this transition, I was a responsible and compliant account holder with XXXX XXXX. However, during the course of the transition to Goldman Sachs, which lasted approximately 3-4 months, I encountered significant and unexpected difficulties. 

Access to XXXX XXXXXXXX Account : Throughout the transition period, I was unable to access my XXXX XXXXXXXX account. This prevented me from viewing my balance, paying my bills, or managing any other account-related matters. 

Failure to Receive New Card : Despite diligent communication with Goldman Sachs ' customer support, I did not receive my new card. The support staff repeatedly assured me that the card was on its way, only to later discover that it had been sent to an outdated address. 

Delays in Addressing the Issue : The eventual realization of the mistake by Goldman Sachs led to further delays. The process of receiving my new card and accessing the newly switched Marcus account was fraught with unnecessary challenges. 

Credit Report Impact : During this period, I received a credit report indicating serious delinquency on this credit card account. This was alarming, given my otherwise perfect payment record on this and all other credit cards under my name. Though I promptly paid the outstanding {$30.00} balance upon finally gaining access to my account, the delinquency had already been recorded on my report. 

Impact on Mortgage Application : This erroneous delinquency has had a direct and adverse impact on my attempt to purchase a house, as it reflects unfairly on my creditworthiness. 

Unsuccessful Attempts at Resolution : Despite my best efforts to reach out to the concerned parties and seek resolution, I have been met with resistance and inaction. 

In light of the foregoing, I respectfully request your intervention and assistance in resolving this matter. I believe that the facts clearly demonstrate that I am a responsible consumer who pays debts in a timely manner, and that this incident is an aberration resulting from circumstances beyond my control. 

Your prompt attention to this matter will not only correct an injustice but also facilitate my ongoing efforts to purchase a home. Please find enclosed relevant documents supporting my case. 

I look forward to hearing from you soon. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX. My mother held a CD which matured on XX/XX/XXXX. I held POA ( and POD along with my brother ) and had been managing my mother 's financial affairs for a year preceding her passing due to her incapacitation. 
XXXX. Upon maturity, the aforementioned CD was rolled over into a subsequent account. This account yielded a lower interest rate. The beneficiary designations remained the same with myself as POA/POD and my brother as co-POD. 
XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, acting as POA for my mother, I met with a Wells Fargo banker determining it was financially prudent to incure the {$640.00} penalty to close the lower-yield account and establish a new 6-month CD with higher interest rate under the same beneficiary designations. Regrettably, I did not observe at the time of opening that new account that the banker had incorrectly titled the new CD, omitting the POA/POD designation. 
XXXX. My mother passed away on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX 
XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX my brother and I met with a representative at Wells Fargo to close several of my mother 's accounts. The other accounts were labeled corretly. The incorrect titling of this account was noted and we were informed that access to the funds in this account would be grandted upon filing of the Letters of Personal Representative. The Death Certificate was also scanned into their system at this time. 
XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX my brother and I met with another Wells Fargo banker bringing in the letter of Peronal Representative and we were not able to access the funds until an EIN account was set up. This is incorrect because the CD should have been labeled as POD & should be readily available to my brother and myself without an EIN account. 
XXXX. XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Our lawyer reached dropped a letter in person at Wells Fargo explaining the mistake. XXXXXX/XX/XXXX our lawyer followed up and was refused any information on the case, being referred to Customer Service overseas. 
XXXX. Multiple letters, personal interactions and phone calls have followed over the last XXXX months and we are still unable to access the funds. Wells Fargo refuses to speak to me about the case, except to say it is under investigation, and has not notified our lawyer of any updates or resolutions. 
XXXX. Wells Fargo actions are arbitrary and capricious. They have not been acting in good faith and have not come to a resolution in a resonable amount of time. They have placed a great burden on my brother and myself both with loss of time and financially, especially after the loss of a loved one. This case is a simple banker error in the titling of an account.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am so sick of this .... 
On XX/XX/2023 I initiated a {$120.00} payout XXXX XXXX that had a displayed processing date of no later than XX/XX/XXXX ( the next business day ), which means the funds would have typically posted to my bank account by the XXXX. Upon checking my survey.com account and email I can see that not only was the payout not processed by that time, but has also not been processed at all as of the XXXX, which means that, at the earliest, the payout won't be sent to my bank account until next Tuesday! Because I am very familiar with the timing of the payouts from this source I had a delayed emergency payment to another account scheduled to not post until just after this payout posted, but that is not what happened since I haven't received any funds as of yet on time for this payout. I also had a payment scheduled from another which posted to the account on time as it should have because they appropriately processed it in a timely manner. Both payments would have posted at the same time if it wasn't for XXXX mishandled this. 
This has caused my bank account to be overdrawn and a {$30.00} NSF fee will be assessed this weekend or on Monday the XXXX. I am absolutely livid and disgusted. I absolutely can not afford to pay this extra fee expense at this time because of this company not processing payouts in a timely manner. 
I understand that this is not FHB 's fault or a bank error, but the extra fast processing of the charge to my account on the XXXX instead of the XXXX is questionable. 
I am requesting reimbursement of the {$30.00} NSF fee.
