Consumer complaint narrative: I have a XXXX XXXX ( Continental Finance ) that I closed about 2 years ago. It had not been delinquent but I wanted to pay it off. I have never missed a payment of $ XXXX since I had the card. About 3 months ago I wanted to put it into a debt management program ( XXXX XXXX ) to get interest rate down to pay it off. XXXX XXXX contacted them twice to send a proposal and they never responded to it. All the while I was still paying the $ XXXX to keep the account current. Due to problems with XXXX the account had a late payment of a matter of days and XXXX charged a late fee of {$39.00}. Since XXXX  really had no interest in working with me or XXXX XXXX I requested XXXX XXXX forget about it and I would just continue to pay $ XXXX. To make a long story short XXXX charged me another {$39.00}. I set up autopay for XXXX and requested that they pull $ XXXX. However, because of the late fees I had a payment due of {$160.00} ( which was totally erroneous ), they were supposed to pull a payment of {$35.00} of XX/XX/XXXX and instead pulled the {$160.00}. I called my bank to stop payment on the {$160.00}. They have tried to do this but because the payment hasn't posted yet they are unable to do it until it posts. I called XXXX XXXX and got them to drop the late fees after I informed them that late fees have been capped to {$8.00} for each transaction. Well once I told them that they dropped the late fees and we had a conference call with my bank and we are going to have another conference call once the {$160.00} posts to my checking account to have this charge refunded back into my checking account. I'm requesting that you look into the practices that XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) is engaged in. I'm sure I'm not the only client that they are charging exorbitant late fees to. Please look into them because what they are doing is usury. Also, their customer service is atrocious ; it's like they intentionally make it difficult to connect with them ; it's like they are trying to hide their business practices. I would appreciate any help you can give me in resolving my issue and ensuring that no other customers have to be subjected to what I've been subjected to.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to urgently request executive review and immediate action regarding a {$5000.00} personal check that U.S. Bank placed on a XXXX hold, leaving us with {$12.00} in our account and no access to funds for critical living expenses. There was also absolutely no notification that the check was even on hold. And after the check was deposited electronically a couple hours later, we received an email that said, It was accepted and will be available in XXXX business day that was not the case, the screenshots are attached. 

We are XXXX  year customers and have deposited checks from this same issuer before including XXXX just last week with no hold applied. We deposit checks frequently via mobile for our business, and we have no history of overdrafts or returned items. Yet this time, we were told there is no way to override the hold and that no escalation team exists.

Weve spoken to two different branch managers, the customer service line, and other representatives all of whom denied the existence of escalation options such as XXXX, risk, or XXXX review. The only help offered was to file a complaint with a XXXX wait for any possible resolution while we are left with XXXX money to pay rent, buy food, or cover bills. 

This is not a procedural issue this is a human hardship that U.S. Bank is actively worsening. XXXX 100 % of a check without release of even a portion during urgent financial need is excessive and punitive. 

We also are extremely confused why were not notified of the hold and were instead notified that the check was approved and accepted. Why was there a hold after that email? Why were we lied to? And what in the world is going on?

I am writing to formally lodge a serious complaint regarding the handling of my refund request for my closed Chase Sapphire credit card account. This entire process has been extraordinarily frustrating, and I am deeply dissatisfied with the lack of urgency, clear communication, and follow-through from your customer service team. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I closed my Chase Sapphire credit card account and discovered a credit balance of {$880.00}. I contacted your customer service department multiple times in XX/XX/XXXX to request the refund. After several phone calls, I was emailed a transfer request form to have the funds refunded to my checking account. I completed and submitted this form on XX/XX/XXXX, and the request was processed on the same day. 

However, after XXXX days, I noticed no refund had been credited to my checking account. I followed up with customer service, and while the representative assured me the refund request had been processed, I was informed that the only solution was to issue a physical check. I was told this check would be mailed to me in XXXX business days. 

I waited patiently for the check, but by the second week of XX/XX/XXXX, I still had not received it. When I called customer service again, I was told the check had already been mailed and was asked to continue waiting until XX/XX/XXXX. At this point, I began to feel like my issue was being ignored. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I called once more, and I still had not received the check. I have verified my mailing address several times and confirmed there are no issues receiving mail. Despite this, I was told to continue waiting. I then requested that the check be sent via XXXX, offering to pay for the expedited service, so I could track its delivery. The representative refused to accommodate my request and stated that a new check could be issued, but I would have to wait another XXXX business days until XX/XX/XXXX. 

This delay, lack of communication, and refusal to take appropriate action is completely unacceptable. Chase Sapphires inability to address my refund request in a timely manner and the failure to acknowledge the urgency of my situation reflect poorly on your customer service and your commitment to customers. 

To resolve this issue, I demand the following : Immediate processing of my refund with proof of processing. 
If the refund is to be mailed, it must be sent via certified mail or XXXX to ensure I can track its delivery. 
A detailed explanation as to why my refund has been delayed for this extended period, and what steps Chase Sapphire is taking to ensure that I can get my refund back. I want them to treat me seriously even thought I have closed account with them

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX/XXXX/2023, I received a call from a Wells Fargo that turned out to be an impersonator. During the call, the Wells Fargo impersonator obtained my log-in credentials and used those to 1 ) attempt a wire transfer and 2 ) take cash advances/make charges totaling {$7300.00} on two credit cards associated with my small business account. During the call I noticed strange comments, so I hung up, and called Wells Fargo to report the incident. Wells Fargo immediately stopped the wire transfer and issued a {$2500.00} credit to the small business credit cards ; however, I dispute the full amount of {$7300.00}. Wells Fargo denied my claim on XXXX/XXXX/2023, and since that time, I have repeatedly and consistently requested help through the XXXX Assistance XXXX for XXXX XXXX XXXX. My request is that the XXXX investigator re-open and review the full case, and the facts will clearly show that all charges on the cards since XX/XX/2023 are related to the same fraud incident. Unfortunately, since XXXX/XXXX/2023, Wells Fargo has been unwilling and unable to respond to my requests. Each time I call the XXXX Assistance XXXX and present my case number, I reach a new customer service representative who is unable to contact the XXXX investigator directly. I have attempted to submit supporting documents by fax ( XX/XX/2023 ) and email ( XX/XX/2023 ). As of this writing, Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX can not confirm whether the XXXX investigator has received or reviewed these documents. During my XX/XX/2023 phone call to the XXXX Assistance XXXX, the customer service representative advised that he would create escalations claim and submit on my behalf. Since that time, I have been assigned an escalations representative in Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I sent ( via certified mail ) a copy of my case to my assigned escalations representative. Proof of delivery shows the package was successfully received by Wells Fargo. As of this writing, the issue remains open and unresolved. I am submitting this complaint to CFPB because Wells Fargo 's failure to act timely is impairing my credit.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: I ama victim of Identity Theft and Discover Bank was notified of such as well as the three national credit bureaus. I was XXXX  at the time my information was used to open an account with Discover. I have never authorized an account with Discover, nor have I given anyone permission to use my information. Discover Bank sent Form 1099-C cancellation of Debt for tax year XXXX. That is a write off of the fraudulent debt and has been reported to the IRS as such. Yet Discover is still re reporting this account after the credit bureaus have been removing the fraudulent debt due to Identity Theft. Discover Bank needs to stop adding a fraudulent closed debt to my credit report that has already been cancelled and reported to the IRS as such. By law when a creditor issues a 1099-C cancellation of debt to the IRS for a charged-off account, it means that {$600.00} or more is no longer payable to the creditor. The IRS considers this taxable income for the debtor, and they may have to pay taxes on the forgiven debt.

Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX - Received a text about a suspicious charge on my account for {$1300.00} from XXXX XXXX. I called and said that it was fraudulent and there was a second charge for {$5100.00} on my statement that was also fraudulent. The {$1300.00} was removed, but he neglected to address the {$5100.00} and I did not know this until I opened my next statement. They cancelled my charge card and issued a new one and rolled the {$5100.00} onto my new credit card number. 

I also called XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX to see if they couldn't credit back the fraudulent fee. They advised me that they could do nothing and I had to go through my XXXX XXXX. They needed to issue a charge back. 

I contacted XXXX again on XX/XX/XXXX with the updated XXXX explanation and wanting to understand how this fraud happened. They assured me they would address the issue. 

XX/XX/XXXX - contacted XXXX XXXX again, because they did not resolve the {$5100.00}. They promised to resolve the transaction again and placed a provisional credit on our CC. 

Elan mailed a letter dated XXXX XXXX, XXXX reversing the provisional credit. They stated that we authorized the transaction, and received the benefit from the transaction. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I spoke with Elan again and explained to them that this was wrong. Well, XXXX maintained it was valid so there's NOTHING they could do. I asked for the documents that prove this is a valid purchase. They said they would mail them to me. I asked that they have someone in Management contact me. 

XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX me. Again, I informed them that this charge was not authorized by my husband or I. She said the case was closed and there was nothing she could do and suggested I contact XXXX for the credit. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I contacted XXXX again and they claim that they have no method of issuing a credit and it has to come in the form of a charge back. During the course of this long conversation, they did acknowledge that it was a fraudulent purchase. I asked for a document to be sent to be acknowledging the fraud. They agreed to mail it to me, but I did not receive it. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I contacted Elan again to tell them XXXX acknowledged the fraud and this needs to be reopened. After begging them, they agreed to have another XXXX contact me. 

XX/XX/XXXX - Elan/US Bank XXXX XXXX ) contacted me and said the case was closed and there was nothing else XXXX Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX We needed to pay the charge. 

XX/XX/XXXX - Mailed a certified XXXX Dispute form to XXXX, UT. I was contacted on XX/XX/XXXX by XXXX. Again, they acknowledged it was fraudulent and escalated the claim. They advised me again that there was no way for them to refund me and that it had to come through as a charge back and that they would not dispute it. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I sent a letter to XXXX XXXX, XXXX of XXXX XXXX XXXX. The credit union promoted the Elan credit card and explained the awful experience customer service support I was receiving from they company they partnered with. I am a longtime customer of this credit union. He assigned the issue to XXXX - XXXX of Credit Card Services. 

She attempted to get this escalated and have a " real '' XXXX from XXXX to contact me. 

XX/XX/XXXX - A man named XXXX called from Elan. He worked in the XXXX of the XXXX. I asked what the XXXX 's name was? He didn't know, and would have to look it up, which he did. His title was XXXX Response XXXX. He wasn't a supervisor, XXXX, vice president, XXXX, etc. He told me there was nothing more that could be done and that I would have to file for arbitration. He would be mailing the information on how to proceed with arbitration. He didn't care that XXXX acknowledges it's fraudulent and it needs to be charged back. They WILL NOT contest it. He didn't care that we don't own an IPhone, which was the device used to purchase tickets to a XXXX XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX. He also didn't care that the IP address used was not our XXXX address. He would not issue a charge back. He informed me that I was assigned case # XXXX. 

I relayed this information to XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX. I am beyond outraged that the hours I have spent on a fraudulent transaction to our credit card and now I am being told I have to go to arbitration for a fraudulent claim. I have now incurred {$110.00} in finance charges, since I will not pay for a fraudulent charge. It also will be affecting my XXXX XXXX. I asked for another provisional credit while this is still " in my mind '' being disputed, but it was denied. 

I just can not believe that a large corporation is allowed to resolve customer services issues like this. My husband and I are Senior citizens ( XXXX and XXXX ) old. We live on a fixed income. My husband is XXXX and it would have been impossible for him to attend a fight at the XXXX XXXX. They should be ashamed of their actions and how they have addressed this issue. Taking advantage of Seniors is just despicable. 

I am just exhausted trying to resolve this and I am sincerely hoping you can help us. I need to be able to sleep at night and until this is resolved I don't see that happening. 

I am unable at this time to upload documents, but if necessary I will have someone help me do this.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative: I had a free 3 day trial with XXXX. I cancelled my subscription the same day I started it. However, they still deducted {$28.00} from my account. I also had a 3 day trial with another dating site and also cancelled it the same day. It was for {$19.00}. The second company cancelled my subscription and Chime returned the {$19.00}. Chime also credited my account the {$28.00} and said that if it was found that XXXX was justified in deducting the money, Chime would deduct that {$28.00} from my account again. XXXX cancelled my subscription effective the day I opened it, however, Chime decided XXXX was justified in deducting the {$28.00}. I canceled this account well within the time allotted. XXXX has not tried to deduct the {$28.00} again since my account was, in fact, cancelled. Both of these cases were the same set of circumstances. The second company willingly cancelled my subscription and the funds were returned to me, end of story. XXXX also willingly cancelled my subscription, but for some reason unbeknownst to me, Chime decided that it was justified and took the money back out causing all kinds of problems in my account. Both circumstances are the same. Why give me the money back on one and not the other. XXXX had no problem with the refund since I closed the account well in advance of the end of my trial period. Who is Chime to decide they were deducting the money anyway? It doesn't make since. If XXXX had no problem with it, what I Chime 's excuse? I asked and the man got quite smart with me and told me they revisited the situation and decided to deny my dispute. I asked again why, when it was the same incident as the other. He said he didn't have to explain the reasoning that they decided to deny my dispute and did just that. He went on to say he did not have to give me any further explanation. I said it before and I'll say it again, these online banking businesses need to have a tighter rein put on them. I have a right to know the reason they denied my dispute and what made it different than the second dispute filed the same day. Again, they were both identical, they both agreed to cancel my subscription with no problem. Why money was returned to my account from one and not the other. I thought my bank is supposed to look out for my best interest and protect me. Obviously, Chime does not look out for their customer 's best interest nor protect the customer 's money.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Arizona XXXX Telephone : ( XXXX ) XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/1988 SS # : XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against the following creditors for multiple violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ). The attached documentation provides comprehensive evidence of the violations detailed below : FCRA Violations : Incorrect Date of Birth Incorrect Previous Addresses ( Multiple Instances ) FDCPA Violations : XXXX. XXXX Account Number : XXXX The violations outlined above have caused significant distress and hardship in my life. These inaccuracies have not only marred my credit report but have also impacted my ability to secure reasonable credit terms, obtain housing, and achieve my financial goals. I am deeply troubled by the fact that the incorrect information has been used to assess my creditworthiness, ultimately affecting various aspects of my life, including my emotional well-being. 

Allow me to share a personal story that exemplifies the extent of the damage caused by these inaccuracies. As I was in the process of purchasing a home for my family, I encountered insurmountable hurdles due to these false accounts and improper reporting. The dream of providing stability and comfort for my loved ones was shattered, and the emotional toll of facing this ordeal has been overwhelming. The stress and XXXX caused by these inaccuracies have strained relationships and created a constant sense of uncertainty in my life. 

I implore the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to intervene and enforce the legal protections put in place by the FCRA, FDCPA, and FCBA. I request that the relevant creditors promptly investigate and rectify the violations they have committed. Specifically, I urge them to remove the unverified accounts from my credit report, thereby ensuring an accurate representation of my credit history. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and your commitment to safeguarding the rights and well-being of consumers. I trust that your intervention will bring resolution to this distressing situation and enable me to rebuild my financial stability. 

Thank you for your consideration. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I did not violate any terms or conditions of the User Agreement, but PayPal appears to have. Your response is totally unacceptable. 

PayPal continues to send the same boilerplate/canned response, informing me to refer to their XXXX User Agreement. Without specifying what part of the User Agreement I allegedly violated, it's impossible to determine such an alleged violation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing in regards to TD Bank changes its policies on who can deposit money into my checking account. My boyfriend went to TD Bank to deposit the mortgage money as he has been doing for the last XXXX  years since we have bills to pay and he was told that he can no longer deposit into my account yet I am the one that provided him with MY account information. Who or what gives TD Bank the right to tell people who can and can not make deposits into MY OWN ACCOUNT, its an absolute disgrace. I was told that I needed to add him to my account and we do not have a joint account hence me providing my information to him and I should NOT have to add anyone to deposit money. Say a wife sends her husband to the bank then that person can't make a deposit on someone elses account, that is the dumbest thing I have ever heard. I do not appreciate TD Bank making up the rules as they do along as if I give someone permission to deposit money into MY OWN ACCOUNT THAT IS MY PROGROATIVE AND REALLY ITS NONE OF TD BANKS BUSINESS OVERALL. I am not happy with TD Bank given this new change and I dont think its fair to their customers or appropriate & I want this looked into as a whole. 
When my boyfriend goes to the TD Bank IN DE during lunchtime they have a copy of his license to show who he is and that we live at the same residence. Its ludicrous that TD Bank can even tell people what they can do with their own accounts.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am an international student at XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX, my employer is sponsoring my XXXX by paying my tuition and living expenses. Before arriving in the XXXX, XXXX sent the funds to my XXXX account so I could pay for initial expenses, including my rent and deposit. After arriving in New York, I opened a Chase bank account on Thursday XXXX of XXXX at XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. I was assisted by XXXX XXXX, who confirmed that it was fine to transfer my funds from XXXX to the new account. I then transferred the {$60000.00} in XXXX parts of XXXX each the following weekend. 

On Sunday XXXX of XXXX, I received an email from Chase stating that my account might be restricted, and I was instructed to call for further assistance. When I called, I was encouraged to go to the branch. I recalled the same day at XXXX, and this time, i was informed that a final decision had already been made to close my account. I proposed to provide proof of the origin of the funds, including documentation from XXXX, but this offer was rejected without review. 

When I visited the branch on Monday XXXX XXXX, I was informed that they did not have additional information about my account closure or the status of my funds. I was told conflicting information : that Chase might reject the XXXX transfer and send the money back to XXXX, or that they might issue a check. However, no clear timeline or confirmation has been provided, leaving me confused and unable to plan my next steps. 

They also cancelled my meeting appointment that i had booked with them for Tuesday XXXX of XXXX without any further explanation. 

This unexpected account closure has caused significant emotional distress and inconvenience. These funds are crucial for my tuition, housing, and other living expenses as I begin my XXXX program. The delay and lack of transparency have disrupted my studies, caused me to miss critical school commitments, and created uncertainty about how to meet my financial obligations. 

The funds came from a legitimate source, and I was transparent with the bank during the account setup. In addition, Chase failed to notify me in advance or provide me with an opportunity to resolve the issue before closing my account and they have not clearly communicated how or when I will receive my funds, leaving me in financial limbo.

I urgently request assistance to ensure the immediate and safe release of my funds and to hold Chase accountable for the distress and inconvenience caused.

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo has allowed unauthorized users to access my bank account three times in the last 6 months -- XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. It appears their security verification for changing online banking passwords is not strong enough -- seems like you only need a phone number or email, or if you have the last four digits of the SSN you can change it, and those are easily found on the dark web. When this happened in XXXX, I asked the bank to open an investigation and they found that one of their customer service agents failed to recognize that someone was impersonating me and had called asking to change the phone number associated with my bank account, so they were able to set it to their phone number, change the password, and withdraw funds. The investigator told me that the customer service representatives didn't catch the fraud because the person calling " sounded confident, '' which was not an indication that anything was wrong. I pointed out that people committing fraud are often professionals and very good at coming across in a certain way, so their security should be more than what appears to be them just checking out the vibes of the person calling. 

Wells Fargo also represented to me that their would be additional fraud alerts placed on my account after the XXXX incident. However, if they did anything like that, it didn't work because my account has now been compromised again. This time, someone was able to change my password without my authorization, and then they granted themselves guest access to my online banking. The hacker was able to transfer {$2500.00} before Wells Fargo 's fraud system caught on and alerted me. It also allowed some of the transactions to go through ; only one was caught and frozen. The hacker overdrew my bank account, so Wells Fargo allowed the {$2500.00} transaction to go through. The hacker also used XXXX to transfer {$950.00} after adding a new recipient. This was not picked up by fraud detection either, even though I had never sent money to this recipient before. There should be some kind of multi-factor authorization or other security measure for adding or sending funds to a new phone number. Wells Fargo did freeze an attempted {$45.00} transfer, but the other money had already been taken. I'm attaching to this complaint emails that I received that indicated that the fraud was occurring. I don't know the people or phone numbers who are listed as recipients in the emails. 

I have been very careful with my online password -- it is not saved in my browser nor is it a password I use anywhere else. I have done scans of my devices for keystroke tracking and have not found anything. I often use my work computer to log in, using XXXX mode, and I work around sensitive information so the security on the work devices is very high. The problem seems to be with Wells Fargo not having effective security. I have been a customer for 10 years, but I am going to close my account and move my money to a bank with better security practices.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I had a CD account that matured on XXXX XXXX XXXX confirmed to be closed and transferred to my Marcus XXXX. I checked my account on XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX  and my CD was not closed, the money was not transferred, yet it said the maturity date was XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX 

I immediately called them and turns out that back in XXXX, I had taken out a chunk of money to put into a XXXX  XXXX CD from my XXXX and they had put a hold on my account. I did NOT receive ANY notification or alerts that I had this hold so because I had this hold, they could not close my CD and transfer it to my XXXX. So then after being transferred between 3 different representatives, confirming my identity every single time, then hanging up and waiting for them to call me, only for my phone to block all unknown numbers, me calling them back, and them finally calling me back again, they told me that the hold was cancelled and my CD will be transferred to my XXXX within 1-3 business days! 

This was my first time calling them for support so I tried be patient and wait, but still nothing was updated on my account. I had to wait until after XXXX XXXX to call them again on XX/XX/XXXX in which I had to do the whole process of explaining all over again and they told me the TRANSFER WAS NEVER PROCESSED. This was the first red flag of so many more to come. How can you not finish processing what your customer has requested?! So NOW they tell me that my CD was marked as a new CD account so transferring money out of the CD into my XXXX will result in a withdrawal fee. I was not having it and said that can NOT happen. The representative said, " I'll talk to the agents and SEE what we can do '' I responded, " No, you will not 'see ', you MUST remove the withdrawal fee for something that I did not do! '' They said they will put this into a case to get it approved to remove the withdrawal fee and again, they told me it will take 1-3 business days to transfer and I was getting pretty frustrated, but what can I do except wait? I don't usually get angry or aggressive with these phone calls. I try to be understanding so I said I'll wait. 

Now comes this past week, XXXX XXXX, STILL my CD is just sitting there I can not access my money and nothing has happened. I call them for the THIRD TIME and again, I am told that they never processed the case to get my withdrawal fee waived so the money from the CD can be transferred out. At this point I just lost it and told them this is trash customer service and I deserve a compensation. To her credit, this representative was the most understanding and nicest out of everyone and she put in another case number for me to get the withdrawal fee waived as well as a good will credit of {$25.00} to compensate all the headache and frustrations of this, which is better than nothing, but definitely not worth all the time I had to put into getting this resolved. She also told me that the the money in the CD is still accruing interest even though the account matured already ... we'll see if that's actually the case. So she gives me two case numbers and said it ll take another 1-3 business days. so once again, i'm left to just waiting. 

Today, XX/XX/XXXX, I call again because I can't imagine what the hold up is. This time, as soon as I share all of the past 3 weeks of frustration and lay out exactly what has happened and what has been communicated to me, the representative says, actually there is no timeline and they were never supposed to tell you it will take 1-3 business days. I truly lost it and for the first time demanded to speak to her manager. She transferred me to her supervisor who was very sassy and sarcastic and was not helpful at all. i explained everything and she just kept repeating over and over again that I will get a call when it's resolved, but THERE WAS NO TIMELINE OF WHEN. When I pointed it out to er that this means I am indefinitely waiting to access money that is rightfully mine with no projection of when it would be, all she responded back with was, they will call you when it's approved. I was furious and said this customer service is completely useless and I expect some form of compensation for all of this. She said we can't do that, but can file a complaint for me. I asked her what the complaint will do and all she said was, it will just be on file ... again completely useless to what I'm dealing with now. So I gave her feedback right then and there and said this is completely unacceptable and ridiculous and I will be closing my account as soon as I have access to my money. I asked her for the case number again and she was like, " Oh I didn't think you'll need it b/c you're closing your account '' Uh no, I'm not closing anything until I get this resolved with no penalty fee. And at that point, there was nothing else more I could say to her and I just hung up. But this has been t most frustrating three weeks ever and I am baffled by how terrible of a customer service they have. I'm never going back or recommending this to anyone.

Consumer complaint narrative: As of Wednesday the XXXX of XXXX I havent received my direct deposit. I called capital one they told me it was my employers fault at first. next day comes around and i have to do XXXX step authentication to get into the app everytime until i deleted XXXX XXXX  XXXX that had access to my account. we didnt receive a emails or office statement until Thursday saying everyone should have there deposits thursday night and friday morning. This is by far the worst experience i have had with a bank. they dont answer the phone and they dont have any answers regarding peoples money i have bill i need to pay i am a college student this is not okay.

The event happened, in XXXX XXXX I made a cash deposit at a branch located in XXXX XXXX on XXXX XXXX, or " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' I used the branch atm, where there are multiple cameras present at the machine. The deposit amount was {$3000.00}. at the time of reporting the funds not being deposited, or showing that it was in a pending state ; the atm claims department opened the claim. I asked for a provisional credit, and they mentioned that could take up to XXXX days. After two weeks, and calling in multiple times for an update I was told later that the claim had been closed 2 days after the claim had been opened. I asked why it was that I didn't get any notification that the claim had reached a resolution? In which they responded that there wasn't any kind of policy that was consistent with that kind of notification. In which I responded with the fact that's how I have been notified in the past with two other claims. 

This conversation with the claims manager ranged from explaining all of my interactions with the machine, and to understanding how the machines perform, and correspond with the server, or in other words, what kind of pings get created within that process. In which I learned that there are such things as " XXXX '' pings that are associated with every interaction with the machine. Thus my response, that their statemen that there was no evidence that I interacted with that machine is inconsistent with there statement about how the machine sends that relay information in pings to the server. And to top off the fact that they hadn't checked any cameras, was also included in their response by default as I offered the question about if that had been checked or not? 

There were forms of retaliation that followed in including deposits being denied, or stopped after the claim was opened, and through multiple atm 's I wasn't able to make deposits, which further pushed back my late payments that I was trying to pay for with the original deposit. 

These forms of communication or lack of were outside the time frames of operating a claim in accordance to the OCC. They also had lied about certain known truths of the information I gave in a statement, and their outcomes. This was essentially stealing from a customer, and lieing about the findings within the investigation. 

1. ( the provisional credit wasn't initiated until approx. 3 weeks later after the claim had been opened. ) 2. Consumer complaint narrative:
I contacted CitiBank as a result of a letter that they sent to me asking me to contact them as a result of suspected fraud. 

The following is a letter I wrote and follow up details to date as the problem is still not resolved. 


CitiBank XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXXXXXX XX/XX/XXXX RE : Fraudulent Charges Made against XXXX ( Previously Acct : XXXX ) Dear Citibank, Consider this my Affidavit regarding the details of the above matter. 
I have been a victim of identity theft, this fact is on file with all credit bureaus, the XX/XX/XXXXXXXX police, the Federal Trade Commission and XX/XX/XXXX 

The Citibank card noted above was issued as a replacement for card XXXX. The replacement card is in my possession and has never been activated by me or my spouse. There should be no way to use this card as the new account number is only known by me and Citibank. 

Unfortunately, somehow, this card was used to make many unauthorized charges recently even though it was never activated. The charges amount to approximately {$27000.00}, {$9800.00} of the total were processed. I/We never made or authorized any of these charges as the card has not been activated by me, the account owner.

XXXX then reviewed my profile and found that this account had been modified to add a fake authorized user. XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX who has a cell phone XXXX, further there was an address added to the account :XX/XX/XXXXXXXX and a fake XXXX mail XXXX I requested that Citibank removeXX/XX/XXXXas I do not know him and never authorized him to have access to my account.

I asked XXXX to permanently close accountXX/XX/XXXX and to NOT open a replacement account and NOT send me any new cards.

I have also reported this activity to the Federal Trade Commission and am keeping my case updated. 

The following is a detailed timeline : XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX from Citibank regarding suspicious activity associated with my account. ( Letter enclosed Reference Number XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX We called to report fraudulent charges noted above and spoke to XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX reviewed the charges and asked if any of them were made or authorized by me. I responded No I did not make or authorize any of these charges. 

XX/XX/XXXX I asked How is it possible that a card that has not been activated is able to be used?. XXXX politely said that he did not know how this could happen. 

XX/XX/XXXX I asked, If this new card was issued to me, and I and Citibank are the only ones who know the account number. XX/XX/XXXX XXXX indicated that he marked ALL of the charges to account XXXX as Fraudulent. 

XX/XX/XXXX Per my request XXXX told me that he permanently cancelled account XXXX and promised not to set up a replacement account or issue any new cards. 

XX/XX/XXXX I then asked XXXX to send me via mail a written record of the call which he never did. 

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX confirmed that the charges would be removed from the account and that the account was permanently closed. XXXX also checked using my SSN to ensure that no other accounts with CitiBank were open associated with my SSN. 

XX/XX/XXXX I told XXXX that I has not yet received a bill from the original account and was concerned about making my payment. He said that while the original account is being reviewed no bill will be issued and late fees will not be applied because of the ongoing investigation of account No. XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative: CARECREDIT / SYNCHRONY BANK - I have/had six different promotional purchases on this account. If paid off within certain time frames I can avoid finance charges. I'm very careful to make sure I am paying correctly to avoid these. In XXXX I had a promotional charge in the amount of {$3000.00} due, I discovered that Synchrony had misapplied my last three payments to random other promotions instead of this promotion. I requested the correct their mistake. Instead they reversed the payments an applied them to other promotions. Instead of continuing to argue with them about getting it paid I asked my husband for money to get it paid off. That would have left the next three promotional balances with something applied to them - this is where they misapplied. My XXXX promotion was paid off and according to my records that would have left my upcoming XXXX promotion with approximately {$300.00} dollar applied to it leaving me just over {$100.00} to pay by XX/XX/XXXX. I have a spreadsheet laying all of these payments out. Today I received an email telling me I owed almost the full balance of the XXXX promotion, {$410.00} due by the 3rd. When I logged onto my account I was expecting to see close to {$300.00} already applied to this promotion and there is only {$5.00} applied. So I contacted them requesting a full accounting from them of the payments received on my account for the past 12 months with the information as to what charges these payments were applied too. I was told to review my statements, the information was there. Its not, the statements show the payments received but not where they have been applied. According to my records there is close to {$300.00} unaccounted for- they didn't have it applied to what was due in XXXX, it was on XXXX, XXXX and XXXX- now that {$300.00} shows not on those promotional balances and it does not show the promotional balance from XXXX overpaid the {$300.00} - So where is the money? Somewhere in the past year something with how they are applying and accounting for my payments has been done incorrectly and they are missing {$300.00} from being applied to my promotional balances. My request for the accounting of the past 12 months showing payments and where they were applied was denied. They told me they can only tell me what payments were made in the past 60 days, nothing more. They have no system to tell me this. That makes me really highly concerned. I do bookkeeping and HR for a living and I have to keep all my records for years - you are telling me they don't? I just want an accounting of my records. Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative: Complaint : Regardless of the amount of times Wells Fargo is fined and sued, they continue to deceive their account holders without even attempting to hide it. During this year, I have paid more than {$300.00} in erroneous overdraft fees that are charged to my account the next day, during the grace period that they continuously and falsely advertise. In the evidence that I am submitting, you can clearly see various examples of this, i.e. account is overdrawn on Day XXXX, the account balance is then made positive via deposit on Day XXXX, but on Day XXXX, an overdraft fee appears to have been posted on Day XXXX. I have gone to my local Wells Fargo a couple of times where the Manager lectured me on how to understand the way they structured their transactions to make it beneficial for them. The reality is that the manager told me that the Wells Fargo app was only for educational purposes, basically stating that you shouldnt believe what you see because it could not be true and that since this was a reoccurrence in my account it must be my fault. With her attitude, she essentially told me that if I werent poor and stored my money with Wells Fargo more often, I wouldnt have these issues. The worst part of everything is that even when Wells Fargo sees that they are in the wrong, they will tell you We are so sorry but since this is not the first Overdraft Fee we can't waive it despite the fact that the times they have only waived it when they recognize that they are at fault. Wells Fargo will never lose the argument ; they will tell you that X transaction was mysteriously started before I ( the customer ) could even see it, and that's the reason I accrued Overdraft Fees. Basically, if a bill is paid on the XXXX of each month and appears on my account on the XXXX WF will charge an overdraft fee if I dont pay it on the XXXX, despite that date being within their imaginary grace period because the transaction started on the XXXX, despite the fact that it was not reflected on my educational app on the XXXX. Wells Fargo offers bill pay services and autopay services but expects its customers to remember the exact day that the transaction is initiated. Wells Fargo hides information from its customers and they will always argue to favor them, leaving the customer with nothing to do. Wells Fargo is stealing from its customers and if you are a minority, you will be treated as if the only money you have is whatever they see in your account. I pay $ 10 monthly to Wells Fargo so I can store my money at their place and I expect Wells Fargo to honor their services and promises. The purpose of my complaint is to show that the billion-dollar settlements that Wells Fargo has recently incurred apparently do not surmount the amount of money that they steal from their account holders while being monitored by the Federal Government . I hope that my complaint is thoroughly reviewed and I do not become another of the millions of customers encountering this same situation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hi I filed two complaints previously with CFPB regarding this and was told US bank was working on it. I had since then spoken to them many times and was told to again keep waiting for them to provide a resolution. Not only did US Bank never contact me, I ended up calling their fraud liasion center again in XXXX XXXX XXXX and was told the claim was rejected and if I wanted to get my money back, I had to go through a court. 

During that phone call, I also asked for details of the investigation and reason why they would not be able to reissue me a check and I have never received the requested information from US BANK. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I had a lawyer send a demand letter to US Bank but have not heard from them since then. My lawyer also reached out to the XXXX XXXX ( where the check was fraudulently cashed out ) and I have attached their response here. Based on their response, it was US bank 's responsibility for not being able to notify XXXX XXXX within the required 30 day window. In addition, it sounds like US Bank received the response from XXXX XXXX way earlier than what I was told. Again I am trying to resolve this issue without having to go through a court. So I need US Bank to respond with details of the investigation as well as reissue me a check with the amount plus loss of interest accured asap. 

Please find response from XXXX XXXX below : Pursuant to UCC 4-207 ( d ), a claimant must submit a claim to a warrantor within 30 days after the claimant has reason to know of the breach and identity of the warrantor. Failure to meet this deadline results in the warrantor being discharged. 

In this case, XXXX XXXX notified US Bank at least by XX/XX/XXXX of the alleged forgery. See emails attached she sent US Bank affidavit. US Bank then had 30 days to make claim upon XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, or by XX/XX/XXXX. 

However, U.S. Bank did not send XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX any notice until a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX well outside the 30 day timeframe. Accordingly, per the attached emails, the claim was denied. 

Claimant ( s ) knew of the alleged breach at least by XX/XX/XXXX, but notification was not timely tendered to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. As such, any liability the XXXX XXXX had in this matter has been extinguished pursusant to UCC 4-207 ( d ).

Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Wells Fargo regarding a recent incident involving a failed XXXX payment . Despite my repeated attempts to resolve the matter directly with Wells Fargo, I have encountered significant obstacles and remain unsatisfied with their response. 

On XX/XX/2024, I utilized Wells Fargo 's services to send a {$100.00} XXXX payment to a recipient who is registered with XXXX and is also a customer of Wells Fargo. The intended recipient 's details are as follows : Name : XXXX XXXX Phone Number : XXXX However, despite the deduction of funds from my account, the payment was never delivered to XXXX XXXX. Despite my efforts to seek clarification and resolution through multiple calls to Wells Fargo 's customer service, I have been met with evasive responses and a failure to address the issue effectively. 

According to Wells Fargo representatives, the failure to deliver the payment was attributed to a purported token issue within their system. Despite this acknowledgment, Wells Fargo has refused to accept responsibility for the failed transaction, claiming that it falls outside their jurisdiction. 

Not only has Wells Fargo failed to deliver the funds to the intended recipient, but they have also neglected to provide any information regarding the whereabouts of the money. Furthermore, despite my insistence, they have failed to initiate the refund process. 

I believe that, given Wells Fargo 's history and pattern of fraud, their handling of this matter constitutes a blatant act of fraudulent behavior and a violation of consumer rights. As such, I am seeking your intervention to ensure that Wells Fargo fulfills its obligations to deliver the funds to the intended recipient or issue a prompt refund. 

I urge you to investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate action to hold Wells Fargo accountable for their actions. Additionally, I request that measures be implemented to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future and to safeguard the rights of consumers. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Your office will take the necessary steps to address this complaint and ensure a satisfactory resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I am writing to file a formal dispute regarding violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that have significantly affected my credit report. My goal is to seek enforcement of my legal rights as a consumer and request your assistance in rectifying these violations. 

I am a diligent individual who believes in the importance of financial responsibility. I have worked tirelessly to maintain a positive credit history and ensure the accuracy of my credit report. However, I find myself in a distressing situation due to unauthorized inquiries, inaccurate account reporting, and questionable information on my credit report. These issues have not only caused financial stress but have also had a profound emotional impact on my life.

These inaccurate entries have directly hindered my ability to achieve significant life goals, such as purchasing a home and securing financing for necessary expenses. I have had to endure sleepless nights, constant worry, and the mental toll of feeling powerless in the face of a system that is supposed to protect consumers.

Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information related to charge-offs that appear on my credit report. Upon reviewing my report, I have identified entries that I believe are incorrect and require immediate investigation and correction. I am submitting this dispute in accordance with 15 USC 1681e ( b ), which requires credit reporting agencies to maintain accurate information, and I am requesting that these inaccuracies be addressed. 

The charge-off information on my credit report appears to be incorrect in the following manner : XXXX XXXX XXXX  The company did not provide me with a XXXX for me to file this debt on my taxes giving that they have already forgiven or written off the debt on their taxes. Since they deemed it income on their end, its illegal to report income on my credit file. with that reporting on my report, it seems prejudice and unfair. 
JPMCB Card This company has reported a charge off on my account for XXXX consecutive months and its only been charged off once. Thats inaccurate information being displayed on my credit file. In addition, they have written this income off, where is my XXXX? 
XXXX XXXX XXXX This company has reported a charge off on my account for XXXX consecutive years and its only been charged off once. Thats inaccurate information being displayed on my credit file. In addition, they have written this income off, where is my 1099?

As per 15 USC 1681e ( b ), it is your responsibility to ensure that the information reported to credit agencies is accurate and complete. The charge-off information listed above does not accurately reflect the status of my accounts, and as such, I am requesting an immediate investigation and correction of this data. If the charge-off information can not be verified, I request that it be removed from my credit report. 
Please provide me with the results of your investigation in writing, and if applicable, notify me of any corrections made to my credit report. I also request that you remove any unverifiable or outdated information in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
For your reference, I have included any relevant supporting documentation, such as payment records, correspondence, or account statements, to assist in the resolution of this dispute. If needed, I am willing to cooperate fully in order to resolve this matter as quickly as possible. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, you are required to complete this investigation within XXXX  days. Please notify me in writing of your findings and any updates to my credit report. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX my Apple Card was hacked and significant purchases made within a XXXX hour time period. I notified Apple immediately upon discovering the fraud, contacted the stores when I would receive notification that a purchase was ready for pickup, filed a report with the FTC and cooperated as best I could with providing the limited information I had on the thieves. 

I have been working with more than 30 different Level 1 customer service representatives and had to finally only request to speak with someone at a supervisory level due to the poor service, confusion and advice. I have a spreadsheet with all 19 of the dispute files and when any action was taken. I have since discovered that more purchases were attempted but had been caught before completed. On the disputes the back and forth on resolved, reasserted, and denied has been a trued nightmare. Invariably one person would make a determination and then another would countermand. It has been XXXX months of constant chaos and frustration. Each and every time I think we are nearing the end another issue arises and am told it will be ANOTHER XXXX  days till resolved. There is no dispute whatsoever that I did not make a single purchase as I live about XXXX miles from where the fraudulent action was initiated, my ethnicity and name do not mesh with the diversity of those picking up the items and no request for confirmation of proof I made the purchases at the time of a person not listed on my account picked up the electronics. 

During the hack they were also able to download funds from my associated debit card to Apple Cash and promptly cashed it out at a Florida XXXX. I immediately contacted my bank who within a 3 hour time period confirmed that this was fraud, that I was not involved and refunded the missing money to my bank account. 

The guidance I received over these last 4 months has been frightening to say the least. One representative actually thought it would be a great idea if XXXX sent me the credit balance on my account ( due to the dispute credits ) and I could then pay one of the outstanding installment accounts on one of the fraudulent IPhone purchases ( there were XXXX phones purchased ).. I quickly dismissed this advice as being non-nonsensical which prompted me to ask for a supervisor to intercede. 

I have had some better advice and service from a few of the supervisors who promise to make it their personal mission to get this corrected once and for all. However, when they have cleared one case off the docket some XXXX puts it back on. 

I have specifically been irate that during these XXXX months, the purchases have been reported to the Credit Bureau which of course has had a negative impact on my credit rating. Debt to income way out of whack with just under {$9000.00} in fraudulent purchases. When I contacted customer service to express my frustration that obvious fraudulent purchases would be reported under my name. I received a nasty email in return stating that because the balances showed up on my billing statement they were correct in reporting the information. Totally dismissed the fact that this was fraud. Credit rating directly equates to the cost of money for me. I have had to delay the purchase of a new vehicle as I would be charged much higher interest rates that I would have afforded under my true rating.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I made a cash deposit ( {$1400.00} ) into my Chase account ( on XX/XX/XXXX, approx. around XXXX ), using one of their drive-through ATM 's. The ATM encountered an error after I deposited my cash. Before the machine could show me how much money I deposited, the screen changed and gave an error message that said " This ATM is currently not working. In the meantime, you can use our Chase Mobile app to deposit checks, transfer money, find other ATMs and more. You can also see your receipts at chase.com '' The machine gave me a receipt, that didn't include my deposit amount but included identifying numbers for the ATM machine. I immediately called Chase customer service to start a claim. I was asked on the phone, to provide, what I assume to be the tracking number for the ATM. 

Fast forward, I get temporarily credited the {$1400.00} I deposited, 3 days later, on the XXXX of XXXX. As of yesterday morning ( XX/XX/XXXX ), Chase initiated a reverse deposit, and took {$1400.00} out of my account, because their investigation into the claim, showed that there were no errors with the ATM, or any additional funds in the diversion bin. 

This is simply untrue and false. How do you investigate the claim, and state that the ATM didn't encounter any errors, when I have picture evidence that the screen shows it's in an error state. I have been essentially, financially handcuffed, unable to buy groceries, and general necessities, because of an error from Chase 's business, for the second consecutive time now. Only to be told I'm wrong, and that the money I worked very hard for, is being taken away, once again. 

The way this has been handled is deeply unsettling and unfortunate, for me. I have to bear the brunt of Chase 's incompetence, not only once, but twice, having my life halted.

I feel this is unfair. Ive had this account since 2012 never have I provided my ID. I want my money! I did nothing wrong for them to hold my money.

To my dismay, I was informed that the request should have been emailed rather than mailed. Despite expressing my frustration and apprehension, the representative needed help to clarify whether Navy Federal received my initial letter or why my account access was restricted in the first place. I should not have to call several times to get my questions answered! At this point I would never trust NFCU with large sums of money in an account. 

Furthermore, I was given an email address, XXXX, and instructed to resend the documents electronically. I'm just getting back to you once again, so I quickly sent the required materials. However, despite multiple attempts to follow up, I am still waiting for a response or acknowledgment from Navy Federal.

As a result of this lack of communication and resolution, I need help accessing my account online. The inability to obtain information over the phone, coupled with the geographical distance from the nearest branch, has left me feeling frustrated and powerless. 

I am deeply disappointed by the lack of professionalism and efficiency Navy Federal Credit Union demonstrated in handling my concerns.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
My American Express card required a payment by XX/XX/2024. A credit in the amount of the payment due posted on that very same day, XX/XX/2024. Therefore, no further payment was due for that statement. However, American Express charged me a late fee of {$29.00} for that statement cycle. When I called about it, I was refused a reversal of the fee. I was told that although the statement shows the credit posting in time on XX/XX/2024, the process did not complete until the next day. 

I explained that the date on the statement claims the credit was received on XX/XX/2024, the date by which a payment was due, and so that printed date is the appropriate reference. But neither the representative, her supervisor, nor the supervisor 's manager reversed the fee. Each claimed that the system did not permit it. If so, American Express has a system of charging customers late fees for amounts showing as already credited on statements. This system is misleading and unfair to consumers. American Express should be required to change it. I also request a reversal of the fee of {$29.00} posted to my account.

Chime failed to provide provisional credit despite Regulation Z requiring them to do so in most chargeback cases. 

They denied my dispute without providing a clear, written explanation of why I was still responsible for the charge. 

They falsely cited Regulation Z as a reason for denying me provisional credit, which is misleading and potentially unlawful. 

They promised to provide a written explanation within four hours, but after four days, they still have not responded. 

XXXX informed me that this issue is solely Chimes responsibility, but Chime refuses to process my refund properly. 

I am demanding an immediate refund of {$130.00} and a full explanation of why Chime mishandled my chargeback. 
I filed a chargeback dispute with Chime on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX, for a {$130.00} charge related to a defective phone purchased from XXXX. 

XXXX accepted the return and acknowledged the phone was defective, yet I was still charged. 

Chime initially accepted my dispute but then denied it exactly 30 days later on XX/XX/XXXX, which appears to be intentional stalling. 

Chime failed to issue provisional credit during the dispute process, which is standard banking practice for chargebacks. 

They falsely claimed that " Regulation Z '' prevented them from issuing provisional credit, but they refused to provide a written explanation of how this applies to my case. 

Chime promised a written response within four hours but, after four days, has still failed to respond. 

XXXX confirmed that Chime is responsible for this chargeback, yet Chime refuses to issue my refund.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I filed a dispute against a company known as XXXX XXXX, also operating under the names XXXX  and XXXX XXXX XXXX ( hereinafter referred to as the " XXXX '' ), due to continued charges even after I had canceled their services. However, Capital One refused to reimburse me for these charges. 

On or around XX/XX/XXXX, I reported to Capital One that my card was lost or stolen. Capital One assured me that the old credit card would no longer be valid and could not be used by anyone. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent an email to the XXXX to cancel their services. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, after noticing charges by the XXXX despite the cancellation ( I was out of the country until XX/XX/XXXX ), I disputed these charges XXXX times. I informed Capital One that the XXXX had used my lost credit card number to make these charges. Capital One assured me they had blocked the XXXX to prevent further charges. The transactions were as follows : ( XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX, {$29.00} ( XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX, {$69.00} ( XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX, {$29.00} ( XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX, {$69.00} Initially, Capital One credited back these charges, but later reversed all four transactions after receiving documents from the XXXX. 

Capital One provided me with the XXXX 's documents. I disputed the XXXX 's claim that cancellation had to be done via certified mail, as they attached a document stating this policy. However, this document was fabricated. The XXXX did not provide this cancellation policy, and there was no " Accept '' button in any of their emails. Before purchasing their service, they had emailed me stating that I could cancel at any time if I was unsatisfied with their service. 

I uploaded my supporting documents to the platform provided by Capital One, highlighting the XXXX 's fabricated documents regarding the cancellation policy. 

Capital One denied my dispute against the XXXX and refused to reimburse the four charges. 

Even after these disputes, the XXXX charged me again on XX/XX/XXXX ( {$29.00} and {$69.00} ) and on XX/XX/XXXX ( {$410.00} and {$200.00} ). I was shocked and contacted Capital One to dispute these charges. 

Initially, Capital One credited these four charges, but later reversed them.

I meticulously prepared my supporting documents this time, including all email correspondence with the XXXX, highlighted important sections, and conducted online searches to find any published terms and cancellation policies. I found their terms but no cancellation policy. I also included complaints against the XXXX. 

Regarding the charges of {$410.00} and {$200.00}, the XXXX added a new statement to the cancellation policy that was not present in previous versions. I pointed out that this was evidence of the XXXX fabricating documents. 

I uploaded my response with supporting documents ( XXXX to XXXX pages ) for all eight transactions on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

Capital One denied all my disputes except for one transaction of {$29.00}. Despite contacting Capital One over 12 times to resolve the issue and respectfully requesting reinvestigation of the XXXX and authentication of their documents, the disputed amounts were not credited back to my account.

I am seeking assistance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). If necessary, I can provide the documents that I submitted to Capital One upon request.

* I want to upload all documents, but I left them in my office. I have only two of them in this computer and I upload two documents.

Consumer complaint narrative: Goldman Sachs is doing incorrect math on how much credit I have for my card in XX/XX/XXXX. By XX/XX/XXXX, I paid {$1400.00} and I spent {$600.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX they downgraded my credit limit from {$1500.00} to {$800.00}. The system said that I had {$600.00} in card balance and I had {$190.00} available credit which is true that I had spent {$600.00} in XXXX however I paid a total of {$1400.00} and there's {$680.00} that is unaccounted for. There was one customer service rep who told me on around XX/XX/XXXX that I overpaid and I would have full limits and receive a check for anything I paid beyond the {$800.00} limit after my payment was applied on XX/XX/XXXX. The backend system made a mistake and when my payment was applied on XX/XX/XXXX, it incorrectly said that I have only {$190.00} when I should have had no limits and I was supposed to receive a check for {$79.00}. Here 's the original math done by the Goldman Sachs rep and this math checks out to me : {$1400.00} ( total paid for XXXX ) - {$600.00} ( total spent in XXXX as of XX/XX/XXXX ) - {$800.00} ( available credit limit that was supposed to be available to me on XX/XX/XXXX ) = {$79.00} ( credit overpayment check that would be sent to me ). Because Goldman Sachs is now doing incorrect math ( which I suspect is because their backend database isn't properly equipped to apply payments properly when a credit limit is downsized in the middle of a billing cycle ), here is the new formula of what happened : {$1400.00} ( total paid in XXXX ) - {$600.00} ( total spent in XXXX as of XXXX ) - {$190.00} ( available credit to me on XX/XX/XXXX ) = {$680.00} ( total amount that is unaccounted for ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Urgent Complaint Regarding Money Transfer Issue MoneyGram Transaction at XXXX Dear XXXX, I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding a MoneyGram money transfer transaction I conducted at a XXXX location in the United States on XX/XX/XXXX. The transaction was intended to send funds for a rent payment in XXXX, but to this date, the recipients has not received the money. 
Transaction Details : Date of Transaction : XX/XX/XXXX Money Transfer Service : MoneyGram XXXX Store Location : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Transaction Reference Number : XXXX Amount Sent : XXXX USD Recipient 's Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Recipient 's Bank : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( BUH ) Transaction Reference Number : XXXX Amount Sent : XXXX USD Recipient 's Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Recipient 's Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( BUH ) Issue Description : Upon verifying with MoneyGram, I was informed that the money had been sent to the recipient 's bank in XXXX. 
However, when the recipients contacted the bank, they stated they had not received the funds. 
Despite multiple follow-ups with both MoneyGram and the bank, the issue remains unresolved, leaving the recipients without access to the money. 
Attempts to Resolve the Issue : 1. I contacted MoneyGram Customer Support, who confirmed that the funds were sent to the bank.

2. The recipients contacted their bank, which stated that no such transaction was received.

3. I revisited XXXX, but they were unable to provide further assistance. 
4. I requested MoneyGram to trace the transaction and provide a clear resolution, but no satisfactory response has been given. 
Requested Action : I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that : 1. The funds are either successfully delivered to the intended recipients or refunded to me.

2. MoneyGram and XXXX improve their accountability and transparency in handling international transfers. 
3. A formal explanation is provided regarding the whereabouts of the missing funds. 
This situation has caused significant financial hardship, and I seek immediate resolution. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and provide any updates regarding its progress. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I checked into a XXXX XXXX  XXXX however my card was incorrectly charged for a different reservation than my own but the employee attempted to cancel the transaction and informed me that it didn't actually go through. However, I showed him on my phone that the transaction did indeed go through my bank and it resulted in a pending transaction. 

I told them that my bank ( Current ) is good about reversing canceled transaction immediately so if it was in fact canceled I would have the funds back within 24 hours. I waited 72 hours and contacted Current because it was still pending and the hotel had their accountant look into and insisted it did not go through so they couldn't cancel it. 

My bank ( Current- XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has stated they have a cardholder agreement that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX would remain pending for 31 calendar days and I can not dispute a pending transaction and they can not manually cancel it until 31 days have passed due to their own policy ). That policy is actually ridiculous. A cardholder agreement can only be made between the consumer and the bank so how can include a merchant incorrectly charging you for something you didn't authorize? The merchant has admitted to the mistake and supplied my bank with a " Debit Release Authorization Form '' to reverse the funds but they remain saying I have to wait for 31 days and the charge is still pending 2 weeks later. The release form the merchant supplied shows no approval code as they stated the card processor glitched and the charge should've fallen off within 48 hours. These policies show a complete disregard for consumers that rely on the bank to protect our accounts and funds from errors.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is regarding Comenity Capital Bank and their handling of a XXXX XXXX  XXXX for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which has resulted in violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and potentially the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) due to their harassment, mishandling of disputes, and credit damage. 

In autumn XXXX, I experienced brief financial hardship and missed XXXX payments. Prior to that, I had a perfect payment history. In response, the bank began calling me XXXX to XXXX times per day, cycling through over XXXX different phone numbers. I have screenshots and voicemail recordings documenting this. XXXX message even threatened that I needed to get a lawyer. This excessive communication may constitute a violation of the FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692d ), which prohibits conduct that harasses, oppresses, or abuses the consumer. 

XXXX later admitted in writing that they contacted me this frequently but claimed it was legal since the calls were within allowed hours. Harassment is not permitted simply because it happens between XXXX XXXX  and XXXX XXXX  volume and frequency are also factors. I did not consent to these excessive contacts, and I had not opted into any autodialing systems. 

Despite resolving the account and bringing it back to good standing, my XXXX XXXX dropped over XXXX points, which is disproportionate and harmful, especially for a balance that was under {$3000.00}. This has become the only negative mark on my credit history and has directly blocked me from securing housing. 

I contacted the bank several times : Called and was falsely told that " good faith removals dont exist '' Submitted a request via the banks official website ( still unanswered ) Asked for a formal dispute and heard nothing in return These are violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C XXXX 1681i ), which requires furnishers of credit information to investigate disputes fully and respond within XXXX days. They have either failed to investigate or performed inadequate internal reviews. 

I have also filed multiple complaints with the CFPB : XX/XX/XXXX against XXXX XX/XX/XXXX against Comenity for abusive communication tactics XX/XX/XXXX against Comenity for improper dispute resolution XXXX of these complaints were closed without action, and the bank has continued to ignore, delay, or deny their responsibility. 

In addition to the CFPB : I filed with the New Jersey Division of Consumer Affairs ( XXXX ) They referred me to the Utah Attorney XXXX XXXX and the Utah Department XXXX XXXX XXXX, since Comenity is XXXX Both agencies referred me to the FDIC, where I filed on XX/XX/XXXX The FDIC responded XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, forwarding my complaint back to the CFPB, despite this being an exhausted route This is a closed-loop with no accountability. I have followed every formal channel and submitted documentation to all appropriate agencies. The bank is ignoring the CFPB, and unfortunately the CFPB appears unable to enforce action.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I made a {$6000.00} payment to my Delta SkyMiles Reserve American Express card to free up credit for an urgent, time-sensitive purchase. Immediately after the payment posted, Amex reduced my credit limit by {$5600.00} resulting in a transaction denial and financial harm. 

I received no prior notice of this credit reduction. During multiple calls and chats, Amex representatives and a supervisor confirmed : 1. No 45-day advance notice was issued ( in violation of TILA 12 CFR 1026.9 ) 2. No adverse action letter was provided, despite the decision being based on my credit profile ( in violation of ECOA XXXX U.S.C. XXXX ) 3. My credit score and utilization ratio were negatively impacted by the limit drop ( in violation of FCRA XXXX U.S.C. XXXXm ) Instead of resolving the issue, Amex offered a solution where I could pay an additional {$5200.00} to guarantee reinstatement of my original limit with a waiting period of up to XXXX business days. 

I repeatedly requested documentation of the credit decision, including certified mail tracking or internal records, and was told that nothing could be emailed. I also requested a transcript or recording of the call, which Amex stated could only be obtained through a subpoena. 

I was refused a live escalation to anyone with authority to resolve the issue, despite multiple formal requests and confirmation this was a legal dispute. This behavior paired with the timing of the credit reduction reflects coercive and abusive financial practices, and amounts to constructive fraud, bad faith, and unjust enrichment. 

Additionally, this conduct violates fundamental principles of equity and trust law. By accepting a large payment from me in good faith, then restricting my access to that credit without lawful notice or justification, Amex breached the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, and violated my right to equitable reliance. The company profited from my performance under the credit agreement while obstructing my access to the very benefit of that agreement. 

I am requesting : Immediate reinstatement of my original credit limit A refund of the {$6000.00} payment if credit access remains restricted A full investigation and written explanation Reversal of all damage to my credit profile I have preserved a full transcript, names, timestamps, and a legally valid recording of the call. This is now part of an ongoing legal matter, and I request a formal regulatory review and resolution.
