Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, Subject : Regulation Z Violation Dispute with Capitol One I am filing a formal complaint against Capitol One regarding the mishandling of a credit card dispute. 
Below are the details of the incident : On XX/XX/year>, I contacted Capitol One to report an issue related to a purchase made on XX/XX/year>, with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I had taken my car to XXXX for repairs due to a check engine light and trouble starting my vehicle. After paying for the service and picking up the car on the same day, the check engine light reappeared and the starting issue resumed. As XXXX was closed at the time, I returned to the shop on XX/XX/year> to inform them that the issue had not been resolved. The representative, XXXX, advised me that I would have to pay for additional services, despite the fact that the problem I had originally paid to fix had not been addressed. When I requested a refund or for the work to be redone, my request was declined. 
I then took my car to a different shop, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year>, where I was informed that XXXX had not completed the necessary work correctly, and that the repairs would need to be fully redone. After authorizing the repairs at XXXXXXXX XXXX the issue was resolved, and my car was functioning properly. 
On XX/XX/year>, I initiated a Regulation Z dispute with Capitol One, citing reason code 4853 : " Not as described, defective service. '' I explained that XXXX had assured me the service would resolve the issue, but it did not, causing me to incur additional costs with another repair shop. I provided Capitol One with all the relevant information, but they did not request supporting documentation at that time, which I found unusual. 
On XX/XX/year>, Capitol One sent me an updated letter stating that my claim had been denied, citing that the goods were as described and in good condition. They instructed me to provide supporting documentation by XX/XX/year>, in order to proceed. I complied and submitted all the requested documents on XX/XX/year>, including the sales invoice, a detailed letter outlining my attempt to resolve the issue with XXXX, and the invoice from the new shop showing that the work had to be redone. Despite submitting these documents, Capitol One denied my claim again within XXXX XXXX 
On XX/XX/year>, I called Capitol One and spoke with a manager, XXXX, who informed me that I needed to provide a letter from the second repair shop on their letterhead, explaining why the work from XXXX was not completed properly. I informed XXXX that this information was already noted on the invoice, but I would obtain the requested letter. XXXX confirmed that this letter was the only additional documentation needed to continue the case. 
On XX/XX/year>, I obtained the requested letter from XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX and resubmitted all my evidence to Capitol One. However, Capitol One once again denied my claim within an hour. 

On XX/XX/year>, I called Capitol Once again, only to be told that I needed to provide a credit voucher from XXXX. Since XXXX refused to provide a credit or resolve the issue, I was unable to obtain such a voucher. I explained this to Capitol One and referenced my prior conversation with Manager XXXX, who had assured me that the letter from the second shop would suffice. Despite providing all required documentation, including the requested letter, Capitol One continued to deny my claim. 
Furthermore, when I spoke with Managers XXXX ( ID XXXX ) and XXXX ( ID XXXX ), they refused to submit my case for pre-arbitration with XXXX, despite my having provided sufficient evidence, as outlined in the XXXX chargeback guide ( Section 3.24.6 ). Their refusal, combined with their rude behavior and disconnection of calls, has caused significant delays and frustration in resolving this matter. 
Given the clear violation of Regulation Z and the failure to properly handle my dispute, I request that Capitol One credit my account permanently for this disputed charge. If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will pursue further legal action. 
I have included all my documents along with this case along with the XXXX dispute guide showing explaining my evidence is enough. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in resolving this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> XXXX

On XX/XX/2023, I had to take an emergency medical leave of absence from work for mental health reasons. This was an XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, so I was not able to get XXXX and insurance claims established until after I had taken the leave from work. Due to this, I have not been getting paid and have gone 6 weeks without receiving any payment. 

On XX/XX/2023, I finally received two checks in the mail from the State of California Employment Development Department. The first check was for an amount of {$6200.00}, while the second was {$3000.00}, making a total of {$9200.00}. 

After receiving these checks, my first action was to go to my local Chase branch and deposit the checks in person at XXXXXXXX XXXX on Wednesday, XX/XX/2023. I hoped this would make the funds available within 1 3 business days. On Thursday ( XX/XX/2023 ), I checked the status of the deposit and received a notification stating that the funds would be held until XX/XX/2023. I was not given this information when I deposited the checks with the bank teller the day prior. I have not had any funds for 2 weeks, and waiting until XX/XX/2023 is not feasible. If I had been informed of the hold time before depositing the check, I would have made other arrangements, as I need these funds as soon as possible. 

I then called the XXXX XXXX department and spoke with XXXX. This representative was very helpful. I explained that I have been completely out of funds for the past 2 weeks and currently have no money to pay for my medication, food, bills, or gas. I also shared that I had to take a medical leave of absence from work due to mental health, and this financial situation is greatly exacerbating the issues I am experiencing. I offered to provide medical documentation to verify my situation and why I received these funds from the State of California. 

XXXX said that this was not necessary and I do not need to provide medical documentation ; the funds will be made available to me on XX/XX/2023 since they now understand my situation. I was very grateful for his help and was instructed that if the funds were not made available to me automatically on XX/XX/2023, I would just need to call back, and the funds would be released. 

On Friday morning, XX/XX/2023, the funds were not available, so I called at XXXX XXXX as instructed. The agent I spoke with this time said that the funds had not been received from the State of California, but as soon as the funds were received, they would be made available to me, and I would not need to wait until XX/XX/2023 ; I would receive the funds on XX/XX/2023. 

At XXXX XXXX I had not received the funds, so I called again to check on the status. I was then told that I will not be receiving the funds until XX/XX/2023. After being asked to speak with a supervisor, I was informed that the money has still not been received, and I can try calling again later. 

At XXXXXXXX XXXX, I still had not received the funds, so I called again. I asked to be escalated to a supervisor and was now told at this time that I need to provide medical documentation, and they will then decide if they will release the funds to me early. Its Friday night, and the banks close in 30 minutes, so I can not provide this until the next business day. I could have provided this on Thursday morning, but I was told I did not need to. 

I am now in a very difficult situation. I was behind on bills and arranged payments for my bills on XX/XX/2023, as I was promised I would have the funds by this date. I have no money to pay for medication, food, or gas, and I am running the risk of losing services such as electricity and phone. I have no money for gas or food, so I have to sit at home and wait for the funds of these XXXX funds to be made available ; I am out of medication and can not even get this. I took a leave of absence for mental health, and I have been working to get better for the past 5 weeks. I had been making progress and felt happy for the first time in over 1 year. 

This situation with XXXX has undone my progress over the past 5 weeks. After waiting for 6 weeks and struggling to get by, I was finally paid for my XXXX claim, then Chase bank said they wont release the funds for nearly 2 weeks. After speaking with a customer service agent, I was assured I did not need to provide any medical documentation, and I would receive the funds on XX/XX/2023. On XXXXXXXX XXXX on Friday night, XX/XX/2023, I was then told I need to bring in medical documentation for them to even consider releasing the funds to me, and I am greatly suffering.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a series of unauthorized charges on my Apple Card account. I have exhausted all reasonable efforts to resolve this matter directly with the issuer, Apple, but the issue remains unresolved despite numerous attempts. Here are the details of the situation : On XXXX, XXXX, I initially set up a XXXX order, and subsequently canceled the order after the initial trial period. Between XXXX and XXXX, no charges appeared on my Apple Card account, indicating that the cancellation was successful. On XX/XX/XXXX, an unauthorized charge of {$77.00} was authorized on my Apple Card account by the merchant. I promptly disputed these unauthorized charges on XX/XX/XXXX, with Apple Card customer service. Disputes were filed again on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, as the unauthorized charges were not rectified. The charges for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, were recently reversed. However, these reversals came after multiple disputes were filed, indicating that the charges were indeed unauthorized. Throughout this process, new card numbers were issued each time by Apple due to the unauthorized charges. Despite this, the unauthorized charges continued to occur due to Apple 's participation in an updater program with the merchant. Apple acknowledged in my communications with their customer service that the updater program does not function as intended in the case of unauthorized charges, demonstrating their own awareness of the issue. I have made diligent efforts to resolve this matter with Apple, but their failure to prevent unauthorized charges and their lack of effective action have led me to this point of filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. The recurring unauthorized charges, despite multiple disputes and new card numbers issued, have caused considerable frustration and financial inconvenience. I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau intervene and investigate this matter on my behalf to ensure that these unauthorized charges are properly resolved, and appropriate measures are taken to prevent such incidents in the future. At a minimum, I am asking that they credit my account for the charges that were reversed for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ( and to really honor their zero liability pledge, the dispute for XX/XX/XXXX should also be honored ). I believe that it is in the best interest of consumers to have a secure and reliable financial system, and Apple 's inadequate response raises concerns about their commitment to protecting their customers ' financial well-being. Enclosed with this letter, please find copies of relevant documents, including communication records with Apple, transaction statements, and dispute documentation. I appreciate your attention to this matter and thank you for your assistance in resolving this issue. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your valuable support in holding companies accountable for their actions.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Institution Complained Against : American Express XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX SUMMARY OF COMPLAINT On XX/XX/year>, I, XXXX XXXX, acting as the authorized representative of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, submitted a lawfully issued security instrument in the amount of {$1000.00} as a secured payment coupon to American Express in accordance with trust and private settlement protocols. This instrument was accepted in-hand by their office. 

However, American Express failed to return the original negotiable instrument. Instead, they responded : We were unable to process your payment of {$1000.00} received on XX/XX/year> because it wasnt an acceptable form of payment. 

Despite this so-called rejection, the original instrument was never returned, and instead a photocopied facsimile was mailed back on plain paper, clearly demonstrating that the original was converted, retained, or disposed of unlawfully. This action violates the following statutes and regulations : VIOLATIONS CITED 1. UCC 3-603 Tender of Payment Once tender of payment is made, and the obligee unjustifiably refuses to accept the tender, the obligor is discharged as if payment had been made. American Express failed to process the valid instrument or reject it in accordance with 3-603 ( a ) and ( b ).

2. UCC 3-604 Discharge by Cancellation or Renunciation Retention and dishonor without returning the original creates an unlawful cancellation or impairment of the instrument, especially when no lawful rejection or return under protest was performed.

3. Conversion and Commercial Dishonor By refusing to return the original trust-issued negotiable instrument, American Express has unlawfully converted private trust property, an act tantamount to theft under commercial law, violating fiduciary and consumer financial obligations.

4. Breach of Fiduciary Duty and Fair Dealing ( 12 CFR 1002.4 ) American Express failed in its duty to handle consumer payments and private trust instruments with good faith and in accordance with applicable consumer financial protection laws.

5. Failure to Provide Proper Accounting and Fair Credit Reporting ( 12 CFR 1026.7 ) As no valid rejection was issued and the payment was converted, the balance should have been credited. American Express failed to credit the account and failed to provide proper statements reflecting the tender.

6. breach of indentured agreements & Sec filings DEMAND FOR CREDIT & CIVIL MONEY PENALTIES Due to American Expresss dishonor without lawful protest, conversion of trust property, and failure to credit a valid payment, I am demanding : Immediate credit to Account # XXXX in the amount of {$1000.00} as required by UCC 3-603 and 3-604.

Return of the original security instrument, or a sworn affidavit explaining its disposal or conversion.

Civil Money Penalties beginning at {$25000.00} USD, pursuant to 12 U.S.C. 5565 ( a ), for the unlawful seizure and dishonor of trust-based negotiable instruments. This penalty includes : {$1000.00} per day for willful dishonor, {$5000.00} for unauthorized retention, {$15000.00} for failure to return trust property and resolve dispute in good faith.

Further refusal to act in equity and good faith will result in lien enforcement, private arbitration, and escalation to additional federal and regulatory enforcement bodies including : Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) Securities and Exchange Commission ( SEC ) Federal Reserve Board Legal Division IRS Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration ( TIGTA ) REMEDY REQUESTED 1.Immediate credit of {$1000.00} to the account.

2.Return of the original security instrument or affidavit of handling.

3.Enforcement of civil money penalties beginning at {$25000.00}.

4.Written acknowledgment of wrongdoing and commitment to policy correction.

All rights reserved. Submitted without prejudice under UCC 1-308. 
This complaint is made in good faith and under oath as to its truth and accuracy.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I discovered fraudulent charges on my PayPal account totaling {$1100.00} from XXXX. 

I filed a claim with PayPal regarding these fraudulent charges at approximately XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX That claim # is Case # XXXX At approximately XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX I get a response from PayPal stating " We've completed our review of your unauthorized activity case, and weve determined there was no unauthorized use. Based on our review, we found this transaction is consistent with your PayPal payment history ''. 

I haven't ordered from XXXX in years so there is no history of XXXX orders in 3 years. 

Secondly, I've never ordered thousands of dollars in products from XXXX so their conclusion is inconsistent with my purchase history. 

PayPal violated and dishonored their own fraud protection policies. It's also clear there needs to be a wide scale investigation into PayPal 's dealings and partnerships, especially with XXXX and other companies. 

As I was conducting research, I was shocked at the number of people who'd experienced this same and were forced to pay fraudulent charges on their PayPal account. 

PayPal is also violating the Electronic Fund Transfer Act Regulation E, which protects consumers from fraudulent charges.

Furthermore, in their own written PayPal has minimized the issue as being " unfamiliar transactions '' and " a disputed payment ''.

This is not the first time I've filed a claim for fraudulent charges on my PayPal account.

On XX/XX/XXXX I filed claim XXXX XXXX which they dismissed and denied as fraudulent charges. I was told to contact the company and take up the issue with the company. The company would not comply. 

I reached out to XXXX to file a fraud claim. Though PayPal denied they were fraudulent charges and is forcing me to continue paying these fraudulent charges, XXXX has frozen my account claiming a chargeback has been processed. This is obviously untrue as PayPal did not refund me for those fraudulent charges. 

So I'm unable to file a fraud claim with XXXX. Furthermore, XXXX referred me back to PayPal to take up the issue with PayPal. 

PayPal claimed to have done a thorough investigation into the matter and state since the address is the same, there is no indication of fraud. 

However, if a thorough investigation was completed by PayPal, there should have been informed uncovered regarding package interceptions, as outlined in this article linked below. 
https : XXXX PayPal 's written statement is proof they are unaware of this issue and serves as proof there was no thorough investigation.

PayPal has made it clear that I am responsible for paying fraudulent charges due to PayPal 's pay in 4 plan and that my card will be charged. This requirement of paying fraudulent charges is a consumer rights violation. 

Furthermore, PayPal has prevented me from removing my debit cards from PayPal 's site, in order to protect myself from further fraudulent charges. 

Again, violating their own consumer fraud protection policies and violating consumer rights. 

At this point PayPal has caused unnecessary stress and exacerbated my medically established diagnosis of XXXX XXXX This has caused me to begin treatments to address this.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: 1. Summary of the Problem I am filing this complaint against XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX for failing to comply with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) requires credit reporting agencies to verify accounts through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract upon my request. I sent a formal letter on XX/XX/year>, demanding removal or verification of a certain account on my credit report. Navy Federal Cr Union XXXX I followed up with a second letter, allowing time to delete those unverified accounts. To date, they have not provided proof of the original signed contract nor removed the disputed information. 2. Steps I Have Taken XX/XX/year> : Sent a written demand for physical verification of all disputed accounts, referencing my rights under the FCRA. Next, I sent a follow-up letter demanding deletion of unverified accounts and reminding them of their time to respond. I have not received reply from all 3 bureaus, nor have the disputed items been removed. 3. Applicable Law ( FCRA Violations ) Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requires credit bureaus to provide physical verification of an original consumer contract with my signature if they intend to continue reporting an account. FCRA, Section 611 : Mandates the removal of any information that can not be verified within a reasonable period. 4. How This Affects Me These unverified items harm my creditworthiness and ability to obtain loans and other lines of credit. Because the bureaus have not complied with federal law to either verify or remove the disputed items, they continue to report potentially inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit file. 5. What I Want Immediate removal of all unverified and inaccurate accounts from my credit report. Any further relief, as deemed appropriate, including ensuring that the credit bureaus remove all related inquiries and notations that harm my credit standing. I trust the CFPB will review this complaint and take action to ensure the credit bureaus comply with the FCRA. Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

I told him i had no clue what this person purchased only that when i first called 6 months ago, I was told it was one {$400.00} and one {$500.00} purchase made. He then said theyd send me a statement so i could dispute the individual claims and I have received NOTHING. They claim to record the phone calls for training purposes so I asked him to review my phone calls that would solidify my claims and he laughed and said yeah, no. Synchrony bank is disgusting and looking at the other 488 complaints made in the last 6 months, pertaining to similar issues, they should be shut down. Consumer complaint narrative:
APPEAL FOR FRAUD XX/XX/year> Money Network Financial XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Department Dispute Case ID : XXXX Attachments : State Drivers License and Current Banking Institution To whom it may Concern : I am replying to my original dispute placed on XX/XX/year>. What I believed to be so straightforward has now pushed me to the point of breaking out in hives. I am currently looking to retain counsel due to the stress your bank has caused me. I am on XXXX, and this is the money I am receiving for that. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, so I have a very astute sense of the issue and this illegal what your bank is doing. 

Here is the timeline of events, the actions I am taking and the resolution I would like to see. 

Original Issue : XXXX, XX/XX/year> o I woke up with a notification from XXXX that my XXXX payment ( {$3200.00} ) was deposited into my Money Network Account. 
o Upon Logging onto the account, I had noticed the money was transferred within 30 minutes after it was deposited. 
The total amount transferred was {$3200.00} o What struck me as odd was I did not initiate this o It was within minutes of the deposit which I never log on that soon ( it is XXXX California XXXX XXXX ) time o The amount is not what I usually transfer. I always transfer the full amount to my own bank, a credit union o When I looked the account numbers were not mine ( reference my account attached I am showing the last 5 digits out of safety ( I can no longer can log onto the app due to the account being closed ) o I immediately called Money Network to dispute the fraudulent transaction and close the account o The representative, closes my account, tells me she will expedite a card for {$8.00} and I will need to send the dispute o She said they will do research to determine the issue and let you know o I was happy since it seemed there was a resolution. 


Wednesday XX/XX/year> XXXX  XX/XX/year> o I call and speak to 5 different representatives ( one being a supervisor ) ( spent 6hrs on the phone total ) o One told me the money was in my new account ( there was a green light ). Her name was XXXX, and her phone extension was XXXX ( there is no way to get any accountability from the employees that you call into ) o One put me on hold for 58 minutes till I finally hung up o One told me a card was not sent and that the dispute was denied, and that XXXX needs to open an account and send me card o Finally, a supervisor told me that I will need to dispute it and no card was sent. She told me that she would put a trace in and once they traced it, I would have to call the bank the money was sent to, and I NEED TO GET IT BACK! * *Ive worked for XXXX and XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX That is the banks job, not the customers. I am blown away by all of this o I ALSO RECEIVED THE DISPUTE VIA US MAIL. WITH A FEW SENTENCES SAYING THAT WE ( MONEY NETWORK ) HAVE DETERIMINED NO ERROR OCCURRED. SO, IN ONE DAY YOU ALL TRACED THE BANK AND FOUND I OPENED THAT ACCOUNT? ITS FRAUD. IT USUALLY TAKES 30-90 DAYS TO RESOLVE o On XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX I went to the XXXX site office ( in person ) in southern California XXXX 
o XXXX said they have nothing to do with Banking. They do not send cards nor open accounts ; Money Network opens the account and XXXX just wire/Deposits the money o I also have moved forward with HARD CHECKS ONLY from XXXX, I will not be utilizing Money Network XXXX 
o I now need to get my {$3200.00} back from Money Network that the XXXX deposited. 

THINGS TO MAKE NOTE OF : o How is it that when I call, I need to do a 2-factor authentication to verify the account, but someone can transfer upwards of thousands through an APP ( I only had the app and never did anything online with a computer ) and was able to without a text to my number nor any sort of verification?

o 1-day internal investigation?!??! UNREAL!

o I have added the original submission of the dispute below o My current drivers license o My current banking information ( for comparison against the fraudulent transaction it was routed to, if you look, they do not match ) o I believe this was an internal issue. Someone knew of this amount and went ahead a transferred it without any difficulty and now you guys within a day say you have no fault? 


NEXT STEPS : o I am logging a complaint with the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation : they regulate a variety of financial services, businesses, products, and professionals. The department operates under the California Business, Consumer Services and Housing Agency.

o I am also logging a complaint with the Federal Reserve Consumer Help. You may file a complaint if you think a bank has been unfair or misleading, discriminated against you in lending, or violated a federal consumer protection law or regulation. 
o I am also logging a police report with my local law enforcement department : XXXX XXXX, CA. 
o I am also logging a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission o Lastly, I am searching for an attorney to take on this case if I do not receive my money in XXXX weeks. I should not have to contact anyone outside of the Money Network institution and so forth to get my money. That is your job as a financial institution to protect my money and rights. And you have now left me open to scammers and what not and expect me to go get my money? I dont think so. I will be like a dog with a bone. I dont care how long I have to carry this on, I will get my money and expose this bank if I have no action in two weeks. 
o I am on XXXX, and this should not be what I worry about, it is adding to my illness.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Capital One for engaging in unfair and deceptive business practices regarding my account number ending in XXXX. Despite my full compliance with a Debt Management Plan ( DMP ) through XXXX XXXX XXXX, this creditor wrongfully charged off my account, inaccurately reported missed payments, and failed to provide proper notification. 

Key Facts of the Complaint : I enrolled in a Debt Management Plan ( DMP ) through XXXX XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/year>. 

Capital One initially accepted payments through th

e DMP. I have made every DMP payment on time and in full sinc
e enrollment.

Despite my compliance, Capital One charged off my account.

I was never notified that this action was being taken. 
The creditor stopped accepting payments through the DMP, causing further financial harm. 
They are inaccurately reporting missed payments and the charge-off to credit bureaus. 

My credit report now reflects a charge-off and delinquencies that never occurred based on my DMP compliance. 
This unfairly damages my credit, making it harder to recover financially. 
This appears to be a violation of consumer protection laws. 

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) requires accurate reporting. 
The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) prohibits misleading debt collection tactics. 
Capital One may have also violated state consumer protection laws regarding failure to notify me properly.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding the unacceptable handling of a dispute I filed with Chase Bank. I have been a loyal Chase customer for over 10 years, and I am extremely disappointed by the way this issue has been addressed. 
On XX/XX/year>, I purchased a custom mouth grill from a merchant. After receiving the item, I determined it was not as advertised and returned it to the seller. I followed proper procedures and submitted a dispute to Chase, providing the following : Proof of return shipping Screenshots and records of my phone conversation with the merchant Evidence suggesting the merchant falsified documentation Despite this, Chase ultimately sided with the merchant. I attempted to file this dispute three different times, and each time I encountered severe incompetence and unprofessional behavior from Chase representatives.

One particular representative claimed he could not see a date on a document I submitted. When I offered to re-upload a clearer version, he refused to help and threatened to hang up on me. This level of disrespect is unacceptable under any circumstances, let alone during a dispute process. 
Furthermore, I believe that once representatives realized I am an XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX my concerns were not taken seriously. I was treated dismissively, and my supporting documentation was disregarded without valid reason. The experience has left me feeling unheard, disrespected, and discriminated against. 
I am requesting that : This case be re-opened and fairly reviewed by a competent and impartial team. 


A formal apology be issued for the mistreatment I experienced. 


Proper disciplinary action be taken against any employees who acted unprofessionally. 


If this complaint is not resolved in a timely and just manner, I will consider taking additional steps, including escalating this matter to federal regulators and exploring legal options. 
I hope Chase Bank will act responsibly and address this issue with the seriousness it deserves. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Chase Credit Card Account Number XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: 4 years ago I was approved for Citibank MasterCard World Elite travel card and I've continually made on Time payments and have never missed a payment and have never been late on a payment and have always paid more than the payment amount. In XXXX of this year 2023, my mother who was diagnosed with XXXX got into almost fatal car accident which rendered her unable to care for herself so she had to come stay with me and I had to be out of work for 4 months so I was using my credit that I had worked so hard for to get us by. I used a good portion of my credit over these XXXX months and then after paying almost {$11000.00} on this Citibank card to pay down the balance they decreased my credit limit not once but twice. They decreased it all the way down to what was left on this credit card after I paid the {$11000.00} on it, they decreased it all the way down to what I still had to pay off which made it look like I've maxed this card out again with the personal credit companies which affects my credit score which affects everything else.that I've worked so hard on paying off. They have done.this to a lot of other accounts holders and it's really bad business and almost a lie. My credit limit started out at XXXX and then they raised it to XXXX and then they decreased it to XXXX and then they decreased it all the way down to XXXX XXXX with no warning and after I've paid {$11000.00} on this card. Their business practice are affecting my credit score my other lenders and my interest rate and daily living on other things. I have never missed a payment, I've never made a late payment, and I've always paid more than they've billed me. I just think this is really dirty business practice and they are using their corporate power to hurt the consumer. I have paid over {$35000.00} to pay my credit cards off in the last 45 days with {$11000.00} going to this Citibank card. They would have been better off closing this account and allowing me time to pay it other than just making it look like I'm maxing out this credit limit on this card when they've lowered it by {$11000.00} in 2 months and only after I paid {$11000.00} on this card. I really would understand if I was a bad customer or if I was late on my payment or if I missed a payment but in 4 years I've never missed or been late on a payment. I just don't understand how they're allowed to do this and they are really affecting my daily life using my credit for the better good of me and my family.ive worked really hard on myself and my finances over the last 10 years and this unfair practice by Citibank is really affecting me and my credit score, among other things. It goes way past them lowering a credit limit. It's a domino effect and it's a lie.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
Back in XXXX I applied for a credit card with Chase called Chase Freedom Unlimited. I specifically chose to apply with them because of the promotion they had to get {$200.00} cash back after spending {$500.00} in the first 3 months of having the credit card. 

I was able to meet that requirement probably within the first month of the card opening. I noticed however that they did not apply the promotion to my account even after the fact. 

I initially called them about a month ago to inquire and I was told that it was a mistake and that they were going to send an escalation. I then receive a letter about a week or so later saying that they are not able to apply the promotion. 

I called a second time and this time, the representative stated that the first representative didn't do the escalation properly and that I shouldn't worry about having to call about the same issue again. It will be taken care of. 

This week ( XXXX XXXX, 2024 ) ; I received another letter and this time saying that the promotion was never in the account to begin with. So I called and talked to a supervisor who told me the same. They also asked me for proof of application which realistically nobody does when applying for a credit card. 

My question is why was that never mentioned in the beginning when I first got approved. It wasn't mentioned the first or the second time I called and brought this to their attention. Yet they expect me to have proof that I had the promotion when I applied. 

I asked them to provide the writing where it said I wasn't getting the promotion when I first got approved. They are not able to provide that either. 

I feel like it was a click bait and I was mislead with multiple different information. I didn't have this issue with any credit cards in the past. So I feel like it was a dirty tactic to get people to apply but not honor the promotion.

American Express ( account ending XXXX ) received a payment in the amount of {$980.00} in the form of security ( negotiable instrument ) sent by Registered Mail ( RE XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/year>.

42 USC 1786 ( m ) ( 10 ) ( A ) - ) The term coupon means a coupon, voucher, or other negotiable financial instrument by which benefits under this section are transferred.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Novo Bank Website : https : //www.novo.co/ Support Email : XXXX On XX/XX/year>, at approximately XXXX XXXX, my email, phone number, and both my XXXX and Novo accounts were compromised. That same day, an unauthorized transfer of {$180.00} occurred from my XXXX account into my Novo account. 

On XX/XX/year>, three additional unauthorized transfers were made from my XXXX account into my Novo account, totaling {$12000.00} : {$5000.00} {$5000.00} {$2000.00} Shortly afterward, two unauthorized outbound transfers from my Novo account were made to XXXX XXXX XXXX, in the amounts of : {$1400.00} {$40.00} These transactions were executed without my knowledge or authorization. 

On the morning of XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Novo Customer Service at approximately XXXX XXXX reported the account compromise, and explicitly requested an immediate freeze on my account. I also formally disputed all unauthorized transactions. 

Despite this clear notice, on XX/XX/XXXX, my account was unfrozen by a Novo representative named XXXX XXXX, based on fraudulent documentation submitted by the hacker. The ID used was clearly fake and included : A photoshopped image of my face A label reading XXXX A non-matching ID number This blatant forgery should never have passed Novos verification processes. As a result of this failure, an additional {$5000.00} was transferred to XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, and another {$5000.00} to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Fortunately, it appears both {$5000.00} transfers were reversed and returned to my Novo account on XX/XX/XXXX. As of XX/XX/year>, my Novo account had a balance of approximately {$10000.00}. However, Novo closed my account without any clear explanation and has failed to return those funds. 

I have no personal or professional relationship with the individuals who received these funds : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Email : XXXX Bank : XXXX Bank, last XXXX digits : XXXX XXXX XXXX Email : XXXX Bank : XXXX Bank, last XXXX digits : XXXX Despite repeated follow-ups, Novo continues to tell me that the account team is working on it, without offering any clear timeline or resolution. In contrast, other financial institutions I closed accounts with due to this breach promptly sent my remaining balances by check. Novo has not done so.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to request the removal of certain inquiries from my credit report. I have recently reviewed my credit report, and I noticed several inquiries that do not reflect my current credit activity accurately. I kindly request your assistance in deleting these inquiries from my credit report for good. 
Below, I have provided the necessary details regarding the inquiries that I would like to be removed : 1. Inquiry Dates : [ XX/XX/XXXX ] [ XX/XX/XXXX ] [ XX/XX/XXXX [ XX/XX/XXXX ] [ XX/XX/XXXX ] [ XX/XX/XXXX ] [ XX/XX/XXXX ] 1 understand that inquiries may remain on my credit report for a certain period of time, typically two years. However, I believe these inquiries were made without my consent or knowledge. Therefore, I kindly request that you investigate the legitimacy of these inquiries and remove them from my credit report permanently. 
As a responsible and diligent consumer, I have always strived to maintain a good credit history, and inaccurate inquiries can have a negative impact on my creditworthiness. I have attached copies of supporting documents, such as bank statements or correspondence, to prove that I did not authorize these inquiries. 
1 kindly ask you to initiate an investigation into these inquiries and take the necessary steps to ensure their deletion from my credit report. Additionally, I request tha provide me with a written confirmation once the inquiries have been removed. 
Please note that according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), it is your responsibility as a credit bureau to ensure the accuracy and fairness of the information contained in credit reports. I appreciate your attention to this matter and your commitment to upholding the FCRA guidelines. 
1 would like to express my gratitude for your prompt attention to this matter. If you require any additional information or documentation, please do not hesitate to contact me at the phone number or email address provided above. I look forward to a swift resolution of this issue. 
Thank you for your cooperation. 
Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX ]

Consumer complaint narrative:
My mom sent me {$400.00} via PayPal. I didn't ask for the money and thought she shouldn't send me that much money, so I graciously accepted {$100.00} with gratitude for groceries for my children. As a single mom, any financial help is good, times are tough. 
I sent back {$300.00} to the account that I thought was my mom 's. The same name. The email address she's used forever. I didn't think twice because everything matched up. However, the account was not owned or connected to my mom and she never received the {$300.00}. PayPal told me to reach out to the person who received the money and ask for a refund, which I did, several times to only receive XXXX mysteriously deposited into my account. I have called PayPal and sent messages. I have asked my mom to do the same. She claims she never received the money and that account is not in any way connected to her. I honestly don't understand why PayPal can't cancel the transaction or refund the money. I tried to cancel the transaction, .but that option wasn't even available to me. I really hope someone can help me with this. This is a lot of money for someone who is on a fixed income. This is devastating to me on behalf of my mom. I feel awful this happened and want to help and make sure she gets her money back. Please, if you could help me, I would greatly appreciate it. 
Thank you!!

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my concern over an unsettling interaction with Chase Bank that led to the unfair closure of my account and withholding of my funds. 

A few months ago, I deposited a cheque at Chase Bank, which was my two months ' security deposit from my previous apartment. The said amount was successfully recognized and credited to my bank account within a few days. However, distressingly, Chase Bank proceeded to close my account suddenly, without prior notification. More worrisome is the fact that they retained my deposited funds and only provided a refund for the other balance in my account. 

When reaching out to Chase for clarification, I was informed that they could not release my funds before they successfully verified the management company of the apartment complex I previously resided in. It baffles me why they would credit the check to my account in the first place, only to later state that verification of the source of the funds was required. 

Chase Bank, furthermore, indicated that if verification was unsuccessful, my funds would be transferred to the state. It is unsettling that despite funds being clearly entitled to me, they wound up with control that they were not entitled to.

Chase is giving me no other solution to recovering the {$24000.00} - essentially stating that they are going to keep that money.

Consumer complaint narrative:
am writing to formally dispute the decision regarding my PayPal claim which was wrongfully denied despite clear evidence that the item I purchased was not as described and does not function as intended. 

Key Points of My Dispute : 1. The item is defective and does not work as advertised. Despite PayPals claim that the seller accurately described the product, this is false. The product does not function in the manner described in the listing, making it Significantly Not as Described under PayPals Purchase Protection policy. 
2. PayPal misrepresented the facts of the case. The response I received falsely claims that my dispute is based on personal preference rather than functionality. However, my complaint explicitly states that the item does not perform as advertised. This is a clear violation of PayPals policies. 
3. PayPal has denied me consumer protection. The item was not delivered in the promised condition. Denying my claim despite this evidence violates PayPals own policies on protecting buyers from fraudulent or misleading transactions. 

I demand that PayPal properly review my claim with all evidence considered, or I will escalate this complaint to [ Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, XXXX XXXX XXXX, or relevant legal entities ]. I expect a resolution that includes a full refund, as I have been sold a non-functional product under false pretenses.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the inaccurate late payment reporting on my credit reports associated with XXXX Account [ Account Number : XXXX ]. This account is listed on my credit report twice, showing two different amounts for the same account, and it also inaccurately reflects late payments. These inaccuracies are in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and I request immediate corrective action. 

The FCRA, a federal statute governing the accuracy and fairness of credit reporting, provides specific guidelines that must be followed by furnishers of information like XXXX XXXX : 1. **Accuracy of Information ( Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ) ** : The FCRA mandates that furnishers provide accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies. I assert that the late payment reporting on my credit reports is inaccurate and does not reflect my payment history accurately. 

2. **Duty to Correct and Update Information ( Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) ** : The FCRA places an obligation on furnishers to promptly correct and update any information found to be inaccurate. As the late payment reporting is erroneous, I demand that you correct this information immediately with all credit reporting agencies that have received it. 

3. **Investigation of Disputes ( Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ) ** : Upon receiving notice of a dispute from a consumer, the FCRA requires furnishers to conduct a reasonable investigation into the disputed information. I hereby formally dispute the late payment reporting on my XXXX account, and I expect you to initiate a thorough investigation into the accuracy of these entries. 

4. **Time Limits for Investigations ( Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ) ** : The FCRA mandates that furnishers must complete their investigations within 30 days of receiving notice of a dispute. I insist that you adhere to this time frame when conducting your investigation. 

Failure to comply with the FCRA could result in legal action against XXXX XXXX. If these inaccuracies are not promptly resolved and corrected, I am prepared to take legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA. 

I request that you promptly investigate and correct the inaccuracies in the late payment reporting on my XXXX Account [ Account Number : XXXX ], addressing both the duplication issue with two different amounts and the inaccuracies in the late payments reporting. Please provide a detailed written response to me within the time frame stipulated by the FCRA, outlining the results of your investigation and any actions taken to rectify the inaccurate reporting. 

I am committed to ensuring the accuracy of my credit reports, and I anticipate your full cooperation in this matter. Please be advised that legal action will be pursued if XXXX XXXX fails to rectify these inaccuracies promptly and in accordance with federal law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: Hello, I have a Capital One credit card with a measly {$300.00} credit limit. I had to verify numerous times with different customer service reps at Capital One the payments that were made during the end of XXXX and beginning of XXXX. My account was verified successfully ( whereas I'm the actual account holder ). I sent them all required documentation. When I sent over the account information re my nephews info, the account number did not match his chime card. I was on the phone with a capital one rep and called my nephew on a XXXX way call and the rep claimed she could not hear him. When I tried XXXX way call with several other people they had no problem hearing me. I asked to have my account closed without any negative connotation attached to the closing because I have no idea what is going on. Capital one continues to ask for the statement attached to my nephew 's card which I sent them. The info they are requesting is an issue where capital one, chime company, my nephew and I need to be on the phone. I was told I could not call capital one 's verification department directly they can only call me. I have been waiting for several days for someone to call me regarding this. I'm beginning to think there's something fraudulently going on here and I have sent too much banking information to capital one for a credit card with a {$300.00} limit. Furthermore, I don't understand why they can not close the account, because at this point in time I myself have no idea what is going on and absolutely not getting any communication from capital one. I have the same message on my account, " This account is currently restricted '' as if I'm some kind of criminal or engaged in criminal activity.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Business bank account was closed by company with no explanation or reason why it was closed. After account was closed our customers continued to send ACH payments to the closed account. PNC bank tells me the ACH transactions were returned to the sender which is XXXX County Clerk of Courts Comptroller.

I contact sender and tell them PNC insists that the funds were rejected and sent back to the sender which is XXXX XXXX. The county comptroller then provides me a copy of their financial statement showing where the funds were sent out to PNC bank and never received back from PNC bank. They also provide me with a ACH payment trace number, which is then provided to PNC bank. They requested a return trace number from PNC bank in order to be able to track where the funds went since PNC bank is insisting they sent them back. To this date after countless calls and emails to multiple PNC bank branches, several in-person visits to multiple branches, and multiple calls to PNC bank customer service reps in multiple departments, PNC bank has not provided a return trace number for either of the two missing ACH payments of over {$4000.00} each. PNC bank has not initiated a single call back about this issue since day one, I have had to contact them every single time, only to get told they can not find anything and the funds were returned. If these two ACH transactions were not returned, I feel fairly certain there could be more transactions that were not returned as well. I had this bank account opened since I started the business since XXXX. After they closed the account there were still other ACH payments erroneously being sent to the account from different customers over a year later that PNC banks also states were returned to the sender but will not provide me with the list of transactions so I can verify if that really happened. 
This issue first started in XX/XX/XXXX for the first transaction and XXXX of XXXX for the second transaction and I still feels like I have not made any progress. The county comptroller states that she can not dispute the issue with their financial institution without a return trace number from PNC bank in order to verify that the missing funds were actually rejected by PNC bank and sent back. Now PNC bank is trying to tell me that they can not get that info because it was too long ago. 

Missing ACH Payment # 1 for {$4600.00} was sent from XXXX County to PNC BANK on XX/XX/XXXX. The original ACH trace number is # XXXX Missing ACH Payment # 2 for {$4400.00} was sent from XXXX XXXX to PNC BANK on XX/XX/XXXX. The original ACH trace number is # XXXX

I went to the bank on Monday XX/XX/XXXX, to show them the proof, The lady at the bank called the fraud dept, and they told her they were having technical dificulties, and it will take about an hour for their issue to be resolved, but the bank was closing in an hour. The lady at Chase told me that she will contact in the morning of XX/XX/XXXX, when I spoke to her, she told me that the document is not good enough, because it does not have a phone number. Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX a packaged for {$710.00}, I ordered with Best Buy using my Best Buy Citibank Credit Card was delivered by XXXX XXXX At the time of delivery, I was on a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. That cruise was from XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. I also provided the credit card company proof of that during this dispute. I got home from the cruise on XX/XX/XXXX and did not have a text message saying a package was delivered. Which was odd because we have parcel locker boxes that XXXX and other carriers are supposed to use which stores the package in locked box and will send you a text and code to get your package. My apartment complex provides these boxes so stuff like this doesn't happen. I looked up my XXXX XXXX number and the proof of delivery photo shows it on a counter which is located downstairs in my apartment complex across from the USPS boxes. I went down there and the package was not there. Anyone who walks in this building could have taken it. Why was it not put in a parcel locker box? Why was it not delivered to my address apt door # on the shipping address? I immediately called XXXX and opened an investigation on this situation. That following Thursday XXXX called me back stating that Best Buy is the shipper and needed to call them and file a lost and stolen claim as they were at fault for not delivering the package properly. I took every step possible to try and get Best Buy to contact XXXX and do what they asked and they refused stating it was delivered properly based on proof of delivery. I have a chat log showing me telling them to contact XXXX and do that as well. Bottom line is though it wasn't delivered properly. Proper delivery would be them delivering it to my apartment door # listed on the shipping address, which the proof of delivery photo from XXXX, when you look up the tracking #, shows it was left on a counter. That is not my shipping address apartment door. So it was not delivered properly. And anyone could have taken that package, including the driver after snapping that picture based on where it was located. To top it off, I was on a cruise ship on XX/XX/XXXX. I couldn't even check then and they should have either brought it to my door listed on the shipping address or put it in a parcel locker box which would have secured the package and this would have never happened. Listen, I can't force Best Buy to call XXXX and file a lost and stolen claim like XXXX said for them to do. But it also wont let me file that claim, because best buy and XXXX have a contractual agreement and they need to be the ones to do it. So I had one last option, file a dispute with my Best Buy Credit Card who is done by Citibank. I filed this dispute with Citibank on XX/XX/XXXX after spending hours on the phone with best buy and XXXX trying to get this fixed. I just wanted my item, that I never received. But Best Buy was not doing what XXXX asked and I can't again force Best Buy to listen. So I filed this dispute with Citibank on XX/XX/XXXX for the amount of {$710.00} for not receiving the item and because it was not delivered properly. I sent Citibank tons of proof and documentation. Including a best buy chat log showing me to tell them to contact XXXX and file a lost and stolen claim, a police report, I sent them the XXXX proof of delivery photo which shows the package on a counter and not delivered properly to my apartment door etc. A few days ago Citibank closed this claim, stating Best Buy sent them proof of delivery stating they will not charge it back or refund the item and it was delivered properly. Honestly, I beyond disbelief at how this has been handled. I clearly showed Citibank proof with the proof of delivery photo from XXXX that it was not delivered to my apartment door. I sent them a police report and all this information. Why would I spend XXXX plus hours, file a police report and go through all this if I had the package? I was on a cruise ship when it was delivered and where it was delivered was in an open area downstairs in my complex. not a parcel locker box which we have here which would have secured it, not my actual apartment door which is listed on the shipping address. Also the item is {$710.00} how come they didnt ask for signature or put it at a XXXX drop off location if they had issue or because of the value of the item. I am filing this against, Citibank for denying my claim and accepting what best buy said when its not even valid especially with all the proof I provided. If I am not refunded, I will be seeking legal action. Also I have a XXXX credit score, I have never been late on any payments and I have no debt. So I am extremely upset at Citibanks handling on this. I should not have to pay for item that was not properly delivered and was stolen.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Request for Validation of Accounts To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to request your company to validate the following items on my credit file, which may be inaccurate. Please validate these items to ensure they are correct and belong to me. This request is in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ), asserting that I dispute your claim and seek validation. Kindly forward a copy of this request to the relevant creditor.

I want to clarify that this is not a mere request for " verification '' or proof of my mailing address. Rather, it is a formal VALIDATION request, as stipulated by the aforementioned Title and Section. I respectfully urge your offices to provide me with credible evidence establishing my legal obligation to pay this debt. Please provide the following : 1. Identify the original creditor and specify the purpose of the claimed debt.

2. Clearly explain and substantiate how the alleged debt amount was calculated.

3. Furnish copies of any documents demonstrating my agreement to the asserted debt.

4. Provide verification or a copy of any applicable judgment, if applicable.

5. Demonstrate that the Statute of Limitations has not expired for this account.

6. Show that the creditor is authorized to collect in my state.

7. Provide me with the creditor 's license numbers and Registered Agent details. 

I'd like to emphasize that if your offices have reported unverified information to XXXX, XXXX, or TransUnion, such action may potentially constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. I must assert that if any derogatory information appears on any of my credit reports due to your actions or the actions of the represented company, I will not hesitate to initiate legal action against you for : - Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act - Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act - Defamation of Character I trust that you will provide the necessary documentation within 30 days from the receipt of this letter. During this time, all collection and reporting activities related to these accounts must cease. 

Please be advised that any adverse actions affecting my credit reports taken during this validation period will lead me to consult my legal counsel for appropriate action. This includes inaccuracies in reporting or verifying an account as accurate without providing supporting proof. 

Should your offices fail to respond to this validation request within the specified timeframe, I demand that all references to the mentioned accounts be promptly deleted and entirely removed from my credit file. Furthermore, I expect a copy of the deletion request to be sent to me immediately. 

Additionally, I kindly request that the credit bureau or creditor refrain from making telephone contact with me, whether at my residence or place of employment. Any such communication attempts will be deemed harassment, compelling me to pursue legal recourse. I insist that all future communications be conveyed in writing and sent to the address indicated in this letter via USPS. 

It is advisable for you to ensure the accuracy of your records before I am compelled to pursue legal action. This endeavor aims to rectify inaccuracies and ensure that any information obtained serves that purpose.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a credit card with Synchrony Bank, for a balance of {$700.00} with no interest for 1 year. I was making minimum payments due to Covid then midway through I made a higher payment then the bank lowered the card balance and availability by a couple XXXX dollars. I called to ask the reason for the credit limit decrease and was informed it's their right and if not paid by the 12 month it would be off the new credit limit. Subsequently the year hit and the interest was added which I was aware of. However, Synchrony based the interest of the original card credit limit and not the credit limit they changed the card to midway through. I called to dispute and explore medical/pandemic considerations. 
They mailed the payment history as requested but nothing reflecting the credit limit change and the reason for the current interest. They Subsequently sold the account and locked me out from reviewing the full record. The new debt collector stated that's not something they can investigate because Synchrony said the balance is final. I again asked since they are the new owners they should assume full responsibility and investigate the amount to make sure it's accurate. The male representative said he would consult with a supervisor and call back. A different representative called with the same offer to pay {$1000.00} after explaining the scenario and again requesting a supervisor, she put a representative on who said she was the supervisor but sounded like the same person. She again stated Synchrony sent them the amount and she couldn't change it. That was the end of the discussion and they placed the original amount and full interest on my credit report. They will not investigate they just revert back to Synchrony did it.

Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally submit a complaint against HSBC regarding the unjust closure of my accounts. HSBC has closed my accounts without providing a clear or legitimate reason and referenced terms in a hyperlink-controlled document that was neither reasonably presented nor clearly disclosed at the time of account opening. This situation has caused significant financial harm and raises serious concerns under U.S. consumer protection laws.

Details of the Issue : Bank : HSBC Bank USA XXXX. 
Account Types : personal savings, checking, investment, credit cards Date of Closure Notification : XX/XX/year> Reason Provided by HSBC : HSBC has consistently refused to provide any specific reason for the account closure, stating that they reserve the right to close accounts at their discretion, as indicated in a hyperlink attached to the original contract. This clause was not adequately disclosed or highlighted when I opened the account. 

Relevant Legal Concerns : 1. Lack of Clear Contractual Terms : HSBC has indicated that the right to close accounts without reason is detailed in a hyperlink found in the online version of their terms and conditions. This clause was not adequately disclosed or highlighted when I opened the account. According to 12 U.S. Code 5531 ( Unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ), it is unlawful for financial institutions to engage in unfair or deceptive practices, including burying significant contractual terms in hyperlinks that are subject to unilateral modifications by the bank without proper disclosure or customer consent.

2. Unfair and Unreasonable Contract Terms : The clause HSBC refers to effectively allows them to close accounts without explanation, and because the clause was hidden in a hyperlink-controlled document, which can be modified at their discretion, it denies customers the opportunity for informed consent. This violates the principle of fairness under the Truth in Savings Act ( 12 U.S. Code 4302 ), which requires that all terms of a banking contract be clearly and conspicuously disclosed at the time of account opening. The failure to provide a clear, stable, and unmodifiable contract term undermines my ability to make informed decisions and contradicts federal regulations mandating transparency. 

Impact on Me : I have lost access to my funds and accounts without any clear reason or warning, significantly disrupting my personal finances and business activities. 
HSBCs refusal to explain their decision prevents me from addressing or rectifying any potential issues. 
The lack of transparency and fairness in their contractual terms has eroded my trust in their services and damaged my financial standing, possibly affecting my ability to open accounts elsewhere.

The CFPBs findings indicate that Zelle has not only neglected to protect consumers but has also allowed repeat offenders to exploit the system, leaving user vulnerable to scams. The lack of accountability and transparency is unacceptable and raises serious concerns about consumers safety.

Consumer complaint narrative: Hi, last year I was refunded from XXXXXXXX XXXX mid last year or so ( About XXXX usd ) I used XXXX Usd of it no issue and tried to process the remaining XXXX on a dog i was paying off. The money got refunded because my bank marked it as spam without notifying me. I had to call them after a few days to get that information. After letting my bank know that it was not fraud, i then was told they would look into it and it should be put back into my account within a few buisness days. A week or so passed and i called them again, and informed them i had been waiting on that XXXX to be deposited. They told me the same thing, that they will look into it and it should go back into the account in a few buisness days. A few weeks on calling turned into a few months ... After I had enough i demanded to speak with the manager to figure out what is going on as I was still waiting on that money to pay off my dog which had crazy interest that was racking up. I was told by the manager " XXXX '' that it was " stuck in a loop '' and that he would personally write a check and get it mailed express shipping ... After a week of not reciving the check we called again and he assured up it will be handled.. After another week or so we complained again and eventually after complaining enough times we recived a check that wasnt even valid. The manager confirmed that it wasn't cashed out and that he would find another way through a credit or a valid check. After being told flase promises the mangers stopped replying and we weren't able to hear back from the company on any update on the situation. It has almost been a year! at this point we switched banks because of this awful service and are considering a lawsuit.

Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased two products from a company that were on pre-order but payment was taken at time of purchase. The amounts were for {$620.00} and {$120.00} and the dates are listed on my account for these transactions were XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. After over a year with no product in hand and little to no information being sent by the company pre-ordered from, I requested a refund around XX/XX/XXXX. About a year later, XX/XX/XXXX, I heard back from the company letting me know that they would cancel my orders and refund them to the card on file. The card had expired since the original transaction but the new card I have is attached to the same account that was on the original card. The company let me know that the funds should go back and contacting my bank, TD Bank, and speaking to a representative led me to believe that there should be no issue. If I did have an issue with the transaction posting after 7-10 business days, I would need to go into a branch to dispute the transaction. The orders were cancelled and refunded in their XXXX XXXX payment system on that day. I waited 7 business days for an authorization or the funds to be shown in my bank account, but nothing happened. I traveled to the XXXX XXXX TD Bank location and spoke to someone in person about the transactions. They spent time verifying that the transactions existed in the record of my account and they told me that I should wait the extra 3 days to make sure that the transaction posts. While TD 's policy of 60 day dispute timeframe was out of scope, they might be able to fix some issues. I was told that the representative would reach back out to me at the 10 business day mark of the transaction. At this time, I reached back out to the original company for a followup and they gave me two ARN ( Acquirer Reference Number ) numbers to help the bank track the transaction. I did not get called on that XXXX day. I called the branch on the following day to follow up and was told that there was no appetite by management to help me. I called the TD " Customer Care '' line for help and was told that my card was expunged from my account. They could see that the card WAS on the account, but the data was gone. This did not make sense to me as the transactions are on the account and was told that the refund to the old card should work but was told that because the card is so old, they couldn't do anything. I spoke to a manager and was told the same thing. I tried many times to give them the ARN that I was given but no one seemed to know what the ARN was. They took the numbers and told me that they would escalate my issue to the investigation team at TD Bank but I would need to wait 5-7 business days to hear back from the investigation team. I waited 5 business days and heard nothing so I reached back out to TD Bank to get a status on my investigation from a manager only to find out that no investigation request was put in and that " It isn't right that I'm being treated this way. '' The person told me they would reach out to me after reaching out to the Investigation team. I have not heard from anyone at TD Bank since. I reached out to the original company and have not heard back from them either. By refusing to help me with this issue, TD Bank has effectively robbed me of {$740.00} and my trust that they actually will help any client if they run into an issue.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
15 U.S. Code 1602 - Definitions and rules of construction ( e ) The term person means a natural person or an organization.

( f ) The term credit means the RIGHT granted by a creditor to a debtor to defer payment of debt or to incur debt and defer its payment.

( g ) The term creditor refers only to a person who both ( 1 ) regularly extends, whether in connection with loans, sales of property or services, or otherwise, consumer credit which is payable by agreement in more than four installments or for which the payment of a finance charge is or may be required ( j ) The terms open end credit plan and open end consumer credit plan mean a plan under which the creditor reasonably contemplates repeated transactions, which prescribes the terms of such transactions, and which provides for a finance charge which may be computed from time to time on the outstanding unpaid balance.

( l ) The term credit card means any card, plate, coupon book or other credit device existing for the purpose of obtaining money, property, labor, or services on credit.

( m ) The term accepted credit card means any credit card which the cardholder has requested and received or has signed or has used, or authorized another to use, for the purpose of obtaining money, property, labor, or services on credit.

( n ) The term cardholder means any person to whom a credit card is issued or any person who has agreed with the card issuer to pay obligations arising from the issuance of a credit card to another person.

Any false representation of material facts made with knowledge of falsity and with intent that it shall be acted on by another in entering into contract, and which is so acted upon, constitutes fraud, and entitles party deceived to avoid contract or recover damages. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

In the federal courts, it is well established that a national bank has not power to lend its credit to another by becoming surety, indorser, or guarantor for him. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

It is not within those statutory powers for a national bank, even though solvent, to lend its credit to another in any of the various ways in which that might be done. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Under truth in lending regulation providing that disclosure of consumer credit loan shall not be stated, utilized or placed so as to mislead or confuse consumer, placement of disclosures is to be considered along with their statement and use. Truth in Lending Regulations, Regulation Z, Section 226.6 ( c ), 15 U.S.C. following section 1700 .XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Any violation of the Truth in Lending Act, regardless of its technical nature, must result in finding of liability against the lender. Truth in Lending Regulations, Regulation Z Section 226.1 et seq., 15 U.S.C. Section 1700 ; Truth in Lending Act Section 130 ( a, e ), IS U.S.C. Section 1640 ( a, e ). In XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

I initiated a Consumer Credit Transaction with Bank of America N.A. ( Bank ) XXXX XX/XX/XXXX using the prepaid account given to me by Congress to exercise my right to credit as a natural person. I am very aware that banks are not allowed to lend credit and that their authority to use credit is granted through the applicant. I am also aware of my hybrid prepaid account that it available through a separate credit feature attached to the social security number account and by provided Bank of America with the social security number and a signature it gives them authorization to make an electronic funds transfer according to Regulation E. Proof of this transaction is evident on my credit report in the form of an inquiry. I contacted the bank on XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX  and XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX expressing my rights to proceeds and was told I was stating opinions and the applications had disclosures. I did let the agent know the application would not allow me to opt of sharing my information with third parties and was ignored. I also alerted the bank to being in default and are liable to me pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance which Bank of America is liable to me in the amount of USD {$200000.00} payable in lawful money.

Consumer complaint narrative: I received multiple alerts about credit inquiries performed on my Credit Report. The inquiries occurred on or about XXXX XXXX XXXX. I received a denial letter from one of the companies in the mail yesterday, XXXX XXXX XXXX Thus, today, I began my endeavors to get ground truth on what is happening. I first contacted the XXXX credit reporting agency. They informed me I needed to contact the companies by whom the inquiries were performed. I have done so. Using the numbers provided by the credit reporting agencies, I successfully contacted 3 out of the 4 companies. However, the fourth company, US BanCorp, required additional research to find a number I could call as the credit reporting agency only reflected the contact data as 'By Mail ' only and provided a mailing address in XXXX, ND XXXX NOT what a consumer wants to do in order to QUICKLY put a halt on someone fraudulently applying for credit in their name. I succeeded in contacting US BanCorp using a round-about way ... a Freespoke.com search for a phone number... ANY phone number for US BanCorp to attempt immediate resolution... and am in the process of getting the inquiry removed from my credit report. I also noted a new phone number on my credit reporting agency profile, XXXX. I, nor anyone in my family, have ever had this number. I removed it. The number is possibly and seems to be from the area in which I reside. Further, one of the companies with whom someone applied for a credit card in my name used my actual current home address. The use of my actual home address coupled with the 'local ' phone number appearing on my profile leads me to believe someone local may be intercepting my mail. I have not yet filed a police report, but I do plan on it within the next 24 hours ... .still ongoing processes to re-secure my digital existence.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Cash App ( Block , Inc. ) due to inadequate customer service and unfair practices, which violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ). Specifically, Cash App failed to take timely and effective measures to prevent and address fraud on their platform, leaving my account vulnerable and unprotected.

Furthermore, their dispute resolution process was unfair and deceptive, as they did not comply with error resolution requirements under the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E. These actions have caused significant inconvenience and financial loss, and I seek appropriate redress for these violations.

I am filing a complaint with CFPB regarding capital ones failure to deposit my direct deposit from my employer and any other incoming deposits. Capital one has cited technical issues which may violate the electronic fund transfer act EFTA as it requires timely access to funds. This situation raises concerns about consumer protection laws, and I request your assistance in investigating this matter to ensure my rights are upheld. Thank you.
