Consumer complaint narrative:
Credit card company charges XXXX dollars annual fee for the card. I was fine with it because I really needed the card. They approved for % XXXX. 

Less than a week into using the card, it was blocked a couple of times for fraudulent use. I wouldn't have known if I didn't call. No email or text to let me know. I was trying to use it for XXXX. Apparently, it's fraudulent. They unblocked the card but told me i can't use it for XXXX anymore. 

Anyway, a week into using the card, I called and found out that it was blocked again. But this time they can not unblock it without me sending ID. They just told me because of fraudulent use. But they did not even confirm with me if they are indeed fraudulent. They were all legit purchases. 

Another issue came up when they told me that I can only fax or postal mail the ID. No email or website upload of the document. During this time, I can't even access my account online. 

I was able to send the fax and called if they received it. I've called several times to see if the information on the number of days to process changes. The general information I got says that it takes A WEEK FOR THEM TO RECEIVE THE FAX. I don't know if they are outsourcing it or what but in this day and age, I can't imagine any US company receiving fax that long. After that, it will TAKE TWO WEEKS TO PROCESS THE DOCUMENT. 

So, to unblock my card for a purchase they said was fraudulent, which was not, will take XXXX weeks. I paid XXXX dollars to use the card and they've already blocked it for almost a month.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I logged into CapitalOne.com to make a payment on my PotteryBarn Visa Credit Card, and was notified the account was closed. When I call the bank I spoke with XXXX who stated the company sent a notification to me on XX/XX/XXXX to indicate I needed to provide updated income and employment status. XXXX initially stated this request was sent to my email, when I advised that no such email was received, he then stated it was sent postal mail. I advised that no such piece of mail was received from Capital One. He then repeated the methods he claimed I was notified, however, was unable to produce evidence that either had actually occurred. 

I advised XXXX that I regularly ( almost every 90 days ) receive notification when I log into their website requesting this information be provided, and I have provided the information every time it has been requested. I asked XXXX to provide the last date I provided this information to Capital One, and he advised they do not track this information and he could not provide it. 

I then requested to be transferred to a supervisor, and spoke to XXXX XXXX located in XXXX, Florida. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, Florida ) advised an electronic document is in my documents folder when logged in, no such document exists. XXXX XXXX confirmed that the website prompts for income/employment information when required by bank, advised that I have no such prompt on any cards and XXXX XXXX agreed that I would have had to provide information to make prompt go away, however, she is unable to determine when was the last time the income/employment information was updated. 
- Placed on hold why XXXX XXXX determines what can be done to the account to restore them - Immediately after ending call with XXXX XXXX, I received an email notification to update my income and employment information from CapitalOne. When I updated my information online ALL credit cards associated with my profile were updated. 
- XXXX call received on XXXX @ XXXX EST Team does not handle account requests. Verified mailing address. Escalated for further review. 
o 7 to 10 business days more - XXXX called on XXXX @ XXXX XXXX o Working customer accounts team, information was updated but yet the accounts were closed. 
- Spoke with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX EST o Advised that the bank has made the decision to not reopen the accounts because the information has not been provided. I advised him that the information was provided on XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX, and subsequently at the exact same time updated online. He simply restated that I never provided the information, and when I again requested when the last time this information was provided to Capital One, he stated he could not discuss this any further. When I pressed to speak with someone who could provide this information, he simply stated " the bank has made it's decision and you can not speak with anyone else ''. 

Capital One has violated truth in lending regulations, and arbitrarily closed an account without providing any opportunity to resolve the issue. Furthermore, the bank has openly refused to correct the error or even provide information when asked about how their income verification process is tracked.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Capital One regarding the closure of multiple credit card accounts without my knowledge or consent, which has caused direct harm to both my personal credit and my small business. 

I recently launched a new business and attempted to pay down my Capital One balances using a new XXXX business account. For reasons unknown to me, the payments were returned. Once I realized the issue, I immediately transferred the funds to my personal account and successfully paid the cards down. 

Shortly after, I discovered that Capital One had closed all of my credit cards without warning or notification. These accounts are regularly used for both personal and business expenses. Their closure now puts me at risk of being denied a small business loan I was preparing to apply for a loan intended to help me purchase and revitalize my familys driving range. 

This is my livelihood, and the closure of these cards severely impacts my credit utilization and payment history XXXX major factors in my credit profile. 

To make matters worse, I reached out to Capital One support and was transferred between XXXX different representatives, none of whom had a clear solution. The final individual I spoke with was dismissive, unprofessional, and unhelpful. There was no effort made to resolve the issue, and I was left without answers, options, or accountability from Capital One. 

This situation is unacceptable. I have been a responsible customer, and I paid the balances down in good faith to improve my credit. To have these accounts closed without a single phone call or email, and then be treated dismissively, is incredibly damaging financially and emotionally.

Consumer complaint narrative: I received an email from XXXX on XX/XX/year> stating that there had been a change to my credit report. Upon checking the report, I saw that there was a hard inquiry from Capital One that I did not recognize. I immediately called XXXX and told them that I did not apply for a credit card through Capital One and did not grant anyone permission to check my credit report. They placed a fraud alert on my account and I asked them to place a temporary freeze on my credit report. I then called Capital One on XX/XX/year> and informed them of the fraudulent activity. They informed me that they did see that I had an account with them ( which I personally did not open ) and that a credit card had been applied for on XX/XX/year>. They informed me that the card is in the process of being delivered to whoever applied for it, but that they would place a fraud alert on the account and that the card will rendered inactive. They also told me that this account/transaction is under open investigation for 60-90 days and I should receive something in the mail from them within this timeframe regarding the outcome of the investigation. I asked them to remove the hard inquiry from my credit report and was told this could not be done until after the 60-90 day period. Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Urgent Matter Application, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Dear Discover Financial Services and Discover Bank, I hope this letter reaches you in good health. I am writing to bring to your attention a matter of significant concern regarding the handling of applications submitted to Discover Bank, which have been converted into securities and subsequently traded on the secondary market. It has come to my attention that my applications, in particular, have been utilized for this purpose, and I believe there are critical issues that require immediate attention and resolution. My applications were submitted to Discover Bank under the understanding that they would be processed in accordance with the terms outlined in our binding agreement, and that in return for the investment, I would receive the agreed-upon products and services. However, it has come to my knowledge that these applications have been transformed into securities for trading on the secondary market without my explicit consent. I would like to draw your attention to the following points : XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX : The conversion of applications into securities for trading on the secondary market is a practice that, according to my understanding, was not disclosed in our initial agreement. This has raised concerns about the potential misuse of my personal information and the financial benefits derived from these securities trading activities. XXXX XXXX  : I have considered a forensic audit to expose XXXX numbers associated with the securities generated from my applications. This audit aims to determine the amount of money these securities have generated and whether this aligns with the terms of our binding agreement. Material Evidence : As outlined in Discover Financial Services and Discover Bank 's XXXX, XXXX, Prospectus, and Indenture Agreement Form, these documents serve as material evidence of the company 's objectives to attract investors and generate capital through various means, including the trading of securities. Tort Actions and Discrimination : The attempt to use non-public personal information without my explicit written consent for the purpose of discrimination and fraud is deeply troubling. These actions have caused harm to my personal well-being, reputation, and have resulted in the denial of my rights and titles to monthly bonds, interest payments, and proceeds. Upon a thorough review of the XXXX form which is accessible through the Securities Exchange Commission ( SEC ) website, it has become apparent that there are areas where both the parent company and its subsidiary may be at risk of noncompliance and legal ramifications. I believe that it is imperative that this matter be promptly presented to the Risk Committee and the Board of Directors to initiate a comprehensive review and take necessary actions to prevent further damage. The specific points of concern include : Noncompliance Risks : The XXXX form indicates potential areas of noncompliance that may expose both Discover Financial Services and Discover Bank to legal and regulatory risks. Legal Implications : Failure to address the identified noncompliance issues could result in legal implications, fines, and damage to the reputation of both entities. It is crucial to assess the severity of these risks and take corrective measures immediately. Responsibility of the Risk Committee : Given the nature of the risks outlined in the XXXX form, it is the responsibility of the Risk Committee to conduct a thorough analysis, assess the potential impact, and formulate strategies to mitigate these risks effectively. Board of Directors Oversight : The Board of Directors should be informed promptly about these compliance and legal risks to ensure transparency and to enable them to make informed decisions that safeguard the interests of the company and its stakeholders. Preventative Measures : Immediate action is necessary to implement preventative measures that align with regulatory requirements and ethical business practices. This will help in safeguarding the company 's integrity and protecting against further legal and compliance risks. I strongly recommend convening a special meeting of the Risk Committee and the Board of Directors to address these concerns. Timely and decisive action is crucial to protect the best interests of Discover Financial Services and Discover Bank. If the proper party is unwilling to provide a remedy for these actions within 21 business days from the receipt of this letter, I intend to use the findings from the forensic audit, along with the aforementioned forms and exhibits, as evidence to recollect all proceeds generated from the security investments. On or before XX/XX/2023, there will be a letter sent by registered mail to both the Parent Company and its Subsidiary ( Discover Bank ). This parcel will contain a medallion-stamped or notarized letter reiterating these concerns. I implore you to treat this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves to avoid further legal action. I look forward to a prompt and amicable resolution to this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Good day! To whom it will concern - My name is XXXX XXXX. I am filing a complaint against American Express National Bank regarding the mishandling of a check issued from my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  for {$10000.00}. 

I requested a check withdrawal from my account in XX/XX/2025. The check was supposedly issued on or after XX/XX/2025, but I never received it. There was no tracking number, delivery confirmation, or secure method of dispatch provided by American Express. Despite this, I was asked to sign an indemnity form that would transfer full liability to me for a check that I never received and that they can not prove was delivered. 



Background : This account was funded multiple times via direct deposit from my investor banking account at XXXX XXXX. When I attempted to deposit another {$5000.00} in XX/XX/2025, I was informed that I no longer had access to the account for withdrawals or deposits. I was later told the account had been closedwithout ANY notice. 

Since then, I have been locked out of the account entirely, unable to sign in or view any statements or records. I was not given adequate support or resolution, despite contacting American Express multiple times. 


I ask that this matter be escalated to someone with the proper authority to resolve it, such as a supervisor or executive support. 

I have exhausted every reasonable option available through American Express customer service, including multiple calls and email attempts. My emails to XXXX were returned as undeliverable. Online resources also led to broken or missing pages. 



Why this matters : I have acted in good faith and am simply trying to retrieve money that belongs to me. I should not be held liable for an unsecured, untracked check that never arrived. This is causing undue stress and potential financial hardship. 

I am asking the CFPB to investigate and help ensure American Express National Bank returns my funds promptly and securely.

Consumer complaint narrative: I deposited a check in my checking account via mobile deposit with Chase bank in the amount of {$2100.00}. The check was issued from XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX  due to an old mortgage account that I closed in XXXX. I made the deposit on XX/XX/XXXX. A hold was placed on the account. The hold was supposed to be released on XX/XX/XXXX. I called Chase on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  to inquire about releasing the hold. I was transferred to the fraud department. I was told that the check was not able to be verified by XXXX XXXX XXXX bank, however, they did NOT say that the check was not paid. The representative questioned me at length about how I came in possession of check and so forth. I was accused of trying to deposit a fraudulent check. The representative said that my account would be closed on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  and any funds in the account would be forwarded to me via check. As of today, my account shows an available balance from that check in the amount of {$1700.00} dollars that I am not able to access. Nor have I received a check from chase. I am still in possession of the check as it was made via mobile deposit.

RE : BANK FRAUD COMPLAINT - Wrongful Denial of Fraud Claim Dear CFPB, I am filing a complaint against ( BECU ) Boeing Employee Credit Union for wrongfully denying my fraud claim and refusing to reimburse unauthorized transactions totaling {$2300.00}. 
BANK INFORMATION : Bank Name : Boeing Employees Credit Union ( BECU ) Account Number : XXXX ( last XXXX digit Transaction Dates : XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/2025 Amount : {$800.00} and {$1500.00} COMPLAINT DETAILS : I was victim of a sophisticated fraud scheme where criminals impersonated my friend and XXXX representatives to obtain my banking security code. On XX/XX/XXXX, unauthorized withdrawals of {$800.00} and {$1500.00} were processed, but my account balance was only {$440.00}, causing my account to go negative by over {$1800.00}. I immediately called the bank that same day to report the fraud. The bank initially provided provisional credit on XX/XX/XXXX but wrongfully reversed it on XX/XX/XXXX, claiming I " cooperated '' with the scammers.

WHY THE BANK 'S DECISION IS WRONG : 1. Insufficient funds prove unauthorized access : My account balance was only {$440.00} when {$2300.00} was withdrawn - I clearly did not authorize transactions that would overdraw my account by over {$1800.00} ( See attached bank activity ) 2. I was deceived, not cooperative : I believed I was helping a friend and speaking with legitimate XXXX representatives 3. Immediate reporting : I called the bank the same day ( XX/XX/XXXX ) when I discovered the negative balance 4. Evidence of criminal activity : All text conversations were deleted by the criminals see attached screen shot of my text messages ) 5. Unauthorized access : The caller had my banking information without my consent 6. Violation of Regulation E : The bank failed to properly investigate unauthorized electronic transfers BANK 'S RESPONSE : The bank claims this is a " scam, not fraud '' and refuses to reimburse me. This distinction is improper - I was a victim of deception, not a willing participant in wrongdoing. 
REQUESTED RESOLUTION : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and require Boeing Employees Credit Union ( BECU ) to : 1. Reimburse the full amount of {$2300.00} 2. Provide proper fraud protections to customers 3. Improve their fraud investigation procedures I have attached documentation including bank statements and police report reference number [ if available ]. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
My Capital One credit card app was hacked online and someone made a payment on the accounts. They attempted to use the accounts, however I called Capital One immediately upon finding out this happened and told them. They closed access to me from all of my accounts, which also included the ability to make payments.

They have been charging late fees and interest each month, yet denying my access to make a payment. This has been reported to my credit report and made a severe impact on my credit score. I contacted them to close the accounts, since they would not allow my access to make payments. They finally gave me access to make payments. 

They are reporting late payments each month, however I have been making payments. They are not following the Fair Debt Collection Act. They have been posting late fees each month and additional interest charges that are not accurate.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, California XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/1982 SS # : XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to you as a concerned consumer regarding a recurring issue of violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which has significantly impacted my financial well-being and personal life. This is the second time I am submitting a complaint, as my initial concerns were not adequately addressed, and the violations persist. 

I would like to bring to your attention the following violations that have been ongoing : Inaccurate Personal Information : Violation : Violations of FCRA Section 607 ( a ) and 611.

Specifics : The inaccurate reporting of my previous addresses, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX , has resulted in misleading information being associated with my credit report. 
Unauthorized Inquiries : Violation : Violations of FCRA Section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) ( B ) and Section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) ( F ).

Specifics : Unauthorized credit inquiries were conducted by various creditors without my explicit consent, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX XXXX, XXXX , XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX , XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX. These inquiries have negatively impacted my credit score and financial standing.

Disputed Account Information : Violation : Violations of FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) and Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ).

Specifics : Despite my previous dispute, Bank of America 's account number 63 remains on my credit report with questionable and unverified information. This has led to confusion and further damaged my creditworthiness.

These violations have taken a toll on my personal and financial life. Allow me to share my personal story to emphasize the severity of the situation. As a single parent working diligently to provide for my family, my credit score plays a pivotal role in my ability to secure housing, obtain fair lending terms, and secure a stable financial future for my children. The inaccuracies and unauthorized inquiries have led to undue stress, denied opportunities, and financial setbacks that continue to haunt me. For instance, due to the inaccuracies in my credit report, I was denied housing at my preferred location, impacting the quality of life for my children. 

I implore you to enforce the legal protections outlined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act to rectify these violations. I kindly request that you investigate the aforementioned creditors and ensure that the unverified and inaccurate information is promptly removed from my credit report. I believe that my efforts to correct these issues align with the goal of fostering fair and accurate credit reporting practices that protect consumers like myself. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and the efforts of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau in safeguarding consumers ' rights. Your intervention is essential in bringing resolution to this distressing situation. 

Thank you for your time and consideration. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX, I opened a Macys credit card at the recommendation of a Macys sales associate at XXXX XXXX XXXX, based on her promise that I would receive 30 % off my entire purchase on my statement, as well as 30 % off any purchases made that same day or the next day. Based on that representation, I agreed to open the card and combined my purchases with my mother and sister, who were also shopping that day, expecting the full 30 % off for all transactions within that time frame. 



The total purchases I made were : {$600.00} on the first transaction {$250.00} later that same day {$170.00} the next day I was told by the associate that 30 % off would be reflected on my statement, which she even calculated at around {$180.00} off the first purchase, and I expected a total of approximately {$310.00} in savings across all three purchases. However, I was shocked to find only {$100.00} taken off, and upon calling customer service, I was told there is a {$100.00} cap on the discountwhich was never disclosed by the associate. 

Had I known the discount was capped at {$100.00}, I would not have opened the credit card or made the additional purchases. My mother even had her own Macys card she could have used, but we relied on the associates clear and persuasive representation that the 30 % would apply without a cap. 

This is not only extremely misleading but also violates fair consumer practice. I respectfully request that Macys honor the full 30 % discount as promisedamounting to the expected ~ $ XXXX otherwise offer a remedy for this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, California XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/1990 SS # : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal dispute regarding several violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) that have severely impacted my financial well-being and overall quality of life. I humbly request your intervention to ensure that the legal provisions are enforced and that the involved creditors rectify the situation. 

FCRA Violations : Inaccurate Information on Credit Report : I have discovered inaccurate information on my credit report that has deeply affected my ability to secure loans and maintain financial stability. Per FCRA Section 611, I exercised my right to dispute these inaccuracies through the prescribed procedures. Subsection ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) emphasizes the importance of accurate credit reporting, yet these inaccuracies persist, violating my rights as a consumer. 

Unauthorized Inquiry : My credit report shows unauthorized inquiries by entities such as XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and others. FCRA Section 604 outlines permissible purposes for consumer reports, but I did not provide consent for these inquiries. Subsection ( a ) ( 3 ) ( F ) stipulates the necessity of a legitimate business need for such inquiries, which has not been fulfilled in these cases. 

Unauthorized Reporting to Credit Report without Permission : It has come to my attention that certain entities, such as XXXX XXXX XXXX and others, have reported accounts to my credit report without my explicit permission. This violates FCRA Section 604, Subsection ( a ) ( 3 ) ( F ), as well as my right to accurate and fair credit reporting. 

FDCPA Violations : Demand for Deletion of Account under 15 USC 1692f : I assert that XXXX Account Number : XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX are in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Section 1692f, Subsection ( 1 ), explicitly prohibits the collection of any amount unless expressly authorized by the agreement or permitted by law. I demand immediate deletion of these accounts in accordance with this statute. 

Unauthorized Reporting to Credit Report without Permission : Furthermore, I did not provide permission for XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX to be reported to my credit report. This act violates FDCPA Section 807, Subsection ( 8 ), which disallows communicating false credit information, including the failure to communicate that a disputed debt is under dispute. 

TILA Violation : Reporting Inaccurate Account Status under 15 US Code 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S Code 1681i ( 5 ) : I strongly believe that XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX 's inaccurate reporting of my account status breaches TILA 's commitment to accurate and transparent credit information. Section 1666i outlines the responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies, which includes providing accurate and complete information. 
These violations have brought significant distress into my life. I would like to share a personal story of how these inaccuracies and unauthorized inquiries have impacted me emotionally and financially. [ Here, you can provide specific details about how these violations have affected your life, such as difficulties in obtaining loans, emotional stress, missed opportunities, etc. ] In light of the aforementioned violations, I kindly request the following actions be taken : Enforce the legal provisions under FCRA, FDCPA, and TILA to address the violations by the involved creditors. 
Request the immediate removal of the unverified accounts from my credit report, as per my rights as a consumer. 
I appreciate your attention to this matter and your commitment to upholding consumer rights. I look forward to a swift resolution and the restoration of accurate credit reporting. 

Thank you for your time and consideration. 

Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative: A bank account was fraudulently opened at Capital One in the name of our company. We first learned about the fraudulent account when our company received a statement for the account for the period XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The statement showed a {$5000.00} XXXX deposit from me, personally, which I never made, from a bank I have never heard of ( shown on the statement as XXXX  ). I immediately called Capital One to ask them to close the account, and to complain that the bank account was fraudulently opened, and that XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) never authorized opening any such account, and that I not only wanted it closed but also wanted as much information about the account opening and the deposit as possible, to be able to investigate possible identity theft. The bank took my information, and said if I wanted to reach their fraud department I could only do so by fax and must include all my identification. I followed the instructions and faxed my ID and my questions to the fax number I was given. I repeated this entire exercise the next month when we received another statement, and again the month after, when we receive a third statement along with a notice that the account was overdrawn. I have not received any response from the bank to my questions. Each time I was told someone would get back to me, but no one ever did. After the third statement arrived with the notice the account was overdrawn, I was simply told not to worry, the matter was being looked into and the bank wouldn't be trying to recoup the money from our company. That was not a response but an excuse for not responding. I WANT INFORMATION how this ever could have happened in the first place. The bank was either negligent in checking the identity of whoever opened the account in our company 's name, or something else went wrong, but I can't get any information whatsoever from the bank. It's like talking to a stone wall. I am attaching for the CFPB my three faxes to the bank and most of the attachments to them ( but am not including my IDs, which were attached to those faxes ).

I received a phone call from Marcus by Goldman Sachs on XX/XX/XXXX. Unaware if the unsolicited call was fraudulent, I elected not to provide personal information directly to that specific representative. They asked if I opened an account with Marcus by Goldman Sachs and I informed them that I did not. The representative said that I may be the victim of identity fraud and provided me steps to deal with identity theft. 

After that unsolicited call, I independently found the phone number to Marcus by Goldmans Sachs and contacted them a few hours later onXX/XX/XXXX. The customer service representative sent me to their fraud department. The representative at their fraud department refused to provide any information regarding the fraudulent account, such as when the account was opened and how they verified the identity of the individual who fraudulently opened this account. I told them that any account opened in my name ( at this point, I provided them with my personal information ) was fraudulent and that I've never opened accounts with Marcus by Goldman Sach. I asked if the account has been closed, but the representative refused to provide that confirmation, saying " our policy is to not provide that information. '' I was then told by that representative that any fraudulent account would be closed and I would receive a confirmation letter confirming that the account was closed. 

I never received any confirmation letter confirming the account was closed. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an account statement, via mail, from Marcus by Goldman Sachs covering the period of XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX for the fraudulent account. I then contacted Marcus by Goldman Sachs later on XX/XX/XXXX. I inquired if the account was closed, why or how the account was allowed to be opened and why the account did not appear to be closed even after my reporting it as fraud on XX/XX/XXXX. Again, the representative ( XXXX ) refused to provide any information, citing their policy not to provide said information. 

I have no faith that this account was closed or will be closed, even though I reported it as a fraudulent account.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
Last summer, I followed a professional baseball team around the country to watch their games in many cities. I purchased all of my tickets ahead of time through XXXX so that I was guaranteed quality tickets. Once I procured tickets, I then purchased flight tickets and hotel reservations. 

I purchased tickets through XXXX for XXXX events that took place within about a XXXX day period. That allowed me to book all of my travel arrangements. 

The first XXXX events that I went to with those XXXX tickets granted me access to the venue but were in far inferior seats than what XXXX advertised and sold to me. I paid premium prices for premium tickets but then was provided far inferior seats. When I called XXXX from the event I was at, they said they would take care of it. When I followed up the next day, I was told it would go through their process but it would be taken care of. XXXX days later, I went to the second event with XXXX tickets that were not what I was sold. 

XXXX told me that the tickets are sold from other consumers and they are just the middle-man. However, XXXX also has a guarantee that if the tickets are not as described, they will either refund the money or provide better seats. XXXX did neither. At that point, I couldn't continue spending XXXX of dollars for travel and not know of the quality of seats, if any, that I would have. So I had to purchase tickets for those events elsewhere even though I had XXXX more events of XXXX tickets. 

XXXX told me that I should post my future tickets up for sales on their website ( which they make money off of ) in hopes of getting my money back since I didn't want to continue taking the risk of their tickets being inaccurate. I explained that if they didn't sell or sold for less than what I paid, I would be getting ripped off again, and it wasn't fair to me. 

After numerous calls/emails, I was offered XXXX XXXX reduction on my most recent transaction. Obviously, that wasn't fair to me. After speaking to supervisors and sending in paperwork, I was offered a {$500.00} future credit for the website and reversing my most recent change ( {$760.00} ). The {$760.00} was reversed, but I refused both the XXXX XXXX reduction and {$500.00} future credit since my charges were for over {$500.00}. 

XXXX supervisors from XXXX eventually said that I needed to have my credit card company file disputes for the transactions. The supervisors, who claimed they were the highest level of support that a consumer could talk to, had their hands tied. They were only able to do what was already offered ( XXXX XXXX reduction, reversal of most recent charge ), and if that wasn't fair to me, I would have to file disputes with my credit card company. 

When I first tried to file disputes with my credit card company, as the merchant requested, the credit card company ( Chase ) refused to open the claims. They said that since I accessed the event, nothing was owed. I explained that the only way I knew that my tickets were not what was sold to me was by accessing the event. They said it didn't matter. Now, when I have followed up with Chase about this, the supervisor used a different excuse as to why they won't open a dispute ( even though the merchant insisted that is what I needed to do ), telling me this time that it was too long after the transaction, so I would have to provide information directly from the merchant. That isn't my fault that they failed to adhere to their responsibilities originally and aren't holding the merchant to their guarantee of refunding the tickets or providing better tickets if the ones provided aren't what were advertised. 

I am stuck between XXXX companies. One, XXXX, claims to be trying to do the right thing but can't unless disputes are filed. The other, Chase Bank, has refused to do their responsibilities to their consumers.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, California, XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Iowa XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against Wells Fargo for Potential Data Breach, Mismanagement of Personal Information, and Request for Monetary Damages Introduction : I am filing a complaint against Wells Fargo due to receiving communication linked to an old account under the name XXXX XXXX, my birth name, which I legally changed in XXXX and have not used since. This situation, which I believe to be a result of a data breach or severe mismanagement of personal information, is not only alarming but poses a risk to my financial security and privacy. In light of this, and my immediate need to address potential repercussions, I am seeking monetary damages to hire a private investigator and obtain necessary insurances. 

Narrative of Events : Upon receiving the letter from Wells Fargo regarding an account associated with a name I no longer use, I was deeply concerned about the integrity of my personal data and the security of my financial information. This incident is particularly troubling as I am in the midst of planning significant financial activities, including a capital raise and real estate transactions, necessitating a clear and secure financial standing. 

Violations and Requested Resolution : Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) : The potential exposure of my personal data suggests a breach of GLBA, which mandates financial institutions to protect the confidentiality and security of consumer information. 

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Should this issue affect my credit report, it would violate the FCRA 's requirements for accurate and fair credit reporting. 

Given these concerns, I request the CFPB to : Initiate a thorough investigation into the handling and protection of my personal and financial data by Wells Fargo, specifically identifying how my former name came to be associated with recent communications. 
Mandate Wells Fargo to provide monetary damages sufficient to hire a private investigator to assess the extent of the data breach or mismanagement and to secure necessary insurances that would protect my financial interests moving forward. 
Ensure Wells Fargo takes immediate steps to secure my data against further unauthorized access or breaches and to correct any inaccuracies in their records or on my credit report stemming from this issue. 
Conclusion : The receipt of this letter under a former name and the potential it signifies for a data breach or significant mismanagement has caused me considerable distress and concern for my financial future. It is imperative that this matter is resolved promptly and thoroughly, with Wells Fargo held accountable for any lapses in data security or management. I trust the CFPB will act swiftly to address this complaint and facilitate the necessary financial restitution for me to mitigate the potential impacts of this situation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a complaint against Capital One for unauthorized charges and potential identity theft on my credit card account. This complaint is in regard to the mishandling of the reported unauthorized transactions and the subsequent responses received from Capital One. 

**Background** : - **Last Authorized Use & Account Closure** : My capital one credit card account was closed in XXXX  XXXX 2023 due to returned payments, despite my immediate efforts to resolve the issue I was informed by capital one that my account would not be reopened. 
My credit card account was closed XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX by capital one, I was unable to use the card, capital one closed he account. I never received notice from capital one that I was approved to open a new account, or any correspondence that my previous account had been reopened. The account representative with capital one told me my account was closed. If capital one reopened the account that they closed for returned payments they never notified me of this. My understanding was that my account was closed and my credit card was unusable. 

- **Unauthorized Charges During Hospitalization** : During my hospitalization, my personal belongings were stolen, including my Identification Card, my social security card, my cell phone which I use to access my capital one account and my banking app, as we all as all of my contacts. This was the only way I used to access my account.Unbeknownst to me, over {$8000.00} in charges were made on this closed account, which I discovered after my discharge from the hospital. A police report was filed regarding this theft XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. XXXX ). 

**Capital Ones Response** : - **Initial Communication** : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Capital One acknowledged these unauthorized transactions, assuring me that I would not be held liable. 
- **Subsequent Contradictory Letter** : However, a subsequent letter XXXX XXXXXX/XX/202XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX ), contradicted this assurance, stating there was insufficient evidence of fraud and holding me responsible for the charges. 

**Legal Position** : - Under 15 U.S. Code 1643, my liability for unauthorized use of a credit card is capped at {$50.00}, provided I report the unauthorized transactions in the timeframe required which I reported the unauthorized use immediately upon discovering it. 
- I followed all required procedures for reporting the unauthorized use promptly and believe I have been unjustly held liable for charges beyond the statutory limit. 

**Request** : - I urge the CFPB to investigate this matter thoroughly. 
- I seek immediate rectification, including the removal of all fraudulent charges above the {$50.00} liability cap. 
- I also request a detailed explanation of the inconsistent responses and decisions made by Capital One in this case. 

I trust that the CFPB will address this matter with the urgency and seriousness it warrants. Thank you for your attention to this issue.

Dear CFPB, I am submitting this formal complaint regarding a fraudulent credit account that was opened in my name with XXXX XXXX  Card Services. Upon discovering this fraudulent activity, I disputed the account. As a result, XXXXXXXX XXXX confirmed in writing that the account would be closed and removed from my credit report. 

Despite this confirmation, I have continued to receive multiple emails and phone calls attempting to collect on this fraudulent debt. Each time, I have provided the attached letter from XXXXXXXX XXXX verifying that the account was fraudulent and should not be pursued. However, I am now facing legal action from an attorney representing this debt, who is threatening to garnish my wages. 

The following laws are applicable to my case and should be enforced : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ) Ensures the accuracy and privacy of consumer credit reports. Under the FCRA : I have the right to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report ( 1681i ).

The credit reporting agencies and data furnishers are required to remove fraudulent accounts once they are identified ( 1681c-2 ). 
The continued reporting of a fraudulent account may be considered a violation of my rights.

Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq. ) Protects consumers from abusive debt collection practices. Under the FDCPA : Debt collectors can not attempt to collect a debt that is not valid ( 1692e ).

It is illegal to use false or misleading representations in connection with debt collection ( 1692e ( 2 ) ( A ) ).

The threat of wage garnishment on a fraudulent debt may be considered an unfair and deceptive practice ( 1692f ).

Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) ( 12 U.S.C. 5531 et seq. ) Prohibits unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( UDAAP ) in the financial marketplace. The continued attempts to collect a fraudulent debt may violate the CFPAs prohibition against unfair collection practices.

Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ) Criminalizes identity theft and fraudulent use of another persons identifying information. Since this account was fraudulently opened in my name, I request that this matter be further investigated as a potential identity theft violation. 
I am attaching all relevant documentation, including the letter from XXXX XXXX  confirming the accounts closure. I request that the CFPB take immediate action to : Ensure that this fraudulent account is permanently removed from my credit report. 
Stop all collection attempts and legal action against me regarding this debt. 
Investigate and enforce penalties against any party violating federal laws. 
Please confirm receipt of this complaint and provide information on the next steps to resolve this matter. I appreciate your prompt attention to this urgent issue.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have an XXXX XXXX  credit card through Bank of America. It was set up to autopay each month out of my XXXX bank account. Bank of America, for reasons unknown and with no notification to me, decided to halt the autopay. The first I learned of this was when I got a late statement from them through the mail, which included a late fee and interest charges. I called the customer service department, who apologized and credited the late fee and interest charges. They were unable to reinstate the autopay immediately because autopay had been blocked for my account. But they told me they would get it unblocked, and would then reinstate the autopay from my XXXX bank account. This didn't happen, and XXXX  weeks later I received another late notice with another late fee and more interest. I again called the customer service department, who again apologized and credited the late fee and interest charges. On this second call, the customer service rep was able to reinstate the autopay, and we used it to pay the full balance on the card. A few days later I received another notice from Bank of America to say they had reported me to the credit reporting agencies, and also had lowered the credit limit on my credit card. I again called the customer service department and requested they reverse the errorneous late payment report to the credit reporting agencies, and reinstate the credit limit on the card. They indicated they would not reinstate the previous credit limit without me resubmitting my full financial information. Also they would request the back office to reverse the errorneous late payment report to the credit reporting agencies. I checked Equifax today, and the late payment report was never reversed. Again I called Bank of America customer service and was told the back office had refused to reverse the errorneous late payment report. 

During this entire process, i was repeatedly told they had filed my complaints to the appropriate department, and that I would be contacted to review them. To date Bank of America has not contacted me about any of these complaints.

Consumer complaint narrative:
At XXXX on XX/XX/24 I called what I believed to be my bank about a withdrawal I was planning to make, as it was large and I didnt want my account to be flagged to shut down. I was asked multiple questions to verify it was my account which I answered, my call was disconnected and I thought nothing of it, I had the answers I needed. I received 5 calls from this number and did not answer them. I then got a text message from chime saying my account was locked due to suspicious activity. I called the number back, and was told I needed to go through the verification process once again and move {$2500.00} into a separate account to hold it for the process of unlocking my account. I was told it wouldnt go through as my account was locked and it was just part of the process and I believed it as the number they called from was the number I call for my bank all the time. {$2500.00} was moved into a different chime account without my authorization and I spent 2 and a half hours on the phone trying to get it back. Chime told me they dont know how the scammers were able to get their phone number. Chime has told me they can see the money in the other account and that an internal investigation is being conducted however I feel like no one is taking this seriously and I feel like Im not being helped. 
Attached are the call logs as well as text messages from the scammers and the wire transfer that was made without my consent

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding my Wells Fargo XXXX credit card application, which I submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. Despite following all verification requests from Wells Fargo, I have encountered repeated delays, inconsistent instructions, and what appears to be unfair treatment. 

After submitting my application with all required details, I was informed that it was denied due to an inability to verify my identity. Wells Fargo requested that I fax two forms of address verification, which I did. After not receiving a response for over a week, I called again, and they then requested that I also fax a government-issued ID, which I promptly submitted.

Another week passed with no response. When I followed up, I was told that my faxed ID was too dark to be viewed, though my previously submitted documents were accepted without issue. I then went to a different UPS store to resend the fax. Again, I received no response. 

A few days later, when I called for an update, the agentwho was noticeably impatientclaimed that I still needed to resubmit two address verification documents and my ID. I explained that I had already done so multiple times, but the agent simply repeated that my documents were missing. Frustrated by the inconsistency, I requested to speak with a manager.

I was transferred to another representative, who told me that if I went to a Wells Fargo local branch and had them submit the fax on my behalf, that would resolve the issue. I followed this instruction and went to a Wells Fargo branch to submit the documents again. However, when I called today for an update, I was again told that my ID was too dark to be processed. 

At this point, it feels as though Wells Fargo is intentionally creating obstacles to deny my application. My credit history and income fully meet their requirements, yet they continue to provide vague or contradictory reasons for rejection. I believe I am being unfairly discriminated against, as there is no reasonable explanation for these repeated document requests and delays. 

I request that CFPB investigate Wells Fargos handling of my application and ensure that I receive a fair and transparent evaluation. 

Thank you for your time and assistance.

I tried to get a refund through XXXX XXXX but they told me they rarely happen and upon being rejected there I contacted Chase Bank only to have them repeatedly refund the money and then take it back. The two unauthorized charges were made on XX/XX/XXXX. 

During this time the person who had gotten my money reached out multiple times via text message and then by XXXX app, first to apologize for what they called an " ordering issue '' as they claimed to run some sort of online XXXX business and thought I had placed an order across their broken ordering system. I had not. The scammer then said they didn't have my charge/money in their system so I confirmed with XXXX XXXX that a transfer was made and then they promised a refund and to send me a package for my troubles. Neither happened. Then they attempted to scam me further with fake emails and text messages asking for money to release the package they claimed to be sending as an apology. I did not remain in contact or send them anything. I am guessing this happened because Chase initially issued a refund and the scammer wanted their . 

After some more detective work what I believe happened is a person attending a public event used some sort of phone IP cloning device giving him access to copies of people 's phones. I came across a XXXX XXXX  of about 8 people who were all at the same event and all had XXXX XXXX or XXXX charges from this same person, I too was at the same event. It also seems we were signed up for the XXXX XXXX via an XXXX XXXX that was using it as a point system pre-installed in a XXXX  register. Another similarity everyone in the XXXX XXXX had.

instant, the ATM machine froze both with my money and my ATM card ending in XXXX, I stood in shock knowing how much I wanted this money to pay for my rent, I called on the security guy behind me, a very nice young man who told me to let the bank know what had happened and immediately I saw a staff suited up walking out of the bank, I made hand gestures that I had money stuck in the machine, he shrugged it off and just told me to call the number on the ATM, I went into the bank and spoke to a staff working the front desk by the name XXXX, he lacked empathy, he cared less of my concerns as I wanted to speak with a branch XXXX to help me escalate my issue to get credit, he insisted I call a number he was even gon na write for me, I wondered for a minute if I mattered to Bank of America as a customer or some guy or if it has to do with the XXXX of my skin, I wound up calling the number on the ATM without the help of my branch where my trouble began, I was put on hold for about XXXX minutes and mind you, I was on a work time schedule and the last I heard was that it will take XXXX business days for me to get money that literally was in my hands and that just got stuck in your atm, To cut this story short, I am not interested in the corporate inefficiency and mediocrity associated with your bank but I know I have protected rights as a customer and I will not suffer this However, on this official complaint, my name was affiliated with an address that is not my home address. In addition, given that the address listed on the court complaint was not my own, I was not made aware that such a complaint was raised against me because the notice was not sent to my correct home address. Therefore, the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  had taken my non-response to this complaint as me refusing to address the complaint and not pay the outstanding credit card fee. Therefore, the XXXX XXXX proceeded to levy the amount owned on my bank account. Given that I had no knowledge of the creation of this credit card and that this address listed under my name in the court order, I had come to the conclusion that this credit card creation is a result of my identity being stolen and wrongly used. In addition, since XXXX XXXX was only holding onto the amount of money that was being levied by the courts, the courts had also extracted the same amount of money that was being levied from my wife 's ( XXXX XXXX XXXX bank account from XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX since that account is a joint account affiliated with me. On XX/XX/XXXX, I had sought out legal representation in regards to the court complaint and levy against me from the law firm of XXXX XXXX XXXX. In working with XXXX XXXX as my legal counsel, he and his law firm had filed a Notice of Motion to the XXXX XXXX and a Proposed Answer. On XX/XX/XXXX, a judge from the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX had decided to grant the motion to vacate the default judgement. Around that time, the funds have been returned to myself and my wife in our respective bank accounts. On XX/XX/XXXX, I had file a police report in the XXXX XXXX Police Department in regards to the wrongful theft and usage of my identity.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX Louisiana in on XX/XX/XXXX and have been XXXX since then. Navy Federal Credit union has been notified mutiple times that i fall under the Louisiana State Service Member Civil Relief Act ( SCRA ) Title 29:312 reads " Limits on creditor interest rates A. Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, no creditor in connection with an obligation entered into on or after XX/XX/XXXX, shall charge or collect from a person, or spouse of a person, who is on XXXX XXXX interest or finance charges exceeding XXXX percent per annum during the period that the person is XXXX on XXXX XXXX. 

B. Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, interest or finance charges in excess of XXXX percent per annum that otherwise would be incurred but for the prohibition in Subsection A of this Section are forgiven.

C. The amount of any periodic payment due from a person, or spouse of a person, who is on XXXX XXXX under the terms of the obligation shall be reduced by the amount of the interest and finance charges forgiven under Subsection B of this Section that is allocable to the period for which the periodic payment is made. 

D. In order for an obligation to be subject to the interest and finance charges limitation of this Section, the person, or spouse of the person on XXXX XXXX, shall provide the creditor with written notice and a copy of the military or gubernatorial orders calling the person to XXXX XXXX and of any orders further extending XXXX XXXX, not later than one hundred eighty days after the date of the person 's termination of or release from XXXX XXXX. 

E. Upon receipt of the written notice and a copy of the orders referred to in Subsection D of this Section, the creditor shall treat the obligation in accordance with Subsection A of this Section, effective as of the date on which the person is on XXXX XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX court may grant a creditor relief from the interest and finance charges limitation of this Section, if, in the opinion of the court, the ability of the person, or spouse of the person, on XXXX XXXX to pay interest or finance charges with respect to the obligation at a rate in excess of XXXX percent per annum is not materially affected by reason of the person 's service on XXXX XXXX. 

Acts 2005, No. 296, 1, eff. XX/XX/XXXX. '' Navy Federal Credit Union continues to charge me and my spouse interest over the legal limits of the SCRA.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Can't use card to make purchases
Consumer complaint narrative: I want to start off by stating that I appreciate security in this day and age. Also that is isnt that I want or expect anything out of the ordinary. Initially, receiving a pre-approval for an American Express credit card was a moment of immense excitement for me. It represented not just a financial tool, but a lifeline during a challenging time. Everything started smoothly - I even requested additional cards without issue. The problems began when an alert for unusual activity was triggered due to my brother, an authorized user, linking his XXXX to the card. In an attempt to resolve this, I contacted customer service but unfortunately failed the authentication process. This was partly due to having the representative on mute as I was in a public place. Following this, I was directed to use XXXX for identity verification. Despite my comfort with technology, this process was fraught with difficulties, taking three days of back-and-forth communication and ultimately ending in another failure. The emotional toll of this experience has been overwhelming. My account is currently frozen, and I am faced with additional contingent steps. Despite the fact that my home address, listed on my driver 's license, matches all the cards ' addresses and there has been no unusual activity or transactions, the resolution seems distant. I understand the need for security measures, but the lack of flexibility and understanding in my situation is disheartening. I intend to fulfill my financial obligations and pay what I owe. However, it is crucial to highlight the emotional rollercoaster this process has been, especially for someone with limited credit history. My experience with American Express has been far from what I expected, and I believe it's important for potential customers, particularly those new to credit, to be aware of these potential challenges. I hope that this complaint will be taken seriously and that American Express will review and improve their customer verification processes and customer service approach.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I deposited my {$17000.00} IRS tax refund check into my Chase Bank account. Chase cashed the check and accepted the funds but has refused to release my money despite full verification of my identity. 

I have provided Chase with all required verification documents, including : SSA-89 and SSA-2458 forms verifying my Social Security Number.

Direct confirmation from the IRS that the check is valid and was issued to me. 
Tax documentation proving I am the rightful recipient. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, Chases Fraud Department ( Agent XXXX ) confirmed to me that : Chase will never release my funds under any circumstances. 
Chase has no timeline to turn over my funds to Michigan Unclaimed Property.

Chase stated that I will not get my money back. 

This is a serious violation of multiple federal banking laws and escheatment laws. Chase can not legally hold consumer funds indefinitely without returning them to the rightful owner or turning them over to the state. 

Chase is violating the following laws : Conversion of Funds ( MCL XXXX & Federal Banking Precedent ) Chase wrongfully possesses funds that do not belong to them. 

Breach of Contract ( UCC 4-401 ) Chase cashed my check but failed to make funds available.

Expedited Funds Availability Act ( 12 U.S.C. 4001 et seq. ) Chase has held my deposit beyond the legal limit.

CFPB Consumer Protection Laws ( 12 U.S.C. 5531 UDAAP Rules ) Chases actions constitute unfair and deceptive banking practices.

Truth in Savings Act ( 12 U.S.C. 4301-4313 ) Chase failed to provide written notice of why my funds are being held indefinitely.

Failure to Follow Escheatment Laws ( Michigan & Federal ) Chase refuses to turn over my unclaimed funds to the Michigan Treasury, despite confirming they do not intend to return them to me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
10 or more years ago ( unsure about exact date ). I had a {$50.00} stop payment placed on my account for a payment to XXXX. I'm not even certain if was for a XXXX. Anyhow, they did not properly explain, and/or document the changes " Stop payment '' ten plus years ago. 

As to-date I've had 2 or more {$50.00} payments returned by XXXX XXXX ; I was also assessed two or more {$50.00} NSF fee by AMEX. Puzzled by the returned payments and frustrated by the fees I started to dig into what's going on. XXXX XXXX has returned the two {$50.00} payments as of XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX. I guess due to this {$50.00} stop payment from 10+ years ago. Still unsure how it popped up. 

When i called AMEX to ask for forgiveness and the fee waived, I was told its XXXX XXXX 's fault. You need to contact your bank ; we will not waive the fees. About a solid month ago I also asked for the annual fee to be waived for me. I was laid off by XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX after 15 years of service. I considered enrolling in the payment plan to help people but declined after i found out it negatively impacts your credit. I begged and pleaded with the two reps i spoke to that day to waive the enrollment fee, and the first NSF fee. I was strong armed on the phone with Solid NO 's, this is our policy, no forgiveness, the fees are valid. 

Look, I understand, having worked for corporate America. Those fees help your stock price. My first manager would scold me for waiving the {$20.00} phone fee. When I worked my first 3 years in the call center. I felt too much for those people, you could hear the hurt in their voice. This {$20.00} was coming out of something in their monthly budget, part of the light bill, groceries, gas for the week. It was the least I could do. People that fall behind on bills usually juggling a lot. Deciding which bill to pay to avoid disconnected. This has become my case. I haven't been XXXX  this long since before I was a kid. Which is why I also thought AMEX would show compassion in my plight.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I opened a Citibank checking account online in response to a promotional bonus offer. As outlined in the attached terms, the requirements to earn the {$320.00} bonus were as follows : XXXX. Complete at least XXXX Enhanced Direct Deposits into the checking account within XXXX days of account opening. 
XXXX. The total amount of those direct deposits must be {$3000.00} or more. 
XXXX. The checking account must remain open until the bonus is paid. 
XXXX. The bonus will be paid within XXXX days after successfully completing all required activities. 

I fulfilled all these requirements : On XX/XX/year>, I received a direct deposit from my employer for {$1500.00}. 
On XX/XX/year>, I received a second employer direct deposit of {$1500.00}, bringing my total to {$3000.00}. 
As of XX/XX/year>, I had completed all qualifying activities within the XXXX window. 

Based on Citibanks own terms, the bonus was to be paid within XXXX days of completing these activities, which would have been by XX/XX/year> ( or the next business day, XX/XX/year> ). 

However, I did not receive the bonus by that date. I contacted Citibank to inquire, and while they acknowledged that I had fulfilled the requirements, they informed me I must wait an additional XXXX days after completing the requirements to receive the bonuscontradicting the written terms of the offer. 

I asked to escalate the issue, but I was told there was no further escalation process available and that there was nothing I could do. I believe Citibank is not honoring the promotional terms they advertised and is instead delaying or altering the agreed-upon payout timeline after I fulfilled all conditions. This feels deceptive and misleading. 

I am seeking assistance in holding Citibank accountable to the original terms of the bonus offer I agreed to and receiving the {$320.00} bonus that I am contractually owed.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a joint Citi Bank with my husband in XXXX of XXXX. My husband performed three jobs doing XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and we deposited three checks from the people he had done these jobs for into our new account. My husband performed similar work the year prior and this work is filed on our tax returns. The checks totaled {$1400.00}. I also had made a {$25.00} initial deposit into the checking account. 

We received a letter stating that the {$1400.00} deposit had been received on XX/XX/XXXX and that the deposit would be available as following : {$100.00} Available immediately and {$1300.00} available on XX/XX/XXXX. 

That day, I went to check my account and found that my online access had been blocked. I called Citi and after hours of being transferred and multiple phone calls, I learned that my account was under review. One of the people that wrote a check to my husband called and let us know that Citi Bank had called them and asked them several intrusive questions about the check that they wrote to my husband and were concerned that the caller from Citi Bank may be a scammer due to the way they behaved. I called Citi Bank about this and an agent told me that it is Citi 's policy to verify all third-party checks deposited on new accounts. ( I've never heard of such a strange policy at any other bank. ) All three people that wrote these checks confirmed that the checks cleared their banks and the money went to Citi Bank. They told me that they needed to speak to every person that had written the checks to confirm the checks. We co-operated. The three people that wrote the checks co-operated. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, we received a letter that Citi would close our accounts automatically within 60 days. I called Citi and Citi told me that the balance on the account would be refunded me within 30 days after closure. They stated that I would be receiving a final statement in the mail. I was also told that if their review had determined that the checks wrote to me should not have been deposited, they would return that money to the people that had written the checks. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, my husband and I received a {$25.00} check from Citi with " Closeout Disbursement '' written in the memo line. This was the money that we deposited as an initial deposit into the account and did not include the {$1400.00} in checks made out to my husband that were deposited on XX/XX/XXXX. 

We reached out to the three people that wrote my husband checks on XX/XX/XXXX and they informed us that none of them had received the money back either. 

This means that as of XX/XX/XXXX, Citi is holding {$1400.00} of funds from checks written out to my husband. Even though Citi closed the account, they did not return the money to either the people that made out the checks or my husband, the person that the checks were made out to. 

Since the checks cleared the banks from these three people, Citi is clearly holding on to this money and a search online seems to indicate that Citi had done this to hundreds or thousands of others. It feels like Citi is trying to steal money that does not rightfully belong to them. I've lost trust in putting money in banks. How could it be possible that depositing checks into a checking account may mean you will never see the money again?!

Consumer complaint narrative:
On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, my XXXX daughter attempted to cash XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX at the Bank of America branch located  at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX FL. She had received these bonds as a baby and, before going to the bank, signed them as required. 

Prior to this, she had confirmed on Bank of America 's website that the bank cashes savings bonds for account holders. My daughter has held a joint account with me, XXXX XXXX, since XX/XX/XXXX, and my wife and I have been long-time customers of Bank of America for over 20 years. 

However, when she arrived at the branch, the bank refused to cash the bonds, citing an internal policy that requires an account holder to have been a customer for at least three years before being eligible to cash savings bonds. This policy was not disclosed on their website, nor was she informed of it when she opened her account. My daughter left the bank in tears. 

To resolve the issue, I left work and accompanied her back to the bank. The bank still refused to cash the bonds because my wife 's namenot minewas also listed on them. XXXX XXXX, a bank representative, reiterated that their system prevents the cashing of savings bonds for newer account holders, and our only options were to bring my wife in person or mail the bonds to the U.S. Treasury.

Following this, I attempted to submit the bonds to the Treasury. However, I discovered that because my daughter had already signed them, we could no longer complete the process via mail.

This situation forced my wife, who suffers from severe XXXX  triggered by conflict and interactions with strangers, to leave work and accompany us to the bank. This was an extremely distressing experience for her. As a result, both my wife and I lost half a day of work to resolve an issue that should not have existed in the first place.

Had my wife been unable to go with us, my daughter would have had to wait two and a half years before being able to access her own money. This undisclosed policy created unnecessary hardship for our family and contradicts the information provided on Bank of America 's own website. 

I appreciate your time and attention to this matter and look forward to your response.

Consumer complaint narrative: I applied for a Wells Fargo Choice Privileges Master Card  on XX/XX/2024. I get an email that is in review and if they approve it, I will receive one in 7 days. I am already a Wells Fargo customer with two credit cards with them. I even opened a checking account with them last year. I closed it after they lied to me. They froze my online access and when I called them to find out why they asked questions if I visited another country and tried to access my account. They wanted me to go into a Wells Fargo branch and show them my ID so they could unfreeze it. I went to the location in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and they said i needed an appointment. So, I went to the cashier and withdrew almost all of my money. I asked them how if I can't access my account online and you need to see my ID to unlock my account can you give me cash without seeing my ID because I need to make an appointment. Just days prior there was a text I received pretending to be Wells Fargo Fraud department. It actually was. After the visit with that branch the next day I went to the branch off XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX They said they take walk ins, and I don't need an appointment, The lady called the number and verified to them who I was by my ID and they made me change my login and password there. NO ONE Breached my account on my end as I checked. I do my own XXXX security. Another person there for the same reason as I proved it was not on my end and Wells Fargo failed to report to the Federal Government the breach then. I opened a no interest credit card with them much later after this. So now we are caught up to the XXXX XXXX application. I had to call the number to find out they wanted me to go to a branch and give them a government ID and two documents such as utility bills and etc. They never supplied this info on why my application was being held up and would complete deny it without providing me this information if I didn't take the initiative. I only have 7 business days. I filled a XXXX complaint on XXXX and it was assigned to a person named XXXX I believe. I told them I am well established with them and that they have no problems sending a statement to my house and taking my money. My license is linked to a Private Security License and License to Carry ID 's and they do not need certain information on my DL such as the audit number and such and they don't need copies of my utilities with my account numbers and such. I didn't need that when I got my MasterCard from them or Dillard 's card, which my Dillard 's card is the oldest. With all the data breaches to include the one they never reported the only way my other 3rd party accounts stay secure is to ensure that they never get them. So, I played their little game and went back to the XXXX XXXX location in XXXX XXXX on Thursday XX/XX/2024, at XXXX. A XXXX lady helped me. I told her what I needed her to do was fax this info in and because I had scratched out information such as amount due, due date, account number she wouldn't do anything at all. The more I talked the more attitude she had like well what do you want me to do about it. The account holder name, address, as well as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  wasn't scratched out. So basically, they refused to accept what they sent me to do and wanted while failing to disclose exactly that during the application process nor in the email given. To be specific they had no intentions of giving an honest chance of credit before I even filled out the application. When I gave this lady my cards and told her to close my accounts, she gave them back to me and told me to call the numbers on the back. Wells Fargo is a useless bank with useless people they employ that it amazes me how they are staying afloat if they aren't being subsidized by the government because none of this is how you keep customers. I still haven't heard a peep from Wells Fargo about this new incident that already lowered my credit score and I find what they have done possibly violates parts of the Deceptive Trade Practices Act. I think my bank account was open for 3 weeks before I got that text which I found that also quite odd. I will give the 3 weeks some doubt as that was some time back, but I am almost positive on the timing on that one.

Consumer complaint narrative: My TD bank debit card was lost and stolen. I've filed a complaint and disputed some unauthorized charges with TD bank. But they reviewed it and rejected my claims. I was travelling out of the country earlier this month to XXXX. The first night I was out at a bar/club, I've spent XXXX $ on the card. But not knowing that fateful night was the same night I lost my card. I was then travelled to the countryside in the next 10 days not knowing the merchant was continuing to charge my card and drained my account all the way to the negative balance. By the time I had internet Wi-Fi and logged in, it was already too late. I called and reported, y debit card was lost but it was XXXX days later. TD representative said " I had to wait for all the transaction to post first then I could dispute ''. I was then waited 2 more days to call back to dispute. At this time, my checking was in the negative balance. I called and talked to a dispute specialist to file a claim. He advised I had to wait 5-7 biz days to see any progress or provisional credit back. But I called again 1 week later, my claim was denied. How on earth was this my fault? My card was lost and someone unauthorized charged it to the max. Where is the truth in here? where is the consumer protection for unauthorize charges on my account.

To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Chase Bank regarding an unjustified hold on a payment made to my business credit card account, which has severely impacted my business operations. 

Complainant Details : Name : XXXX XXXX Credit Card Number : XXXX Date of Incident : XX/XX/XXXX Amount in Dispute : {$12000.00} Description of the Issue : On XX/XX/XXXX, I transferred {$12000.00} to my Chase business credit card account. However, Chase has placed this amount on hold for a " security review '' and stated that the funds will not be released until the XXXX of XXXX without further justification.

It has resulted in overall disruption to business operations, potentially affecting long-term business stability. 

I have contacted Chase customer service multiple times to request an expedited review and release of the funds. Despite my efforts, the issue remains unresolved, and Chase has not provided a satisfactory explanation or resolution. 

Desired Resolution : Immediate release of the {$12000.00} held by Chase. Audit of Chase business practices in that regard. Assurance that similar issues will not occur in the future. 
I believe that Chase 's actions are against consumer rights and represent a highly despicable business practice. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that financial institutions like Chase uphold their obligations to their customers. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in resolving this issue promptly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
