Consumer complaint narrative:
I placed an order for a product from a merchant on XX/XX/XXXX, and provided credit card details ( Chase Sapphire Preferred ) verbally. Shortly after, I received a text from Chase Bank saying that they declined the transaction and believe the transaction is fraudulent and requested me to confirm whether I initiated the transaction or not. '' Since Chase told me the transaction wasn't completed, I contacted the merchant and re-placed the order, however, the original transaction actually was completed.

When I called Chase to discuss, they said they won't do anything unless I contact the merchant first. This seems like a firm rule, so I contacted the merchant who will try to resolve this for me in the coming days, however, in the event that Chase actively advises a consumer that a transaction won't go through, and then the transaction does go through, the entirety of the burden to resolve this matter should rest on Chase, as their fraud monitoring system is inaccurately advising consumers about their credit card activity. If I weren't monitoring these payments, it's possible I never would've noticed that the charge was posted multiple times.

But on the other hand XXXX told me XXXX  declined thats why they had to use backup payment method, which was BOA. As per XXXX advice I returned the items and withdrew the fraud claim. On XX/XX/XXXX I got an update from XXXX saying that, they refunded my {$1100.00} to my BOAs card. I checked with BOA because I didnt see it in my account they said it might take 4-5 days. I waited since when I didnt see any refund I went ahead and filed a dispute on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX I physically mailed them the proofs and on XX/XX/XXXX I uploaded the proofs. Since then I have talked back and forth with several agents. I can provide their id, names and dates. However after all that they denied my case. On XX/XX/XXXX I reappeared and they denied my case again. The reason for denial is : I did not claim within their required time frame. But this is not true. I filed in time, sent and uploaded all the proofs. However, each time I call they they say they see where the mistake happened and wait 45 days and I will get my money back. 45 days at a time has added up 9 months. This is when I got fed up and shared my story with XXXX, there someone told me about this website. I am here with high hopes. I have audio recordings of all those phone calls too. I have posed some of it in my XXXX account too. I spent {$39.00} to promote my video related to this topic on XXXX, which I wouldnt have had to make or promote if they had done the right thing.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> : I sent about {$1600.00} to WISE US VIRTAUL ACCOUNT. This was to add money in my WISE account. 

So this transaction should have been : Me -- XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX -- > US WISE BANK ( Virtual account ) -- -> WISE MY Bank But then, for some reasons ( they insist I didn't write down my personal number ), Wise failed to recognize the money I sent. It was belong to me, but because of failure in recognition Wise rejected to add my money in WISE MY BANK. 

They said they rejected the transaction. 
I do understand they rejected to tap in but, rejection doesn't mean I get refunded. Because when they rejected, the money I sent is back to US WISE BANK and stuck there. 

From US Wise bank to my XXXX XXXX it can not be automatically sent as US Wise bank was virtual account. Wise should take back money in their account and put in my XXXXXXXX XXXX information for the completion of refund. 

While I proved everything that shows I didn't receive any refund, and ask for them to prove the proof that their US WISE bank send to my XXXXXXXX XXXX, they just showed me that they rejected the transaction from my wise bank to us wise bank, which never means refund. 

I explained this several times after thorough review with XXXX XXXX XXXX but wise doesn't refund at all. So I decided to file a complaint.

FNB processed a fraudulent check in the amount of {$3900.00}. FNB has refused to put the money back in our account due to their error. I immediately notified the bank. I was told an investigation would be started..I was told that I needed to file a police report, which I did. The following day, I attempted to contact the assistant manager as instructed. Her number went into the company directory and there was no individual listed with her name. I was unable to also leave a voicemail. I emailed the assistant manager but received no reply. I've been in the bank several times to speak with individuals regarding this matter and the assistant manager never attempted to engage me in conversation. 

On XX/XX/year> hours provided an affidavit of forgery or alteration and was told that this needed to be signed. I was provided another form which my lawyer advised me not to sign. Since I was unable to return this form for a few weeks I received a letter which was the only written instructions I received from the bank, to return this affidavit or the investigation would be stopped. On XX/XX/year> this affidavit was returned to the bank. However, after I left the bank, the assistant manager notarized this form without my consent and me being present and signing it in front of her. The date on this form was also altered. I filed a complaint with the state notary board and in the process of contacting the local police for criminal prosecution. 

On XX/XX/year> I again presented to the bank and asked about this matter. I was told that I needed to bring in the police report but was never told us. Throughout the whole process I was never provided any written policy, instructions, etc. to indicate how the process worked. On XX/XX/year> I contacted a regional manager and left a message. This message was also unreturned.

Sub-issue: Credit card company won't increase or decrease your credit limit
Consumer complaint narrative:
Capital One XXXX Dear XXXX, I am writing to express my deep dissatisfaction and concern regarding the recent adverse action taken in response to my request for a credit line increase with your institution. On XX/XX/year>. I received correspondence from Capital One stating that my request for a credit line increase was denied, citing information allegedly obtained from XXXX. However, this assertion is not only inaccurate but also deeply troubling. 

I want to bring to your immediate attention that my XXXX credit report has been frozen for identity theft protection purposes. Therefore, any claim of utilizing XXXX for a credit pull in this context is unequivocally false. It is imperative to note that the adverse action letter sent to me contained erroneous information that does not align with the current data reported on the credit reporting agency platform. In addition, I have exercised my rights given to me under the FCRA and I have reached out to the Consumer reporting agency directly and was reassured that my consumer report has been frozen and the reasons you have claimed for denial of a limit increase is in fact fale. 

Under federal law, I am entitled to accurate and truthful information regarding the reasons for any adverse action taken against my credit request. However, the adverse action letter provided by Capital One included XXXX different reasons for the denial, none of which reflect the actual state of my credit report. This discrepancy is not only alarming but also violates the rights afforded to me by federal regulations. 

I demand an immediate and thorough investigation into this matter. Upon calling to inquire about this I was told to apply again. It is imperative that Capital One rectifies this situation by providing me with a detailed explanation of the inaccuracies present in the adverse action letter. Where did you get this information from and why are you falsely claiming it came from XXXX when I keep my report frozen and why am I being denied a simple limit increase, I did not request {$50000.00}. Furthermore, I insist on a reevaluation of my credit request based on accurate and up-to-date information from the appropriate credit reporting agency. 

Failure to address this issue promptly and satisfactorily will leave me with no choice but to escalate this matter to the relevant regulatory authorities. I trust that Capital One values its reputation for fairness and transparency and will take the necessary steps to resolve this matter expediently. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and expect a timely response within 30 days of the receipt of this letter. 

Sincerely

This should be investigated.

Consumer complaint narrative: Hello so I went into my local chase branch located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and made a {$920.00} deposit into my checking account. I did deposit a lot of change like dollar bills, fives, twenties, a couple fifties and the rest in XXXX dollar bills which I've done before but this time I think there was a problem with XXXX of the bills getting stuck because the ATM I was usuing started making a very loud noise and it took much longer than usual to process the bills. Unfortunately this caused the ATM to give me a transaction error, then printed out a receipt which I have proof of and told me to make sure my deposit did go through which it did not and my money didn't come back out to me! Also this completely made the ATM machine unusable so I thought for sure they would see my money was stuck in there. I called the number it said to for help since the associates there said there was nothing they could do to help me. I called this number while inside the chase and told them everything that happened and they said they would issue me the money as missing credit that I received on XX/XX/XXXX and from then on I thought everything was resolved but then a month later on XX/XX/XXXX they reversed the credit. I called the support line again and they said I had no proof of depositing the money into the ATM even though I did and had already submitted all the proof they asked for so I told them something isn't right please submit another claim for me my money is in that ATM and if they could check the transaction logs or whoever worked at that bank and fixed that ATM had to of reported it on the logs that it was over in money however they told me they couldn't make a new claim for me only reopen my original claim so I never received my credit again. Months passed it was now XX/XX/XXXX, and they finally reached out to me again and told me there was no reports on this ATM being over in money and that they can't locate what happened to my deposit, so I'm very desperate at this point and I just go into my chase branch and speak to their manager XXXX, she told me she had only been back in office for one month because she was on pregnancy leave and that she would help me try to get my money back so she called everyone I had already contacted and said she wanted to escalate my claim AGAIN and she spoke with the manager of claims department and asked them to look into again for me, so for the 3rd time I was told they would reach out to me again and they eventually did on XX/XX/XXXX. I spoke with the head of the claims department and he said nothing was found again so this time I said I wanted to report this as theft because now I was suspicious that whoever went to fix that ATM or did the logging stole the money and just didn't report it because how else could they not find it? So they told me I have to call the branch this happened at so I finally able to get ahold of XXXX again on XX/XX/XXXX and told her I believe this was employee negligence or theft so I want to report this so she said she will submit this to the executive 's office and it's going to take time and they will have to do a full investigation, MANY months passed and no one ever reached back out to me so I contacted XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX to get an update then she gave me the number of the person working on my case which I believe now this was the wrong department it should've been reported to the fraud department because this guy ( couldn't understand the name heavy accent ) told me the same thing they all said that nothing was found, I don't even believe they ever looked into this situation even then I pleaded with them my proof that I had a coworker who was with me that day and watched me deposit this money and the error receipt telling me to make sure this deposit went through and they could clearly see into my checking account that the money never did. I know much time has passed since then but this whole situation was taking a huge toll on my mental health and I all I could do when I thought of it was cry out of frustration, I finally found this site that could possibly help me or help others in this situation so it never happens again and maybe I can actually get better resolve for this. I really appreciate your time!

Consumer complaint narrative: I was in XXXX in XXXX, and the rental car company charged me an extra {$810.00} for damage to the car that I didn't cause. I presented video evidence showing that the damage was there when I picked the car up, and they still took a deduction from my security deposit for it. I disputed this charge with Wells Fargo ( Dispute # XXXX ) on XX/XX/XXXX when I returned, and was told that I would be notified of any developments in the process. I never received any further correspondence, or a final decision, but my card was charged the full amount on XX/XX/year>. When I called Wells Fargo about this, they told me that the merchant had presented compelling evidence to support that this charge was warranted, and they had denied the dispute and closed the case. This was all done without notifying me, and never in the entire process did they give me an opportunity to present my video evidence proving that this was an incorrect and unjust conclusion. When I mentioned this on the phone, they told me that there was nothing they could do, despite their website clearly stating that there was an appeal process for cases like this. When I called back and spoke with a supervisor, they immediately reopened the case, but still never asked or gave me an opportunity to submit my own evidence. They promised that they would have an answer within 30 days from today ( XX/XX/year> ), and I have a recording of that phone call. Attached are the photos of the car when I picked it up, if that is helpful. Please let me know if there are any more documents or statements that would be helpful for this case.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Wells Fargo regarding the handling of my consumer banking account ending in XXXX. I believe that my recent experience with Wells Fargo reflects significant issues in their customer service and resolution processes, and I seek your assistance in resolving this matter. 

In XXXX, I received a notification that my account was being closed due to a random address verification requirement. While I initially received the verification letter without issue, subsequent communications revealed that my correct address was not utilized for further correspondence. This discrepancy resulted in delays and significant inconvenience on my part. 

Furthermore, despite being assured that I would receive a refund of {$420.00} within XXXX business days, I have yet to receive the promised check. Upon inquiry, I was informed that my correct address was not on file, despite it being used for the initial communication. This failure on Wells Fargo 's part to maintain accurate customer information is deeply concerning. 

To compound matters, I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, instructing me to complete a form titled " Replacement of missing cashiers check - Reference PMB account '', which mandates notarization. It is unacceptable that I am now expected to undergo additional steps, including notarization, due to Wells Fargo 's mishandling of my information. 

It has been XXXX  days since the promised refund, and I am still without my money. The inconvenience and frustration caused by Wells Fargo 's errors are unacceptable. As a consumer, I expect transparency, accountability, and timely resolution of issues from financial institutions. 

I request that the CFPB investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate action to ensure that Wells Fargo rectifies these issues promptly. Additionally, I seek compensation for the undue stress, inconvenience, and financial losses incurred as a result of Wells Fargo 's negligence.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to dispute a transaction followed by a handful more made with my Found debit card linked to my account. The transaction in question was with XXXX XXXX, and I contacted Found to request a chargeback due to XXXX 's failure to provide the services as agreed, resulting in unauthorized charges as they provided vehicles that were not suitable for the work they were intended/hired for until mechanical issues were resolved. I also found it strange that Found had hid the " dispute charge '' option and I had to call them to get them to " unlock it '' so it would appear. 

Despite providing all relevant details and explaining the situation, Found refused to process the chargeback or assist in filing a dispute. They directed me to resolve the issue directly with XXXX, which I had already attempted multiple times without success, and I have reiterated this to them. XXXX has given me the run around in hopes that I simply give up, and I am unable to resolve the dispute on my own. 

I am seeking the assistance of the CFPB to compel Found to process the chargeback or dispute, as they are obligated to assist customers in resolving unauthorized or disputed transactions under federal regulations. My attempts to resolve this through Found 's customer support have been unsuccessful, and I am left without any other recourse. 

I respectfully request that the CFPB intervene in this matter to ensure that Found fulfills its obligations and assists me in recovering the disputed funds.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I called Chime Bank to report multiple unauthorized transactions made with my debit card ending in XXXX. 

I told the bank that someone hacked one of my emails and linked my debit card to make purchases on an App called XXXX and another transaction called XXXX XXXX. 
I told them I did not authorize these transactions, I don't use that app at all and I have no idea why they charged me those amounts. 

I asked them politely to recover my money by filing a dispute for unauthorized transactions because this is fraud and we're dealing with fraudulent transactions. 

They filed a dispute and submitted the case to the internal department, within 1 hour or so I got an automatic email from Chime saying : Based on our investigation, we have concluded no error occurred. Therefore, no funds will be credited to your account and this claim is considered closed. 

I contacted the bank again multiple times after getting rejected over and over again and receiving an automatic email sent by XXXX with the same final decision, I found out my case was not being reviewed by a real agent other than a machine which is one I was getting automatic emails with a final decision denying my disputes over and over. 

I spoke to several agents and supervisors, but no one has been able to solve this matter. They keep sending the same emails and no evidence, no explanation, nothing at all. They just want to deny my disputes and not refund my money from the merchant. They were also rude and very disrespectful over the phone. 

I'm here to ask for help, and I believe you guys are the only ones that can help me. I'm going to provide all the screenshots and images I have of the unauthorized transactions and emails. 

Here are the fraudulent transactions : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear authorities, I would like to report paypal for taking money from user accounts occasionally and irresponsible and unreliable identity verification. First of all, paypal limits user accounts accusing violation of acceptable use policy. They sent email saying our accounts are permanently limited and after 180 days, we will get emails regarding our account situation and withdraw of money in the balance. As per my case and a lot happened to other users, we dont get email as they promised prior after 180 days of limitation. Instead, after certain amounts of time, we receive email that paypal can take recovery loss from our balances not mentioning a specific amount. 
In my case, my account was restricted on XXXX XXXX and I didnt receive any email from paypal during or after 180 days. Only on XX/XX/XXXX, i received email that paypal can take recovery loss and i checked my account on same day and my balance was same. But on XX/XX/XXXX, all the balances in my account which is XXXX $ was taken as paypal recovery loss. I used PayPal with my real informations and I never had dispute over transactions. First off, this kind of dishonest financial institutions are risky for benefits and financial guarantee for public consumers. I acknowledge that as per their terms and regulations that we sign when we open account, that they can take recovery charges. However, from their side, theyre not open with how much percentage of balance they can take or they dont inform you via email about how much money they took from your account or for which specific reason. Moreover, they dont send instruction email after 180 days as they promised. Customer has the right to know for which specific reason, they money was taken and to argue until he feels justified. 

Second report : I found out that someone was putting random fake SSNs and Tax IDs and PayPal system is accepting them. You should take action immediately as it endangers public safety and wellbeing. Secondly, if Paypal gets suspicious over a transaction, it should report to respective authorities, not by itself keeping the money illegally without informing authorities. 

I really would like to request CFPB to take action on Paypal and refund the money to customers.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Widespread Violation of XXXX  and XXXX Debit Card Surcharge Rules with No Enforcement To Whom It May Concern, I am submitting this complaint due to the widespread and growing practice of merchants adding illegal surcharges or so-called convenience fees when I use a debit card at the point of sale or online. This violates XXXX and XXXX  publicly published rules, which explicitly prohibit surcharges on debit card transactionseven when the transaction is run as credit. The problem is rampid and getting worse, even utility companies are doing it. 

Despite multiple complaints submitted directly to XXXX and XXXX, including merchant names, dates, and receipts, they have taken no action and do not respond. These networks continue to promote these protections publicly while making no effort to enforce them. It creates a false sense of consumer protection and enables systemic abuse by merchants. 

As a consumer, I have no recourse. Banks refer me back to XXXX, who ignore me. Merchants refuse to remove the fees, claiming theyre convenience fees, a deliberate mislabeling to avoid scrutiny. 

For example, my trash service provider charges a {$1.00} fee when I attempt to pay my bill online using a debit card, giving me no fee-free option unless I mail a physical check or allow ACH pull from my bankneither of which is practical or secure for everyone.

I am requesting the CFPB investigate : Why XXXX and XXXX do not enforce their own published rules. 

Whether the use of deceptive convenience fees to bypass surcharge rules is a violation of federal consumer protection laws. 

Why merchants are allowed to charge fees on debit transactions despite contractual card network rules that prohibit them. 

Please treat this as a formal complaint. I am prepared to provide documentation and multiple examples.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I applied for an Aspire Credit Card, which was promoted as having no annual or monthly fee. After about 12 months of use of the card, Aspire apparently changed its fee structure and started charging me a $ XXXX fee, which I did not notice until today. I carried a balance on the card until paying it off in full earlier this fall, so did not notice the extra $ XXXX in charges. 

Aspire invited me several times to sign up for XXXX of statements and notices, but I prefer paper notices, so I never opted-in to XXXX 

Despite this, XXXX apparently never notified me in writing of its new fee structure. I asked when they mailed me notice of the new fee, and they told me I was sent an " email notice '' in early 2023, But if such an email was sent, I never saw it. I recieve hundreds of emails a day, so if such an email was sent, I did not see it. 

As such, I have apparently been charged $ XXXX for at least XXXX months, without notice to me or my consent to such charges. I would like to be refunded for any of these charges that were placed on my card. In a phone call with customer service, I was told that the $ XXXX maintenance fee is " automatically added '' after the card account is open for a year. I do not recall any disclosure of this escalating fee structure. 

When I called to cancel my account, the first XXXX customer service representatives told me that a request to cancel my account would take " 45 days '' or " XXXX business days '' to process, and that the $ XXXX fee would be deducted during that time. Only after I identified myself as an attorney did the customer service rep ( the XXXX one I spoke with ) agree to cancel my account more quickly, and to remove the existing {$10.00} balance ( XXXX monthly maintenance fees ). 

This undisclosed increase in fees and XXXX cancellation period seems extremely sneaky to me, and since XXXXspire markets itself as a " credit recovery '' credit card, I suspect Aspire is deliberately taking advantage of unwary consumers. I signed up for the Aspire card because I recently exited a personal bankruptcy, and Aspire was the only " XXXX XXXX XXXX credit card that did not charge monthly or annual fees.

Secretly charging a monthly fee added after XXXX XXXX feels like a bait and switch deliberatly structured to mislead consumers.

Consumer complaint narrative: I ordered a pair of shoes from a third-party seller called XXXX, but they turned out to be fake. Despite multiple requests for a shipping label, they ignored me, forcing me to contact Amex for help. After about a week, they finally provided a label, but I was out of town at the time. Once I returned, I promptly sent the shoes back, and the merchant approved the return. However, I still haven't received a refund or credit, leaving me with a bill to Amex. They refuse to waive the charge due to the merchant 's three-day return policy, even though I repeatedly asked for a shipping label to return the counterfeit shoes. It feels unfair that I'm stuck with this bill when the merchant is unresponsive and I was the victim of their mistake.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint regarding my recent dispute with Chase Bank concerning a refund for a product purchased from XXXX ( XXXX # XXXX ). 

I made the purchase on XX/XX/year>, and returned the product to XXXX as agreed. On XX/XX/year>, XXXX confirmed receipt of the returned item and initiated the refund process upon my cancellation of the dispute with Chase, as requested by XXXX. However, as of XX/XX/year>, I have not received the refund. 

XXXX claims that the refund was processed via their payment XXXX on XX/XX/year>, and indicated that the amount should have appeared in my account within 5-7 business days. However, after multiple follow-ups with Chase, I was informed that no refund has been credited or is pending on my account. 

XXXX has denied my dispute despite clear evidence provided, including confirmation from XXXX of the refund initiation and my bank statements showing no credit has been applied. I have communicated with XXXX regarding the missing refund, and they have stated that they have no further control over the situation and that it is now entirely in Chase 's hands. I have also searched my statements for any transactions related to the dispute, but none were found. 

Despite following their instructions, I have not received any resolution or clear timeline for when the refund will be processed. I am now left without my funds over a month after returning the product. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) assist me in resolving this issue with Chase Bank and ensure that I receive the refund that is owed to me. 

I have attached the following documentation : Complete email correspondence with XXXX. 
Credit card statements from the start of the incident to today, XX/XX/year>, showing that no refund has been made. 
Proof of return of the product to XXXX. 
Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

Consumer complaint narrative: I have contacted the company several times in regards to the late payments on my account. Recently while my account was in good standing and almost completely paid off my account was closed due to me reporting fraud. I informed the company that I never reported fraud on the account, and that I instead filed a dispute to have the late payments removed as I was told the payments would not be reported to the credit bureaus. Not only has the account been closed, but I was never properly notified of the accounts closure and the reasoning behind closing the account. Also, the company is still taking payments from my bank after making the decision to close my account. This inaccuracy has done more damage to my credit than good, and I have been told that the account can not be reopened. The account should have never been closed as I never reported fraud on the account, I reported inaccuracies in the payment history. I am looking to take legal action, as this has cause extreme distress.

Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative: Monday XX/XX/year> I checked my account for devices logged in. There was a web device that did not belong to me. I attempted to delete it and got a response saying " unauthorized action ''. Tried a XXXX time with same result. I immediately tried to contact Robinhood support. According to Robinhood the best method of contacting them is via their app. The only initial contact you get is their chatbot. I described the situation and it replied with a solution that had absolutely no bearing on the issue I described. I battled with it until it gave me the option to get a call back from a representative who would be with me shortly. This occured at XXXX XXXX XXXX. On the app it said I was in line for a call back. I made several attempts each day, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with no success and no call back. XXXX I XXXX  Robinhood Phone numbers and found one that said it was an information number and one that said for support. I called and the person answered " Robinhood support, this is ( name ) how can I help you? The first step is for them to verify your identity. With that information, that person accessed my account, acted as though he was helping, but in reality he sold my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, took my cash, bought bitcoin and sent it to a bitcoin address. while on the phone, I checked my account. I saw my balances gone and that person hung up. He stole {$1900.00}. Sunday morning at XXXX XXXX I received a phone call from Robinhood support. They noticed some unusual activity on my account and froze it pending further investigation. They had no concern for what my original reason for contacting them was. My original complaint was why can I not secure my account. A few days later I got a text saying they would get ahold of me and update me on the status of my account. After XXXX  days I received an email stating that because I had initiated the transactions I would not be eligible for reimbursement, but they lifted the freeze on my account, but maintained a no trade restriction on my XXXX account with no date as to when that might be removed. After a few more days I tried to contact them again via email and their app with no response from either. XXXX days later I got a text saying that my request had been resolved. So they magically resolved my issue without solving anything and without asking me if I was satisfied. I'm still out {$1900.00} and they will no longer discuss that issue with me. I am slowly withdrawing my out of there so as to not " raise any suspicion '' Due to their complete and blatant disregard for any customer support, I was not able to secure my account and was consequently hacked. With thousands of verifiable complaints lodged against them, XXXX different disciplinary measures from other financial regulatory authorities registered against them, how are they still allowed to do business?

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX : Opened a US Bank XXXX Checking account with a {$250.00} deposit using promo code XXXX from the link attached to the below advertisement ** Open your checking account online through this page, in a branch or over the phone by XXXX with an opening deposit of {$25.00}. Then within 90 days of account opening, enroll in the U.S.Bank Mobile App or online banking and make at least two direct deposits. 
Earn {$300.00} when the combined total of your direct deposits is between {$5000.00} and {$9900.00}. 
Earn {$500.00} when the combined total of your direct deposits is {$10000.00} or more. 
** XX/XX/XXXX : Called US Bank support to confirm the above promotion was attached to my account and that I was eligible. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Received first direct deposit totaling {$5000.00} XX/XX/XXXX : Received second direct deposit totaling {$5000.00} XX/XX/XXXX : Called US Bank at XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX to check on the status of my bonus and was told that since I did meet the requirements a request to post my bonus would be sent and that it should appear in my account within 3-5 business days. 

XXXX XXXX, XXXX : Called US Bank back since the bonus had not posted and I was told that I was ineligible because I had an open checking account with US Bank before. After mentioning that Id never gotten a US bank promotion or ever had an account I was told that they did open two for me back in 2022 that made me ineligible even though I could never access these alleged accounts. 

I attempted to open a checking account with US Bank for the first time in XX/XX/XXXX. However, I encountered issues during the process. Despite receiving requests to fund an account, I couldn't proceed as the funding page consistently resulted in errors, prompting me to call customer support. 

Upon contacting customer support, I was informed that my application was on hold pending an address verification. I complied with their request to fax a picture of my ID, but after a week of no response, I followed up. I was then told that my application was under review. When I asked to simply create a login since I was being prompted to set up funding information, I was informed that I had to wait as there was nothing to attach a login to. 

Now, more than a year later, after meeting the requirements and being assured of my eligibility, I'm being informed that I don't qualify due to having two accounts in the past. This information would have been crucial to know before being told I qualified and before meeting the requirements. As evidence that I never had an active US Bank checking account, I'm attaching two emails from 2022 stating that my account could not be opened.

Thanks XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy. 

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing a formal complaint regarding an unfair and exploitative policy enforced by XXXX credit card by Synchrony Bank that imposes unnecessary financial burdens on consumers. The bank refuses to provide mailed monthly statements unless customers pay an excessive {$2.00} per statement fee. This effectively forces account holders to either : Accept electronic statements and manage their accounts entirely online, or XXXX in autopay to avoid the fee. 
This practice is unfair, coercive, and potentially in violation of consumer protection laws. Customers should not be penalized for preferringor needingpaper statements, which are a fundamental part of responsible financial management. Furthermore, this policy disproportionately affects individuals who lack reliable internet access or prefer traditional banking methods.

I believe this may violate provisions of the Truth in Savings Act ( TISA ) and CFPB regulations regarding transparency and fairness in financial services. I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that banks do not unfairly restrict access to essential account information. 

Please let me know the next steps regarding this complaint. I appreciate your prompt attention to this issue.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Against CashApp for Improper Customer Service and Dispute Handling I am filing this complaint against CashApp for failing to provide proper customer service and for mishandling disputes related to my account. These issues appear to violate the **Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) ** and its implementing regulation, **Regulation E ( 12 CFR Part 1005 ) **.

1. Inadequate Customer Service : - CashApp provides insufficient customer service, relying heavily on automated responses without offering a way to contact a live representative or escalate concerns.

2. Failure to Handle Disputes Properly : - I reported unauthorized or incorrect transactions, but CashApp did not follow required procedures under Regulation E.

- They failed to acknowledge my dispute within 10 business days, did not investigate it within 45 days, and did not issue a provisional credit during the investigation.

Requested Resolution - Investigate CashApps compliance with the EFTA and Regulation E.

- Require CashApp to improve its dispute resolution processes and customer service support.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Xe.com XXXX regarding their handling of my business account application. 

Timeline : Date of Application with Required Documentation Submission : XX/XX/year> Date of Submission Confirmation : XX/XX/year> Date of My Follow-Up : XX/XX/year> Date of Rejection Notice : XX/XX/year> Details of Issue : Despite submitting all required documentation and following the application process, my business account application was rejected without any explanation. Xe.com policies confirm that application approvals for new accounts typically take one day or longer. However, my application sat unprocessed for two full weeks. I followed up on XX/XX/year>, and immediately after inquiring about my application, I received a generic rejection email. 

XX/XX/year> Email Title : Unable to Assist Thank you for being so interested in Xe. Please note that we have reviewed your application and have made the decision to not pursue it further. We apologize for any inconvenience this decision may have caused.

I immediately followed up via email, requesting information for the rejection and asked to understand why I was not given the opportunity to cure any deficiencies. My follow-up request for clarification received no response. 

Potential Regulatory Violations : 1 ) Unfair Business Practices : Xe.com 's failure to provide a reason for the rejection of my application and their lack of response to my inquiries constitutes unfair business practices. The arbitrary rejection without explanation undermines trust and transparency.

2 ) Discrimination and Gatekeeping : As a XXXX XXXX, I am concerned that my application may have been unfairly rejected based on XXXX  practices. Any form of gatekeeping or XXXX  in the account approval process is a serious legal violation. 

3 ) Lack of Transparency and Accountability : Transparency is crucial in financial services. Xe.com 's lack of clear communication and failure to provide a reason for the rejection of my application raises concerns about their accountability. This failure to communicate violates consumer protection standards.

4 ) Consumer Protection Violations : Consumer protection laws are designed to prevent unfair and deceptive business practices. Xe.com 's actions, including the lack of transparency and potential discriminatory practices, violate these laws.

Impact on Business : The arbitrary rejection and lack of communication from Xe.com have significantly impacted my business operations and planning. This includes delays in setting up essential international payment processes crucial for my business activities.

Request for Action : I request an investigation into this matter and a resolution that includes a detailed explanation for the rejection of my application. Furthermore, I request an explanation as to why I was not allowed to cure any deficiencies in my application.

Lastly, I seek assurance that Xe.com will adhere to regulatory standards for transparency, non-discrimination, and fair business practices in their dealings with potential, existing, and previous customers.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I called Wells Fargo on XX/XX/XXXX to make a credit card payment before my due date using the company 's phone/IVR system . The phone system indicated that my payment was processed, Wells Fargo sent me a letter confirming my transaction and Wells Fargo updated my credit card account online showing that my balance had been paid. I noticed a few days later that my payment had not been processed from my XXXX account. I proactively called Wells Fargo on XX/XX/XXXX to ask why they had not taken my payment. Wells Fargo indicated that my payment failed due to a lack of funds. I did a bridge phone call with XXXX and Wells Fargo and my XXXX agent confirmed to the Wells Fargo agent that my funds were available the entire time. I have attached here proof that enough funds were available in my account the entire time of this issue. The Wells Fargo agent requested my bank account info again and proceeded to process the payment again. I was again provided a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX that my payment transaction was processed. On XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed that Wells Fargo still had not processed my payment from my XXXX account. I again proactively called Wells Fargo and the banker indicated on a recorded line that the XX/XX/XXXX payment attempt had not gone through because the prior Wells Fargo baker had missed a digit in my bank account number. I gave this banker my XXXX account info again and that banker processed my payment. I received another letter from Wells Fargo dated XX/XX/XXXX that my payment had been processed. At no point during this process did Wells Fargo communicate to me that my payments had not been processed successfully or on time. In fact, via written letter and via WellFargos website they indicated to me that my payment had been paid on time. Wells Fargo has assessed an interest charge of {$560.00} to our account. I have filed a formal complaint with the Executive Office of Wells Fargo and they have closed the complaint and left me with this interest charge even though Wells Fargo themselves failed to process the payment correctly. 

I would like the interest charge of {$560.00} to be credited to me. I proactively attempted to make my payment before its due date, I proactively followed up with Wells Fargo to make sure they received my payment on multiple occasions and I had XXXX confirm that funds were available. I have also attached here proof that enough funds were available in my account the entire time of this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing a complaint with the CFPB regarding Capital One 's failure to deposit my direct deposit from my employer and any other incoming deposits. Capital One has cited technical issues, which may violate the Electronic Funds Transfer Act ( EFTA ) as it requires timely access to funds. This situation raises concerns about consumer protection laws, and I request your assistance in investigating this matter to ensure my rights are upheld. Thank you.

On XX/XX/XXXX I first opened a savings account with XXXX, and funded this account with {$40000.00} from my XXXX account on XX/XX/XXXX which would reportedly debit on XX/XX/XXXX. Despite this whole process, at no point was I ever actually able to make an online account. 

I received an e-mail on XX/XX/XXXX that was e-statement was ready to view, and tried again at that time, unsuccessfully. Their website would always give the following error message when trying to make the actual account / login information : " We are unable to validate your information. You may try again, or for assistance contact Customer Service at XXXX. '' I attempted to call customer service multiple times, often only get robots through the first stages, particularly because without a login I do not know my own account number except the last 4 digits that they included when they let me know my e-statement was available. When calling on XX/XX/XXXX at around XXXX, when I finally reached a human, they left me on hold for over 1hr 30min, probably hoping their customers would just give up. 

At this point, this bank feels like a complete scam. I would like access to my {$40000.00} to move it straight back to XXXX ASAP. Completely baiting people with a high interest rate but then just not even letting people have access to their own money. I have been robbed!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Rocket Money ( formerly Truebill ) for ongoing, unauthorized subscription charges to my account dating back to 2023. I did not knowingly sign up for any XXXX XXXX or recurring billing, and I have not had the app installed on any of my devices during the time these charges occurred. 

I contacted Rocket Money and submitted a formal request for cancellation, refund, and proof of authorization. In response, they acknowledged the active subscription but failed to provide any evidence that I explicitly agreed to recurring charges. They offered no refund for the past charges and redirected me to another department without resolution. 

I am requesting a full refund for all unauthorized charges, cancellation of any current subscription, and confirmation that no further charges will be made. 

I consider this an unfair billing practice and am seeking assistance in resolving the matter. 

Additionally, I am filing a complaint against XXXX XXXX for unauthorized recurring charges made to my account since 2023. I have not had the XXXX XXXX app installed on any of my devices during that time, and I never consented to a continuing subscription. 

I contacted XXXX XXXX directly and formally requested a full refund and documentation showing I agreed to these charges. They acknowledged the active subscription, canceled it, and refunded only the most recent charge despite the fact that I had not knowingly used or agreed to their service in years. They declined to refund earlier charges or provide proof of my consent. 

I believe this constitutes unauthorized billing and am requesting a full refund for all past charges, proof of how they obtained authorization, and assurance that no further charges will occur. 

I am submitting this complaint due to the companys refusal to resolve the matter properly and fairly.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX I placed an order for a XXXX XXXX XXXX Full Size memory foam bed-in-a-box mattress with stated dimensions of XXXX inches long by XXXX inches wide by XXXX inches high. 
A mattress was delivered Saturday night XX/XX/year>. I left it unopened overnight in a warm room to reach room temperature. 
Opened box Sunday morning XX/XX/year>. Placed plastic-encased mattress atop an old 8 '' full mattress being used as a box spring, which is on top of a full-size metal bed frame. Removed plastic wrap from mattress at XXXX XXXX. At XXXXXXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year> the mattress measured 77 '' long x 53 '' wide x about 9.5 '' high ( height varied from place to place, being lowest at the bottom/foot corners and highest about 1/4th from the top/head ) .An insert that came with the mattress states " Please allow 48 hours for full recovery ''. 
At XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year>, 48 hours after plastic was removed, the mattress measured 77 '' long by 54 '' wide by from 8.5 '' to 11 '' high. I did not order a mattress of that size. The mattress I ordered measures 75 '' long x 54 '' wide x 12 '' high. I did not receive what I ordered.

FTC regulations state, under topic Your Rights When You Get Unordered Merchandise, " By law, companies cant send unordered merchandise to you, then demand payment. That means you never have to pay for things you get but didnt order. You also dont need to return unordered merchandise. Youre legally entitled to keep it as a free gift. '' (
https : //consumer.ftc.gov/articles/what-do-if-youre-billed-things-you-never-got-or-you-get-unordered-products ) Per FTC regulations I do not have to pay for or return the mattress I did not order. I did not receive what I ordered and should not be charged for merchandise I did not receive.

On XXXX XXXX XXXX I called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  answered the call. I asked to speak to a supervisor. XXXX then took my call. I explained that I was due a refund per FTC regulations. I was put on hold. When XXXX came back she said they " can't do a returnless refund '' and said I should dispute the charge with my credit card issuer. 
On XXXX at XXXX I called Ally Credit Card XXXX. At XXXX I spoke to XXXX with the Non-Fraud Engagement Dept . I explained the situation. He filed a " not as described '' dispute. He said I'd get a letter within 10 business days.

Not having received any letter from Ally Credit Card I called them back on XXXX at XXXX. XXXX took the call. She said the dispute was on pause because they needed more information. She transferred me to XXXX of the Non-fraud Engagement Dept. I gave him the measurements of the mattress and told him that the expanded mattress, which weighs about 50 lbs, is too heavy and cumbersome for me to return ( I'm XXXX and live alone ). I told him I'd taken several photos of the mattress with a measuring tape as proof that my assertions are factual. I asked if he wanted me to submit the photos and he said it wasn't necessary. I told him FTC regulations say I don't have to return or pay for unordered merchandise. XXXX said I'd get something in the mail within 30 business days. 
On XXXX I retrieved my mail from the community mailbox and there were 2 letters from Ally Credit Card dated XXXX. One stated they needed more info. I wasn't sure if that still applied so I called them at XXXX. Despite having chosen the " disputes '' menu option the person who answered, XXXX, said she was with Customer Service. After I explained the reason for my call she transferred me to Disputes. XXXX took the call. I explained everything yet again. XXXX said the case was " closed out '' as of the XXXX. I was again grilled about any attempts I'd made to return the mattress. I explained that I'm XXXX, have no one to help me, and can't possibly roll up and compress an expanded mattress so it will fit back in its box. I can't manage a 50lb cumbersome item down the stairs, I can't fit it in my car... it's impossible for me to return it. I told him I wasn't required to return it per FTC regulations. He continued to state that if I didn't attempt to return the mattress ( which I did not order ) my dispute would likely not be approved. He said he would send my case " up for review ''. He gave me a fax number and a mailing address ( I can use either option ) to submit more information. Instead of complying with FTC regulations ( as other credit card issuers have done for me in the past ), Ally Credit Card is forcing me to go to the time and expense of printing out photos ( they don't provide an email address for submissions ) and then either faxing or mailing my additional info to them. I don't know if I have faxing capabilities anymore so will likely have to mail the documentation, incurring further expense on my end. ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX so these additional expenses are a burden. )

I asked what had happened and they told me they could not tell me. They told me to call a XXXX XXXX XXXX and leave a message. So I have done that everyday since. I asked the following questions with the following answers- Can you tell me why my account has been frozen? No- Can you tell me when my account will be unfrozen? No- Can you help me figure out what the timeline is for this process? No we don't have a timeline - Can you send me a policy that outlines the justification for this asset XXXX? We don't have a policy. 
- So I just wait until XXXX day hoping this investigation wraps up and in the meantime hope it actually gets done? Yes it will happen eventually.

i am reaching out to CFPB for awareness and see how such credit card fraud can be handled better because otherwise inspite of calling the bank on time for credit card fraud, i loose money then its a big issue. 

Consumer confidence in banking will go for a toss.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX I noticed an amount moved from my PayPal account to my XXXX checking account which I did not move. I then changed my password in my Paypal, XXXX XXXX and XXXX. When I went to get into my XXXX XXXXXXXX it would not let me into the system. I then called them and XXXX froze my account. They said it would be XXXX business days. Then a XXXX time called them it was now a 10 day wait and third and fourth time called still no resolution. 
XXXX. They will not let me get into my account to see the balances, transfers, what money was spent etc. This should be illegal that I can not access the account statements or have copies of the activity. Now I do understand freezing the money while under investigation. 
XXXX. Each time I call they say they will escalate the issue. However, no escalation and no answers almost a month later. 
XXXX. I had over {$9000.00} in the account. Should be able to get access to that money within a certain time frame. 
XXXX. When XXXX sends me emails to reset my acct I do not receive them. It is like someone hacked my phone or computer and is intercepting the emails from the XXXX team? 
XXXX. As of today they said I would hear something in XXXX hours. Each time I talk to them it is the same process. They ask for a picture of me and my Drivers License or ID. Then it seems someone else ( hacker? ) has information I am talking with them and get an email from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX This email is asking for more information like my debit card info, bank info etc from other bank. I believe this is a scam. My bank said do not give that info. XXXX said I should not have to give that info. 
XXXX. The communication at XXXX is difficult to deal with and is not ran on a professional level of most banks etc. I feel XXXX is hiding something, not looking into the case and trying to keep my money due to their mistake of letting someone change my email and account information and to gather access to my account. 
XXXX. Hacker possibly changed the main email on my account without me knowing. no text, no emails to me etc. Then they ordered debit cards and had them shipped to them and they spent money possibly. However, I do not know the extent of anything because I can not access my account to see what was spent or possibly stolen. 

I would not recommend using XXXX if this is the way they treat their customers.

Magicly the appeal id filed was closed today after cashapp got the CFPB complaint they closed the complaint through cashapp. All of the information theyre asking are asking for is in this complaint. $ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IN XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX on statement. 

Attached is the statement and the conversation with support and the statement the charges are on. 

DO NOT tell me to contact cashapp support Ive contacted them many times with XXXX resolution. Ive also filed an appeal with XXXX resolution. ALL the information you need is in this complaint. Please dont ask for it again, just read the complaint. 

Below is the narrative from complaint number XXXX.

When i tried to report the charges to Cashapp the accounts name had changed to " XXXX XXXX '' then it changed to " XXXX '' at the time the statement was created. I reported all of these transactions to cashapp and they investigated. they began sending the payments back and refunding the money as fradulent. after the 3rd repayment they said that the rest of the transactions were not fraud and that i had violated their terms and conditions. Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Reporting Suspected Financial Fraud Involving XXXX XXXX  Transactions I am reporting suspected financial fraud involving XXXX  XXXX  transaction data on a financial platform, specifically Cash App. I have noticed significant discrepancies in my transaction history that suggest potential tampering or manipulation of records by the platform, which seems to be concealing inconsistencies in the amounts sent and received. 

In particular, I have multiple versions of XXXX files downloaded from my account that show conflicting data for the same transactions. These discrepancies appear to have been introduced after the transactions were completed, raising serious concerns about data integrity and potential manipulation. 

I am prepared to provide copies of these records, along with any other relevant information that may assist in your investigation. Please let me know if further details are required. 

Additionally, I would like to outline the pattern of discrepancies I have observed in my XXXX  transactions : Each time I purchased XXXX and transferred it, I believed I was sending the exact amount I had bought. However, it became apparent that a larger amount was being withdrawn. I suspect this issue began when I won XXXX XXXX  through XXXX. At that time, I was new to XXXX and unsure if I had understood the amount correctly. I later realized that the amount I believed I XXXX XXXXmight  have been altered to just XXXX XXXX. 

This issue persisted for many years without my knowledge, largely because I was unable to see these discrepancies unless I downloaded my transaction history. The recent transaction history displayed on the website did not reflect these issues. The evidence I will provide clearly shows that the amount of XXXX I intended to send or withdraw never matched what was actually deducted, with much larger amounts being withdrawn. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to assisting with your investigation. 

" I would like to clarify that all the spreadsheets have been filtered to show only XXXX-related transactions. Any differences observed between the files are solely those made by Cash App, apart from the highlighting and filtering to display all XXXX transactions. ''

I am filing a complaint against Cash App ( Block , Inc. ) due to inadequate customer service and unfair practices, which violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ). Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a copy of my consumer report recently after being denied an extension of credit due to reported late payments. Consumer reporting agencies have a duty under federal lawto report consumer information as accurately as possible. The items in this dispute have different information reporting across all bureaus which is a violation and not reporting 100 % accurate as required by law. I have never been late on payments for the account listed in this dispute. By law they must produce proof with statements proving that these payments were late as required. If they do not provide sufficient proof then this constitutes noncompliance and is a violation under 15 US Code 1681i ( e ).

I sent my initial letter to the credit reporting agency on XX/XX/2023 informing them that there was inaccurate information and that they had 30 days to do investigate per the FCRA and failed to investigate in the allowed time frame. I sent a demand to comply letter XX/XX/2023 informing the credit reporting agency that they failed to follow procedure and that I never received investigation results and they still refuse to investigate and send me results. 
More than 60 days had passed so I drafted an affidavit of facts on XX/XX/2023 outlining all the violations they committed and sent to the CRA along with a CFPB complaint. The company responded via the CFBP complaint portal that they have 60 days to respond. It has been more than 90 days since my initial notice which is more then allowed under the FCRA. I am demanding the items in this dispute be removal immediately and my affidavit is rebutted as required under law now!!!!

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>2024 an unauthorized charge was made on my account for the amount of {$1.00}, I saw this on the Citi mobile app, I disputed the transaction on XX/XX/year>2024 and was immediately credited the {$1.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX I saw another unauthorized transaction on my account made on XX/XX/year>2024 for the amount of {$320.00}, I tried to dispute on the citi mobile application and could not do it, I called the XXXX and reported the unauthorized transaction the Spanish speaking agent advised to immediately destroy the card and citibank costco anywhere bank would send a new card in the mail. Days passed and an e-mail was received to call back citibank and speak to an agent in the fraud center. The agents do not speak XXXX and a translator was used on the call that confused more than it resolved. After being asked questions about the use of the card, the agent said the decision would be sent out in the mail. I confidently thought that citibank costco anywhere card would credit my account for that unauthorized transaction. I received a letter in the mail stating that I was responsible for paying this unauthorized transaction because I provided my account number when the transaction was made. I did not make this transaction, I have previously made purchased with this merchant, the last being in XX/XX/year>2024. I called XXXX and asked why I would not received a credit for a transaction I did not make. I was transferred to about 4 to 5 agents no one would help me, while having a translator on the line. I was treated like an idiot, I felt lost and discriminated because I could not communicate with the agents, and the translator only made things worse for me. I clearly stated to the translator please I need the {$320.00} credited to my account, I did not make this transaction, the call lasted 49 minutes and there was no resolution to the call. The dispute was remade on XX/XX/year>2024, and there has been no credit to my account. The letter I received states that I will be reported to the credit agencies if I don't pay an unauthorized transaction made on my account, I feel threatened and coerced to pay something I did not authorize on my account, just to protect my credit and because Citibank Costco Anywhere card refuses to help me as a consumer of their credit card services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX c/o XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NJ XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Social Security : XXXX American Express General council office , center for cardmember and merchant litigation Mail code number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX Ave. XXXX XXXX Plantation Florida XXXX Subject : Request for Rescinding Signature, Access to Applications, and Card Reopening Dear American Express, I hope this letter finds you well. My name is XXXX XXXX, and I am writing to express my concerns regarding my credit card applications and their associated information held by your company. 

As a holder in due course, I am invoking my right to rescind my signature on applications containing my non-public personal information, including my Social Security number. Given my decision to no longer engage in business with your company, I am uncomfortable leaving such sensitive information in your possession. 

During a conversation with your agent on XX/XX/2024, identified as XXXX XXXX XXXX, I was informed that American Express does not have an obligation to provide me with the authoritative copies of the XXXX credit card applications in your possession. I believe this denial infringes upon the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) and contract law. 

In light of this situation, if it is not feasible to provide the authoritative copies of the applications, I request an alternative resolution. Specifically, I propose that you reopen all of my cards and place them in an opened-end status with no preset limit, accompanied by an automatic monthly discharge. 

I believe that this solution would address my concerns while still aligning with the legal and contractual obligations involved. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and your cooperation in finding an amicable resolution. 

Thank you for your understanding. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
Was referred to ALLY BANK by an online contact using their provided link which offered a {$100.00} bonus if the account was opened within a specified time frame and then a direct deposit was made to the account. I registered for the promotion and received a confirmation email from ALLY BANK that I was eligible to apply and receive the bonus. 

On XX/XX/year>, I applied for the account using the referral link with the bonus promotion attached and displayed on the screen. The account application was approved and opened automatically. I immediately initiated a {$100.00} transfer to fund the account which posted to the new account on XX/XX/year>. I also arranged for my next direct deposit to be sent to this account to fulfill the terms of the sign up bonus. A {$100.00} payroll deposit posted to the account on XX/XX/year>. The {$100.00} promotional bonus should have been credited to the new account by XX/XX/year> per the terms of their offer. 

By XX/XX/year> the bonus {$100.00} still had not been credited so I contacted ALLY BANK support staff to inquire into the matter. The agent I spoke with said that because there is an account at ALLY BANK owned by a trust for which I serve as Trustee, I am already in their system and thus the bonus was not automatically issued. We went over the terms of the bonus offer together. The terms of the bonus list " Excluded Friends '' who are not eligible for the promotion as a person who has an account at ALLY. It does not exclude the trustee or beneficiary of a trust, and even if the trust is being treated as an " artificial person '' as per the law, that artificial person is separate and distinct as a trust - not an individual. The terms of the bonus also specifically exclude trust owned accounts from being eligible for any of their promotions so ALLY BANK does consider them different from actual new customers as per their own terms. The agent agreed with me that the terms were met but had no authority to act on the matter so assured me they forwarded the matter to what they called " back office review ''. I was then given a confirmation number ( XXXX XXXXXXXX ) and told someone would manually initiate the promotional bonus from the back end and contact me within 7-10 business days. 

By XX/XX/year>, I still had not received the {$100.00} promotional credit and no one had made any effort to contact me by telephone nor mailed me any information. I spoke with another agent to check on the status and provided the confirmation number. They had no additional information about my investigation but assured me someone would contact me within XXXX business days. I was never contacted and the promotional credit is still not in my account. 

This morning, XX/XX/year>, I have attempted to reach out to ALLY BANK and was given the same speech as my call on the XXXX, leading me to believe there is no actual back office investigation and or the customer support agents are not following the proper steps to get this matter resolved.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023, shortly after midnight, I received a text from someone claiming to be my sister in law. The person said that her daughter XXXX owed some people money and they wanted it now, but she didn't have a PayPal account to send the money, and could I send it. I said that I would help, since I had a PayPal account. She first asked for {$300.00}, to be sent to a person I didn't know, then she said that didn't go through, to send {$300.00} to someone else, and another {$500.00} to that person. When I said I didn't have that kind of money in my account, I was threatened with not being able to see my brother or be welcomed to their house. I was told to transfer the money with my debit card so they would get the money right away instead of waiting a few days for the transfer. Then they asked me to buy {$1000.00} in bit coin, and to send it to a different account, I purchased the bit coin and had to add an extra {$100.00} for fees. The bitcoin didn't transfer, fortunately. When I saw my sister in law in the afternoon of that day, she had no idea what I was talking about. I immediately called PayPal to file a fraud claim, and was told that since I made the transfers of my own accord, that it was personnel, and not a business transaction, there was no fraud, and to call my bank. I tried to contact the people I sent the money to, but their accounts were gone. I called my bank, and the fraud department took the information and said they would get back to me. On XX/XX/XXXX, {$1200.00} was transferred back into my account, in the amounts of {$100.00}, {$300.00}. {$300.00}, and {$500.00}. I thought everything was settled, but sadly it wasn't. PayPal said it was a charge back, and that I owed them the money. I don't know what a charge back was, and was told that they had paid the fraudulent accounts and paid the bank as well. I told them that I was told there was no fraud so why did you give the money to the bank. No reply. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX, a collection agency, and called them to say I don't owe this money, and explained what happened and why I felt I didn't owe PayPal. I was told to call PayPal and ask for records that the money was deposited into my account. Paypal Closed my account and I had no way of getting to see what had happened and to who the money went to. PayPal doesn't care that I was scammed. PayPal is a large company, and repaying someone who was scammed {$1200.00} certainly won't hurt their bottom line, and would show that they are a good company to do business with. In the meantime, I have set up monthly payments of {$25.00}. I will not do business with them again, and will be very cautious of people texting me and asking for money. Thank you. 

As I am unable to open my account, I have to access to emails I have sent to them. Also, the text I received on XX/XX/XXXX was somehow deleted.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
IMMEDIATE ACTION DEMANDED : Formal Complaint Against XXXX and Chase Bank for Facilitating Fraudulent Transactions I am writing to demand immediate action and redress regarding a series of fraudulent transactions facilitated by XXXX and Chase Bank, which have resulted in significant financial losses. Despite my prompt reporting of these fraudulent activities, Chase Bank has dismissed my claims on the basis that the transactions were " authorized. '' This response is wholly inadequate and represents a failure to protect my consumer rights under federal law. 

Details of Fraudulent Transactions : XX/XX/XXXX : {$2500.00} XX/XX/XXXX : {$5000.00} XX/XX/XXXX : {$600.00} These transactions were executed via XXXX from my Chase business account. Despite my compliance with all necessary protocols to report these transactions as fraudulent, Chase Bank has neglected its duty to protect my assets and uphold my rights as a consumer. 

Violation of Federal Laws : The actions of XXXX and Chase Bank are in direct violation of the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E, which mandate consumer protection against unauthorized and fraudulent electronic fund transfers. Specifically : EFTA Section 907 ( a ) : Prohibits unauthorized electronic fund transfers. 
Regulation E, Section 1005.11 : Requires financial institutions to investigate and resolve errors, including unauthorized transactions, within specified timeframes. 

The blatant disregard for these legal protections by both XXXX and Chase Bank necessitates immediate rectification and accountability. 

Demands for Resolution : Comprehensive Investigation : A thorough and immediate investigation into the fraudulent transactions and the practices of XXXX and Chase Bank that facilitated this fraud. 
Reversal of Fraudulent Transactions : Immediate restitution of the {$8100.00} lost due to these fraudulent transactions. 

Enhanced Security Measures : Implementation of robust security protocols to prevent similar incidents in the future. 

Legal Accountability : Pursuit of punitive measures against XXXX and Chase Bank for their failure to adhere to federal laws protecting consumers against fraud. 

Supporting Documentation : Enclosed are screenshots of communications and other relevant documentation evidencing the fraudulent nature of these transactions. 

Conclusion : The negligence demonstrated by XXXX and Chase Bank in handling this matter is egregious and warrants immediate and decisive action. I expect the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency to uphold their mandate to protect consumers by taking swift and effective action to address this issue. Additionally, I ask for provisional credit to be considered during the investigation period, as outlined under Regulation E, to ensure that I can meet my ongoing financial commitments. 

I am prepared to provide further documentation and testimony as necessary to ensure justice is served and my financial losses are fully recovered.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I placed an order with XXXX totaling approximately {$170.00} using my Chime XXXX XXXX card. The following day, XX/XX/XXXX, I received two packages containing vitamins and phone chargers. A third item XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX valued at approximately {$140.00} including taxes was scheduled to arrive that day as well but never did. 
It appears that the package was either misdelivered or stolen. I immediately contacted XXXX, and they advised me to wait XXXX hours. During that time, I spoke with my apartment leasing office and neighbors, but the package was not located. 
XXXX requested identity verification to process a refund. I submitted my ID XXXX times without any resolution. Frustrated, I filed a complaint with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX. A representative from XXXX XXXX  department, XXXX, reviewed the case and acknowledged that the XXXX XXXX XXXX were likely delivered to the wrong address, as shown by delivery photos taken on different days. The delivery photo for the missing item clearly depicts a different location than the first XXXX packages I successfully received. 
Despite this, XXXX refused to issue a refund and claimed I violated some policy yet my XXXX account remains open and unrestricted. With no resolution from XXXX, I contacted Chime on XX/XX/XXXX to dispute the charge. Chime initially ruled in favor of XXXX, stating that the merchant did nothing wrong. 
I requested copies of the documents XXXX submitted to Chime and found they only included general delivery information and return policy language. I continued to engage with both XXXX and Chime and on XX/XX/XXXX, Chime agreed to reopen the dispute. However, by the time the second investigation concluded which took XXXX to XXXX business days XXXX claimed the window for issuing a refund had closed. 
Throughout this process, I continued providing updated evidence to both XXXX and Chime. Yet Chime denied the dispute again on XX/XX/year>, claiming there was no merchant error. They did so despite Amazons own statements to the XXXX  confirming that the package was misdelivered. Chime continues to reject my claim without fully reviewing the evidence I have submitted, and I have never been given the opportunity to speak directly with the dispute analyst handling my case XXXX continues to submit the same evidence and I submit strong evidence for my case. 
At this point, I believe both XXXX and Chime have failed in their responsibilities. XXXX has admitted the item was misdelivered but refuses to refund me, and Chime has refused to conduct a fair, thorough investigation. I am seeking CFPB assistance in holding both companies accountable and recovering the I paid for the missing package XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
