Consumer complaint narrative: for many years now, I've been using my credit cards to purchase lottery tickets. I use the lottery processor that goes directly to the lottery so the store selling the tickets don't pay the processing charge. On XX/XX/year>, I received a text message about a charge to my card that I did not make. When I logged into my account, I saw the charge along with a Cash Advance Fee of {$10.00}.... I have another card with the same company that I used to buy tickets with a couple days ago and there was a cash advance FEE of {$20.00}. I never in my lifetime have taken a cash advance on anything. So I called the credit card company and asked about the Cash Advance Fees and was told it was for buying lottery tickets, that is a new charge with their company. I was not aware of this change and never received any literature or warning of it. I was also told that it accrues interest DAILY until it's paid for! If I didn't notice this, it would keep growing until my statement came in the mail at the end of the month! I called the lottery commission and they have no knowledge of charges like this. You can't get cash back from a lottery credit card processor. The store that sells the lottery has nothing to do with it. It is the CREDIT CARD COMPANY that has decided to charge lottery tickets and any form of casino gambling as cash advances. Due to the other unauthorized charge, I had both cards reissued with new numbers. These charges are outrageous and the consumer doesn't know about it until it happens! I wanted them to reimburse me for the cash advance fee and they said they would have to cancel the charge associated with it, which doesn't make sense, because you really can't return lottery tickets! I would like the money back for these charges along with interest, they are not fair and pretty sneaky.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Bank of America and associated entities, I, XXXX XXXX, hope this finds you well. I'm reaching out regarding the document I received on XX/XX/XXXX, which pertains to the denial of my credit rights by Bank of America and its affiliates. While the document appears to originate from Bank of America, it frequently employs the pronoun " We, '' suggesting the involvement of multiple individuals or entities in its creation. However, as the document lacks signatures, I kindly request that all individuals involved in its drafting identify themselves in their private capacities. This will enable me to address them appropriately as I applied for a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX card. 

The credit application I submitted identifies Bank of America National Bank as the creditor, referencing number XXXX However, this designation appears to conflict with XXXX XXXX XXXX ( l ), which outlines that a creditor does not encompass entities solely involved in honoring a credit card transaction, as detailed in XXXX XXXX XXXX ( k ). Moreover, the use of XXXX XXXX XXXX details, particularly account numbers on electronic credit applications, is intended for securing credit, as endorsed by the securities definition within XXXX CFR XXXX. 
I would like to address the recent denial of my request for a " Confirmed Credit '' under UCC XXXX. When I submitted my request, I did so with the understanding that it met all the necessary criteria and requirements outlined in the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) XXXX, specifically pertaining to " Letter of Credit. '' As per Bank of America 's prospectus, the primary assets of the trust comprise receivables from designated XXXX Bank of America credit card accounts and Pay Over Time features. These assets encompass both principal and finance charge receivables and are subject to oversight by federal and state consumer protection laws, as emphasized in the XXXX Report. 
Bank of America, identified by SEC filing number XXXX, functions as a Sponsor responsible for orchestrating and commencing securitization transactions through the transfer of assets to the issuing entity. In my capacity as a natural person, the inclusion of my social security number on the credit application serves to facilitate this XXXX XXXX for securitization objectives. This process aims to establish an unbound credit limit based on my XXXX 

This notice stands as a declaration of breach of fiduciary duty and my right of subrogation. I insist on the proper allocation of credits and rights associated with my application. Failure to return the assets or acknowledge their intended use within XXXX business days will compel me to take regulatory actions. These may include filing complaints with the SEC and IRS regarding potential abusive tax schemes linked to the SEC-filed trust arrangement. 

As a globally integrated payments company, BANK OF AMERICA provides a diverse array of products and services, including credit and charge cards, as well as travel and lifestyle offerings. It operates under rigorous regulatory supervision by the Federal Reserve as a bank holding company. 
This notice aims for a fair resolution to the outlined issues, in line with the principle that equity prevents injustices without recourse. It emphasizes that those seeking equity must act fairly, impacting all involved parties personally. The terms laid out here necessitate equitable treatment, asserting that the essence of my application justifies an unlimited credit limit. 

Upon submitting my application to Bank of America, I was denied access to my personal credit, purportedly due to private non-public information unlawfully obtained by you from credit reporting agencies. My application represents a written request for a credit extension, made in accordance with the procedures outlined in XXXX CFR Subchapter A part XXXX. According to your prospectus report, my application, upon submission, is purchased at a discounted rate and converted into a receivable/treasury marketable security, i.e., a trust asset as per section XXXX. 
I seek clarification on the reasons behind this denial of credit. According to Section XXXX ( XXXX ) of the Federal Reserve Act, " In no event shall such collateral security be less than the amount of Federal Reserve notes applied for. Therefore, as a consumer, I should not have been denied credit. Furthermore, under the FCRA, it appears that socioeconomic discrimination has been employed against me. The information utilized by Bank of America to assess my 'creditworthiness ' constitutes personal non-public information acquired from a third-party company. This adverse action has caused me injury and emotional distress, as I have been unable to obtain necessities for my personal development and growth. I am deeply troubled by these actions. 
The XXXX Report XXXX Bank of America outlines that the primary assets of the trust include receivables from designated XXXX Bank of America credit card accounts and Pay Over Time revolving credit features. These receivables comprise both principal and finance charge receivables. 
I question whether I was discriminated against and denied open-ended credits based on my XXXX XXXXXXXX, given that I provided Bank of America XXXX XXXX tender, i.e., my duly tendered, endorsed, and signed application. Does Bank of America 's policy grant it the authority to disregard the encoded rules of XXXX USC XXXX, which asserts my right to the enjoyment and benefit of my contract? 

Does Bank of America 's policy grant it the authority to omit crucial information while utilizing complex legal and technical business terminology? Extrinsic XXXX  refers to deceptive acts or misrepresentations made outside the main event, which deprive the victim of vital information or involvement. Moreover, my original promissory note, initially intended as an application, was converted into a receivable/trust asset by Bank of America without my knowledge or consent. This critical detail has never been disclosed to me by Bank of America. 

If, by any chance, I have granted Bank of America authorization and/or Power of Attorney privileges, whether explicitly or implicitly, I hereby revoke all such authority and rescind Bank of America XXXX XXXX interest. According to the XXXX Report XXXX Bank of America, it states that " The certificates will evidence undivided beneficial interests in the trust assets allocated to such certificates, representing the right to receive from such trust assets funds up to ( but not in excess of ) the amounts required to make payments of interest and principal in the manner described below. The certificates will be available for purchase in minimum denominations of { {$100000.00} } and integral multiples of { {$1000.00} } in book-entry form Payments of interest and principal will be made on each related interest payment date to the certificate holders in whose names the certificates were registered on the last day of the calendar month preceding such interest payment date, known as the record date. 
Consequently, if the application/securities/receivables are registered in my name, then all interest and dividends are rightfully due to me, the consumer. Does Bank of America 's policy grant it the right to exploit and deprive consumers? The actions of Bank of America against me are inherently actionable. If your response to this complaint is conveyed by an attorney or any member of the XXXX XXXX XXXX, I hope they seriously consider their oath, which states, I solemnly swear that I will support the Constitution of the United States, that I will faithfully discharge the duties of the office of attorney, and that I will conduct myself at all times with integrity and civility. Any action contrary to this oath constitutes misconduct and is inherently actionable. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: Hello. On XX/XX/year> my credit card was charged {$4900.00}. The transaction appears to be as ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) located in XXXX FL XXXX. However, I live in CA, and the transaction was made in a different state, like the opposite side of the USA. I do not understand how that transaction went through without me being asked by the bank to verify it first. On XX/XX/XXXX night, I noticed my wallet was missing ( which had my physical credit card and my driver 's license in it ), that is also when I noticed the unauthorized transaction on my card and called the bank to let them know my wallet is missing, again saying that my physical driver license was in my wallet too. I told them that I had never left CA also. During the 90-day investigation, they sent me many papers such as affidavits to sign. I did all of it. Later, I received a call from them and they asked me how come had you lost your wallet for 2 nd time in my life which is very unethical question. The same card was also lost more than a year ago and maybe that is why they allowed themselves to ask that question. I also confirmed with them that the last time I used my card was the transaction made on XX/XX/XXXX, from XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX amounting to XXXX XXXX As proof, they did not require it, but I was so cooperative that I called them and said that I could send my other card statements, which would show my daily transactions. They agreed, and I sent them by mail my 3 other banking statements which had my transactions showing here in CA made on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ( the day the charge was made in FL ), and XX/XX/XXXX also. Later, I called them to verify if they received my statements as a proof that the XXXX FL transaction was not made by me and that it was not authorized. They picked up the phone and stated that it was not an enough proof and that the case was closed. They did not even care to tell me that the case was closed, I found out about it at the time I called to verify If my proofs were received. I also asked what else they wanted because the statements I sent to them showed exactly the dates I used my other cards in CA, also showing my name, my address and all my other personal information. They said they do not know what exactly they want as proof and they stated that they are not proceeding with the claim. Lastly, they also reported my credit account as disputed, resolved, and disagreed with XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. This is just ridiculous. They have no right to ask me to pay for smth that I did not do, did not know, and did not authorize. they have no right to report my account as disputed, resolved ( when it is not ) and disagreed ( by the customer ). They did not even let me know about this, I also found out about this reported from the credit reporting agencies.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Arizona XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/1984 SS # : XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute multiple violations of federal laws related to consumer protection and credit reporting, as outlined by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ), and the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ). I kindly request your assistance in enforcing my legal rights and addressing these matters with the respective creditors. 

The violations I am raising concern about have had a profound impact on my life, affecting my financial well-being and emotional state. These violations have caused undue stress, XXXX, and uncertainty, as my credit report contains inaccuracies and questionable information that tarnish my creditworthiness and personal integrity. 

Unauthorized Inquiries and Inaccurate Account Reporting : Several creditors, namely XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and others, have made unauthorized inquiries into my credit report without my consent. These inquiries were conducted on various dates, as specified in my previous correspondence. These unauthorized inquiries have left me feeling powerless and violated, as my personal information was accessed without my knowledge or permission. 

Furthermore, there are instances where my account information has been inaccurately reported, leading to incorrect representations of my credit history. For example, the accounts associated with XX/XX/XXXXXX/XX/XXXX( Account Number : XXXX ), XX/XX/XXXXXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ), XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ), and others have been inaccurately reported, impacting my credit score and potential lending opportunities. These inaccuracies have caused unjust hardships and hindered my ability to secure favorable financial terms when needed. 

Personal Impact : I want to emphasize the personal toll these violations have taken on my life. The stress and emotional distress resulting from the inaccuracies and unauthorized inquiries have disrupted my peace of mind. As I strive to manage my finances responsibly, I find myself facing obstacles that were not of my making. This situation has affected not only my ability to secure loans and credit but has also caused significant XXXX  and sleepless nights. 

Request for Action : I implore the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to enforce my legal rights and ensure that these violations are addressed promptly. I kindly request that you work with the respective creditors to investigate and rectify the unauthorized inquiries and inaccuracies on my credit report, specifically related to the accounts listed below : XX/XX/XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXXXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) I believe that the removal of these unverified accounts from my credit report is essential to restoring my financial well-being and mental peace. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and your commitment to protecting consumers ' rights. Please keep me informed of the progress made in addressing these violations and seeking resolution with the creditors. I look forward to a favorable outcome that will help alleviate the burdens caused by these unjust circumstances. 

Thank you for your time and consideration. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Name : XXXX XXXX Birth : XX/XX/XXXX Credit Card : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I am filing a complaint against Bank of America ( BofA ) for their bank system error that caused incorrect late payment reporting against my credit report XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX, harming my credit score and disrupting my life. 

In XXXX, I set up autopay from my XXXX account ( ending XXXX ) for my BofA credit card. It worked without issue for four years until XXXX, XXXX. 

XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I found a late payment for {$15.00} ( statement XXXX, due date XX/XX/XXXX ) over 30 days past due, reported to the 3 credit bureaus, which causes them mark this card past due in XX/XX/XXXX. BofA didn't send any email to notify the past due bill. 

XXXX. I discovered that autopay settings were deleted. I called BofA ( XXXX ), rep advised manual payment and autopay reset and then contact them again. I did manual payment and autopay reset as they suggested. 

XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called BofA again to figure out whats wrong. BofA confirmed the issue was their bank systems fault by the phone, not mine. They said sometimes the bank system will lose autopay setting. Case ID : XXXX XXXX csa XXXX XXXX was created, and they promised to revert the negative report. 

XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called BofA to track the progress of the case. Them claimed the case was resolved and advised waiting for updates of the new credit reports. I concerned but complied.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Barclays mishandled hotel dispute, refused to reopen after errors. 

What happened : On XX/XX/year>, I was wrongly charged {$400.00} by a hotel for a smoking fee. I did not smoke in the room. The charge was based solely on an automated smoke report that triggered around XXXXXXXX XXXX. and continued past XXXXXXXX XXXX., while I was asleep. I had showered and gone to bed earlier. No hotel staff ever entered the room or verified the alert. 

When I asked the front desk manager ( the only person Ive been allowed to speak to ), why no one came to the room, he said they do not have to physically verify it and only rely on the smoke report. Thats unreasonable, especially since smoke sensors can be triggered by non-smoking causes like steam or aerosol. 

I disputed the charge with Barclays, and they mishandled the process from the start : They misfiled the dispute as an altered amount instead of an unauthorized transaction. 

They denied it in a letter dated XXXX XXXX XXXX, but I was out of town for work and did not receive the letter until XX/XX/XXXX. 

I called immediately and was told the dispute would be reopened correctly. 

In XXXX, I found out it was never reopened. I called again and asked for a manager. 

A manager called once, on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX, left a hard-to-hear voicemail with no direct callback number. 

When I called back, I had to start over. I was eventually told to send a written letter and assured it was not too late. 

I sent the letter via certified mail. 

Then on XX/XX/XXXX, I received a new letter ( dated XX/XX/XXXX ) again denying the dispute and now claiming its too late, despite all previous reassurances and delays being Barclays fault. 

This latest letter also again listed the charge incorrectly as {$390.00} instead of the correct {$400.00}, despite my previous corrections. 


The hotel has refused to let me speak to anyone other than the front desk manager, who told me flatly : > It goes no further than me. Whats done is done. 
Ive left multiple voicemails for the general and assistant managers none have responded. 

Now Barclays is threatening to report this charge to the credit bureaus if I dont pay it even though it remains disputed and theyre the ones who mishandled the process repeatedly over XXXX months. 


I have been traveling for 26 years for business and have stayed in thousands of hotel rooms during that time. I have never smoked, never vaped, and have never once been accused of doing so or charged a smoking fee until now.

On XX/XX/year>, between XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I attempted to make a deposit at a Citibank ATM located on XXXX XXXX in XXXX. Since I do not understand XXXX, I followed the icons displayed on the ATM screen to complete the transaction. After inserting my bank card and entering my PIN, I tried to deposit cash. However, due to my inability to understand the English instructions, I pressed the Check button. A slot opened below the ATM, and I placed XXXX {$100.00} bills ( totaling {$500.00} ) into the slot. The slot closed immediately after. 

Shortly afterward, the ATM prompted me to retrieve my bank card. At that moment, I realized I might have made an error, but the cash was already inside the ATM. I repeatedly inserted my card, hoping to reopen the slot, but the cash could not be located. 

I took photos of the ATM, including its ID number ( ID # XXXX ), and contacted my family for assistance. My family helped me call Citibank and report the issue. Over the phone, the bank staff, assisted by a translator, assured me they understood the situation and asked me to wait for their investigation. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I personally visited the bank to follow up and provided the details again. The staff submitted an investigation request on their computer. Since then, I have been waiting for updates from the bank, but no substantial progress has been made. 

During this period, Citibank sent three letters : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Thank you for contacting us regarding the above-referenced checking account on XX/XX/year>. Please rest assured that we are reviewing your inquiry and will contact you in writing with the results of our investigation. 
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Thank you for contacting us regarding the deposit of {$500.00} made at the ATM on XX/XX/year>. We have completed our review. Our records indicate that there were no cash discrepancies at the relevant time and location. 
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Thank you for contacting us regarding the above-referenced checking account on XX/XX/year>. Please rest assured that we are reviewing your inquiry and will contact you in writing with the results of our investigation. 

I received each of these letters XXXX days after the mailing dates. 

This is the full account of what happened. During this time, I have visited the bank several times, but there has been no resolution or clarification of where the {$500.00} cash I deposited went. 

I am now seeking a clear explanation. Where is the {$500.00} cash that I deposited into the ATM? 
Did the ATM malfunction and consume the cash? 
Did a bank employee intercept the cash during processing and fail to report it? 
Or does Citibank assume that a customer like me, who doesnt understand English, can be easily deceived and has decided not to return my money? 

In this era of advanced technology and information systems, banks have access to sophisticated monitoring systems. Can this issue truly not be investigated and clarified? 

I demand a definitive answer. How can cash deposited into an ATM simply disappear?

XXXX Order # XXXX Amount paid : {$6600.00} Order Date : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Just for context, I'm a XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  no longer working and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

On XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX I bought a gold chain online from a merchant called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and paid {$6600.00} on my Bank of America debit card. 

The following day an empty box was delivered by XXXX. 

It had an invoice and an empty, small zip-loc type bag in it. I called XXXX immediately and I've spoken to seven customer service folks at different levels, providing them with whatever they have asked me for : several interviews, photos of the box, etc. 

The XXXX representative on XX/XX/XXXX told me to contact XXXX XXXX directly and request a refund. I tried to contact them many times without success. XXXX representatives assured me on multiple occasions that my funds. would be refunded and not to worry. 

XXXX advertises a warranty/guarantee that promises to protect consumers if they are defrauded by a merchant using their platform. It is called the XXXX XXXX and my claim for coverage under this was also denied. 

I reported this back to XXXX ; the representative said they would look into it. The day the box arrived, I read the reviews and I'm glad that I saved the webpage. I will submit via your portal the 13 other reviews by customers who paid for but did not receive their orders from XXXX XXXX ( all in less than last 6 months ). 

When I checked XXXX XXXX weeks later, there were no reviews at all. All wiped clean and the review function itself only to be found at the bottom of at least a 5 page scroll down from the top, not at the usual location near the top. 

After more than a dozen calls and emails with XXXX, they emailed me and said I was not going to receive a refund. No reason was given and none was available when I called to follow up. 

I requested Bank of America to chargeback this purchase as it was fraud. So far they have refused to indemnify me and they did not even provide a provisional credit as required under Federal law and as promised in their " Deposit Agreement and Disclosures '' provided when I opened my account. 

I am owed {$6600.00} from Bank of America. 

Thank you

Consumer complaint narrative:
American Express XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute, Demand for Return of Security/Investment & Inquiry Regarding Securitization of Personal Information To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to address and formally dispute the adverse action taken against me regarding the recent denial of my credit application with American Express. I find it particularly troubling, given that American Express has continuously and aggressively solicited my business through targeted marketing and promotions. This solicitation creates an expectation of fair dealing, yet after collecting my highly sensitive personal data including my Social Security number American Express not only denied me but also appears to have used my information for its own financial gain. 

Based on publicly available information, including details from American Express most recent prospectus, it is clear that the company securitizes applications, contracts, and account receivables as part of its strategy to create financial instruments. These instruments are then transferred to third parties or bundled into asset-backed securities, which are subsequently used to raise capital and expand business operations. This process effectively transforms customer applications and agreements into marketable securities, subject to financial trading and liquidity generation. 

By collecting my personal information and application data, American Express has received and converted this into an instrument that has tangible value within financial markets. Whether directly or indirectly, my data may have been incorporated into pools of assets that American Express securitizes and uses as leverage for funding activities, increasing shareholder value, or meeting regulatory capital requirements.

Given this reality, it is clear that my application which you have chosen to deny has nevertheless provided American Express with a form of security or investment through its contribution to the companys securitization and funding mechanisms. Denying me the credit facility while retaining the value generated from my data raises ethical and potentially legal concerns. 

Demand for Remedy : Given that my application and personal information may have been utilized in securitization processes that benefit American Expresss capital and business expansion strategies, I find the denial of my credit application unjust. Therefore, I formally request the following remedy : 1. Approval of a Lifetime Credit Facility : Immediate approval of an American Express credit card with an unlimited credit line for the duration of my lifetime.

2. Proper Discharge of Account : Assurance that this account will be managed in accordance with the discharge, cancellation, and satisfaction provisions outlined in your indenture agreements, specifically those pertaining to noteholders. 

[ Securitization and Use of Personal Information ] : Publicly available documents, such as the American Express Issuance Trust II indenture, indicate that American Express engages in the securitization of receivables and related assets. Specifically, Section 6.01 of the indenture discusses the Satisfaction and Discharge of Indenture, stating : This Indenture will cease to be of further effect with respect to any Series, Class or Tranche of Notes when : ( a ) all Notes of that Series, Class or Tranche theretofore authenticated and delivered have been delivered to the Indenture Trustee canceled or for cancellation ; ( b ) the Issuer has paid or caused to be paid all other sums payable hereunder ; and ( c ) the Issuer has delivered to the Indenture Trustee an Officers Certificate and an Opinion of Counsel each stating that all conditions precedent herein provided for relating to the satisfaction and discharge of this Indenture with respect to the Notes of that Series, Class or Tranche have been complied with. 

This suggests that American Express has mechanisms to discharge obligations related to securitized instruments upon fulfillment of specific conditions. 


Additional Demands : Furthermore, I reiterate my previous demands : 1. A comprehensive explanation for the adverse action taken against me.

2. A detailed account of how my personal information, including my Social Security number, has been utilized, particularly concerning securitization activities and transfers to third parties.

3. Disclosure of any financial instruments created using my data and how such instruments have been leveraged to raise capital.

4. If American Express chooses not to extend the requested credit facility, I demand the return of any value or investment derived from my personal information and application. 

Failure to address this matter satisfactorily within 30 days will compel me to escalate my complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and other relevant regulatory bodies. I am prepared to pursue all necessary actions to protect my rights and recover any value unjustly retained by American Express. 

I expect a prompt and equitable resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

I tried going to a local branch and they said they could not help find out, and I also called chase, got redirected to many different divisions with the final answer being that " no one I can talk to can ever tell me why my accounts were closed, other than upon further inspection we can not continue banking with you ''. I have over {$3000.00} points in my ultimate rewards portal that can be used towards travel, and now I am forced to spend them all within the next 30 days, that is if they don't suddenly take them away prematurely too.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Letter to Discover Card Customer Service : Discover Financial Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Il XXXX Subject : Account Reinstatement Inquiry for Discover Card Dear Discover Card Customer Service, I am writing to express my deep concern and frustration regarding the suspension of my Discover Card account. All my accounts were current and in good standing, and I have not received any valid explanation for this suspension. 
I want to emphasize that withholding my access to my securities constitutes security fraud. As a consumer, I have the right to credit, and this action is a violation of the Consumer Credit Act and the Equal Credit Opportunity Act. Regardless of the reason for revoking my credit line, this decision has had a significantly negative impact on my credit score. 
I kindly request an immediate investigation into this matter and urge you to retract this decision promptly. I expect a thorough explanation for this action, and I anticipate a resolution to this issue without further delay. 
Sincerely, Consumer Credit Act : The Consumer Credit Protection Act ( CCPA ) is a federal law that encompasses several statutes, including the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ), and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). These laws protect consumers in various ways, such as ensuring accurate credit reporting, promoting fair lending practices, and regulating debt collection activities. 
Equal Credit Opportunity Act : The Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) is a part of the Consumer Credit Protection Act. It prohibits creditors from discriminating against credit applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, age ( provided the applicant has the capacity to enter into a binding contract ), or because the applicant receives income from any public assistance program. 
I went through a lengthy process of verifying my income providing bank statements etc. which was ultimately denied because I wrote the starting balance incorrectly, instead of clarifying this information my account was closed without notice and refusal to reopen. 
I have called in an attempt to resolve this matter and was denied by a XXXX or XXXX who submitted a complaint on my behalf as Manager was not taking phones calls. 
Violations of these laws can result in civil penalties and fines imposed by regulatory agencies, and individuals who believe their rights under these laws have been violated can file complaints or lawsuits seeking damages. It's important to consult legal counsel or the appropriate regulatory authority for specific and up-to-date information regarding these laws. 
Warm regards, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX, Ca XXXX cc : XXXX XXXX, XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a paper check from my employer, which I deposited into my bank account on XX/XX/year>. After the bank processed the deposit, they placed a hold on the funds until XX/XX/year>. This hold period is standard practice for certain types of checks or deposit amounts, but in this case, it has resulted in a significant delay in accessing my funds. 

When I inquired about the possibility of having the funds made available sooner, I explained that typically, banks are expected to make deposited funds available within 2-5 business days per federal law. However, the bank staff dismissed my request and stated that there is nothing they can do to expedite the release of my funds before the hold period ends on XX/XX/year>. 

This situation is deeply frustrating and distressing for several reasons : Financial Strain : I rely on my paycheck to cover essential expenses such as rent, utilities, groceries, and other bills. The 11-day delay means I am unable to access my money when I need it most, leading to financial hardship and stress. 

Lack of Flexibility or Support : Despite my reasonable request for an earlier release, the bank 's refusal and their assertion that nothing can be done is disheartening. It feels like there is no consideration for the urgency of my situation. 

Impact on Daily Life : The delay has disrupted my financial planning and caused unnecessary hardship, which could have been mitigated if the funds were made available sooner. In addition to this hindering me from being able to obtain critical medicines. 

Overall, the delay and the bank 's response have caused significant frustration, anxiety, and financial difficulty. I believe there should be clearer communication and more flexibility in such cases, especially when the delay extends well beyond the typical 2-5 business days.

The credit bureaus must verify these items under Sections 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) and 611 ( a ) ( 1 ). ( A ). I'm hoping that these disputed items be UPDATED immediately. 

XXXX XX/XX/2022 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

In XXXX of this year ( I have not received a statement, so I am not able to verify specific date of incident ), my business and personal accounts had an overdraft. BECU blocked my online account, but I had not been informed, so I just thought it was a technical error or a password problem. I tried several times over the following days and weeks, but could not access, so I decided to call and ask for help. When I called, BECU informed me that they had closed my accounts ( including my credit card, which I had made timely payments on ) because of the overdraft. They said it was turned over to their " Financial Crimes '' department, which shocked me. I have never been treated like this by a bank. I have been a good customer and never had an issue. For them to respond in this manner was unfair, harsh, and lacked any kind of thoughtfulness toward me as a customer. 
When I looked into it, I found that I had deposited checks from another business of mine and from another personal account I held. The business has a couple of clients that owe a considerable amount of money ( over {$95000.00} ) and had been told one of the clients had wired the money to the accounts the checks were written from. They, in fact, had not, and were just trying to buy time to make their payment. I have been hit hard by the lack of payments from these clients, which know they owe the money. I'm sure they will pay, but I am having to reach out to them every few days to push them or at least get a status update. I've been assured that I will be paid, but I need BECU to be patient and understanding, while I work on getting this resolved with my clients, so I can cure the debt owed to BECU. 
I feel terrible about the overdrafts, and I will take care of what I owe. This was uninntentional on my end and, I believe, understandable. Some leeway should be granted to me by BECU, and allow me to make payments or wait until I am paid completely and can pay the entire amount owed ( approximately {$9000.00} total between the accounts ). I also need my access to the online banking restored, so I can make regular payments, get records of the transactions, get statements, and manage the accounts. Cutting me off immediately, put me in the dark, with no explanation for weeks. Had I known early on, I would have been able to track and manage this a lot better. 
I need any fees waived where possible, my accounts restored and allowed to continue, and I need any credit reporting removed. I have been hit hard enough by our clients ' lack of payments and need support and understanding. I'm committed to resolving this.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2024 I have disputed a charge for {$1900.00} for an XXXX program  that claims to help you sell your work and claims to be a cutting-edge program. I signed up for this program XX/XX/XXXX and after about a month in the program I realized the program was all fluff and didn't deliver what it advertised. I asked for a refund from the company XXXX XXXX art or schulmanart.com. They gave me a standard sorry there's only a seven-day money back guarantee response. 
On XX/XX/2024, I then disputed the charge with my credit card which was Apple card XXXX Goldman Sachs. I did receive an initial credit while the dispute was being investigated by the Goldman Sachs XXXX department. On XX/XX/XXXX Goldman Sachs asked me to provide additional information to support my claim for the dispute. I provided this on the deadline they suggested of XX/XX/XXXX. Then on Thursday XX/XX/XXXX I received an e-mail saying my dispute was not valid and I would be recharged for the {$1900.00}. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I then called Apple card and got as many higher ups as I could on the phone least XXXX to XXXX different people and asked for a manager in the dispute department to be able to help me escalate my dispute. I was informed by a manager in the dispute department with Apple that I can not be transferred to the investigation department nor did they have a number I could call so basically I hit a dead end. The manager and the dispute department told me the only thing she could do was to make a note to escalate my complaint. However, my experience with the investigative department is that they don't respond to any emails, and they don't want to talk to you in person. 
After doing some research I found that I can complain to you regarding Goldman Sachs refusal to talk to me in person and having no way to contact them to have a personal discussion around this charge. 
Yesterday I immediately went back to XXXX art to ask them for a refund and have not received a response. The only action they have taken is to block me from their social media sites so that I can not leave a review. 
Hence This is why I'm escalating this complaint to CFPB. Below please see a summary of my reasons for my dispute with XXXX art. I presented all of these details plus a pile of other documents to the Goldman Sachs investigative department, and they still declined to uphold my dispute. 
I really do feel that Goldman Sachs is in the wrong here I feel like I have a very strong case proving my point that the {$1900.00} Let 's see I spent with XXXX art for a fluff art program claiming to be something that it is not, is a valid claim and that my dispute should be upheld and I should be reimbursed the money. 
Reasons for dispute With XXXX art : 1. The money back guarantee was for 7 days and this is a multi-week/month course and certain sections of the course are suggested for each week over an XXXX week period ( minimum! ). 
2. I did not sign any contract or agreement.

3. When I asked the merchant for a refund, the proprietor, XXXX XXXX, did not respond. She had a team member give a standard response. This is awful customer service. 
4. The Incubator course is sold as giving you secrets for selling your art. It is advertised for an XXXX at any level in their career. This is not true. The course is for beginners. Most of the material she teaches can be accessed for free on XXXX. 
5. Most of the video in the course is regurgitated prerecorded videos with XXXX minutes on the subject then a Q/A. Many of these are months/years old. 
6. The initial marketing video touted learn about art licensing, free templates for launching, marketing companies to submit to and a website review if you paid the full {$1900.00} up front. These were the main areas I wanted to do a deep dive in, and assumed the course had the goods. I thought it would be worth the money if indeed these were as she advertised. However : a. There are no templates for launching. She provided what she created for her own launches and graphic with those launches. I understood the templates would be fill in with your own copy. There are none of those. You have to create the entire launch series from scratch, since artists are not going to use the same graphic style and fonts that she used.

b. There was an example in the selling video of one of the Incubator artists that got into a major art magazine and sold about $ XXXX worth of work, yet nothing in the modules about which magazine that was or how to get into/which magazines to look into. The marketing companies is just a spreadsheet list of about XXXX podcasters, some of the contact links outdates. There is nothing about marking your work in publications, etc. which was touted as a selling point. Dont necessarily use social media, use publications and other forms of marketing! However, there is nothing in any of the modules about marketing in publications. There are publicity tips but no company/magazine suggestions. 
c. I still have not received a website review and I signed up at the end of XXXX! 
d. There is very little on art licensing and nothing in depth! The couple of interviews with art licensers did not have ANY in depth how tos they were both just general discussions for XXXX minutes with Q/As. I was so shocked that there was really nothing on licensing that I spent another {$500.00} with another company who had an entire course on licensing. 
XXXX. Her basic instruction, which is most of the course talks about things like : a. How to file b. General life coaching questions XXXX What to post on social media dXXXX XXXX XXXX instruction about XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX etc e. A Who Am I mastermind XXXX Possibility workshop XXXX how to create mixed media art nothing to do with selling our art XXXX. She includes Art Fairs and a packing checklist! I didnt sign up for that! I already know what Im doing in that area. Its like she threw a bunch of old documents that shes created over the years in her program to make it look deep but it is shallow! 
XXXX. Whats really telling is that she has written a book called XXXX which I have a copy of and have read the entire book ( after I signed up for the course ), and XXXX  %, including lists, suggestions, templates etc of what she teaches in her {$1900.00} course are in that book! 
Not worthy of {$1900.00} and I would not even have paid {$100.00} for the content in the course, if I had known ahead of time!

Consumer complaint narrative:
proof that they must delete the trade lines of XXXX and XXXX XXXX Creditors BewareComplying with IRS Rule May Cancel Underlying Indebtedness XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX. XXXX  Many creditors try to assert additional pressure on their debtors by issuing, or threatening to issue, a form required by the IRS ( form 1099-C ) informing the IRS that the full amount of the outstanding debt is cancelled even though the creditor intends to continue collection activities. IRS regulations require creditors to issue the 1099-C form if they cancel a debt of {$600.00} or more in any calendar year. Domestic banks, trust companies, credit unions, savings and loan associations, and any organization whose significant trade or business is the lending of money are subject to this regulation. Additional regulations ( 26 C.F.R. Section 1.6050 P-1 ) list several identifiable events that trigger the reporting obligation to file Form 1099-C. These events include discharge of debt in bankruptcy, expiration of the statute of limitations for collections, discharge by agreement of the parties, a creditors decision to discontinue collection activity and discharge the debt, and expiration of the non-payment testing period. Nothing in the statutes or regulations prohibits collection following the filing of a form 1099-C.

The Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) treats cancelled debt as income to the debtor, which might subject the debtor to federal income tax. Many creditors try to assert additional pressure on debtors by issuing, or threatening to issue, Form 1099-C. However, a recent opinion ( In re XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) from Chief Judge XXXX XXXX XXXX of the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX for the XXXX XXXX XXXX Iowa reveals the peril a creditor XXXX face in issuing the debt cancellation notice. In fact, given this recent decision, debtors in the XXXX XXXX XXXX Iowa might welcome the receipt of form 1099-C. 

In XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX gave up trying to collect a debt from the XXXX that was secured by a mortgage on the XXXX house and issued Form 1099-C. The XXXX  reported the income and paid taxes on the cancelled debt. They subsequently filed a XXXX XXXX  bankruptcy petition. The XXXX XXXX  opposed the XXXX XXXX XXXX plan because it did not propose any payments to the XXXX  XXXX  on the original mortgage debt. The XXXX claimed that the credit union had discharged the debt by virtue of the 1099-C. Ruling in favor of the debtors, XXXX XXXX noted that the issuance/filing of form 1099-C by itself normally will not discharge the creditors underlying claim. Here, however, the notice, when coupled with the evidence that the debtors reported the income on their tax returns and paid the taxes due on that debt forgiveness, caused the debt to be canceled. The debtors were able to confirm their XXXX  XXXX plan based on the bankruptcy courts finding that the credit unions {$60000.00} of unpaid indebtedness was cancelled and that under XXXX  law a mortgage ceases to be enforceable when the debt underlying the lien no longer exists. Thus, the bankruptcy court removed both the credit unions mortgage lien and debt from the XXXX house. 

Although XXXX adopted the minority reasoning in these cases, it does strike at the majority rationale, which states that the filing of IRS Form 1099-C alone is not sufficient evidence that the debt has been cancelled. ( See F.D.I.C. v. Cashion, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ). ) Under XXXX, the filing of Form 1099-C combined with the reporting of the forgiven income and payment of associated taxes is sufficient to cause a legal cancellation of the debtors loan and accompanying mortgage lien, at least under Iowa law .

Therefore, creditors must beware. Under the correct circumstances over which the creditor may have no control the issuing of Form 1099-C may effect a legal cancellation of the debt and release the liens securing the debt. Debtors should welcome Form 1099-C, report it on their next tax return, and pay the taxes due. Although no statutes or regulations prohibit collections on a debt after the filing of a Form 1099-C, creditors should be aware of the associated perils given the XXXX holding XXXX 
Associated People XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Bankruptcy XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a complaint against my financial institution, Revolut, for denying my right to a fair chargeback for goods/services not received. The transactions in question occurred on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have listed them below along with the relevant details : Transaction : Date : Merchant : Amount : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$40.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX {$28.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX {$39.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX {$44.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX {$45.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX {$26.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXl {$26.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$35.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX {$25.00} XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX {$34.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$27.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$47.00} XXXX Its important to note the billed XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) because the merchant billed for these services that were not provided nor purchased, and each of the merchants listed I have never heard of before. 
Despite my repeated attempts on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to resolve the issue with Revolut, they have continuously denied my requests for a chargeback. I firmly believe that as a consumer, I have the right to a fair resolution when goods or services are not received as promised. 
I have provided Revolut with all the necessary evidence, including proof of purchase and attempts to contact the merchants involved, to support my claim. However, their denial of my chargeback requests has left me feeling frustrated and unfairly treated.

I kindly request your assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that I receive a fair and timely resolution. I believe Revolut should be held accountable for their failure to address my legitimate concerns and honor my consumer rights.

" I would like to point out that Revolut has repeatedly stated that they can not submit my chargeback due to card scheme rules. However, I want to clarify that this statement is incorrect. According to XXXX chargeback reason code XXXX, which falls under the 'Consumer Disputes ' category, the shorthand description is 'Merchandise/Service Not Received. ' This reason code explicitly states that the cardholder can dispute a transaction by claiming that they never received the merchandise or services they purchased. Therefore, Revolut 's assertion that they can not submit my chargeback based on card scheme rules is unfounded. ''

Consumer complaint narrative:
WaFd Bank removed the running balance feature from its online banking website without notifying customers, making it significantly harder to track transactions and verify account accuracy. A running balance is essential for customers to hold the bank accountable by ensuring every transaction is recorded and accounted for properly. Without it, customers are left guessing whether deposits, withdrawals, and charges are being processed correctly. 

When I contacted customer service on XX/XX/year>, a representative admitted the issue had been ongoing for months and blamed it on their XXXX. However, I had personally accessed my account within a week or so before XX/XX/XXXX and saw the running balance still functioning, contradicting their claim. 

WaFd executives later admitted the running balance had been displaying errors before they removed it, but instead of fixing those errors, they eliminated the feature entirely. Despite multiple emails to XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX, they admitted that no work has even begun on restoring it and refused to provide a timeline. Their excuses make no sensethis is a basic financial feature that any competent engineering team could reinstate within a day. 

WaFds failure to restore the running balance and their shifting explanations suggest either negligence or an intentional decision to limit customer access to financial data. This ongoing issue restricts customers from properly monitoring their accounts, makes it impossible to easily detect errors, and may violate CFPB consumer financial data rights.

Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am providing updated feedback regarding my prior complaint ( # XXXX ) against SoFi Bank XXXX 

Since filing the original complaint, I successfully escalated the underlying dispute with SoFi and ultimately won the disputed amount of {$2900.00}. However, this positive outcome only occurred after extensive delays, multiple incorrect denials, and failure by SoFi to properly investigate the facts in my case ( initially ).

Key Updates : SoFi initially denied my dispute improperly, causing severe financial hardship.

Only after I provided extensive documentation and filed repeated appeals did SoFi finally reverse their decision and credit my account on XX/XX/year>.

Failing to offer me a proper new account relationship despite ( their ) errors. 

Refusing to confirm in writing that the previous account is closed and ( secure ), posing ongoing financial and security risks. 

I remain concerned about : Potential violations of federal consumer protection laws. 

Negligent account management practices that risk exposing customers to fraud. 

( Retaliatory conduct following my original complaint. ) ( Still one Dispute unresolved all thanks to SOFI mishandling of intial disputes and miscommunication from their end ) Requested Action : I respectfully ask the CFPB to update my case file to reflect : That I won the dispute.

That significant mishandling occurred.

That SoFis systemic issues continue to cause harm.

I also request that the CFPB consider SoFis ongoing conduct as part of any future investigations into their practices. 

Thank you for your continued attention to this matter and for protecting consumers like myself.

BMO CASE : XXXX I am trying to appeal my incorrectly denied fraud case and I have been reaching out to XXXX XXXX for over a month with no response from the claims department. 

Please see below for a detailed account of everything that happened and will need to be thoroughly reviewed. I have been calling daily and still haven't heard back. 

On XXXX XXXX while leaving the XXXX XXXX my debit card was stolen out of my luggage by either the concierge at my hotel or XXXX. I was unaware that it was stolen as I was on a flight ( have proof of me being on a flight ) and could not have been making charges in a country I was no longer in. Upon landing, I received a fraud notification FROM BMO stating that XXXX charges were going to be processed ( others were denied for fraud automatically, have proof of this ) XXXX charge was for {$3000.00} and another for {$86.00} had been made to the same fraud name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( I have screenshots of the fraud changes email from BMO ). I promptly called BMO to turn my card off immediately and filed my fraud case once the XXXX fraud charges were posted to my account. When initially on the phone with the BMO agent I said I didn't know if my card was stolen or my account hacked again as I had just gotten off a plane and didn't have my luggage yet. When I got to my luggage and checked, the card was indeed stolen. 

It should also be noted, that the debit card HAD NEVER BEEN used before, these fraud charges were the first and only charges made on the card. Again, these were also initially correctly flagged as fraud by BMO. 

Once the charges were posted I immediately called and filed a fraud case. I did not hear back about my case so on XX/XX/year> I emailed XXXX XXXX to get an update after filing my case. While I did get an automatic response, I have yet to receive an email from an actual person with information about reopening my case. 

While checking my account, I noticed the fraud charge for {$86.00} had been refunded, but for some reason, the larger charge for {$3000.00} had been denied. This is incorrect, I can prove I was on a plane at this time and did not make either of these charges. To try and get help on XX/XX/year> Spoke with XXXX from the BMO resolution team- she never called me back to update me on my case after she said she was following up. 

On XX/XX/year> Follow-up email to Rege.processing to which I received no automatic response, nor a response from an actual person. 

As XXXX XXXX was not responding to my emails on XX/XX/year> I went into a physical branch ( XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX ) and spoke with the XXXX XXXX XXXX, He emailed Rege.processing on my behalf with all of my evidence to which he received no response and still hasn't to this day. 

On XX/XX/year> I followed up with the Branch Manager for an update. On this day he informed me my claim was denied and emailed me my claim denial and dispute case ( both attached ). It should be noted, I had NEVER received the denial prior to this day XX/XX/year>. XXXX, the branch manager said he did communicate this to BMO for my case. 

After finding out on XX/XX/year> I made a new call to BMO and spoke with XXXX with the resolutions team to try and get help. She has emailed Rege.processing on my behalf and opened a new XXXXase Call Reference # XXXX. 

On XX/XX/year> I sent a new email to XXXX XXXX for a response and looking to reopen my fraud case once again. 

Again, the fraud charge for {$86.00} was returned as it was correctly identified as fraud. I am asking BMO to please return the {$3000.00} fraud charge that was made by the same merchant at the same date/time to my account immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of XXXX, I contacted a company named XXXX XXXX XXXX to purchase snap on veneers through there online sales process. After agreeing to have veneers produced, I submitted two payments on two separate days totalling approximately {$1500.00}. The company had me in a cycle of creating impressions then rejecting my impressions. This went on continuously after which time I decided to discontinue process and request refund ; the company declined my request, citing Texas refund laws. However, after researching the Texas statute, this is what I came up with : Sec. 345.066. BUYER 'S RIGHT TO RESCIND CONTRACT. Until a retail seller complies with Section 345.065, a retail buyer who has not received delivery of the goods or services is entitled to : ( 1 ) rescind the contract ; ( 2 ) receive a refund of all payments made under or in contemplation of the contract ; After being denied a refund, I then notified my bank and filed a dispute in XXXX of XXXX. After some time, my bank decided in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX favor, thus ending my dispute claim against them. In accordance with the preceding law, I am entitled to a refund. I attempted to reopen dispute with my bank with new evidence but they declined to reopen. Please assist me with this matter as I am an unemployed XXXX XXXXXXXX veteran with limited income nowadays. Thank you. 

XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Short summary : Goldman Sachs ( Apple Card ) is charging me for an order that was cancelled, computer returned to Apple, and the purchase price completely refunded to the card from Apple. After many cycles of disputes and investigations ( Ive sent in full documentation ) by Goldman Sachs they insist that the merchant charges remain. My balance should be XXXX and I should owe them nothing. 

Here is the story from the beginning. 


On XX/XX/XXXX I ordered a XXXX XXXX XXXX with extra RAM. ( total cost was {$1000.00} ) At the time, I responded to the offer to apply for an Apple Card ( Goldman Sachs ) for that purchase and was approved. 


I received the new computer, but it soon become obvious that it was not charging for some reason, so I brought it to my nearby Apple Store to have it looked at.

The specialist at the Apple Store looked at my computer and said that it was XXXX and that it needed to be replaced. They said that Id have to arrange to ship it back t

o Apple myself because it was a custom order with extra RAM which they do not in stock in the stores. Well, went home and called Apple to ar
range the exchange of my computer.

I was able to ship it back, and Apple received my return but after that, something went wrong on Apples end, and I never got my replacement computer.

After several calls with Apple to try to get to the bottom of it, I finally got someone ( a supervisor or manager ) who said that they would just go ahead and completely cancel that order and then I could then go online and just purchase a new computer from scratch. 
I wound up not purchasing a new computer at that time and I soon cancelled my Apple Card. 

The ONLY thing I used the Apple Card for was to order that one laptop which was returned ( along with the gift card I never used ). Again, the order was cancelled and refunded to the card by Apple.

I have documents showing my order, showing that Apple received the return, and that the card was refund was being processed. In addition, I have invoices from apple showing that the entire cost of the computer, Apple Care, and the credit for my trade-in computer was completely refunded to my Apple Card.

Goldman Sachs has continually insisted that I owe them for this computer. I have filed more disputes than I can remember ( at least six ) and have spent more hours on the phone with them than I can possibly add up. I have sent them all the documentation that I have many times, yet they keep coming back at me saying that after investigation, there was no billing error, and the merchant charges will stay on my account. 
This has been going on since last XXXX ( it is now XX/XX/XXXX ). The last time I spoke to anyone at Goldman Sachs I was bounced around on conference calls between Apple and Goldman Sachs for three hours ( Apple confirming the accuracy of my claim ) only to be hung up on by someone at Goldman Sachs who told me that there was nothing that could be done. 

Bottom line is that in the end I never bought anything with my Apple Card and there should be XXXX balance on it. 

There is no other way I can try to remedy this with Goldman Sachs. I keep filing disputes and sending in the proof of my claim and they just keep coming back at me saying that I am wrong and that I owe them for this computer. What else can I do? 

Please help me end this nightmare with Goldman Sachs.

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Misleading Credit Card Promotion by Chase in Partnership with XXXX Description of the issue : I recently encountered a promotional offer for the XXXX XXXX XXXX  credit card by Chase while attempting to book a hotel stay through XXXX website. The promotion stated that I would receive up to {$300.00} in statement credits for XXXX purchases made with the card. The way the offer was presented clearly implied that the credit could be applied toward the stay I was booking. Based on this understanding, I applied for the card and was approved. 

However, after further review, I discovered that the {$300.00} statement credit is only applicable to purchases made after the card is received, which takes 710 business days to arrive. This timeframe made it impossible to use the credit for my immediate reservation. The promotion was misleading and did not disclose this critical limitation upfront, leading me to believe it could be applied immediately. 

As a result, I am now responsible for an annual fee on a credit card I would not have applied for had the terms been properly disclosed. Additionally, closing the card to avoid the fee would negatively impact my credit score. I believe this promotion was deceptive and misrepresented the actual terms of the offer.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, California XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX SS # : XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute and address several violations of consumer protection laws that have significantly impacted my financial well-being. The purpose of this letter is to request your intervention and assistance in resolving the matters detailed below. 

I have recently discovered numerous discrepancies on my credit report that involve several creditors. These discrepancies encompass unauthorized credit inquiries, inaccurate account information, and misleading personal data. Through thorough investigation and examination of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), it is evident that my rights have been breached in multiple instances. 

Unauthorized Inquiries : On numerous occasions, I found unauthorized credit inquiries made without my explicit consent. These actions have compromised my personal information and have negatively affected my credit score. These actions directly violate FCRA 604, 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which outlines the permissible purposes for conducting consumer reports. I have provided specific instances and details of these inquiries below : XXXX XXXX : Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Inaccurate Account Information : Moreover, I have encountered inaccurate account information that includes questionable account names and numbers, as well as incorrect payment history reporting. These inaccuracies have substantially affected my creditworthiness and my ability to access fair financial opportunities. The following accounts stand out as examples of these inaccuracies : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name and Number are Questionable XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Inaccurate Payment History Reporting XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name and Number are Questionable XXXX  XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Account Names and Numbers are Questionable XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name and Number are Questionable XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Unrecognized Business Account Inaccurate Personal Information : Additionally, my personal information, including current and previous addresses, has been inaccurately reported, further causing confusion and potential identity concerns : Incorrect Current Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX Incorrect Previous Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX These discrepancies and violations have left me in a state of immense distress. The consequences of these inaccuracies have affected my ability to secure loans, purchase a home, and even find employment opportunities. The emotional toll this has taken on my life is immeasurable. 

I implore the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to take immediate action to ensure that these violations are rectified. I request that you enforce my legal rights as a consumer and facilitate the removal of the unauthorized inquiries and unverified account information from my credit report. These issues are not only a violation of my rights but have caused immeasurable damage to my personal and financial well-being. 

I kindly ask that you thoroughly investigate the violations I have outlined above and take the necessary steps to ensure that these discrepancies are corrected and that justice is served. I am willing to provide any additional documentation or information that you may require to resolve these matters promptly.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Ive been a Chase Sapphire customer for about 2 years now. 

I enrolled in a payment plan by Chase for an Amazon purchase worth {$2800.00} on XXXX XX/XX/2022. The payment was to be made in 18 installments over the course of 18 months.

I was paying off this purchase on schedule and on time till 4 months which amounts to {$630.00}. 

4 months later, I got a refund from United Airlines for some flights I booked through this credit card worth {$1300.00} and this is where the ordeal began. 

Chase claims that any credit/refund which comes into the card, that amount automatically goes towards the payment plan so in this case the credit from United Airlines got applied to the Chase payment plan. 

So in this case, {$2800.00} - {$630.00} ( the payments I made for 4 months ) = {$2200.00}. 

Then apply the credit from United Airlines {$2200.00} - {$1300.00} = ~ {$850.00}. ( Credit from United Airlines ) I continued to make payments every month for the payment plan unbeknownst of the fact that Chase had decided to apply the flight credit automatically to the payment plan. 

Firstly, the claim from Chase that credits are rolled over into your payment plan are bogus. There is no way the system is designed to roll over money into a plan like that unless I explicitly make a payment into the plan on a monthly basis or I decide to pay it off. 

Due to this, I was getting charged interest on my United airlines transactions as their system was considering these transactions as outstanding balances. 

I called Chase after noticing this and they agreed this was a glitch in their system and this shouldnt have happened. I was able to get these interest charges reversed for a total of 4 times. But after 4 months this STILL kept happening and due to circumstances I wasnt able to get on a call with their useless customer service and be kept on hold for long periods of time. 

Due to this I kept getting charged interest for a total of 14-15 months since I got the United refund which amounts to {$190.00} worth of interest. 

We escalated to the Chase Executive Office to get this resolved but no one at Chase seems to care and acknowledge that this was an error on their part and they keep passing this off as something which is how it's supposed to work. Weve also filed a XXXX complaint and that has gone in vain. 

This case is being handled by XXXX from the executive team and his number is XXXX extension XXXX. The customer service has been abysmal with zero accountability and all my concerns have been ignored.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), I am writing to file a renewed complaint concerning my ongoing dispute with Wells Fargo Bank. I recently engaged in another conversation with them, lasting for approximately 50 minutes. In this call, Wells Fargo informed me that they have initiated the processing of four disputed transactions, providing the following claim IDs : XXXX XXXX XXXX While this may appear to be a step forward, a significant concern remains unresolved. When I inquired whether I would be required to make payments for these pending claims in the next billing cycle, Wells Fargos response was far from satisfactory. Instead of providing a clear answer, they transferred me between multiple departments, leaving me without a resolution. Ultimately, I was informed that these claims are still pending due to allegedly missing documentation. 

I must emphasize that I have diligently followed Wells Fargos prescribed process, reporting each claim over the phone and promptly supplying all requested information based on their inquiries. Despite my full cooperation, they continue to delay and avoid processing these claims. Their assertion that I havent provided necessary information is perplexing, considering that I possess the claim IDs as evidence. 

This situation strongly suggests that Wells Fargo is intentionally delaying resolution, allowing these claims to linger indefinitely. It is evident that their actions do not align with their stated commitment to promptly and transparently resolving disputes. The banks inability to address these claims raises serious concerns about their practices and their dedication to customer service. The potential for them to profit from unresolved claims, especially when they possess the requisite information, is both disheartening and unjust. 

In light of this, I implore the relevant authorities to intervene and oversee Wells Fargos activities. The banks behavior warrants a comprehensive investigation and appropriate measures to ensure they adhere to ethical practices and treat their customers with the respect they deserve. 

I sincerely appreciate your attention to this matter and your role in safeguarding consumers rights. 

Sincerely, XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
JP Morgan Chase Bank NA submitted a 1099-C to the IRS in XXXX but they never attempted to collect the debt from me or notify me from when it was charged off in XXXX. This account was charged off in XXXX when I was divorcing my ex husband and we were using XXXX XXXX to handle and settle and make payments on our accounts. According to Florida Law the statue of limitations were up in 5 years which was XXXX. This was illegal activity from JP Morgan and not only that, there was never any attempt to collect the debt from me. They never attempted to collect, and all this time later is a violation of Florida collection laws. There was NO ACTIVITY TO COLLECT in 7 years. 

The IRS form XXXX statute of limitations sets the timeframe during which the IRS can assess additional taxes or the taxpayer can amend returns related to canceled debt income. Here are some key points : Typically, this statute extends for XXXX years from the due date of the tax return with reported canceled debt income1.

You should receive Form 1099-C by XXXX XXXX the year after the debt was canceled or forgiven2. 
Generally, there is no statute of limitations on a 1099-C, but the creditor does have to send you the form promptly so that you can include it on your tax returns3. 
Statutes of limitations vary by state and by type of debt, but creditors are not required to file a 1099-C at that time since they can continue to try to collect on debt indefinitely4.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX of XXXX, I had many of financial accounts compromised via my phone, one of which was my PayPal account. My PayPal account was accessed by someone other than myself, a debit card account opened, and {$1900.00} was spent at various stores that morning. The thief/fraudster also tried to transfer money to other individuals via PayPal. In all, {$4800.00} ( see account statement attached ) was transferred from my XXXX Checking account to PayPal to cover the fraudulent transactions. I reported the money transfers and debit transactions to PayPal as fraudulent and they opened an investigation. PayPal reversed the money transfers but found the debit transactions as NOT fraudulent. They said I was responsible for the debit transactions totaling {$1900.00} as they were " consistent with my spending behavior ''. I also reported all the activity to XXXX as fraudulent as that is where the funds originated from that were spent with the newly opened PayPal debit card. I filed a police report with the city of XXXX XXXX, as that is where the theft occurred, and filed an ID theft report with the FTC. XXXX recognized this activity as fraudulent ( the {$4800.00} transferred from XXXX to Paypal ) and withdrew the money from PayPal resulting in a negative {$1900.00} balance in my PayPal account. I spoke with many PayPal customer service agents who agreed that the activity looked appeared fraudulent, and that I should definitely appeal the findings. I did appeal, but PayPal refused to formally recognize the debit transactions as fraud. The amount has now been placed with internal collections and I can no longer appeal the decision as I have already done so. I strongly believe if PayPal were to look at this closer that the activity would most certainly appear as fraud as within a few hours of time, a new debit card was opened on my account and thousands of dollars spent in various ways from my PayPal account. Also, if they could observe video footage of the stores in which this new PayPal debit card was used, they would see that I did NOT enter any of them at the time of the purchases ( or ever ). I have been a PayPal customer for over 15 years and never have spent that kind of money out of my account within such a short amount of time. It is definitely not consistent with my usual activity. How can they recognize the money transfers as fraudulent, but the debit transactions as not? I have included copies of my police report, ID theft report, PayPal receipts/transactions related to this, etc. I would be happy to provide official documentation of XXXX 's fraud claim findings, if necessary. Thanks.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Fifth Third Bank has now TWICE allowed their employees to go into my account and change my address. They were NOT authorized to do so. Both times they removed my unit number from my address. This caused my initial credit card to be sent who knows where. After a lengthy phone call including an escalation, we were able to resolve this. I was told that AFTER they had already approved me, a manual verifier went into my application and updated my address likely via copy/paste, and forgot my unit number. I thought this would be the last issue. 

This second time happened XX/XX/2023 XXXX XXXX. I was able to find out from their representative that one of their branch employees went into my account to make this change. They deleted my unit number from my account yet again. I went in and manually updated it back to normal. The customer service representative was unable to state which branch did this and instead advised I go to " the nearest branch '' to resolve this violation of my account via unauthorized use. This is my 2nd complaint against Fifth Third Bank, which is displaying gross negligence in privacy practices. How are unauthorized employees allowed to go into peoples accounts? Does 53 allow them to borrow money too? It's unacceptable.

Furthermore, this unauthorized security breach which is clearly the norm, can cause consumers to miss payments as we need a bill to know when to pay. Are you purposely doing this to collect late fees?
