Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Goldman Sachs Bank USA XXXX Unlawful Account Restriction Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am submitting a formal complaint against Goldman Sachs Bank USA, the issuer of my XXXX XXXX account and Apple Card, for what I believe is a violation of consumer banking rights and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau protections. 

On XX/XX/year>, the bank restricted access to my XXXX XXXX account ( containing {$15000.00} ) and my Apple Card, following a verification call confirming a routine transfer. 
Despite no evidence of fraud or unauthorized activity, the accounts were locked and I was told I would need to wait up to XXXX XXXX business days for an internal review, without any clear explanation or recourse. I called them XXXX more times trying to get someone to a person that can address this without further delay. Each agent told me different stories, from only the back office can release the accounts, they must investigate it which takes XXXX days, the accounts are closed. This was a nightmare and put me in a deep level of emotional and mental stress. 

This incident reflects potential : - Negligence in account handling. 
- Violation of the bank 's own deposit agreement. 
- Unlawful restriction of consumer funds without justifiable cause or notice. 

On XX/XX/year>, just before XXXXXXXX XXXX, I received a call from the bank stating that the restriction had been lifted and for security reasons can not tell me the reason why my accounts were placed on restriction. I have this call recorded and can give it to you. I informed the agent I was recording. This confirms that the bank wrongfully restricted access to my funds for over XXXXXXXX XXXX  which I am sure if I didnt end up calling them the XXXX times I did, they would have taken their XXXX days. When I asked for the reason, none was provided. I explained how harmful this could have been to someone with no other resources-if I had needed money for emergency medication or formula for a child, I would have had no access to it. I expressed to the representative that while I understand necessary fraud holds, this was not the case here. There was no fraud, no suspicious activity, and the bank had verified that all was in order. This restriction should never have occurred and represents a gross operational failure. After multiple escalations and a detailed phone call transcript ( available upon request ), I was informed by a supervisor that they are not able to advise any further information. This is just unacceptable business practices.

I do not think it is FAIR in any way to have Capital One lower my credit limit because I am RESPONSIBLE with my use of their credit card. Consumer complaint narrative:
I was defrauded into sending a XXXX payment through Bank of America to an individual posing as a seller of a high-end projector with a claimed value of over {$9000.00}. The device I received was a counterfeit product worth less than {$100.00}, and this fraud is now documented in an official police report ( Report # XXXX, filed with the XXXX, GA Police Department ) . 
I provided Bank of America with this police report, photographs of the counterfeit item, and details identifying the scammer, XXXX XXXX XXXX, who also holds an account with Bank of America. His name is tied to the LLC attached to the account that received my payment, and he has a known criminal history for similar offenses.

I also informed BOFA that I have a recording of my call with their team, during which this denial was confirmed despite overwhelming evidence of fraud. 
I am requesting that this complaint be reviewed by CFPB and that Bank of America re-examine this as a fraud case involving criminal misrepresentation and counterfeit goods, and issue a full refund for the amount I was scammed.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered that my Discover credit card account had been closed due to alleged inactivity. 

Between XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, I actively managed my Discover credit card account with consistent payments and responsible financial behavior. On XX/XX/XXXX, I made a substantial internet payment of {$3000.00}, reflecting my commitment to maintaining the account in good standing. 

This payment, along with other transactions, such as a {$93.00} payment on XX/XX/XXXX, and multiple smaller payments throughout the preceding months, underscores my dedication to fulfilling all financial obligations. 

Additionally, various interest charges were addressed, further demonstrating responsible account management. These actions collectively contributed to a total payments and credits amount of - {$3300.00} during that period. This concerted effort to keep my account current contradicts the rationale for closure based on inactivity or delinquency. 

Reopening of the account was denied by supervisors on XX/XX/XXXX and the Executive Offices contact information was provided that same day. A response from the Executive Offices was initially provided by XXXX via Email on XX/XX/XXXX. A phone call occurred on XX/XX/XXXX with XXXX, stating Discover 's investigation was not ruled in my favor and there was no further course of resolution, other than arbitration. 

Concerned about this unexpected closure, I initiated a dispute with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, aiming to clarify any discrepancies related to the closure reasons provided by Discover. 

Upon investigating my dispute, XXXX highlighted several critical findings that support the reopening of my account : 1. Inactivity : Despite Discovers policy of closing accounts after seven months of inactivity, XXXX has verified that transactions occurred within the past year. This evidence directly contradicts the closure based on inactivity. According to XXXX 's standards, any account activity within a year indicates engagement and functionality, challenging Discover 's basis for closure. 

2. Credit Utilization : XXXX identified discrepancies in the reporting of my available credit, showing an impact on utilization ratios. Before the account closure, my credit utilization was below 40 % ( Available credit +60 % ), a misrepresented factor that undermines any justification for closure related to credit limits. 

3. Delinquency : XXXX confirmed that no recent delinquencies were present on my account, with all payments made punctually. The only existing delinquency predates my approval with Discover, which negates non-compliance as a reason for closure. 
XXXX 's ongoing investigation, initiated on [ dispute initiation date ], consistently refutes Discovers closure rationale. 

Additionally, there are potential errors and cardholder agreement violations on Discover 's part : - Notification Requirement : The " Changes to Your Agreement '' section mandates prior notification for significant account status changes, including closures. However, I was not sufficiently notified, depriving me of the chance to rectify the purported inactivity. 

- Communication Consistency : As per the " Our Communications with You '' section, timely updates are crucial. The absence of adequate notification regarding inactivity raises further concerns, highlighted by XXXX findings. 

- Account Management through Payments : The " Paying Interest '' section implies ongoing account activity through substantial payments. My significant payment in XX/XX/XXXX emphasizes responsible management, contradicting any claimed stagnation. 

Given these developments and potential agreement violations, I respectfully request a reassessment of my account closure. I propose an account reinstatement that reflects accurate historical activity and aligns with industry standards. 

Thank you for addressing this matter.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of Texas has NO interaction with credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX or TRANSUNION ) which includes reporting information regarding bankruptcy cases or verifying the accuracy of information regarding bankruptcy cases held by these credit bureaus. The Federal Bankruptcy Court does not supply information to credit agencies ( XXXX, XXXX or TRANSUNION ) or to third parties like XXXX who is responsible for reporting this bankruptcy. 

The credit reports supplied by XXXX, XXXX AND TRANSUNION reflects a debt being reported by the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of Texas which is untrue. This bankruptcy was reported by XXXX and needs to be deleted immediately because all debts including bankruptcy can only be verified by the originator or it must be deleted. Attorneys and other case participants use these third-party services to collect and organize case filings in matters in which they are involved. It is this electronic filing which gives third parties like XXXX XXXX access to restricted or sealed case information and documents, typically in violation of court order. 

XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), NO consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law.

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. XXXX, XXXX and TRANSUNION are presenting this information as if it were supplied and reported by the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of Texas.

15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX, XXXX and TRANSUNION are not maintaining reasonable procedures. 

Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' And I am opting out of their reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024 a fraudulent purchase was made on my Chase credit card from XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$1200.00}. I did not notice this purchase until XX/XX/2024 when I received an email from Chase on XX/XX/2024 alerting me of a suspect transaction made on my Chase credit card in the amount of {$1200.00}, also from XXXX XXXX. Fortunately, this transaction was declined and I confirmed that I did not make the purchase. At that point, I checked my account via the Chase mobile app and noticed the purchase from XXXX XXXXy on XX/XX/2024 for {$1200.00}. I did not make this purchase and immediately reported it as fraud on the Chase mobile app and followed up with a phone call to Chase verifying the purchase as fraud. 
On XX/XX/2024 I received a letter in my Chase account that they had completed their review of unauthorized transactions on my account. The letter stated that I was responsible for paying for the purchase made on XX/XX/2024 from XXXX XXXX in amount of {$1200.00}. The reason stated " Merchandise was billed to or chipped to your address ''. I do not know how my information was stolen but I absolutely did not make this purchase and there was no merchandise shipped to my address. I do not know how Chase came to this conclusion given that this was 1 of 2 fraudulent purchases attempted with my card ( the second one being the {$1200.00} transaction that was appropriately flagged and declined ). I suspect that when I bought gas on XX/XX/2024 in XXXX, WA my information was stolen from the card reader. 
I am extremely upset by this experience as I did not buy anything from XXXX XXXX and I can not afford to pay for this large transaction. This needs to be investigated further and I would like to be refunded immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Complaint Regarding Excessive Foreign Transaction Fees on Capital XXXX XXXX Checking Account Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a complaint against Capital XXXX regarding excessive foreign transaction fees being charged on my XXXX checking account. 
Account Information : * Account Name : XXXX XXXX * Account Type : XXXX Checking Summary of Complaint : I opened a Capital XXXX XXXX checking account in [ XX/XX/XXXX under the understanding that there were no foreign transaction fees associated with the account. Capital XXXXXXXX XXXX website and account materials advertise that XXXX checking accounts allow for debit card use abroad without additional fees as follows : For XXXX products ( XXXX Checking, Money, etc. ) there are no additional fees when you use your debit card abroad ( any transaction made in a foreign currency or that XXXX classifies as a cross-border transaction ). 

However, since moving to XXXX in XXXX [ temporary due to my son studies ], I have been charged foreign transaction fees on all my withdrawals from ATMs. These fees have resulted in a significant difference between the amount withdrawn in Euros ( ) and the amount debited from my account in US Dollars ( $ ). 

Examples of Discrepancies : * XX/XX/XXXX Withdrawal : I withdrew XXXX from a XXXX ATM. However, my account was debited {$650.00}. At the prevailing exchange rate of XXXX to {$1.00} USD, the withdrawal should have only cost approximately {$500.00} USD ( XXXX x XXXX ). This translates to adiscrepancy of {$140.00} USD. 
* * XX/XX/XXXX Withdrawal : Today, I withdrew XXXX from a XXXX ATM. My account was debited {$680.00}. At the current exchange rate of XXXX to {$1.00} USD, the withdrawal should have cost approximately {$550.00} USD ( XXXX x XXXX ). This translates to adiscrepancy of {$120.00} USD. 

On the other hand, this situation have been. Happening Sice XX/XX/XXXX to the present. 
* Actions Taken : I have contacted Capital XXXX customer service on [ Number ] occasions to inquire about these fees. They have not been able to provide a clear explanation or offer any reimbursement for the excessive charges. I specifically mentioned the information on Capital XXXX 's website regarding no foreign transaction fees for XXXX accounts, but this information was not acknowledged by customer service representatives. 

Attached Documentation : I have attached foto screen taken today XX/XX/XXXX for your reference : * The Bank statements are proof, showing the foreign transaction fees and the corresponding debits in USD to my account. If it is necessary I can requests my bank statements, since XXXX, but sending an Auditor to the bank you can verify same. 

Request for Relief : I request that the CFPB investigate these charges and determine if they violate any consumer protection laws. Specifically, I request that Capital XXXX be required to : * Explain the basis for these foreign transaction fees, considering the advertised benefit of " no foreign transaction fees '' for XXXX checking accounts. 
* Reimburse me for all foreign transaction fees that have been intentionally charged to my account since XXXX, including the discrepancies highlighted in the examples above. 
* Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to your response and a resolution to this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX : FTC/XXXX/FCC

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023, I had a tech from XXXX XXXX XXXX come to my home to provide regular maintenance on XXXX of my XXXX ACs. He said that because it was so old they could not properly service it and began trying to sell me a new unit. Its for an area of a XXXX level house under renovation, so we didnt need it, and as long as the unit still worked, we were fine and would just wait until we were ready for the renovations which would not occur for at least a year. He made the deal sound really good but because I know nothing about where it needed to be moved and electrical stuff, my husband came home from work, and XXXX then proceeded to sell us both on a unit, with these requirements specified by us : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Larger capacity AC than what we had in order to provide for the future remodel, which is the entirety of our basement. The old XXXX was XXXX seer and is still sitting outside of our house. 
A permit had to be filed so I could use it on my taxes and the rebate of 30 %. 
I needed the XXXX future rework promise in writing. 
I wanted the plans for where the new unit would be moved as it was complicated and required extensive wiring and changed locations. I wanted upfront pricing of any extra costs associated to be specified before signing the final sales contract. 
I wanted the 10 % discount promised with the Maintenance Program I had signed up with XXXX XXXX, which is why they were at my home in the first place. 

The deal XXXX XXXX presented seemed great, we told him it was contingent on financing, because we didnt actually need a new AC yet, and were not going to pay out of pocket for XXXX a year early. He told us he would need to pull our credit for specifics. I asked what bank. He said XXXX. I laughed because I just got a card from them and told my husband to do the pre approval so I wouldnt get confused with XXXX cards in the same name. XXXX XXXX asked us questions and filled out the information on his XXXX with us both present. My husband signed once via e-sign from XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX then went to his car to talk to his manager about the deal and came back and told my husband that he was denied. I had walked upstairs at this point assuming no issues. My husband later called/texted me and said they denied him. He has amazing credit, so I noted that something was very wrong and offered to do the credit myself, while I tried to figure out why my husband with near perfect credit was denied. 

XXXX XXXX then went to his car and came back and said the social security number he entered was wrong. We were suddenly approved for everything. We told him it was no rush and asked that he have those details to us by the following week. 
XXXX XXXX is just an HVAC tech, so this was understandable it would take time to develop the plans required and that a salesman was still needed for the contract and notary as listed on the estimate I signed. We were told it was only a credit application and was needed to confirm rates and terms and before they could proceed with the plans. No loan agreement was ever signed. No sales contract was ever signed. 

We received a Notice of Adverse Action in the mail around XX/XX/2023, I immediately called the number on the form and was told that it was XXXX XXXX XXXX. They did not have any record of me or my husband. My husband received a call from someone later in the day and was told a loan had been made. We immediately denied this. No one has ever signed loan documents or agreed to even a sales contract and I have gotten nowhere with XXXX XXXX XXXX or this bank that has a fraudulent loan pending. No copies of the estimate or the pre-approval was ever provided to us. 

The estimate presented to me did not have the discount, nor details of the specific XXXX unit, nor the specifics of the move and wiring required, but included a price of {$12000.00} with a notary fee of {$50.00}. XXXX XXXX told me that he could not adjust it, but it would proper in the contract that we would sign at a later date when they made the plans. I e-signed on an XXXX presented by XXXX XXXX once. He told me he would have to get with his team because it was beyond his scope. He was just a XXXX XXXX called to our home for regular maintenance. 

After receiving the attached letter in the mail on or around XX/XX/2023, I called the number on the front of the form and was notified that a loan application had been made in my husbands name. I called XXXX XXXX and had my husband call the number again that night which was when we learned there was a pending loan application on file for {$14000.00}, nearly {$2000.00} more than agreed upon in the estimate I e-signed for on XX/XX/2023, with a bunch of incorrect information including income and mortgage payment, never completed or authorized by my husband, and using our house as collateral, dated XX/XX/2023. Our house is in a trust and I am part owner. I did not and do not authorize any transaction using it as collateral now or ever. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my concerns regarding Zelles operations, particularly in light of the recent lawsuit filed by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). As a user of the platform, I am troubled by the allegations that Zelle has not adequately protected consumers from fraud and unauthorized transactions. 

The safety and reliability of a financial service are paramount, and the allegations of Zelle failing to address widespread fraudulent activity raise serious doubts about the platforms commitment to its users. Transparency, swift dispute resolution, and effective consumer protections are essential for maintaining trust, and I feel Zelle has fallen short in these areas. 

Unfortunately, I fell victim to fraudulent activity while using Zelle, and despite reaching out to the team for assistance, I received little to no meaningful help in recovering my funds. 

I urge them to take immediate and concrete steps to enhance consumer protection, improve fraud prevention measures, and communicate these improvements transparently. I want to feel confident that my financial transactions are secure and that Zelle prioritizes customer safety and trust above all else.

This was shocking, especially as I had been a preferred customer for over 40 years! It took me until XX/XX/XXXX to recover my funds. I was in XXXX helping my son start a new business, so I had to fly back to XXXX to sign a Declaration of Loss. As a result of this situation, I missed my XXXX card payment, my Social Security checks were not deposited, and I experienced many other inconveniences, including having no access to my funds while in XXXX. 

Now I have no access to my account records, and my credit is ruined. I tried to open an account at three different banks and was rejected. Finally, I found a bank that would allow me to open accounts : XXXX XXXX  in XXXX. 

Here are my notes during XX/XX/XXXX : US Bank notes XX/XX/XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX, I found out that my debit card was refused, so I contacted the bank and was routed to a phone where I left a message, but it was not returned I tried again on XX/XX/XXXX and again received no return call I called again on XX/XX/XXXX and finally one of their representatives was able to figure out what had happened but not why. The back office would not tell her why the accounts were closed and that they have the right to close customer accounts for no reason. 
From US BANK Support : In XX/XX/XXXX The wire transfer of {$50000.00} was deemed not in the customers best interest Why?? I had talked with the wire transfer department and had been approved for the transfer and the money did transfer. 
My mailing address was set to an address in XXXX, an old address which I had not updated, my mistake. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, they had closed all of my accounts without any notice to me. 
They then proceeded to write cashiers checks for all of my accounts and mailed them out to the old XXXX address Over {$110000.00} in the accounts The checks have my name on them and you should need an ID to catch them The wire transfer somehow triggered the bank to close all of my accounts and mail cashiers checks to the wrong address I was not notified by email text message nor phone call The support person said I should wait 15 business days and then cancel the cashiers checks and at that time I should be able to get my money back after I go through another procedure where I get a form and have to formally request my money. At that time, it will probably take one to three weeks to get the form to me by mail and another one to three weeks to return it with my signature as I was in XXXX at the time. 
This Support person also said that I will not be able to open another account at US BANK ever again. Why is that? I have done nothing wrong. 
The support rep was not able to explain why this occurred only that it had occurred and she apologized profusely for it I am hoping that the address they sent it to was to XXXX, XXXX  business partner so I can get the checks back So now I have no money and my XXXX payment will bounce and my social security direct deposit will fail. so I called XXXX and let them know the situation and XXXX  seemed OK with it, but I dont know if Ill be charged interest or penalty or whatever or damage my credit rating. I was charged {$45.00} in interest. I had never missed a payment since XXXX when I opened the account.

Department which Closed the accounts XXXX XXXX left another message, no return call Call again XX/XX/XXXX on hold now Im told that they have not started the cancellation and that its in a queue and then will take up to 5 days to execute before they will issue new checks. 
I was referred to the fraud department She promised the checks would arrive at our residence in XXXX by XX/XX/XXXX, and I should call them on the XXXX if we dont receive it.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, my Chime account was hacked, and I was scammed out of {$970.00}. I immediately reported this issue to Chime and even provided a police report to support my claim. Despite this, Chime denied my claim and refused to take action to recover my stolen funds. 

Following this, I contacted Chime multiple times to address the situation. They issued two conflicting statements regarding the matter but still failed to resolve it. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, Chime notified me of unauthorized attempts to use my card. I replied that I had not authorized these transactions. However, when I later reviewed my account activity, I noticed multiple unauthorized withdrawals totaling the remaining {$1500.00}. I immediately reported these transactions, but within one day, Chime denied my claims again without conducting a proper investigation. 

I submitted a written statement as requested by Chime. However, before I even received my new card, there was another unauthorized attempt to use it. When I called Chime, they assured me that they would resolve the issue, but as of XX/XX/XXXX, I have received no resolution or reimbursement. 

In total, I have lost {$2500.00} due to a combination of the initial scam and subsequent unauthorized transactions. Chime has failed to adequately investigate or address this matter, leaving me without the funds stolen from my account.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal complaint regarding PayPals unfair and deceptive business practices, specifically concerning its arbitrary account limitations, failure to provide clear reasoning, and illegal withholding of my funds totaling {$18000.00} USD for XXXX days. Despite providing all requested documents, service agreements, business plans, banking, letters of explanation, vendor contracts, answered questions on fulfillment times, cancellation policies, cancellation insurance, brochures, website, social, verified guest transactions, and repeated attempts to resolve this matter through XXXX customer service channels, I have received vague, automated responses and no meaningful explanation as to why my account was permanently limited. 
Background & XXXX  Unjust Actions I operate a legitimate small, family-owned business, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX an event venue in Mississippi, providing an event space for weddings and other special occasions. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX opened for business in XXXX of XXXX and began accepting payments via PayPal for guest bookings in XX/XX/XXXX. 
As our business grew, we expanded our advertising and marketing efforts, including partnering with platforms like XXXX ( XXXX  XXXX + XXXX ), which increased visibility and led to a natural rise in transaction activity. 
Recognizing the influx of payments as a sign of business growth, we proactively complied with XXXX verification requests, submitting weeks worth of documentation confirming transaction details, client agreements, and proof of service fulfillment. 
On the evening of XX/XX/XXXX, immediately after complying with instructions from a PayPal representative to have XXXX of our guests check their emails to approve their transactions with XXXX XXXX XXXX and after both approvals were complete, we received an email notification that our account was permanently closed and funds still withheld for 180 days. 
The customer service process has been opaque, lacking human oversight, as responses are largely automated rejections without an avenue for appeal or resolution. 
It is nearly impossible to reach a live representative. The process is frustratingly circularautomated responses direct me to the website, which then directs me back to automated responses, and a beta chat help bot that appears at random and offers nothing but automated selections and responses. 
PayPal automates misleading & contradictory documentation requests. I was required to submit proof of inventory, which is irrelevant to my business as I do not sell physical goods and am categorized under the business type for Hotel/Reservations. PayPal rejected the documentation I provided without an option to explain my business model. PayPal refuses to acknowledge the nature of my business and continues to demand irrelevant documents. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX of Similar Complaints and continued enforcement of arbitrary limitations without due process suggests a pattern of systemic abuse rather than individual risk assessment. 
XXXX Violations & Grounds for Complaint XXXX. Unfair & Deceptive Trade Practices CFPB & XXXX XXXX Protection Laws a. XXXX failure to provide clear, non-automated explanations violates 12 U.S. Code 5531 ( Prohibiting Unfair, Deceptive, or Abusive Acts or Practices - UDAAP ). 
b. Mississippis Unfair and Deceptive Trade Practices Act ( XXXX ) prohibits businesses from engaging in deceptive, fraudulent, or unfair practices in commerce. PayPal 's vague responses, lack of transparency, and prolonged withholding of my funds without clear justification constitute unfair practices. 
XXXX. Violation of the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) & Regulation E a. The EFTA ( 15 U.S.C. 1693 ) and Regulation E ( 12 CFR Part 1005 ) prohibit financial institutions from improperly restricting access to consumer funds. PayPal, acting as a financial service provider, has violated this by holding my money for XXXX  days without due process or recourse.

XXXX. Violation of Mississippi XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Mississippi XXXX protects consumers from unjust withholding of funds by financial institutions. The Mississippi XXXX  XXXX XXXX  and XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) has jurisdiction over businesses engaging in financial transactions within the state. XXXX prolonged hold on my funds without reasonable justification should be investigated. 
XXXX. Lack of Due Process & Discriminatory Practices a. PayPal has denied me any opportunity to appeal or provide further documentation relevant to my business model. The use of automated decision-making tools, instead of human review, raises concerns of arbitrary enforcement and potential discrimination against small business owners.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Bank of America Claims Resolution XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Claim Number : XXXX In reference to your response to the BofA letter dated XX/XX/XXXX regarding Claim number : XXXX in the amount of {$470.00} on my business account ending in XXXX, they are factually incorrect in denying this claim as BofA not being notified within 60 days. This error originated under Claim number : XXXX dated XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$3400.00} and included reimbursement for several fraudulent charges against my business credit card now ending in XXXX ( the previous card was cancelled ). These charges included XXXX {$880.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX ) ; XXXX XXXX {$450.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX ) ; XXXX XXXX {$450.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and XXXX {$800.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX ). BofA provided a temporary credit in the amount of {$2500.00} of which XXXX was attributable to XXXX. XXXX subsequently reimbursed BofA {$59.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and XXXX {$260.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX ) for which I have a letter form BofA dated XX/XX/XXXX. BofA then subsequently charged {$470.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and {$320.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX ) to my account stating that these accounted for duplicate credits. This is where the error originated as the {$470.00} was never reimbursed by XXXX and therefore is not a duplicate credit. I requested a letter from BofA showing where the merchant ( XXXX ) credited BofA and never received it. 

I notified BofA several times concerning this accounting error. I have spent over 4.5 hours detailing this error in several calls to the BofA. I spoke with XXXX in TN on XX/XX/XXXX for over 1 hour who assured me that this error would be corrected. I spoke with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX for over 1 hour who escalated to claims to get it resolved. I spoke with XXXX, XXXX and XXXX from TX for several hours with XXXX assuring me once again that this would be resolved. I received a call back from XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX assuring that this error would be resolved and to await my next bank statement to see the correction as we couldnt speak with anyone in Claims as they dont take calls from customers. After reviewing my XXXX statement and noting that the error hadnt been corrected, I then called and spoke with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX who recommended submitting a new claim in hopes of finally resolving this issue which is represented by the subject claim which BofA is now denying as over 60 days beyond when the error occurred. 

To date this issue has not been resolved with BofA which is now refusing to recognize my claim for the {$470.00} for which they are the culprit. BofA is expecting me to pay the {$470.00} as it reflects in my business credit card balance.

Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX Card number ending : XXXX XXXX XXXX I applied for a Chase credit card based on their advertised offer of 0 % APR for 15 months and a 3 % balance transfer fee. I was approved for a credit limit of {$11000.00}, which was great, but after approval, I found out that I wasnt given the 0 % APR for 15 months or the balance transfer offer as promised. This has left me frustrated, as I applied for the card expecting the advertised benefits. 

Dates : Applied for the card and was approved on XX/XX/year>. 

Credit limit approved : {$11000.00}. 

Im requesting that Chase honor the original terms that were advertised at the time of my application.

Sub-issue: Account opened without my consent or knowledge
Consumer complaint narrative: To whom it concerns, Bank of America opened a checking account and savings account in my name without my consent back in XXXX of XXXX. Account ending in XXXX and XXXX. During this time, Bank of America, Allowed someone to register online banking, and to apply for the accounts. I believe this was conducted by an identity thief. My Wallet was stolen at the time, and my drivers license was also stolen. This would allow an identity thief to use my social security number, and drivers license. At the time of account opening whomever opened the checking and savings account they made several transactions. Bank of America allowed thousands of dollars in XXXX Transfers, Check Deposits, ATM Withdrawals, ATM Deposits. In Branch Withdrawals. None of which I authorized. On XX/XX/XXXX I was supposed to receive a check from the State Of Texas Comptroller ( XXXX XXXX ) This is a Warrant Check from the state of Texas in the amount of {$2600.00}. Warrant Number # XXXX. This was stolen from the mail, and I never received this check. I was informed by the State Of Texas that this check was deposited into a Bank of America Account ending in XXXX. Also which was opened as Identity Fraud. Bank of America Denied the Check Fraud claim on this check warrant from the Texas Comptroller stating that the check was deposited into the intended payee 's account and the intended payee benefited from the check. This is false. The Check was deposited into the fraudulent checking account ending in XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I sent a Forgery Affidavit to the State of Texas who forwarded this to Bank of America. It clearly shows the check was forged and deposited into this fraudulent unauthorized account. I do not know whom deposited the check, however I do know I did not receive any benefit from the proceeds and I did not receive the check. ERS has advised to me that I need to reach out to Bank of America Claims Department Regarding Claim # XXXX Which I did. I asked to reopen the claims and stated that I am a victim of identity theft and that I did not sign any account applications for Bank of America. I did not authorize this deposit, and I completed a Notarized Identity Theft Forgery Packet and that was forwarded from the Comptroller to Bank of America. Bank of America told me that I needed to complete the Identity Fraud Claim Packages they sent me for the accounts, and send it back by email or mail. Which I DID. I included a police report and Identity Theft Affidavit. After Resolution, Of my previous issues. I contacted Bank of America again, the claims department today. XX/XX/XXXX. I was told that my claim couldn't be reopened because the identity theft claims for account ending in XXXX is still pending and not resolved yet. I was advised by Bank of America once this is resolved, and that the accounts are closed for Identity Fraud. I will receive a compensation check in the amount of {$2600.00} From Bank of America and that I will not need to reopen the account. Since I did not benefit from the proceeds of this check, I am requesting Bank Of America to reopen the claim and to issue a refund in the amount of {$2600.00} from the Proceeds that I did not receive. This is my retirement check that I am entitled to. I did not deposit this check into any accounts with Bank of America. I am not sure whom did. When the State Of Texas sent a claim package to Bank of America they advised that I was a victim of Identity theft. Additionally, Bank of America is not closing these accounts as Identity Theft which they should be. I should not have this count against me internally with Bank of America as I did not benefit from these accounts. All XXXX Transactions were and are fraudulent. All Transfers to and from these accounts are and were fraudulent. I did not register the online banking profile. I did not receive any Debit cards for these accounts. I did not receive any account opening documents, and I did not sign any account applications. At this time, Bank of America owes me monetary relief for the XXXX XXXX check in which I am entitled that they stole.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I check my credit card statement via the mobile app and see a {$6200.00} charge that I did not make. The charge was from the previous day ( XX/XX/year> ) made at a company called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
I immediately contact my credit card company, USAA, and report the issue. The card is canceled and a fraud investigation is initiated. I am told that my account will be credited the money while the investigation occurs and that the fraud department will be in touch if they need anymore information from me. At this point, I believe that USAA is trying to help me through this stressful time of victimization. 
Days pass and I don't hear anything from the fraud department. I trust that they have found this to indeed to a fraudulent charge. Meanwhile other fraudulent charges are being attempted and denied on my canceled card. Weeks pass and I begin to have confidence that this nightmare is over. 
Then roughly XXXX weeks later on XX/XX/year> the {$6200.00} charge reappears on my card. I call USAA to inquire about this and initially the customer services reps can not tell me why this charge is back as there has been no letter or report from the fraud department. Several days later I do receive a message from the fraud department simply saying that my fraud claim has been denied and that I am responsible for the {$6200.00}! 
They have given me no reasons for the outcome of their investigation and no other information for their findings. I can not even make contact with them. I have called and asked for an explanation on multiple occasions but will not be put through with anyone in the fraud department. I have asked the service reps what information they need to help them believe me and they have no answer for me. 
They do not seek the truth of the matter. They don't want it to be fraud. They only want to deny and delay and hope that I will go away. 
I have been a customer of USAA for XXXX  years and the one time that I need them to believe me that I have been a victim of credit card fraud, they have basically called me a liar. 
They have this whole facade of being an organization that helps military and veterans. Well, I am a veteran and they are being anything but helpful in this matter.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In late XXXX of 2023 I was contacted by a person that was incarcerated and he asked if I would help him with accessing the funds that were in his checking account at Chase Bank so that he could get personal items, food, and a tablet that were offered to the inmates. I agreed to help him and he released his phone to me so I could get his bank account information and he also had a Power of Attorney drawn up authorizing me to handle his financial and personal business. I found that the quickest way to access his funds was through XXXX transfers because I also had an account at Chase and he told me that was fine because he wanted his items as quickly as possible. I continued to act on his behalf until he was released in XXXX. All transactions that transpired were per his request. When he was released from jail he began telling me that I 'had to meet him somewhere to go over the bank transactions ' and I told him that I couldn't meet him so he told me that if I did not then he was going to go to the bank and tell them that he believed that some of the transactions were fraudulent. On XX/XX/XXXX he filed XXXX online disputes for amounts totalling {$1800.00} and the bank took that amount out of my checking account, leaving me with a negative amount of {$1800.00}. I discovered the transactions on XX/XX/XXXX when I checked my account balance. I went to the bank that afternoon and a call was made to the fraud department and they said I would have to wait 7-10 days to find out more because they would do an investigation and for me to call them back after that time. I explained to the bank representative that I had a POA and all transactions were done on his behalf. She told me to call the fraud department on Saturday XX/XX/XXXX, which I did, but I was told to call back after 10 days. I called fraud department again on XX/XX/XXXX and was told that a decision had already been made in favor of XXXX XXXX. I asked why I hadn't been contacted during their supposed investigation and all I was told was 'because it was XXXX and the decision has been made '. On XX/XX/XXXX I called fraud department again and requested a letter explaining their decision and the reasoning for it but I was told they don't do that. 
The only communication I received from Chase Bank regarding this matter was the seven letters informing me that the disputes had been filed against my account. The only other communication was when I called the fraud department. I do not believe that a thorough investigation, if any at all, was done in this case. A decision was made without anyone contacting me. I don't feel that this matter was handled according to law. The other complaint I have is that Chase Bank 's XXXX regulations has a clause that says if a person allows another individual to use their XXXX account then the account holder is responsible for any transactions that are made, so by allowing XXXX XXXX to take that money out of my account should not have happened. I also believe that it's a possibility that XXXX XXXX may have intended to file the disputes to get the money because he had spent more than he thought. I have also filed a fraud report with the local XXXX XXXX Sheriff 's Department.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : CFPB Complaint Against Synchrony Bank - Fraud Dispute Mishandling Company : Synchrony BankProduct : Credit Card ( XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX What Happened : I am filing a formal complaint against Synchrony Bank for mishandling a fraud dispute tied to an account I did not open, authorize, or benefit from. I became aware of this account only after receiving calls from collection agencies referencing a debt owed to Synchrony Bank. I initially believed the calls were a scam, as I had never opened an account with Synchrony Bank. Once the calls persisted, I contacted Synchrony directly and, after providing my personal information, was informed that an account existed under my name. 

I immediately disputed the account and initiated a fraud investigation. Since then, I have filed XXXX separate disputes with Synchrony over a span of months. Each time, Synchrony responded with nearly identical denial letters citing the same reasons : The account has been open for more than 12 months Payments were made The account is in my name I " authorized, participated in, or benefited from the purchase '' These responses are generic and do not address the specific points I have made in my written rebuttals. I have requested verifiable proof that I opened or used this account, including : A signed application or digital application details ( IP address, device ID, timestamp ) Proof of payments made from my personal bank accounts ( routing/account numbers ) Purchase history and transaction verification Synchrony has failed to provide any of this. Instead, they mailed me generic account statements that simply show activity on the account, with no evidence tying the account to me or my finances. I explicitly told them to cross-reference the payment information with my bank accounts, and they ignored this request. 

Additionally, when calling Synchrony, I am consistently redirected to XXXX XXXX ( the collections agency ) who tells me they can not help. When I attempt to call Synchrony again from my own number, the system disconnects my call after I enter my Social Security number. I have been hung up on multiple times and blocked from accessing real support. 

This entire process has now become a pattern of denial, obstruction, and refusal to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I am the victim of identity misuse, and instead of conducting a proper investigation, Synchrony has ignored my rebuttals, avoided meaningful contact, and continued to report the account as valid to the credit bureaus.

Because of this mishandling : My credit score has dropped nearly XXXX points My available credit on legitimate accounts has been reduced My ability to obtain credit, housing, and financial stability has been severely damaged What I Requested : Proof that I opened the account Verification of payments from my personal bank account Application information ( IP address, phone number, signature ) A copy of the account opening method What They Provided : Basic monthly statements showing charges and payments ( no link to me ) Repetitive denial letters with no actual investigation details

Subject : Formal Complaint Against JP Morgan Chase Bank Dear CFPB XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ) I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against JP Morgan Chase Bank regarding the handling of my account and a pending payout. My name is XXXX XXXX, and I am the owner of XXXX XXXX XXXX, a small business. 

On XX/XX/year>, I received two payments of {$9800.00} and {$3000.00} through Chase Merchant Services. Following this, the Chase team requested additional verifications, which I promptly completed by submitting the required documents. After successfully passing all verifications, I was informed that my merchant account was in good standing and that I could continue processing payments. 

However, on XX/XX/XXXX, after receiving a payment of {$9400.00} from a new customer, Chase Bank placed a hold on my merchant account and my business checking accounts. These accounts are essential for my business operations, including paying salaries, covering expenses, and depositing insurance checks for vehicle repairs. Since then, the payout of {$9400.00} has been paused, and my bank accounts at Chase have been frozen. 

Despite my repeated attempts to communicate with Chase regarding the status of this payout and the reasons for the account freeze, I have not received any responses. On XX/XX/XXXX, I visited a local branch and spent approximately three hours discussing this matter with the branch manager. With their assistance, I attempted to reach other departments by phone to resolve the issues with my accounts and merchant services. 

This situation has caused significant inconvenience and financial hardship for my business. The funds in question are urgently needed for ongoing operations, including payments to XXXX for car parts, salaries, rent, and other essential expenses. Currently, my accounts at Chase reflect a total available balance of {$13000.00}, as well as {$12000.00} in my merchant account and pending checks from insurance companies for vehicle repairs. 

Chase Bank has imposed a 180-day hold on my accounts and has treated me in a discriminatory manner during our communications. The only explanation provided for these actions is that they are due to " security reasons '' stemming from suspicious transaction activity. I would like to emphasize that I maintain a 100 % clean record with my merchant provider and have never had a dispute against my company. I possess comprehensive documentation for all my customers, including receipts, identification verification documents, credit card information, and photographic inspections of all vehicles serviced. 

Therefore, I respectfully request that the CFPB ( Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ) investigate this matter and assist in facilitating a resolution between myself and Chase Bank. I believe that Chase Bank 's actions have been unjustified and have severely impacted my business operations. 

Attached to this complaint are copies of relevant correspondence and screenshots of communication with Chase Bank, along with supporting documentation from my customers. Please let me know if you require any further information or documentation to proceed with this case. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance in resolving this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I submitted complaint XXXX on XX/XX/2023 ( attached ). Fidelity responded on XX/XX/2023 ( attached ). 

In their response Fidelity claims : " Our subsequent review of your claim has revealed the claim was not handled correctly. '' And then asks I provide further information and that : " As soon as the requested information is received, a provisional credit will be issued for that amount and final resolution letters will be sent. '' I responded with the necessary information within XXXX hours ( attached ). However, Fidelity has failed to respond once again. No credit has been issued and no letters have been sent. 

I am now being charged a late fee for failing to pay my credit card bill. However, payment is impossible because the disputed charge remains on my bill. After 10+ years of paying my credit card with fidelity on time, I will have my first late payment due to their inability to handle this dispute properly. There will also be negative credit reporting due to late payment, which means I am paying for Fidelity 's mistakes with my time, money, and credit score. 

Fidelity claims in their response to my previous complaint that they attempted to call me 3x on XX/XX/2023 and XX/XX/2023. However, I have no record of these calls happening three consecutive times. They also claim they could not leave a voicemail. Oddly, several business and personal voicemails have been left during the time span of the supposed calls. I believe these calls did not happen, as the facts do not support it and Fidelity now has a history of failing to communicate with me on matters with this dispute. As they admit in their own response. 

I have attempted to resolve this issue with Fidelity since XX/XX/2023. It has costed me 50+ hours of time, 30-40 calls, and several faxes. The time is invaluable and the calls and faxes have now accrued significant personal cost to me, as I have to pay for each one. 

Fidelity 's behavior on this matter is appalling. They have miscommunicated, misled, and mistreated me during the whole process. I am going to write a 2nd complaint on the same issue, because it is the only way I can get any response out of them and they continue to make false promises and not follow through. 

In order to resolve the dispute I firmly ask that : ( 1 ) A credit for {$2500.00} is immediately issued to my credit card. This amount represents the total disputed amount minus {$130.00} that was previously credit to me. The cost of moving XXXX, booking new ones, throwing away food, changing flights, changing my travel plans, and losing several days does not begin to be covered by this credit. The cost of the XXXX I had to leave due to an illegal invasion of privacy and safety by the host is far higher than my refund. The service was not only not what I paid for, it had significant financial cost to me to fix it. 

( 2 ) I be reimbursed for my time, fees, and communication costs. A 10,000 point gesture is nice, but meaningless when I continue to accrue late fees because Fidelity does not do what it says it will. I have lost significantly more money on this matter than I should have because of Fidelity 's inability to handle it properly. 

( 3 ) Any negative credit reporting for late payment be reversed. I should not be penalized for Fidelity 's mistakes. 

( 4 ) A detailed explanation of why I am being treated this way. I have been a customer with Fidelity for 10+ years, since my first job. I have followed all Fidelity rules, communicate properly, and provided all information asked in a timely and organized manner. Even when I had to call for the 20th time I treated all employees with respect and patience. I have never been angry, unreasonable, or untruthful during this process. Yet, Fidelity lies to me, treats me badly, and does not handle my issue fairly. It has cost me so much time, money, and stress you can not begin to imagine.

( 5 ) Due to Fidelity 's untruthfulness, inability to communicate, and growing cost to me to resolve this, I request all communication be done on CFPB or Fax. I can not trust Fidelity and need written communication from here on out in case this needs to escalated further. I have already told Fidelity numerous times I can not communicate with Mail and they clearly can not communicate over the phone despite my attempts. Since Fidelity refuses to email me, my fax number is XXXX. 

Respectfully, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> I was scammed out of {$60000.00} dollar. I contacted by a woman who said she was a Fraud Agent for Bank of America and that a woman had withdrew {$20000.00} from my account at a B of A near my home. But firstI received a text message from B of A Security asking me if I had made a charge to a XXXX XXXXn XXXX Texas on XX/XX/XXXX. I texted back No and thats how this nightmare began. The womans name was XXXX and she proceeded to tell me that she was here to help me.I check my account while she was still on the phone and I saw that {$20000.00} had been withdrawn from my account. She could somehow see this too. ( I was told by XXXX that once I logged into my account she see could see and manipulate the account which contained ( {$180000.00} ) She asked me to go to my main Branch and take out {$20000.00} ( She was on the phone with me the whole time and guided me every step of the way on what to say and how to Transfer the money into XXXX XXXXs. She explained that XXXX and B of A share the same system and this would make sure that whoever at my main Branch was involved would not be alerted so dont tell them what you are doing. I took another {$10000.00} because she told me that {$10000.00} of the {$20000.00} was being checked and we needed to get this amount to stop the first withdrawal which was done by a blonde woman at the B of A in XXXX Ca. The Bank has a video and to help the investigation this needed to be done again. She said she would call me the next day on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX am which was the time we agreed. Mind you all this time I am believing every word she is saying because she could see my account and I could see it. with her She called and said we had to do the same thing all over again because the cash was not processing completely. Not to worry everything will be up dated soon I looked at my account and this was correct. After repeating the process She said she Would call me on Wed XX/XX/XXXX. She did. She told me to go to my main Branch and get another {$20000.00} out ( There was a note in my account saying return to main branch. XX/XX/XXXX I went to my main XXXX and withdrew {$20000.00} and then another XXXX I withdrew {$10000.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX I went to a different B of A withdrew {$20000.00} and then the same Branch that I withdrew the previous {$10000.00} again. 

On XXXX XXXX When I went back to my main XXXX. ( I put her on Mute She. has been listening the whole time that I am doing all the transactions even though she said she would mute herself. The Bank manager came to the counter and said your DL is being flagged. I think you are being scammed. He gave me the B of A Fraud number and I proceeded to go back to my car. I unmuted XXXX and said I drank a lot of coffee this morning and I need to go back home. ( which was true ) and I said I will call you back. She called and texted me as I was on the phone with Bank of Americas Fraud agent. He told me to block her. I am devastated that I fell for such an evil person who so genuinely convincing. 

The fact that she guided me every step of the way and appeared genuine and could see my account just has me reeling. I have saved all text messages and I screenshot The account before I changed it. I also have the 2 numbers she called me from and a partial screenshot of one of the XXXX cards that I used to make 2 deposits. One for {$20000.00} and one for {$10000.00}. Since I am XXXX I am a paper trail person.. I pray you can get B of A to do a Goodwill Reimbursement and get my hard earned money returned to my new account which is short {$60000.00}. I am just sick and heartbroken! This is just HORRIBLE! 

She called me from XXXX XXXX and ( XXXX ) XXXX Running XXXX XXXX Ca.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: I accepted a credit card offer from Discover in early XXXX and was approved for a $ XXXX limit. Before my card even arrived, I got calls and emails from the fraud dept. saying to contact them. It looked like a scam since I didn't even get the card yet. They sent the wrong card design, and when I went to activate my new card, Discover refused, stating I had to submit my passport or driver 's license to them first. I said absolutely not, and they said they will close my account then. At no time did they disclose this " requirement '' before or during the acceptance/approval process. They do not require this from the majority of their customers, and they refused to tell me why they were trying to do it to me. No other credit card has asked me for this, and nobody I spoke to about this had ever heard of such a request either. I explained that they already have my SS #, birthday, and address. If I give them everything I have, I have nothing to fight the hackers the next time Discover has a data breech and hands them a picture to go along with all other forms of identification and DL #. There were many red flags since the automated system repeatedly hung up on me when I tried to get someone on the phone. Then I reached XXXX from the fraud department twice in one day, which is unheard of in a large company with employees in multiple states. XXXX was rude and even claimed asking for a DL or Passport is the same as a bank asking to see a debit card. I said, " No XXXX, it's not because Discover didn't issue my Driver 's License and a bank issues the debit card they request to see. '' Eventually he admitted I can get a notarized letter to verify my identity so I don't have to submit that information, but that was a lie because the letter requests my license number. In order to obtain a notary 's signature, it is required that you show them your driver 's license. Therefore, obtaining their signature IS verifying your identity. If identity verification is truly what Discover wanted, they would accept that. But they refuse. Also, they can not verify what they do not already have. They never requested my DL # during my approval process, so providing it to them now does not verify their records. However, I actually went to XXXX banks and got XXXX notarized letters that stated I showed them my DL, SS card, Birth Certificate, and my Discover Card ( that they refuse to activate ), and Discover said that is not good enough. I even offered to travel to the nearest office to show my IDs to their employee, but they said they don't have XXXX. ( I was offering to go out of state ). I offered many solutions to further verify myself, but they refused to utilize any ethical business practices, problem-solving skills, or respect to resolve this issue that they created. I told them repeatedly I don't feel comfortable giving them my license # for their files, and asked what else can I do. They kept saying, " This is our policy. We'll close your account if you don't give it to us. '' They are like kidnappers holding my card for ransom. They hardcore marketed me for 2 years. I chose them over other companies and timed it to do a 0 % balance transfer. They already did a hard pull on my credit. My credit report shows I have $ XXXX more available credit, but Discover refuses to give me access to it. If I apply for another company now ( one that doesn't abuse customers ), it will be another hard pull close together, and the company may reject me because it looks like I have $ XXXX available that I don't really have. If Discover closes my account, that will also damage my credit and reputation. They have refused to do anything to mitigate or ameliorate the damages they have inflicted on me. I asked to speak to the head of the fraud department and they told me they don't give that information out. I asked for a contact name and an email to speak to someone with power and integrity to fix this, and they refused to provide that. XXXX, a supervisor, said I can write a letter to a XXXX XXXX and address it to " Care Of Complaint Department. '' They kept saying there is nothing I can do except submit information they never disclosed they could request. They are punishing me for not supplying them with information they were not transparent about. That is not even in compliance with Transparency laws. It's also unethical and disreputable. Nobody should ever be maltreated, disrespected, lied to, or deceived by any company the ways Discover has done so to me. This has been extremely shocking, offensive, stressful, and damaging ( credit wise ) dealing with their incompetence and shady practices. My banker thought this was fraud, especially since the letter Discover provided didn't even have their logo on it. She called Discover to see if this is really how they treat their customers. Even XXXX from Consumer Financial Protection Bureau warned me this sounded like fraud and this is how scammers treat victims because of the time pressure and threats Discover threw at me. I am not the only one who sees the wrong in Discover 's inexcusable abuse.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Coinbase.com email and phone support process is not currently providing support to customers with funds that live in certain areas. 

I have an account with Coinbase.com. There is roughly {$700.00} equivalent in bitcoin in the account. I was advised in XX/XX/2023 and XX/XX/XXXX  by Coinbase.com that they were making changes and were closing my account on XX/XX/. Coinbase.com has decided to no longer support certain accounts. Coinbase.com going forward intends to only support accounts from citizens & residents primarily in XXXX and the United States. I understand Coinbase.com is having several problems and that I need to comply and withdraw funds. 

XX/XX/XXXX  was my first attempt to login and withdraw funds as per the XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX  emails from Coinbase.com. During login, I correctly provide username, password, and my device authentication code. I can not currently withdraw the funds in my account because the " Accept Updated Terms '' process during login is not working properly and keeps cycling through the same click box and dialogue until the session times out or webpage error dialog displays " Access to www.coinbase.com was denied ; You don't have authorization to view this page ; HTTP Error 403 ''. 

From XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/, I tried various ways to resolve matter by logging-in with different devices and with/without VPN, but none of it worked. 

On XX/XX/, I started contacting customer support by email and phone. The customer support via phone says that my account is in an unsupported area. I am a US citizen, but have been residing in XXXX for several years where I created the account. Per Coinbase.com website comments, they are experimenting with customer support, which means they are not supporting certain customers. When I send emails through their customer support, the email support tickets are automatically closed ; sometimes within one or two seconds of sending my support email ( usually within 10 minutes ). This is happening because my account email address is associated to my residency in XXXX, which is an unsupported area per Coinbase.com. 

I reached out to Coinbase.com customer support several times on XX/XX/XXXX  with the same result ( phone hang-ups, phone calls not returned, email support tickets automatically closed ). On XX/XX/, I also reached-out to a Coinbase executive officer, who I know personally from a prior employer ; no response too, but obviously all the execs are very busy with everything going on. In total, I have probably contacted Coinbase.com phone and email support about ten ( 10 ) times with no action from Coinbase.com. 

There should be no such thing as an unsupported area if Coinbase has the customers funds. It seems obvious to me that if a financial institution has customer funds and requested the customer to withdraw funds, Coinbase.com must support those customer accounts with funds whether they are or are not in unsupported areas. Per Coinbase.com emails, I have until XX/XX/XXXX  to withdraw funds, but currently Coinbase.com through their customer support process is preventing me from withdrawing funds with possibly a purposeful lack of support.

Discover initially removed the charge from my balance as fraud but ultimately completed an investigation to conclude it was not fraudulent and added the transaction back to my balance. This support includes ( XXXX ) evidence I purchased a new phone, ( XXXX ) the email from Discover asking to confirm a separate transaction on the same day with the same merchant but a different amount that they suspected to be fraud to which I confirmed the charge was fraudulent and cancelled my card, they did not send a notification asking if this transaction in question was fraudulent ( XXXX ) evidence of my other credit card concluding a similar purchase from the same vendor on the same day was fraudulent ( XXXX ) evidence I boarded a flight to XXXX prior to the transaction date and evidence I boarded the return flight after the transaction date ( XXXX ) evidence of my credit fraud reports submitted to XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ( XXXX ) evidence an XXXX XXXX was opened using my stolen phone without my knowledge and the closing of that account and XXXX and XXXX XXXX conclusion of fraud. Consumer complaint narrative:
**Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Complaint** Complaint Against Navy Federal Credit Union Regarding Unfair Overdraft Fees **To Whom It May Concern : ** I am writing to formally file a complaint against Navy Federal Credit Union ( NFCU ), headquartered in XXXX, Virginia . I have been a customer of Navy Federal since XXXX, and I have recently encountered issues that I believe warrant immediate attention. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the Bureau issued an order against Navy Federal for engaging in unfair acts or practices in violation of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010. The Bureau found that from XXXX through XXXX, Navy Federal charged overdraft fees on debit-card purchases and ATM withdrawals when consumers accounts had insufficient funds at the time the transactions settled, despite members having sufficient funds during the transaction. Furthermore, it was noted that Navy Federal was aware that members were unlikely to understand these unexpected overdraft fees.

Additionally, the Bureau identified that, through XX/XX/XXXX, Navy Federal charged overdraft fees when there were delays in posting credits to members accounts from person-to-person payment networks, even when those funds appeared to be available for immediate use to members.

As a direct result of these practices, my checking account has been closed and charged off due to similar issues regarding the illegal charging of overdraft fees. This has caused significant financial distress and damage to my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative: I submitted a dispute online to Equifax to update my address on my credit report. Equifax does not allow an option for individuals to update their address on their own, the only option they provide is to dispute information. I was able to log into Equifax to submit the dispute and upload a current utility bill showing my current address but was denied access ( locked out of my account ) when I tried to review the results of the dispute. I have contacted Equifax XXXX times, each time the hold time exceeds XXXX hour. I had to enter by social security number and phone number into their automated system just to be connected to a live person. Once a person comes on the line to speak to you, the language barriers interfere with the person 's ability to help me access my account. I was asked to upload a picture of my driver 's license through a link sent to my cellphone. This is an unsafe practice and makes it easy for people to commit fraud. The laws of all states also prohibit how non-government agencies obtain and use driver 's license from individuals. For this reason, I will not be providing them an electronic picture or copy of my driver 's license. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act Equifax is required to allow me to access my credit report and information contained in their system about me. By denying me access to my own information they are in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> - I booked a vacation package at XXXX for 4 family members on my Capital One credit card. My sister ( onXXXX of the travelers ) XXXX XXXX, called XXXX to see if it was possible to change the airport she was flying out of to one closer to her home. XXXX sent her to the XXXX XXXX department where she was told that it would be cheaper/easier to cancel only her flight and keep the remaining tickets since the trip was within the cancellation window. She was told to expect the {$400.00} refund back to my original card within approximately 5 business days. 

XX/XX/year> - XXXX confirmed that her ticket was no longer showing up on the XXXX website and that the other three tickets had been moved to a new confirmation number ( XXXX  ). 

XX/XX/year> - The refund was never received. Called XXXX and was again transferred to the XXXX XXXX department. XXXX agent stated that the flight should have been charged for only the three tickets ( {$1200.00} ) and that she could see where the ticket for XXXX XXXX was cancelled. Told XXXX agent that the total package had been charged for the full amount ( flight & hotel {$3700.00} ). XXXX agent stated that she would make a note and asked if we could get copy of credit card bill showing full charge so she could submit it to accounting. Got a copy of the credit card charge and called back the same night. Spoke to a different XXXX agent who said he would forward the issue to their accounting department and that it should be resolved within 3 business days or so. 

XX/XX/year> - Refund still not received for {$400.00}. Put in a dispute with my Capital One credit card. Received call from Capital One and was told I may need to submit documents. 

XX/XX/year>- Capital One sent an update saying that documents were never received. Let them know I hadn't been told specific documents to send, but sent them a copy of XXXX confirming the ticket was cancelled. 
Called XXXX back and was told they couldn't refund until the dispute was closed. 

XX/XX/year> - dispute was closed against me and temporary credit was cleared from card. Called XXXX back to verify dispute was cleared and was told not on their side but it would be refunded soon. 

XX/XX/year> - refund still not received.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Chime Financial regarding their handling of a dispute related to an unauthorized or unfair charge on my account. 

Summary of the Issue : - On XX/XX/year>2025, I filed a dispute with Chime concerning a charge of {$360.00} made to my account ending in XXXX - The charge was for a deposit paid to a photographer, XXXX XXXX XXXX, which I believe was unfairly charged because : - The deposit was paid under the impression it was a hold fee to secure a future date, not a nonrefundable payment. 
- No specific date, location, or signed contract was confirmed at the time of payment. 
- I canceled the deposit XXXX days later, before any services were rendered, and was not informed that the deposit was nonrefundable. 
- The photographer has been unresponsive to my attempts to resolve the matter directly and has refused to refund my deposit. 
- Despite multiple attempts to communicate and resolve the dispute, Chime has not reversed the charge or taken appropriate action to protect my consumer rights. 
- I also contacted XXXX and the photographer directly, but found no resolution, and my efforts to get a refund have been ignored or rejected. 

Legal and Consumer Rights Concerns : - Under XXXX  and XXXX  law, deposits paid for services that were not provided and where no signed agreement or clear nonrefundable terms exist are presumed refundable. 
- The lack of transparency and the pressure to pay without a signed contract or confirmed details violate consumer protection laws. 
- Chime 's failure to investigate or reverse this charge despite substantial evidence and a legitimate dispute constitutes a failure to protect my rights as a consumer. 

Supporting documents : - Copies of communication with the photographer and XXXX. 
- Dispute documentation submitted to Chime. 
- Any relevant evidence supporting my claim that the deposit was paid prematurely and was supposed to be refundable. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure my consumer rights are protected.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I sent a certified letter with return receipt to bank of America, the address they list online for checking and Billing Inquiries listed below. The letter contains all relevant details needed to file a dispute. 

The original letter is attached with this CPFB complaint and was sent on XX/XX/2024 to : Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX With Certified tracking USPS # XXXX The letter was delivered on XX/XX/2024 and signed for by a Bank of America employee at that address well within 60 days of the original charges I am disputing. 

I also have the return receipt in my possession which shows a bank of America employee signed confirming receipt of the disputed charge letter. I will attach a picture of the return receipt in the documents of this CFPB complaint. 

After nearly 40 days of no correspondence ( Regulation E states Bank must acknowledge your dispute inquiry within 10 business days ), I filed a XXXX   complaint stating that they ignored by dispute charge inquiry letter. I filed the XXXX  complaint on XX/XX/2024 - XXXX  Complaint ID : XXXX A Bank of America Enterprise Resolution Specialist was assigned to my case and called me on Wednesday XX/XX/XXXX. She notified me that their dispute resolution department showed no sign of a dispute and she couldn't do anything about my case. She said I had to file one by calling Bank of America myself. Since the charges are now over 60 days old, the claims department won't let me open the dispute. They said they have no letter from me - despite me sending one and having it signed for, which is well within my legal rights to dispute a charge. 

I spoke with the same Bank of America Enterprise Resolution Specialist and told her that they wouldn't help me dispute the charges. She said she would try on my behalf. After a day, she called me back and said she is unable to file a dispute on my behalf. I told her that this is a violation of my legal rights because I already opened the dispute via sending a letter, which she understood and apologized for but did not give me any options to escalate it.
