Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint - Cash App Fraud & Repeated Dismissal - Complaint To : CFBP This complaint is against Cash App for repeatedly dismissing my claims of unauthorized transactions and failing to investigate clear fraud. 

Cash App has closed my case ( XXXX ) XXXX times without resolution. They falsely claim my transactions were " authorized, '' despite : XX/XX/year> : {$XXXX} transferred from my XXXX XXXX account. 
XX/XX/year> : {$XXXX} transferred from my XXXX XXXX account. 
Cash App refuses to : Provide evidence of authorization. 
Acknowledge a potential security breach. 
Escalate the case for proper investigation. 
Refund my stolen funds. 
This is not a " security best practices '' issue. It is fraud. Cash App 's inaction is unacceptable. 

I demand the CFBP intervene and force Cash App to : Conduct a genuine investigation. 
Refund my {$XXXX} immediately. 
Subject : URGENT : Unacceptable Response & Continued Fraud - Cash App & CFPB Failure - Escalation Demanded I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction and outrage at Cash App 's response to my previous complaint, as relayed through the CFPB. This response is wholly inadequate and demonstrates a continued pattern of disregard for my legitimate claims of fraud.

Cash App 's Response is Unacceptable : They are attempting to dismiss my specific fraud complaint by referencing a general " Consent Order '' with the CFPB. This is a transparent attempt to evade responsibility for the direct theft from my account.

They state, " You do not need to do anything at this time to obtain redress ( including potential compensation ), which also means you do not need to file a complaint with the CFPB. '' This is patronizing and insulting. I have filed a complaint, and I demand a resolution to the specific fraudulent transactions on my account, which are not adequately addressed by a broad consent order.

They provide generic " helpful information '' requests, despite having already been provided with these details multiple times. This is a clear indication they have not reviewed my case properly.

My Experience with Cash App and the CFPB : This is the FIFTH time Cash App has closed my case without resolution.

The CFPB has proven to be ineffective in holding Cash App accountable. They are allowing Cash App to dismiss legitimate fraud complaints with generic, irrelevant responses.

I have been a victim of unauthorized transactions totaling over {$1800.00}, and Cash App continues to ignore my demands for a refund and a proper investigation.

I demand the following immediately : Direct Action from the CFPB : I demand the CFPB take direct action to investigate Cash App 's handling of my specific fraud complaint. Their reliance on a general consent order is unacceptable.

Cash App Investigation : I demand Cash App conduct a thorough, independent investigation into the unauthorized transactions on my account.

Full Refund : I demand a full refund of the stolen funds to my Wells Fargo account.

Escalation : I demand this case be escalated to the highest level within Cash App.

Accountability : I demand Cash App be held accountable for their repeated dismissals and their failure to protect their customers from fraud.

Then finally I am told I need to contact my original back and request that they retrieve my money back. When I ask " why is it a different answer every single time, I just want my money back ''? They would commonly make the date on the check to appear to have come in before my deposit was made, but this would be false. This occurred for the first time with the very first overdraft charge to XXXX & XXXX. They also charged me for this twice. Thus, every charge after this is fraudulent because had I still had the money they falsely deducted from my account, my account would not be overdraft after that. Additionally, they often would charge overdraft fees for online accounts that I had cancelled or never subscribed to simply because the online company attempted to charge my account. These charges were all-around false. Wells Fargo is also saying that they reissued me a check for XXXX XXXX. That is false as well. I never received a reissued check for XXXX XXXX. This is a lie. I expect to be reimbursed all of the XXXX overdraft fees I was charged fraudulently.

Basically, I was using Chime online banking account and when I was working they allowed me to borrow some money from the " my paycheck '' option, where you can borrow a certain amount from your paycheck and since I got payed every two weeks this was a handy emergency lending solution. But I was wrongfully fired from my past employer XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was borrowing money for gas to look for a new job plus for food and certain things. When after a few weeks they took the lending part away and I could no longer see XXXX I owed it so I figured they took my last paycheck since I didnt not get one. And still dont know if the company took it or chime took it. Next I recieved unemployment. Since chime would work and XXXX XXXX wouldnt I still used my chime account for my unemployment. 
I was fired on XX/XX/2023. I recieved my first unemployment check on XX/XX/2023 and realized my back pay wasnt in there. I called the unemployment office and they sent me the correct papars to complete. So Tuesday XX/XX/2023 I spent all evening filling out applications because i desperately needed my back pay to catch up on my bills. Wednesday XX/XX/2023 I recieved my two back pay checks around XXXX pm estimated time and not even a minufe later chime stole my unemployment checks to backpay and settle a debt which I believe is illegal. I thought it was illegal to garnish wages that wasnt a state tax debt, child support or for one other reason that I cant remember off the top of my head at this moment. So basically Chime didnt give me a single warning and took out of {$290.00} they took {$230.00} plus {$11.00} for fees which was the majority of my {$290.00} backpay from unemployment. I think it is wrong to settle debt collection with unemployment and the worse part is I already had another job starting soon on XX/XX/XXXX and was going to use chime but since they didnt wait to take the debt back out of a regular paycheck while also claiming I need to sign up for direct deposit even though I do have my unemployment checks from direct deposited they have screwed me over every way possible. I called them ten times and its always some XXXX person you talk to that doesnt know U.S. Law about unemployment benifits and could care less. They were making fun of me with sarcasm and I am completely done with them.

On XX/XX/year>, PayPal permanently limited my account without providing a detailed reason. They claimed the decision was based on alleged fraud trends and mismatched identity information. I used PayPals invoice service and purchased shipping labels directly from PayPal to ship a high-value item worth {$1500.00}. Despite this, PayPal permanently limited my account and threatened me with fees beyond the original transaction amount. 

I requested PayPal to provide me with detailed information about the alleged fraud activity and allow me to appeal their decision. They refused to give me any details and stated the decision was final. Additionally, PayPal is holding my balance for 120 days, which is causing me severe financial hardship and mental stress due to ongoing health issues. 

I am requesting immediate access to my funds and for PayPal to provide me a proper explanation of their actions. I also request that PayPal stops any attempt to charge me fees beyond the original transaction.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2025, PayPal unexpectedly restricted my account without providing any reason. At the time, my PayPal balance was {$8200.00}. I repeatedly contacted PayPal to request an explanation, but I received no meaningful response. 

From XXXX through early XX/XX/2025, I used PayPal to receive payments from individuals who voluntarily joined a platform called XXXX XXXX. These individuals sent money to me via PayPal under the friends and family option, and I forwarded those funds to the companys wallet as part of my role assisting with onboarding. 

After the platform collapsed on XX/XX/2025, several of those individuals initiated chargebacks through their banks, falsely claiming they had not authorized the transactions or had not received what they paid for. I submitted documented evidence to PayPal proving the legitimacy of these transactions, including receipts, XXXX messages, confirmation certificates, and bank records. Despite this, PayPal still approved the chargebacks, debited those amounts from my account, and applied a {$15.00} dispute fee per case. 

As a result, my account now shows a negative balance of {$12000.00}. PayPal has not explained their reasoning, nor have they acknowledged the evidence I provided. This situation has caused me severe financial hardship and emotional distress. 

I respectfully request that my funds be returned and that PayPal be held accountable for allowing fraudulent chargebacks without proper investigation.

I didn't write the companies but I did call and did everything I knew to do but maybe I did something wrong. I say that because now I have charge offs on my credit report for capital XXXX and XXXX  XXXX. The credit collection agencies are XXXX bank for XXXX XXXX for {$410.00} ( a settlement ) and XXXX XXXX Incorporated for Capital One for {$470.00} ( settlement ).

I need to get my credit report updated and be able to apply for a credit card that I am being sent preapprovals for as well as a personal loan but this sure has messed things up for me and my credit score is low when I need to be able to make payments on items by getting approved for a card and/or a loan so that I can. Consumer complaint narrative: My father had a Coinbase account with his wife listed as beneficiary on the account. After his passing, I uploaded a death certificate and his will and requested the transfer be made to his wife. Coinbase repeatedly asked me for additional documents and a probated will from the state of XXXX. Every time I reply that the beneficiary was added to avoid probate, Coinbase continues to respond with their unnecessary document requests. Multiple times I have asked them simply to confirm their policy of if an account has a listed beneficiary would they still require the estate to go through probate and they ignore that question and respond only with the same document request. This has now been going on for two years while they unlawfully withhold assets from my late father 's wife. I have requested calls from the company and they will not comply. I forwarded a formal complaint directly with them and they simply responded with the same request for documents. My father held all of his eligible assets in joint tenancy with rights of survivorship with his wife, and for any accounts where that was not possible, she was listed as beneficiary. This was done specifically to avoid probate and Coinbase continually is requested a probated will when it is not necessary.

I didnt have cash so he asked if I had XXXX and when I said yes and opened my bank app, he took my phone from my hands and said he would type in the address to send a donation to. After he was holding my phone for a few seconds I tried to grab my phone back but he wouldnt let go. I pulled on my phone but he continued to hold onto it and type. When he finally let go, he had XXXX {$2000.00} to a name and number unknown to me. We never agreed upon any amount at all and he sent the XXXX completely without my permission. It was unauthorized and dishonest. 

I immediately reported the incident to my bank and they assured me that internally, my account said funds failed and would likely not go through because the charge was reported as unauthorized. They reversed the charge temporarily. Then, they reversed the reversal, saying that because I opened the phone and app with Face ID, the charge was authorized. This did not at all account for my phone being stolen from my hands and the scammer refusing to giving it back to me. Despite my immediately reporting the charge as unauthorized and providing a police report, they refused to investigate further.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I've been having major problems with bank of america returning our funds.. I was diagnosed with XXXX back on XX/XX/year> by a XXXX neurologist. I was awarded critical illness insurance payment from XXXX on XX/XX/year>. On XX/XX/year> I Made my partner my Power of Attorney. On XX/XX/year> I transferred a portion to my bank of america checking account. I decided since the XXXX  disease is taking away the ability for me to move my arms and legs and cause speech impairment, to instruct my POA to make a series of withdrawals and open up her own Bank of America account and close my account. I also made a couple XXXX  transfers to her new account. 

The fraud department flagged her bank account as fraud and has been holding her checking account funds ever since. BOA also refused to let my POA close my account. We made visits and called the fraud department numerous times. We showed them the POA paperwork. We brought bank statements proving where the funds originated from. We also brought a letter from my doctor at XXXX for XXXX XXXX, explaining my condition. 

Bank of America says they will return the funds to my still active BOA account but still till this day, over a year and a half later, BOA still hasn't returned the funds. We are planning to make another in person visit to complain and demand our funds back, if we fail we will be forced to hire a lawyer which I really can't afford. 

If possible can you guys help? The XXXX disease has caused hardship and there are medical expenses. I'm quadriplegic now. Unfortunately the XXXX disease is very aggressive. We need our funds back. 

Thank you for your time.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I was a victim of scam by someone named XXXX XXXX with a company named XXXX. On XX/XX/year> she told me on XXXX that she was an agent investor and that if I invested {$200.00}, I would receive {$4100.00}. I sent the money through CashApp which was linked to my debit card. I created a CashApp account this day to send and receive the money. I was then told there was an issue and that I needed to send an additional {$150.00} and that the price I would receive would be {$6700.00}. In total I sent {$350.00} to this person and was then demanded to send another {$1100.00} which I did not do. I paid twice for services I never received. After figuring out that it was scam, I didnt know if they could somehow get the information to my debit card through my account, so I deleted the CashApp account. I contacted XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/year> about this and a claim was opened and the transaction was reversed on that day, and that reversal was reversed again on XX/XX/year> because the charges were technically authorized and because they can not do anything regarding CashApp. I was then told to contact CashApp directly because they would be able to help, which I did twice today on XX/XX/year>. The first advocate that I spoke to told me that the CashApp account I had used for those transactions was not verified so she could not find it, but to create a new account today, have it verified, and contact CashApp again so they could investigate this situation. I did so, and the second time I contacted CashApp after creating this new account, the advocate told me that because the charges were authorized there is nothing they can do and also because the account was closed. I was told to directly contact the merchant who scammed me. XXXX XXXX  and myself have contacted the merchant and they have refused to refund me the money. I understand that the charges were authorized, but I never received any of the services I was promised, and I dont understand why no one can understand the situation I am currently in. I lost {$350.00} to scam, and of course the merchant will refuse to provide a refund or deny scamming me. Please help me. Thank you for your time.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am reporting that Marcus by Goldman Sachs is engaged in fraud, identity theft, and criminal negligence. On XX/XX/year>, I received a suspicious text message for an security code at Marcus. I was not familiar with Marcus but quickly learned that it is one of the many online banks that do not practice adequate KYC controls in accordance with the Patriot Act. I called Marcus and learned that an unauthorized individual had opened an account using my identity on XX/XX/year>. The individual has used the same stolen identity information that has been used at other institutions who practice these same sub-standard KYC controls. Marcus depends entirely on self-attestation of SSN, address, phone number, date of birth, and email and makes no effort to verify that the applicant is the bearer of the true identity. In fact I can prove that Marcus does not properly verify these identity facts because Marcus approved the application using my identity with an incorrect date of birth. Marcus does not collect any government issued photo identification, gps location, or live photo verification. These are identity verification techniques that are in common practice across the internet yet Marcus does nothing and so aiding in the perpetration of fraud, identity theft, and criminal negligence. I have reported this to local law enforcement and the FTC via identitytheft.gov.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing this CFPB complaint as the only recourse to hold Chase accountable for in effect ignoring my fraud claim. I have still not received my {$2500.00} stolen ( two separate transactions ) from me on XX/XX/24 ( shows up as XX/XX/24 because they were closed on the new years ) despite reporting the theft and requesting them to shut down all my accounts before it happened very quickly after I was robbed. Chase first denied my claim on XX/XX/24 by removing the {$2500.00} in credit applied after I reported the fraud then I appealed on XX/XX/24 and sent a lot of documentation clearly showing I did not authorize these transactions whatsoever ( never made a XXXX transfer on chase, no idea who " XXXX XXXX '' is, etc. ) and the bank still denied it on XX/XX/24 saying I authorized it?? I have no way to track any of this other than filing this complaint. They have no in person fraud dept service, no email, no one will give me their contact info to follow up or even give me their last name. Each time I call their fraud line I get a different story ( the fraud rejection letter only included one of the transactions when I very clearly stated there were 2 ) and I'm very worried Chase is not actually looking at my paperwork sent in ( because if they did they would clearly see I did not authorize these transactions whatsoever ) or trying to run out the clock on paying me back or hoping I give up. Their fraud claim operations system is totally rigged against consumers by having no ability to document any correspondence or acknowledge actions taken and I'm hoping this CFPB complaint can help me provide some recourse because I have zero faith they actually investigate anything I tell them, then deny my claim without any acknowledgment they looked at the docs I faxed in with the police report, etc. I don't know what else to do as I have literally tried everything else and to make matters worse, I only have 60 days from XX/XX/24 under the Electronic Fund Transfers Act to file a claim as a victim of electronic/digital fraud and time is running out

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, are writing regarding the closure of our account and the retention of our operational funds by Mercury.com without adequate explanation. This matter requires your immediate attention as it has caused significant disruption to our business operations and financial harm. 

Background Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  NY, opened a Business bank account with Mercury.com ( Bank Name - XXXX XXXX XXXX ) on XX/XX/year>, utilizing the Articles of Organization and EIN provided during registration.

As non-U.S. citizens conducting business in the United States, we relied on Mercury 's services for smooth financial operations. Between XXXX and XX/XX/year>, we conducted regular transactions without any issues. Bank Statement has been attached. 

On XX/XX/year>, Mercury abruptly closed our account, citing a violation of the terms and conditions, without prior notice or a detailed explanation.

Issues : Mercury has retained approximately {$13000.00} of our operational funds without justification or recourse.

Despite multiple follow-ups, Mercury has only cited " internal reasons '' for the account closure, failing to provide any concrete or transparent information. We have marked email to their compliance team, support, help and legal team but Mercury is not replying to any of our emails.

Retaining these funds without cause or explanation appears not only unjust but also potentially fraudulent.

There are XXXX total XXXX  transactions, designated specifically as XXXX  transactions by Truist. 

On XX/XX/year>, I reached out to Truist support to let them know that I had received an email stating I did not meet the requirements of the sign-up offer. The transcript of the conversation is attached to this complaint. While it had registered I completed the required direct deposits, the system did not register that I had completed the required number of qualifying XXXX transactions and therefore I did not receive the award. The representative was not able to answer my question and informed me she would send my information in an appeal form. It has been over a month and I have not received any update regarding my appeal.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I want to tell you my story. I fell victim to theft and fraud, and it destroyed my life, setting me back to XXXX after a year of working day and night, struggling to accumulate funds. About a month ago, I met a girl on XXXX XXXX. She claimed to be from XXXX but currently staying at her father 's house in Hawaii but she lives in Michigan. She told me she runs her own business, does dropshipping, and deals with cryptocurrencies. I expressed my interest in learning about crypto, and she offered to help, suggesting we collaborate to make a significant amount of money. She instructed me to download the Kraken app, and after providing my personal information, she told me to buy XXXX and provided her wallet address. She directed me to use the Kraken app only for buying and to trade on a fake site called XXXX. I opened an account on XXXX and followed her instructions. The first time, she asked me to deposit {$550.00} in XX/XX/year>. I did so using Kraken, and we conducted some trading. I won {$100.00} in profit, and she suggested I deposit it into my bank account. Little did I know, it was all part of the scam. Days later, she said the market was favorable, and we needed to do more trading. She proposed a large amount in XX/XX/year>, {$45000.00} from her and {$4500.00} from me. I accepted the challenge, bought XXXX on Kraken, and withdrew it to the wallet address on XXXX, her fake account. When I lost access to XXXX, I found all the funds were fake money, and the site was fraudulent as well. We did several trades, supposedly winning {$200000.00}, but it was all fake. When I asked her to send me my share to my Kraken account, she said okay and asked for screenshots of every step. Then she sent an email from XXXX, claiming I needed to pay {$10000.00}, 5 % of the profit, and in the email they tell me need to pay before XX/XX/year>XXXX  and they provoke me if i dont pay the taxes NIIT i Dont receive my funds. When I explained I didn't have the money, she insisted I find it on my own or take out a loan. The email she sent later was about personal income taxes, stating I had to pay them before XX/XX/XXXX or face penalties. I had {$7000.00}, sent it to my Kraken account, and withdrew it to the wallet address on my XXXX account, her fake account. When I asked her to send me her share, she claimed her mother couldn't send the money due to an emergency. Everything turned out to be fake. I have her number and many pictures of her, even a recorded video call. Please, please, please help me identify this person and report her to the police. I just want to recover my funds, even though I know they won't be fully compensated for the year of hard work and sacrifices. Help me prevent her from exploiting others. 
This is The wallet adress for here where i send all my money : XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Refund and Damages Due to Unauthorized Transactions and Regulatory Violations Dear XXXX : I am writing to formally demand immediate resolution and reimbursement for a series of erroneous and unauthorized transactions processed by Bank of America ( BOA, ) which have caused me direct financial harm and constitute violations of federal and state consumer protection laws. 
On or about XX/XX/year>, a transaction from my account was duplicated in error. 
Although the duplicated amount had previously been reversed, on XX/XX/year>, the same amount was withdrawn a third time without authorization, on XX/XX/year>. I personally visited the BOA branch on XXXX XXXX XXXX, on XX/XX/year>, at which time you personally acknowledged the mistake made by a BOA. We both confirmed that the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX had previously faxed a lien order, on XX/XX/year>. I paid the lien balance, in full, on XX/XX/year>. On XX/XX/year>, I had also notified both XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, via a faxed statement and receipt, that my personal property tax balance had been paid in full. On XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX faxed proof of this payment to BOA, who subsequently reversed the charge on my account, in the amount of {$640.00}. It was later discovered by both you and BOAs Legal Team, that an identical copy of the lien order had also been received via XXXX and mistakenly misinterpreted as a secondary lien. On XX/XX/year>, I returned to BOAs XXXX XXXX XXXX branch, to speak with you and follow up on the status of my reimbursement. 
Upon acknowledgement of this error, you credited my account, in the amount of {$640.00}, on XX/XX/year>. To my surprise, your institution withdrew $ XXXX my account, for a third time, XX/XX/year>. I immediately contacted your branch office, on the morning of XX/XX/year>, and spoke with the covering XXXX, who made no attempt to resolve this matter. I also contacted BOAs Customer Service Department, via phone that evening, and after over an hour of dispute, the representative acknowledged the withdrawal error ; however, I was denied reimbursement of the funds that were deducted from my account, without my consent, on XX/XX/year>. These negligent acts placed my family under extreme financial hardship, leaving me without the ability to pay bills timely, afford gas for my vehicles and purchase groceries for myself and my XXXX children. 
These actions are not only unacceptable but also violate provisions of the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ), 15 U.S. Code 1693, which prohibits unauthorized electronic fund transfers and mandates prompt investigation and resolution of transaction disputes. Additionally, your failure to maintain proper transaction handling constitutes negligence, conversion, and a breach of contract under Virginia state law. 

As a result of these actions, I am seeking the following : XXXX. Refund of all wrongfully withdrawn funds, totaling {$640.00}. 
XXXX. Statutory damages under the EFTA ( 15 U.S. Code 1693m ), in the amount of {$1000.00}, for this negligent violation and the willful and repeated mishandling of my account. 
XXXX. Actual damages, including any overdraft fees, bounced payments, or credit impacts, estimated at a minimum of {$500.00}. 
XXXX. Reimbursement of legal fees, as permitted under consumer protection laws. 

You are hereby given XXXX calendar days from the date of this letter to fully resolve this matter by issuing the full refund and providing written assurance that no further unauthorized withdrawals will occur. Failure to resolve this matter within the stated timeframe will leave me no choice but to initiate legal action in civil court, including but not limited to, claims under the EFTA, breach of contract, and applicable state consumer protection statutes. 
This letter serves as a final good faith attempt to resolve this matter prior to litigation.

I made multiple on-time payments to Capital One through their mobile app using my checking account ending in XXXX. These payments were : {$100.00} on XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX {$100.00} on XXXX XXXX XXXX {$53.00} on XXXX XXXX XXXX All payments cleared my bank, which had more than enough funds available. Consumer complaint narrative:
Affidavit of Identity Theft and Fraudulent Business Activity XXXX XXXX XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX ( Age XXXX ) SSN : XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Subject : AFFIDAVIT Identity Theft, Unauthorized Inquiries, and Fraudulent Business Account Closure Request Dear Sir or Madam, I, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX am submitting this affidavit to formally dispute and report fraudulent activity discovered on my credit report. This includes unauthorized credit inquiries and the fraudulent establishment of a business account under my identity. 
I am a victim of identity theft and have never applied for any credit cards, opened any business accounts, or authorized any third party to do so on my behalf. Specifically, I affirm that I do not own, nor have I ever owned or operated, any business by the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Any business account or credit activity linked to that entity is fraudulent and should be immediately closed and removed from my credit report. 
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other relevant federal laws, I assert the following rights : Applicable Federal Laws : 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( Section 604 ) : No consumer report may be furnished without my written consent or a legally permissible purpose. I provided neither.

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) : Credit reports must not contain obsolete or inaccurate information. Fraudulent inquiries and accounts fall under this category.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Furnishing false or inaccurate information to consumer reporting agencies is unlawful.

15 U.S.C. 6802 : My personal financial information can not be lawfully disclosed to nonaffiliated third parties without proper notice and opportunity to opt out. 
18 U.S.C. 1028 : Identity theft is a federal crime, and any use of my identity without consent is prosecutable under this statute.

I Request the Following Actions : 1. Immediate removal of all unauthorized credit inquiries and business-related information associated with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
2. Closure of any business or commercial accounts opened using my name, SSN, or any personal identifying information.

3. Written confirmation that these actions have been completed and a clean credit report reflecting the corrected information. 
This affidavit is made in good faith and under penalty of perjury. I respectfully demand your prompt attention and resolution. Should these matters remain unresolved within 30 days of receipt, I will pursue remedies through the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and other legal avenues. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I sent a payment of {$50.00} to my friend, XXXX, through Venmo for a specific purpose. However, after I completed the transaction, I discovered that XXXX 's Venmo account is in collections. As a result, instead of XXXX receiving the funds, the money was diverted to pay off a collections debt. 

This outcome was not what I intended when I initiated the payment. I did not authorize Venmo or any third party to redirect my money to satisfy a collections debt, and the funds were not accessible to XXXX, which defeated the purpose of the transfer. 

I contacted Venmo customer service several times to explain the issue and request a refund of the funds, since the money is no longer serving its intended purpose. However, Venmo has repeatedly refused to return my money, stating that the payment " made it to XXXX, '' even though the funds were actually intercepted by the collections process. 

I believe this is an unfair handling of my funds, as Venmo has facilitated the diversion of my payment to an entity I did not authorize. I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau help resolve this issue by having Venmo return my money, as the original purpose of the payment was not fulfilled.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have been trying to 1 ) receive written notice from PayPal directly that PayPal Credit closed my account, and 2 ) determine whether the account can be re-opened ( and not have to open a new account ). On XX/XX/year>, I received an alert from XXXX that my PayPal Credit account was closed. I looked up my XXXX report ; and it said the reason for the closure was " inactive account. '' I did not receive any prior notice - either by e-mail or postal mail - from PayPal that PayPal was going to close my PayPal Credit account. However, I continued to receive e-mails from PayPal about terms and offers related to my PayPal Credit account, as it if it were still active. I tried to send a message by logging into my account on PayPal 's website ; but that was not an option. I used the chatbot ; and it directed me to call PayPal Credit at XXXX. The number matched other numbers on PayPal 's website and social media, so I called it. The rep kept trying to get me to sign up for rewards like a XXXX XXXX device and also told me a gift card for {$100.00} was on its way to me, even though I repeatedly said I am not looking for rewards but to verify info about my PayPal Credit account. She wouldn't help me until I verified my name, address, date of birth, and all 16 digits ( not just the last 4 digts ) of one of my credit cards. After all that, the rep also had my repeat all the information on a recorded line for their " verification officer. '' At the end, she gave me 2 numbers : 1 ) a passcode, and 2 ) a case number, and also said I'd soon be receiving this information by e-mail ( which I haven't yet ). I asked her if she was going to transfer me or have anyone call me back. She told me to call the same # ( XXXX ) back, provide the passcode, and " directory assistance '' would help me with my case. I called back and another rep said the " directory assistance '' line was down and that's why I got redirected to " rewards '' the first time and now with her the second time, then she hung up on me. I called back after a few minutes for a third time ; and I got another rep who tried to go through the whole " rewards '' and " verification '' process with me again, saying that my passcode was invalid ( even though I had the first rep repeat it several times ). I can not reach anyone at PayPal/PayPal Credit . All I have been trying to do is 1 ) receive written notice from PayPal directly that PayPal Credit closed my account, and 2 ) determine whether the account can be re-opened ( and not have to open a new account ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
Google pay hid my balance after changing the app about a year or so ago, changing it from being app accessible to website only. It's not easily accessible on the website either, it took me several minutes and clicks to find the balance. 

Once I found it and verified my bank account, I tried to transfer my {$1400.00} balance out, only to be informed there is a {$1000.00} weekly limit and I need to try again later ( no money actually transferred ). I wait the week they suggested and tried again, same result, no money transferred out. Chat with customer support, and then they inform me of {$200.00} daily transfer limit ( very low, and not listed when I tried my transfer of {$990.00} to stay below the displayed weekly limit of {$1000.00} ). 

So I finally set the {$200.00} transfer out, and it's denied because I have more than 5 payment options on Google pay ( it's an app designed to hold all your credit cards for online payments ).

They have built this system to make it very difficult to withdraw money. Those items above were all design decisions made by one of the XXXX XXXX companies in the world. 

And the kicker, they don't make your cash balance available as a payment option when using Google wallet. They've probably effectively stolen a ton of peoples balances who forgot they had money there after it was hidden from them.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I pre-ordered a TV on XX/XX/2023 through Amazon.com with an expected delivery of XX/XX/XXXX. The TV was actually sold through a company named XXXX. They provided a USPS tracking number which I can track through Amazon. On the day of delivery, I received an invoice and a letter claiming XXXX will reach out at a later date to deliver the TV. 

After contact XXXX for a refund, the person on the phone refused and said they would call me back, which never happened. Amazon support would not refund me because the amount exceeded the support agents refund limit and had to escalate. 

I decided to dispute the charge with my credit card providerChase. Because XXXX provided a tracking number for the invoice, Chase has decided that the transaction was valid and not their problem. 

I eventually received my refund, but now Chase is re-billing me the amount, claiming that they front-ed me the amount charged and are trying to get their money back. They also point to my refund from Amazon in my statements as the credit provided by Chase during the dispute. I appealed the decision and provided an email from Amazon indicating they refunded the amount, but Chase has denied the appeal and will not respond to further appeal attempts.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, am verifying that this is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and there is no need to ask for validation. 

RE : You violated the United States Code Law 15 U.S Code 1681 a ( 4 ) Consumer Right to privacy You are reporting fraudulent accounts that aren't actually mine, which is an infringement of my privacy. Congress said I have the right to decide what I deem private. I deem my hard inquiry and account information to be private and I DO NOT WANT THIS INFORMATION SHARED ON MY CREDIT REPORT.

FDCPA 807 misleading false reporting THE INFORMATION YOU ARE REPORTING WOULD LEAD A FUTURE CREDITOR TO BELIEVE I APPLIED FOR ALL THESE INQUIRIES & accounts, when in reality it wasn't me, it was a scammer. Reporting these false things is very misleading. You are in violation because you did not witness me sign for these inquiries or accounts, so you can't actually verify that they are accurate, but yet you still reported these things to my credit report which goes against the FCRA laws for FAIRNESS.

15 USC 1681 n Civil liability for willful noncompliance You willfully accepted this credit information about me without verifying with your own two eyes that it was me who applied for this credit. Willful compliance is punishable up to {$1000.00} per violation.

18 U.S. Code 1028A - Aggravated identity theft You shared my information with numerous creditors without getting my consent first. you are criminally liable for aggravated identity theft which is punishable for up to 2 years.

15 U.S. Code 6802 ( b ) 1 ( ) ( a ) ( A ) ( B ) ( C ) - Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information DIDN'T DISCLOSE TO ME THAT I HAD THE RIGHT TO OPT OUT OF THIS INFORMATION BEING SHARED. THAT WAS VERY deceptive OF YOU. You never explained to me that I can exercise a nondisclosure option. I feel like my consumer rights have been violated, and I have been taken advantage of.

FDCPA 8012 furnishing deceptive forms You furnished these inaccurate inquiries and accounts as if they were accurate when they were never validated according to GAAP, so you don't even know if these accounts are accurate, but yet you still took it upon yourself to report this inaccurate information.

Also, you reported that I owe a 'debt ', but nowhere on my credit report do I see a Negative balance, ( I don't see a negative sign in front of any numbers, only positive ). By you telling me I owe a " debt '', but reporting positive balances to my credit report is very deceptive.

15 U.S. Code 1692f. Unfair practices A debt collector may not use unfair or unconscionable means to collect or attempt to collect any debt. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct a violation of this section : ( 1 ) The collection of any amount ( including any interest, fee, charge, or expense incidental to the principal obligation ) unless such amount is expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law.

There is no law that says I have to pay a bill.

( 8 ) Using any language or symbol, other than the debt collector 's address, on any envelope when communicating with a consumer by use of the mails or by telegram, except that a debt collector may use his business name if such name does not indicate that he is in the debt collection business.

This company sent letters to me with a LOGO on it instead of their address. That is a SYMBOL that they are a debt Collection business.

15 U.S. Code 1602 - Definitions and rules of construction ( e ) The term " person '' means a natural person or an organization.

( f ) The term " credit '' means the right granted by a creditor to a debtor to defer payment of debt or to incur debt and defer its payment.

Under 15 USC 1681s-2 this agency is in violation because they furnished information relating to me to the consumer that was inaccurate. I told them that this was inaccurate and they still reported it to my credit report.

I AM THE ORIGINAL CREDITOR AND I DO NOT GRANT YOU THE RIGHT TO DEFER ANY PAYMENTS TO ME. 15 U.S Code 1681 a ( 4 ) Consumer Right to privacy You are reporting very private matters on my credit report. The FCRA says that the consumer has sole say so over matters I deem to be private to me. I happen to find matters about where I APPLIED TO, AND WHO I " OWE '' MONEY TO, to be very private. By you sharing this information, I have developed a very bad Paranoia that I have to take medication for. You are liable for all damages that I suffered because of your illegal activities.

FDCPA 806 harassment in abuse I feel very harassed and abused by your actions. I already contacted the creditors and told them that these accounts were inaccurate, but they still reported negatively to my credit report without my consent. Every time I log in and check my credit report and see these inaccurate items on my credit report, I feel much abused. Creditors keep calling and sending letters to me about these mysterious " debts ' that are not validated by the original creditor, which makes me feel very harassed.

Section 1581a ( 3 ) defines Identity Theft as fraud committed using identifying information of another person.

These creditors illegally obtained my information without my true consent and they obtained credit from other financial institutions using my information. This is identity theft.

15 U.S. Code 1692b ( 2 ). Acquisition of location information Any debt collector communicating with any person other than the consumer for the purpose of acquiring location information about the consumer shall- ( 2 ) Not state that such a consumer owes any debt ; but yet these debt collectors contacted these third-party credit reporting agencies with my information including my address ( location ) and they told them I owed a " debt '' that they reported to my credit report illegally.

15 U.S. Code 1666b. Timing of payments Nowhere in the TILA, FCRA, FDCPA does it define a Late Payment, but yet you are reporting " late payments '' to my credit report. that is very inaccurate and deceptive. Let 's not forget, it is your job to only report accurate Information. You are breaking FCRA LAWS.

15 U.S. Code 1605 - Determination of finance charge 15 USC 1605 defines a finance charge as the sum of all charges in a consumer credit transaction.

15 USC 1692d ( 1 ) A debt collector may not engage in any conduct the natural consequence of which is to harass, oppress, or abuse any person in connection with the collection of a debt. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct is a violation of this section : ( 1 ) The use or threat of XXXXXXXX or other criminal means to harm the physical person, reputation, or property of any person.

This bad debt that is furnished to my credit report is ruining my reputation, and it is defamation of character. attached my consumer report as an exhibit.

15 U.S. Code 1692j -Furnishing Certain Deceptive Forms I am the original creditor. I am not participating in this collection of debt, so any contract that I signed is a violation of 15 USC 1692j 15 USC 1692h- Multiple Debts If payments were made on an alleged debt that was not valid. I request the return of those payments to be mailed to me by check.

15 U.S. Code 1692g - Validation of debts 1 am the original creditor, ONLY I CAN VALIDATE ANY DEBTS. I do not validate these debts or accounts. You tried to trick me into thinking you are the original creditor when in reality, ONLY I CAN EXTEND CREDIT so therefore I am the original creditor. These debts don't exist, they must be removed.

15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Under 15 U.S Code 1681b permissible purposes of consumer reports I never gave you any written consent to report anything on my consumer report no consent is identity theft.

I, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the natural person did not consent to, authorize nor benefit from any of the following inquiries OR accounts.

They are inaccurate, please block and remove them. I already filled out FTC reports # 163130449, which is attached. My identity was stolen and fraudulent inaccurate accounts were applied for in my name without my consent. Also, these credit reporting agencies reported this false misleading information on my credit, which goes against the FRA laws., I understand that under 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 you must complete this reinvestigation AND BLOCK OR UPDATE ALL information.

RESULTING FROM identity theft within 4 days of receipt of this letter. If you leave these items on my credit report, then THAT IS AGAINST THE LAW. You will be criminally and civilly liable for all the fees listed in my invoice attached. Please remove all fraudulent accounts as I have no knowledge of any of these accounts due to the Equifax & XXXX data breach/ identity theft. All are being investigated by the FTC and CFPB.

According to FCRA 605B this information must be blocked immediately until the investigation is over.

Also 15 USC 1681n defines Civil liability for willful noncompliance in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; I will accept payment in the form of a check. Please compensate me within 24 hours of receiving this dispute letter.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681g I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of the request concerning the accounts that you are reporting on my credit report.

Under 15 USC 1681b - permissible purpose of consumer reports THE LAW CLEARLY STATES ( a ) In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

After a few hours I was told that it had been completed. Two days later however the receiving bank still has not received it. 
I spoke to MULTIPLE call agents, In the online banking department and in the fraud department to figure out what was going on. Absolutely No one informed me that my wire was being held up because I needed to verify my fathers identity. Not only his identity but his place of birth and nationality. Why? because his name was in the memo. Only my fathers name was flagged and not my husbands. My fathers name is XXXX XXXX and my husbands name is XXXX XXXX. I absolutely feel like it was held up due to the discrimination against my fathers name. 
I was on the phone with your customer service representative for over XXXX hours trying to figure out what was going on and all I was told was that it was completed. When I asked to be transferred to the wire department I was told that they would not take my call. So I hung up and immediately called them directly and thats when they informed me why it was being held. After 3 days of calling and XXXX hour long phone call NONE of your other representative told me this. ABSOLUTELY NONE. I went into the bank today to verify as i was advised to by your representative and AGAIN i was told the same issue that they have no idea what is going on and why. My funds still have not been released, They can not provide me with a Federal Reference number that I have requested MULTIPLE times. 
If I had been told by any of your representatives that the reason my wire was being held up was because I needed to verify my fathers identity and his immigration status I would have done it IMMEDIATELY. 
I was wiring funds to a title company. The fact that your company chose to hold my funds and flag my wire simply because of my fathers name is absolutely discrimination. There was absolutely no hold or verification needed for my husband whose name sounded white. But since my fathers name sounded XXXX it was held. 
Your customer service representative have been less then helpful and ive been given the run around for 3 days! 3! This is absolutely ridiculous. I was scheduled to close on my house XX/XX/XXXX and send the funds to close on XX/XX/XXXX! Had I known the reasoning behind why it would have been resolved the same day but absolutely NONE the customer representatives are on the same page and can tell me where my money is. Im told by one representative that its completed just to be told by the wire department that its flagged and I need to verify my fathers identity.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Sometime in XXXX, Citibank closed my credit card account without warning while I was actively making payments. I contacted them multiple times asking for an explanation, and no one provided a clear or valid reason. I never received any written notice of closure or charge-off. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I began receiving harassing phone calls from a debt collector using the number XXXX, claiming to be collecting on behalf of Citibank. They stated that the account had been placed into collections, and the amount they claimed I owed was higher than my original credit limit, which I believe is inaccurate and possibly unlawful. 

I have never received any written notice from the collector within 5 days of initial contact, as required under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I requested full written debt validation, including : XXXX. The original account balance breakdown XXXX. Proof the collector is legally authorized to collect on behalf of Citibank XXXX. The date of charge-off XXXX. Documentation explaining the inflated balance XXXX. A written reason for why the account was closed I also demanded that all communications be made in writing due to the repeated, unwanted, and harassing phone calls. 

These actions including failure to validate the debt, harassing phone calls, and potentially misreporting the amount owed appear to violate the FDCPA and may constitute willful violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) if this debt is reported to the credit bureaus without proper validation.

I am documenting all contact, and if this issue is not resolved immediately, I am prepared to pursue legal action for damages under both the FDCPA and FCRA. I am asking for : 1. Immediate withdrawal of this debt from collections 2. Written confirmation that it will not be reported to any credit bureau XXXX. Written notice from Citibank explaining the account closure I am currently unable to pay this alleged debt, especially given that it is disputed, potentially inflated, and was placed into collections under questionable and possibly unlawful circumstances. 

The calls from the collector have been aggressive and frequent, which I consider harassing. I requested that all future communication be done in writing. I'm very concerned this will appear on my credit report and damage my credit score even further, despite trying to resolve the matter in good faith.

Please do not keep money in Venmo or use it to pay for goods and services as they will not resolve your issue whatsoever.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have had a Capital One credit card for a while. In XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, I noticed charges that I believed were not made by me. I disputed the charges and a new card was sent to me. I did not activate that card ( no 2 ). I discovered that a number of charges were made to that card when I received a bill. When I realized something was going on, I notified Capital One and locked my account. I filled out and submitted all of the documents that Capital One requested. Ultimately, these charges were determined to be fraudulent. While I was trying to resolve the issues with card no 2, a new card was issued to me. This card was sent to my family post office box. I did not request this card, either. I believe the card was sent to that po box because I had requested the documents I needed to dispute the charges on card no 2 be sent there. At this point, I was concerned that someone was intercepting my mail and had activated card no 2. I did not activate that card No 3. However, it was used to purchase {$7000.00} in product from one vendor. Initially, without my requesting, Capital One reversed that charge, but then reinstated. At the time of the transaction, I had received an email notification indicating the possibility of a fraudulent charge and I acknowledged that the charge was fraudulent. I have notified Capital One that I believe I am a victim of identity theft and fraud. There were several strange incidents around this charge. 1. the fraud alert, 2. there was an effort to pay the bill from a bank that is not mine, ( this was reversed ), XXXX there have been attempts to log into the account which were not made my me ( I have tried calling about this but was told there was no way to trace it ), 4. once when I tried to log in, another person 's name came up although I had saved my log in information. I have tried to resolve this with Capital One, i have called many many time and have not been able to resolve this problem.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern, On XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted a claim to Capital One regarding a fraudulent charge on my card that dates back to XXXX XXXX the amount of XXXX from a company that is called XXXX XXXX XXXX  This is my first experience with such a serious issue, and I was unaware that I had fallen victim to fraud. An FBI agent who contacted me informed me that multiple accounts of mine had been compromised. I indicated that the individual or company responsible has been federally charged and provided a police report I filed earlier this year, along with court documents that clearly outline how the company has defrauded several credit cards, totaling over {$230000.00}. Despite this evidence, my claim with Capital One was denied. 

The subsequent denial I received stated that my claim was rejected because I continued to make payments on the account after the fraudulent transaction occurred. I explained that I made these payments to avoid my account going into collections, which would jeopardize my account status. I have experienced this with another account, negatively affecting my credit, which is crucial for making significant purchases in my life. 

Despite my persistent efforts and concerns, Capital One denied my claim based on date restrictions. Initially, I accepted this decision until I spoke with a close friend who is also a victim in this case. When she filed a claim for a charge dated XX/XX/XXXX, her claim was approved without issue. I reached out to Capital One to highlight this inconsistency in their handling of claims, but they remain unwilling to review the information I provided. I kindly request assistance in resolving this matter.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Urgent Request for Investigation and Full Refund of Fraudulent Transactions Linked to My PayPal and XXXX XXXX XXXX  Accounts Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to seek the assistance of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) in addressing a serious issue involving unauthorized transactions through my PayPal account , which subsequently affected my linked XXXX XXXX XXXX  account. Despite attempts to resolve this matter directly with both PayPal and XXXX XXXX XXXX, my disputes have been unjustly denied, leaving me without restitution for the significant financial loss I have suffered. Summary of the Incident : As a loyal PayPal user for over five years, I was alarmed to discover that my IRS tax refund had been illicitly withdrawn in multiple transactions, each exceeding {$100.00}. This fraudulent activity was not immediately apparent to PayPal 's security systems, leading to a significant breach of my financial security. Upon discovering these unauthorized transactions, I acted swiftly to contact the recipients, informing them of the situation, which resulted in the return of the funds to my PayPal account. These funds were then transferred back to my XXXX XXXX XXXX  account. Despite these efforts to mitigate the damages, both PayPal and XXXX XXXX XXXX  have denied my claims for a refund. Points of Dispute : Flawed Transaction History Analysis : My dispute with PayPal was denied under the pretense that the transactions matched my usual activity. This ignores the reality that the transactions were unauthorized, highlighting a significant oversight in PayPal 's fraud detection measures. Recurring Security Breaches : This incident is the third instance of unauthorized access to my account, underscoring a recurring vulnerability that PayPal has failed to adequately address. I informed PayPal that the transactions starting around XX/XX/XXXX were unauthorized transactions. The account that my funds were being transferred to has been sending money to their account and then when I reported it they sent the money back two times. I did not file a claim initially because I received my funds back on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX from this account. I have been using PayPal for years and never experienced any issues so I did not understand what was going on but since my funds were returned I did not file a claim at the time. Then on XX/XX/XXXX, the same name started receiving money from my PayPal account again. Starting with {$50.00} transfers on XX/XX/XXXX and moving up to {$100.00} transfers and {$150.00} transfers until XX/XX/XXXX when I noticed and filled the claim. PayPal has denied my claim stating no unauthorized use and transaction history ignoring the fact that every transfer to this account has been unauthorized and my PayPal account has been hacked and accessed somehow. I have done my research and have concluded that the people running this scam understand the PayPal system so they know to create transaction history by pulling money from someone's account and sending it back a few times so the system thinks that the accounts have a relationship. After that is done they drain a person 's account and if they receive enough funds before it is reported and they get the money out of their account the scam has worked. XXXX XXXX XXXX  's Non-compliance : Despite having a zero-liability policy for unauthorized transactions, XXXX XXXX XXXX has also denied my claim, refusing to refund the fraudulently withdrawn funds. This failure to honor their policy compounds the financial injury I have experienced. Proactive Security Measures : In response to these breaches, I have severed the link between my PayPal and XXXX XXXX XXXX  accounts to prevent further unauthorized access, albeit after the fact. This decision reflects my diminished trust in both entities ' security protocols. Request for Resolution : In light of XXXX XXXX XXXX 's refusal to honor its zero-liability policy and PayPal 's inadequate response to this breach of security, I am requesting a full refund of the compromised amounts from both institutions. I urge the CFPB to initiate a thorough investigation into the fraudulent activity associated with my accounts and the subsequent handling of my disputes by PayPal and XXXX XXXX XXXX. Your immediate attention to this matter is critical, not only for the recovery of my funds but also to address potential systemic issues within these financial services that jeopardize consumer protection and trust. I am fully prepared to cooperate with your investigation and provide any additional information required. I appreciate your prompt response to this urgent matter. Around {$2100.00} was taken. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Email : XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
**Subject : Formal Complaint Against Dave for Violation of Consumer Rights ( Case Number : XXXX ) ** **Dear CFPB, ** I am filing a formal complaint against Dave for its mishandling of my dispute claim regarding unauthorized transactions on my account ( Case Number : XXXX ). Despite my multiple efforts to report these fraudulent transactions, Dave has failed to properly investigate or resolve the issue, and has denied my claim on false grounds. This complaint outlines the regulatory violations and the mishandling of my dispute, which has resulted in a denial of my consumer rights under several regulations. 

# # # **Details of Dispute Mishandling and Unauthorized Transactions : ** XXXX. XXXX XXXX, XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, CA XXXX {$5.00} - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, CA - {$19.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, CA - {$25.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, CA XXXX {$16.00} XXXX. **May XXXX, XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, CA XXXX {$25.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA - {$2.00} - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, CA - {$25.00} - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, CA - {$160.00} XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, CA - {$10.00} ( two charges ) 5. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXA - {$13.00} ( two charges ) Total Unauthorized Amount : ** $ XXXX # # # **Ignored Initial Dispute Attempts : ** - I initially contacted Dave on XXXX XXXX, XXXX to dispute these unauthorized charges. Despite multiple emails, my efforts were ignored, and the support team failed to follow up on my concerns. 

- I also contacted Dave on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, using my alternative email ( XXXX ) to request assistance with the same dispute. Again, no response was received, and no action was taken to resolve my claim. 

Additionally, Dave incorrectly stated that I reside in **Orlando , FL**, which was used as justification to deny my claim. However, my correct and registered address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX. I have never lived in XXXX, which further indicates that my claim was denied based on false information. 

# # # **Regulatory Violations : ** The mishandling of my dispute has resulted in several serious regulatory violations : 1. **Regulation E ( Electronic Fund Transfer Act - EFTA ) : ** - **Failure to Investigate in a Timely Manner : ** Regulation E requires financial institutions to investigate disputes within **10 business days** and issue **provisional credit** if further investigation is necessary. Dave ignored my claim and did not conduct a proper investigation within the required timeframe. 
- **Failure to Provide Provisional Credit : ** Even when more time is required for investigation, Regulation E mandates provisional credit be provided to the consumer within **10 business days**. I never received any provisional credit for the disputed transactions. 

2. **Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Regulations : ** - **Failure to Provide Transparency : ** Under CFPB guidelines, institutions must maintain clear communication with consumers during dispute resolution. Dave failed to keep me informed of the status of my claim and ignored my repeated attempts to dispute the fraudulent charges. 

3. **Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Data Security Guidelines : ** - **Breach of Data Security : ** My personal and financial information was stolen and used for fraudulent transactions, suggesting that Dave failed to properly secure my data in violation of the FTCs data security guidelines. 

4. **Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) : ** - **Failure to Address the Dispute Fairly : ** The FCBA mandates fair treatment of consumers disputing charges. Daves mishandling of my claim, denial based on false information, and lack of proper investigation likely constitute violations of my rights under the FCBA. 

# # # **Request for Immediate Action : ** I request that the CFPB take action to ensure that Dave properly addresses my dispute and resolves the following issues : - **Thorough Reinvestigation** of my claim, including the fraudulent transactions that were incorrectly categorized as undisputed. 
- **Refund of $ XXXX for the unauthorized transactions. 
- Issuance of **provisional credit** in accordance with **Regulation E**. 
- Assurance that **accurate information** ( my correct address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX ) is used for any future claims. 

I have attached copies of all correspondence between myself and Dave customer support, which demonstrate my repeated efforts to report these fraudulent charges and Daves failure to properly address them. I am also attaching documentation that proves my correct address and the fact that I was not in XXXX when the fraudulent charges occurred. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt investigation and resolution of my complaint. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX FL XXXX XXXX : XXXX Email : XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/year>

Consumer complaint narrative: To Whom It May Concern : I am a XXXX woman, and I am writing to file a complaint regarding improper denial of medallion signature guarantee services from Navy Federal Credit Union ( NFCU ), a securities transfer agent ; Branch Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX ). As a long-time account holder at NFCU, I should have had access to authentication services of my personal signature for Securities I need to execute as per the U.S. SEC Medallion Standards that banks ( security transfer agents ) in the program must follow. On XX/XX/, I visited the branch listed above and spoke to manager/vice-president representative ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) seeking to have my signature guaranteed for endorsing a NOTE ( security ) for a securities transfer. As stated on the medallion requirements, the bank ( securities transfer agents ) simply needed to : 1 ) Validate my identity via a valid government-issued I.D . ( which I provided and to verify my account at NFCU ), and 2 ) Stamp my signature to certify its authenticity. However, XXXX refused service to me and said NFCU does not offer anything related to medallion signature guarantees or guarantees on NOTES ( securities ) and that NFCU issued a publication stating this 2-months ago. I indicated that as an account holder, I have no records of such publication, and when I requested a copy to inspect said publication, XXXX refused to supply me with a copy. XXXX actions on behalf of NFCU violates the SECs medallion signature guarantee program rules. XXXX refused to show me any supporting documentation or publication or policies or forms related to the types of NFCU medallion guarantee services they provide per my request which severely lacks transparency and, XXXX and XXXX  equity as a securities transfer agency. In fact, XXXX said the following to me yeah, we turn a lot of these requests away for a medallion signature guarantee because people come in with the wrong documents. We have not provided a medallion signature guarantee in like 6-months or longer. This denial of my basic request as a customer of NFCU left me penalized, costing me unnecessary hassle and financial constraints finding medallion signature guarantee services elsewhere that I should have had full eligibility for on XX/XX/ at NFCU. My case warrants regulatory investigation and penalties since service were improperly denied. As an eligible NFCU account holder and member, NFCU needs to justify why I can not avail medallion signature guarantees of my signature on legal negotiable instruments ( securities - NOTE ) under established medallion signature programs it governs. Comparable to a public notary, the notary doesn't authenticate the legal validity of the specimen per se, but it authenticates the signature of the person that is endorsing the contract as valid and true. The medallion signature guarantee is guaranteeing my signature is authentic as I endorse it on a Security. Per 31 CFR 363.43, I respectfully request the CFPB to compel NFCU to explain this denial, provide transparency on NFCU medallion signature guaranteed policies, demonstrate I was not unfairly deprived of this standard service as a XXXX woman, provide me the medallion signature guarantee I need, and deliver training to ensure equal and fair access of this service to rendered to all regardless of XXXX XXXX XXXX  moving forward. Please let me know if any additional details on this concerning violation would help launch remediation. Thank you for your assistance upholding crucial investor access protections. With gratitude, XXXX XXXX, NFCU Account Holder

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
am filing a complaint against Cash App ( Block , Inc. ) due to inadequate customer service and unfair practices, which violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ). Specifically, Cash App failed to take timely and effective measures to prevent and address fraud on their platform, leaving my account vulnerable and unprotected.

Furthermore, their dispute resolution process was unfair and deceptive, as they did not comply with error resolution requirements under the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E. These actions have caused significant inconvenience and financial loss, and I seek appropriate redress.

I am filing a complaint against Cash App ( Block , Inc. ) due to inadequate customer service, unfair practices, and failure to comply with federal consumer protection laws, including the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ), and Regulation E.

1. Failure to Prevent and Address Fraud : Cash App failed to implement adequate security measures to protect my account from unauthorized transactions. Despite notifying them of fraudulent activity, they did not take timely or effective action to mitigate the risk or reimburse unauthorized transactions, violating 15 U.S.C. 1693g of the EFTA, which limits consumer liability for unauthorized transfers.

2. Unfair and Deceptive Dispute Resolution Process : Cash Apps dispute resolution process was misleading and did not comply with Regulation E ( 12 C.F.R. 1005.11 ), which requires financial institutions to investigate errors promptly and provide provisional credit when necessary. They failed to conduct a thorough and good-faith investigation, leaving me without proper recourse or reimbursement for disputed transactions. 
3. Lack of Transparency and Communication : Their customer service was unresponsive and failed to provide clear, timely information regarding the status of my dispute, violating CFPA ( 12 U.S.C. 5531 ( a ) ), which prohibits unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( UDAAP ). 

These failures have caused me significant financial loss, stress, and inconvenience. I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau take appropriate action to hold Cash App accountable, ensure compliance with federal regulations, and provide proper redress for affected consumers.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/year>, and imposter texted me from a XXXX digit phone number with a fraud alert regarding a XXXX transaction that I did not make. After saying XXXX that this was not an authorized transaction, I received a phone call from a phone number that was masked as Chase Bank stating that there was fraud on my account. They had me change my log in information, and sent me through the prompts of deactivating my phone number from XXXX. Meanwhile, my husband called Chase bank stating that his wife ( me ) was on the phone with someone stating they were from the bank regarding fraud. The Chase employee opened the account and said that someone was working on the account, and told him there was no worry. The scammer had me send them a XXXX digit XXXX verification code, which in turn allowed the scammer to take over my XXXX account. I transferred {$2000.00} to XXXX of my XXXX recipients and they informed me to have the XXXX recipient send it back ( that this would trigger a XXXX XXXX for my fraud claim ). I never received the money back, and it did not show up on my account but the chase banker ( scammer ) said it would show up in XXXX hours. They stated that whoever had my account was attempting to XXXX scam my account again, and had me send another {$2000.00} to a different XXXX recipient. The new XXXX recipient was informed to send the money back to me, which I didnt receive again. My husband called Chase bank AGAIN and that banker informed him to have me immediately hang up. I filed a claim in person with Chase bank regarding the fraud, they did an investigation and stated that I allowed the money to be sent back and forth, and it was my own negligence. I opened the claim for further review a second time and was denied and never received any of my money back. I stated that the first {$2000.00} sent would have been negligence on my part, but when a Chase Customer Service Representative states that someone is working in my account and that there was nothing to be concerned about, I used that information and continued to send the additional {$2000.00}. Chase had no regard for their negligence in this matter and were not concerned with getting my money back or finding the scammer who did this to me so I could file charges.

This has been an ongoing case for over 3 years with no recourse.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX, I fell victim to an online scam by a company that was posing as a legitimate business. They copied the businesses website perfefctly and made the website plural ( by adding an " s '' and looked very legitimate ). 

After submitting my claim and written explanation to Wells Fargo bank, along with evidence provided by the legitimate business that clearly explains that no payments were received by them, and they are fully aware of the scam that is taking place, WF bank sided with the fraudulent business. 

Wells fargo claims with zero supporting evidence to me as their client, that their department called the business line and spoke to someone who then told them that I did not cancel my order in time. This of course, is all very untrue. I filed the claim WF as soon as I realized the scam was occurring and of course no legitimate phone numbers were made available to consumers, but apparently, they knew when a bank was calling ( thats why scammers are experts! ) After decades of banking with WF, the fraud department sided with the fraudulent business. 

Below is the email correspondence submitted as a request to the bank to re-open the claim after the bank firstly denied it. 

" Hello, It has been brought to my attention that my fraudulent case claim has been denied. Claim # XXXX. I would like to reopen this claim with new documentation ( see attached ). 

The attached documentation is correspondence with XXXX admitting that there is ZERO evidence of a purchase being made and their companies ADMITTANCE to a fraudulent site they are aware of. This site, XXXX is no longer available online, however, this was the web address of the site that was set up to look like the XXXX XXXX and XXXX platform. 

I do expect proper action to be taken. Sincerely, XXXX '' Evidence submitted is as follows : " Hello, TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN, We do not have record of an order for XXXX XXXX and are not in any way affiliated with, XXXXXXXX or any other vendor. There are several fake sites and accounts advertising our product at a very low price. Please be aware, these are a SCAM. We are working to have these reported and removed as quickly as possible. Please help us and the XXXX community by reporting these ads as scams. Please note, we only sell our boards directly through our website, XXXX, our store on XXXX, and our one Retail Store here in XXXX XXXX. If you click on an ad and it brings you to any site other than XXXX, please know that XXXX has NO affiliation with it and this is fraudulent. Please let us know if there is anything additional we can assist with, our apologies for any inconvenience this has caused. 
Thanks for supporting XXXX, please let us know if there is anything further we can help with or any questions we can answer and we will be happy to assist. 

XXXX XXXX '' Total amount {$1700.00} submitted over 14 transactions. The scammers lead you to believe that they bargain is a one time bargain, however, you can make multiple purchases. As a watersports business owner, I was eager to replace equipment like paddle boards, paddles, kayak seats, etc., which is why I chose to purchase so many things. 

Invoice # XXXX {$130.00} XXXX {$120.00} XXXX {$120.00} XXXX {$120.00} XXXX {$120.00} XXXX {$120.00} XXXX {$120.00} XXXX {$120.00} XXXX {$120.00} XXXX {$120.00} XXXX {$110.00} XXXX {$110.00} XXXX {$140.00} XXXX {$140.00}. 

I tried to attach the invoices from XXXX, but it will no longer allow me to because XXXX was able to determine that it was a scam ( see attached photo ). Also screen shots of my XXXX account that show the payments were made and a few examples of what the email invoice looks like as well.
