Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a correspondence regarding closed complaint case # XXXX. In Complaint Case # XXXX, when I opened one checking and one saving account on the same day, I expected to receive a {$300.00} new checking promotional bonus and a {$520.00} new savings promotional bonus. However, after waiting the required 90 days, I only received the {$300.00} promotional bonus for my new checking account, but the {$520.00} still hasn't arrived. 
I contacted Wells Fargo three times seeking answers. 
The first contact was via phone with a customer representative and I was told that I would not have the required balance at the end of the first period. This is not true. The second contact was with the branch manager in XXXX CA, XXXX XXXX, and was told that I was only eligible for one of the two promotional bonuses, under the terms " You have received any other consumer savings offer bonus or promotional rate that required a bonus offer code within the past 12 months. She even called the authorities and spoke with a representative who confirmed what she had just told me. I told her that even though what you said was true, why did Wells Fargo chose to give me a bonus of {$300.00}? instead of {$520.00}. There is a difference of {$220.00} between the two. She said she could send a message asking why Wells Fargo gave me {$300.00} instead of {$520.00}. She kept telling me that even though I opened a savings account and a checking account at the same time, I only can get one of two promotional bonuses. She ruled out other possibilities such as slow payment processing. and insisted that I just could get one promotional bonus within 12 months. 
I completely disagreed with XXXX. So my third contact with Wells Fargo was through efpb. After more than two months of waiting for further research from them, XXXX XXXX from Wells Fargo sent me an email on XX/XX/XXXX stating, " After further research, we were able to confirm that you were eligible for a promotion bonus offer for of {$520.00}, when opening a Wells Fargo XXXX Savings account. '' However, they were unable to deposit the {$520.00} into my new savings account because I did not keep the account open within 30 days of meeting all the offer requirements. 
XXXX also said : " We also spoke to the branch XXXX and they advised that they offered to look into the missing bonus payments but you requested closure. '' I totally disagreed with XXXX. The reasons are as follows.

General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear US Bank, After exhausting all reasonable avenues for resolution within your customer service channels, XXXX  and CFPB, I am formally requesting arbitration to seek a fair and expeditious settlement. 

Specific Issues and Potential Violations : Over the past several months, I have encountered the following significant problems with my account : Non-receipt of a replacement debit card : Despite repeated requests and assurances, I have not received a replacement debit card, causing significant inconvenience and hindering my ability to access my funds. This constitute a violation of the Electronic Funds Transfer ( EFT ) Act, which requires financial institutions to conduct electronic fund transfers in a timely and accurate manner. 

Unexplained closure of my account : Without prior notice or explanation, my account was abruptly closed, effectively limiting my access to my own funds. This action potentially violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which imposes specific requirements on banks before taking adverse actions against a customer 's account. 

Lack of transparency and unresponsive customer service : Despite numerous attempts to resolve these issues through customer service channels, I have been met with inadequate responses, transfers between representatives, and a persistent lack of clarity regarding the reasons behind the account closure and ongoing review. This lack of transparency may violate the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), which requires creditors to communicate fairly and accurately with consumers. 

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The FCRA does indeed regulate how banks and other entities use and report credit information. Before taking adverse actions based on information in a consumer report ( such as closing an account ), the bank must provide the consumer with a notice, including the specific information upon which the adverse action is based. The consumer has the right to review and dispute this information. 

State Laws : These laws vary by state but may prohibit unfair or deceptive practices, ensuring that banks follow proper procedures and provide consumers with notice before closing an account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX this year, I was on a business trip to XXXX XXXX , USA. Due to work reasons, I needed to extend my stay in the US. I searched for hotels on XXXX and was recommended XXXX to book my room. After booking and submitting my PayPal information, I received notifications from my credit card bank indicating charges. I received two text messages indicating identical charges, and my total credit card balance decreased, which made me suspect a double charge. I immediately reported this to PayPal. Without my consent, PayPal canceled my payment to the hotel booking platform. However, I was unaware that my booking was canceled until the day before I was supposed to check in, when I checked the hotel information and found my reservation had been canceled. Since my hotel booking was non-refundable, I immediately called the hotel platform. The platform advised me to contact PayPal. When I contacted PayPal, they did not resolve the issue. I received an email from the hotel platform and immediately replied, requesting that my reservation not be canceled. I explained that the cancellation was done by PayPal without my consent. Despite my attempts, I never received a response from the hotel platform, only repeated identical email messages from them, which ultimately led to my inability to check into the hotel.

I have made multiple attempts to contact PayPal and submitted my refund request, but to this day, the issue remains unresolved. PayPal has never seriously investigated or understood the problem, merely inquiring about my order with the hotel platform. The cancellation of the order was not initiated by me but was processed by PayPal without my consent, leading to my inability to stay at the hotel. I now demand that PayPal refund the hotel charges for the stay I was unable to complete and apologize for their negligence in handling this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: I filed my taxes with XXXX XXXX and had the funds put into Credit Karma. After funds had been deposited I was getting phone calls at odd hours back to back saying it was credit karma. I looked on my account and nothing looked off, so I contacted CK via phone directly through the app and told them about the phone calls and asked them if they wanted the information that was being sent to me. They told me not to worry about it not to answer or respond that I had nothing to worry about. A week later I started getting text messages along with the phone calls pulled my account and everything looked fine. Then voicemails after voicemails this was around XXXX. Text messages were saying did I authorize this and that charge showing the last 4 digits of an account number that I knew was not mine so I ignored it, was absolutely harassing by now I had to turn my phone off because it was back to back. Within minutes of the calls and texts ending I pulled my account back up and all my money was gone. Contacted CK again and I didnt know what was real or fake anymore was transferred to different departments asking to take a photo with my license and face verified my phone number every time stayed on the phone for hours to be told there was nothing I could do because they were pending charges so I had to wait and call back when they went through. Couple days later they went through spent hours waiting on hold retold the story over and over. Going through my account I noticed under my personal information in the phone number section the phone number only showed the last 4 digits and it was not my number it had been changed but every time I called I was asked to verify my phone number and that was never even noticed by CK which let my information go to whoever and could have been resolved whenever I called to report it the first time. So whenever I was getting phone calls and messages it was from both CK and a scammer and being I was told to ignore it it was the real CK and the scammer at the same time approving the transactions they let it all go through back to back for some AiJeans Cash App. Looking into it MYSELF further I seen a virtual card on my account with the last 4 digits of the card that had been being used the whole time which is different than my physical card, this was never addressed from the CK fraud department as well when speaking to them all they talked about was my physical card more or less accusing me of losing it or letting someone use it. I took pictures of everything from day 1. I was denied the disputes then all of a sudden the money is back in the account and all I have received was they are sorry. I cant even access the funds not because I dont have or even want another card from them and they want to charge me a fee to transfer it out to my bank account which I do not want to link to them. I feel like this is being brushed off and Im not letting it go being my tax information bank information my childrens information from my taxes are all at risk now. Now looking at the account on CK there is no place for phone number information to be edited or added, but I took pictures of the false number at the time and a picture of when I changed it back to my number, so I know they are aware of something and trying to cover it. Something needs to be done!! I have spent weeks now trying to figure out what to do, Ive had to delete every account that I have linked to any money services because I dont trust anything anymore. I couldnt pay my bills, I couldnt get an answer from anyone on what the issue really is. I have been so stressed like Im being stalked, Im well aware of security safety I literally take courses for it in the field of work Im in so I know what the procedures are and this was beyond acceptable it has blown my mind!!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Unjust Overdraft Fee Despite Resolving Negative Balance Before Grace Period Description of the Issue : On XX/XX/XXXX, a transaction of {$2100.00} was processed from my Wells Fargo checking account ( account ending in XXXX ). At the time, the full amount was not available in my account, resulting in a negative balance of {$360.00}. 

To address this, I deposited {$380.00} into my account on XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXXXXXX XXXX  which cleared the negative balance and left a positive balance of approximately {$17.00}. I received an email from Wells Fargo confirming that I had until XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX  to resolve the negative balance to avoid a {$35.00} overdraft fee. Since my account was brought to a positive balance well before the grace period ended, I should not have been charged this fee. 

Despite this, I was charged the {$35.00} overdraft fee on XX/XX/XXXX, even though my account had a positive balance before the deadline. When I contacted Wells Fargo about this issue, they claimed that the fee was due to pending transactions ( e.g., XXXX purchases ). However, these transactions were already reflected in my available balance at the time, meaning the explanation they provided does not justify the fee. 

This is not the first time Wells Fargo has charged unjust overdraft fees on my account. This demonstrates that they are employing deceptive and manipulative banking practices to maximize overdraft fees. Wells Fargo has a history of class-action lawsuits for these same practices, most notably in XXXX, when they were ordered to pay {$200.00} XXXX for manipulating transaction postings to maximize overdraft fees. The current situation reflects that Wells Fargo has refused to comply with fair banking practices and continues to use the same tricky and predatory practices that led to legal action in the past. 

It is clear that Wells Fargo is exploiting its customers by reintroducing these manipulative practices, which were previously deemed unlawful. This is a systemic issue that not only affects me but also likely affects many other Wells Fargo customers. 

Timeline of Events : XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : A transaction of {$2100.00} caused a negative balance of {$360.00}. 
XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : A deposit of {$380.00} was made at XXXXXXXX XXXX, bringing my balance to a positive {$17.00}. 
XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : I received an email stating that I would incur a {$35.00} overdraft fee if the negative balance was not resolved by XXXXXXXX XXXX that day. 
Despite my account being positive well before the deadline, I was charged the {$35.00} fee. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX, XXXX : Wells Fargo representatives explained the fee was due to pending transactions, but their reasoning is flawed as the pending transactions were already deducted from my available balance. 

Why This is Unjust : The email from Wells Fargo clearly states that I would avoid the overdraft fee if my account balance was positive by the grace period deadline of XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I met this requirement. 
Pending transactions, such as XXXX, were already reflected in the available balance when I resolved the negative balance. Wells Fargos explanation is therefore incorrect and misleading.

Wells Fargos behavior demonstrates a refusal to comply with fair banking practices and echoes the same issues from their XXXX class-action lawsuit, where they were penalized for manipulating transaction postings to maximize overdraft fees. 

This fee appears to be the result of a system error or deliberate manipulation, and it violates the terms outlined in their communication. 

Requested Resolution : 1. Immediate Refund : Refund the {$35.00} overdraft fee charged to my account on XX/XX/XXXX. 
2. Investigation into Practices : Investigate Wells Fargos handling of overdraft fees to ensure this does not happen to other customers.

3. Assurance of Compliance : Ensure Wells Fargo adheres to its stated overdraft fee policies and grace period terms moving forward.

Supporting Evidence : Transaction records showing the {$2100.00} debit, the {$380.00} deposit, and my positive balance on XX/XX/XXXX. 
Wells Fargos email detailing the grace period terms and conditions and the amount it refers to.

Screenshots or screen recordings of account activity and balances before and after the grace period. 
Historical information about Wells Fargos XXXX class-action lawsuit and their history of similar unfair practices.

When my scheduled transfer was confirmed on the company 's website, it was listed as occurring XX/XX/XXXX. I assumed this was because XX/XX/XXXX was on a weekend, and did not think much of it. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I logged on to confirm that my transfer took place as expected, and saw that it did not. There was no information that a transfer was processed, scheduled, or canceled. The site was as if I had never requested it. I spoke to a representative from the company who could not help.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Transaction date was XXXX. The amounts of the transactions are {$4300.00} and {$270.00}. 

When I saw these charges on my statement, I immediately contacted Home Depot to dispute these charges.

Home Depot sent me a letter stating that they were conducting an investigation for these charges. I received a final letter from Home Depot letting me know that they have completed their investigation. The letter states that I am still responsible for these fraudulent charges. Not sure what went into the investigation to determine that I am still responsible for charges that I never made. 

I am writing today to continue my efforts in disputing these charges. There were no itemized items on the statement telling me what was actually charged. I dont know if these charges were purchased at the store or online. As you can see my information had been compromised. 

I am requesting that these charges be credited back to my account. I never purchased anything from Home Depot for that amount of money on that day in question. If these charges were purchased in the store, Im sure you have security cameras all over the store. If you go back to that day of the purchases and review the cameras, you will see that I was never in the store. Also, if these items were purchased on-line, where were these items shipped to?

I have been a valued customer of Home Depot for many years. I have always paid my bills on a timely basis. Please continue your review of this fraudulent charge and abate all charges and interest. 

I am concerned that this will impact on my credit rating, which is excellent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The complaint is against PayPal. I have had an account with PayPal for a long time that I rarely have used except maybe 1 or 2 transactions over the life of the account since it was created. They placed my account on a temporary restriction and requested information from me to resolve the account restriction including linkage of a bank account and photo ID. These documents were submitted and accepted when I was logged into my PayPal account. 

Today, I received an email with a receipt indicating a purchase through PayPal that appeared to be a scam. I do not use PayPal. I logged into my account on the legitimate PayPal site to close my account which I was unable to do so. The site indicated that I needed to resolve issues with my account to remove the limitation and could not close or delete any information until that time. I also found the attached notice that stated, " We're permanently limiting your account. You can no longer use PayPal as we've decided to permanently limit your account after review. '' I called PayPal today at XXXX and spoke with XXXX. She stated that PayPal determined that transactions on my account were a security threat to PayPal and its users despite seeing that the account is not used. She stated that I could not close the account or delete any information with the permanent limitation status that she could not override. She would not immediately state the reason that my account was permanently limited but then stated it was due to the photo ID that I submitted upon their request that created the issue but would not tell me anything more. She said that I could submit another photo ID for review. I refused stating that I would not provide any further information since PayPal was not letting me have control over it. She kept referring back to the User Agreement. She could not do anything further. I stated that I would file a complaint with the FTC and CFPB to have my account and all the information deleted from their databases.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have used Venmo somewhat regularly for the past 5-7 years. I've since stopped using it as my main vehicle for sending money due to how poorly my account was managed. Over the last 3 attempts to accept/send money, my account has been Suspended for " Suspicious Activity ''. I needed to add a bank account to my profile as my debit card that had been attached was hacked and the number was no longer usable. I was able to get a small loan for my insurance and bills that I need to pay, and if I were to use any other company, I would've had my phone paid and car insurance. Well now I can't get home from work and I need to wait 3-5 business days for them to verify that the account is mine although I have taken a picture of my license and sending to them, which in itself felt sketchy and unprofessional. It seemed that the verification software was a 3rd Party service, which means I have no clue where my data is going. It's unfair when there are at least 5 major organizations I can choose and the one I choose disables any ability to send and receive money. I thought we might have fixed the issue the last time I called, but nobody seems to take action to help me. I've never complained like this before, but I feel taken advantage of and on the count that this has happened 3 times has sent me over. I just wanted an explanation and for my funds to not be frozen. This is happening to so many people. With major privacy concerns, terrible customer service and strategy integration, scams, and a variety of other things, ( my problem being at the top of everybody 's list ) has gone unpunished for too long. I hope this message brings people awareness to show that there are better options with a customer-first approach that you should use rather than this terrible terrible organization.

I was locked out of my Capital One accounts and my money was frozen and not accessible to me. I callled to verify my account information and try to get clarification on why this happened. When I called the wait was about 10 minutes, I spoke to a representative and they asked me a host of questions, including how many devices do you use, how do you log into your account etc. I had to upload my State ID to verify my identity, after that they asked me if I recently forgot my password or log in. I responded no, I did not. That I changed my password because it was found in a data leak. A few minutes later the representative stated based on the information they gathered, they couldnt have me as a customer anymore and after an investigation is completed I will be contacted about when my funds will be released to me in a check through the mail. No time table was given, no follow up information was given. I told the representative that I needed access to my checking account balance and couldnt wait for this decision, for medical bills for XXXX treatments and rent, I asked is there anyway I can transfer the money or take it out somewhere. They stated that the final decision was made to end the relationship, then they stated that a final decision would be made soon, again no timetable. I asked if I can speak to someone above them about the matter, first he stated yes then said no there wasnt. I asked multiple times if I can speak to anyone else about this, he stated no. My accounts were then blocked from me, denying me access to my funds and balance, until some unknown time or date in the future. I feel confident that I proved my identity and followed all the necessary steps to be allowed access to my funds.

Chase Bank closed both of my and my wifes XXXX account without providing a clear explanation. I was notified that the account was XXXX  due to suspected fraud, but there is no unusual or unauthorized activity in my transaction history. I have called customer service multiple times and visited a local branch, but no one has been able to tell me the specific reason for the closure.

I formally requested a written explanation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Equal Credit Opportunity Act, but I have not received a response within a reasonable timeframe. I am concerned that Chase may have reported false or misleading information to consumer reporting agencies ( e.g., XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ), which could impact my ability to open accounts at other banks. 

I request that Chase provide a clear, written explanation for the closure, and confirm whether any negative reporting has been made to third-party consumer reporting agencies. If such reports exist, I ask for documentation and the opportunity to dispute any inaccurate information. 

Please help ensure Chase responds in a timely and transparent manner.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Chase closed my business account and froze the fund available ( {$49000.00} ) in XXXX. 

Upon discovering this, I called up the customer support who asked me to collect the final check for {$49000.00} from a Chase branch. On XX/XX/year> I went to their branch at XXXX, PA and provided all the verification they needed ( ID proof, proof of business ownership, etc ). After verifying the proofs, the branch said that the check can be expected in 4 - 5 business days. However, the check did not come through until XX/XX/year>. I kept visiting the branch and calling the customer support several times. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I was asked to call the fraud protection line ( XXXX option # XXXX ). When I did so, I was informed that my ownership was not verified. I provided the details of the documents I had submitted at the branch on XX/XX/year>. They finally located the ownership proof and placed request to issue my check. However, it did not come through until XX/XX/year>. I have been following up since then with no result until now. My {$49000.00} is still held by Chase.

I am filing a complaint against Cash App ( Block , Inc. ) due to inadequate customer service and unfair practices, which violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ). Specifically, Cash App failed to take timely and effective measures to prevent and address fraud on their platform, leaving my account vulnerable and unprotected.

These actions have caused significant inconvenience and financial loss, and I seek appropriate redress for these violations.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally express my concerns regarding Zelle 's handling of disputes, particularly in light of the recent CFPB lawsuit highlighting significant issues with the platform. Despite using Zelle numerous times and reporting discrepancies, my financial institution and Zelle failed to investigate my claims adequately. They informed me that recovering lost funds was impossible and that tracking these transactions was unfeasible. The CFPB 's findings indicate that Zelle has not only neglected to protect consumers but has also allowed repeat offenders to exploit the system, leaving users vulnerable to scams. This lack of accountability and transparency is unacceptable and raises serious concerns about consumer safety.

On XX/XX/XXXX An ACH with the title XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$570.00} was withdrawn from our checking account. 

Our bookkeeper is in 2 days per week and we look at this account about 3 times per week. This withdrawal was discovered less than 48 hours after it happened. 

I reported it and was told that it had t be turned in within 24 hours or a " stop payment '' to be done. 

My reaction was How would I do that if I was unaware and that that 24 hours is NOT a reasonable expectation of discovery. I had told Wells Fargo that I had also tried to contact XXXX  XXXX, whom would NOT speak to me as I was NOT a customer. So I filed a formal complaint as instructed. 

Original Claim filed XX/XX/XXXX NOTES on File : XXXX XXXX can not provide any information regarding this claim Contacted on XX/XX/XXXX within 48 hours of charge Contact XXXX  XXXX and they could not tell me anything or numbers to match WE did not initiate or authorize this charge. 

I waited 7 business days and then a Call placed : XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX then XXXX at XXXX XXXX escalating up the chain. 
Was told I had to deny before charge went thruHow can I do that if I knew nothing of the charge Yet she assured me that it would be taken care of and a serious matter as we are " Valued Customers '' and it should be cleared up within 10 days. Here is my Reference # XXXX Claim number They told me they had investigated back to XX/XX/XXXX verifying this vendor had NEVER been used by our business before and the gal than admitted that " maybe a typo and they will continue to investigate '' I questioned her as to what this meant and that it was a recorded call and that I would like to be moved to the next level up. I was on this chain of calls for a total of 57 minutes and then when they got me to the last person who asked again for the 4th time after explaining to the last 3 people ; he put me on hold and then the line disconnected. 

Out of pure frustration, I again called XXXX XXXX Dispute line and was on HOLD XXXX min xfer to Business Department to NO Avail ... I was ran through the calling tree and without being a banking customer was NEVER able to get a live person. 

I waited a couple days, hoping that Wells Fargo would at least attempt to contact me. 

On XX/XX/XXXX attempted another call and again went through the phone chain and this time they created a client care ticket number # XXXX to get a response which could take up to 120 days. However, this person suggested that I " close '' and reopen my account so this does not happen again ... ..I was enraged by this statement and actually considered closing it permanently. However, the inconvenience of this with a small business and running and operating that would be very difficult with current resources and staff. 

I then placed another call : XX/XX/XXXX for a status update, as I had heard nothing to date. They said they tried to call and I had NO RECORD on my phone of a missed call from either Wells Fargo or an unknown XXXX number since my last communication. I spoke to XXXX, who sent me to claims specialist.Reggie and he recorded my issue and assured me someone would be in contact with me. 


Hearing nothing by XX/XX/XXXX, I placed another call and spoke to XXXXThank You for being a valued client and I told her that " NO MESSAGE WAS EVER LEFT '' and she sent me to XXXX ; the Customer Advocacy Team and he filed a Complaint Department Form filled out and that it would be dealt with in 2 biz days... 

REPEAT of Previous and I NEVER HEARD ANYTHING .... 

So I contacted them again to get a " Claim Update '' ... .3 days later ( 1 day after they said it would be dealt with and XXXX assured me that it was being worked on today and contacting the other bank and I again provided information and waited. She actually suggested to check the next day if I didn't hear anything... 

GUESS WHAT. I never heard from them so... 


XX/XX/XXXX I called again and XXXX sent me right to XXXX XXXX & " XXXX '' filed an additional complaint. 

I waited until Friday XX/XX/XXXX and was told my claim was being worked on and we should hear in next few days... 

This is what I got on XX/XX/XXXX in an email Wells Fargo case number : XXXX Account number ending in : XXXX Business name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX : Thank you for contacting us. We completed our research and are providing details to address your concerns. 

Fraud claim decision In your inquiry, you had concerns about unauthorized transaction made from your Initiate Business Checking account ending in XXXX. 

After completing our investigation for claim case XXXX, the Claims Assistance Center denied your claim for the charge on XX/XX/XXXX, for {$570.00}. Because too much time has passed before you notified us on XX/XX/XXXX, we are not able to reimburse you. We attempted to contact you on XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, but were unable to reach you for additional information. We recommend that you contact the merchant, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX at XXXX to resolve your issue. 

As your inquiry did not provide us with any new information to consider, we continue to support the decision made in the claim. We respectfully refer you to our previous letter that details our evaluation of your claim. Attached is the Claims Assistance Center letter dated on XX/XX/XXXX, for your reference. You may also reach out to Claim Assistance at XXXX, Monday through Friday, XXXX XXXX  to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, if you have any questions or concerns regarding your claim. 

While we realize the information provided may not alleviate your frustrations, we hope this letter helps to clarify our actions about this matter. We strive to provide exceptional service and were sorry we didnt meet that expectation in this instance. 

Case status We have closed the case as of the date of this letter. If we receive additional information, we will open a new case to address any remaining or new concerns. 

How to contact us We appreciate the time and effort you took to contact us. If you have questions, you may reach us at XXXX, Monday through Friday from XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX We accept telecommunications relay service calls. 

If there is an attachment to this email and you can not read it, please contact us. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, SD XXXX WHAT IS EVEN MORE " UNREASONABLE '' ABOUT THIS IS THAT IT IS NOT XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX as indicated in the email yet XXXX XXXX is in the letter attached. 


Please assist me one this as I believe we have been wronged and this is unacceptable and unreasonable. This is blatant fraud and we think Wells Fargo is negligent in handling this and our account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I rented a car from XXXX in XXXX, XXXX with my family. I picked the car up at the airport in XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, the car had a flat tire. The equipment ( tire jack, etc ) to change the tire was missing from the car. We called XXXX customer support and were asked to wait for more than XXXX hours. We had to wait in the sun without access to water. I was with my XXXX old son and XXXX  parents. 

When the technician arrived to change the tire, he commented on the fact that the tires were extremely worn and in dangerous condition. The unsafe condition of the tires can be seen in the images that XXXX shared. The tires show significant wear and lack of proper maintenance over an extended period, rather than damage from our single rental of 4 days and limited use of the vehicle. 

After the tire had been changed and later in the day on XX/XX/XXXX, an XXXX representative called me and instructed me to return the vehicle early due to it being " unfit to drive. '' We returned the vehicle to the XXXX office at XXXX XXXX and were given another vehicle and returned the new rental the following day XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX ), I was charged {$1200.00} by XXXX. The rental was originally quoted at a price of {$270.00}. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I alerted XXXX to the incorrect charge and filed a dispute with HSBC which manages my credit card. XXXX did not respond with documentation or an invoice until XXXX XXXX 115 days after the rental occurred. 

My complaint is not about XXXX, it is about HSBC - the financial institution with which I communicate regarding credit card charges. 

HSBC told me on the phone on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX EST that they had issued a chargeback ( credit ) for the {$960.00} charge from XXXX XXXX I had contested. HSBC claims that the {$960.00} credit was posted to my account on XX/XX/XXXX. The statement that I have enclosed here does not show the chargeback ( credit ), nor does any other HSBC statement. HSBC has shared no evidence or documentation of the chargeback. 

In XXXX, HSBC determined the XXXX charge was legitimate but did not share the documentation with me that led to their decision. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX agreed with my concerns about the rental and issued a credit of XXXX to my HSBC credit card. 

On XX/XX/XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX ), HSBC posted a charge from XXXX for {$960.00} to my credit card. I made the mistake of assuming that this charge was the result of XXXX charging me incorrectly for the XXXX rental. The XX/XX/XXXX charge was not due to XXXX ; the XX/XX/XXXX charge was due to HSBC. HSBC was reversing the XX/XX/XXXX chargeback ( credit ) with a debit of the same amount. But the XX/XX/XXXX credit never occurred, so instead - due to HSBC - I have been charged an *additional* {$960.00}. 

I was charged {$1200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and I was charged {$960.00} on XX/XX/XXXX for the same transaction. HSBC 's intent with the XX/XX/XXXX charge was to reverse a credit, but the credit was never made to my account. In summary, my credit card bill has been charged {$960.00} more than it should be, due to HSBC 's failure to properly document and execute chargebacks and manage disputes.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I transferred $ XXXX from my primary bank account at a local credit union to a new High Yields savings account with American Express. This seems to have triggered a fraud alert with American Express. Because a week or so later when I checked my American Express account it showed that I wasnt allowed to move money in or out of that account. I discovered this on XX/XX/XXXX and called American Express immediately. They are me to call during regular office hours on the XXXX. I did that. At that point I was told that I would need to get on a XXXX way call with my primary bank so that American Express can ask my primary bank to verify that I have an account with them. When we got on the XXXX way call, my primary bank- in order to verify my identity- had to ask me my security questions. American Express, listening into this call, would then know the security questions for my primary bank account as well as the answers. This would of course compromise the security on my primary bank account. So I chose not to do that. American Express told me that there was a second option, which was to send them a bank statement from my primary bank account. I did that. A week later my American Express bank account was still frozen. When I called them again on XX/XX/XXXX, they told me that the bank statement was rejected by their fraud team, for reasons they could not disclose. So my only option was to do the XXXX way call with my primary bank.

Then on XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email from the NC DOJ, ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Protection XXXX ) informing me that she had referred my complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. ( I have received no communication from your bureau. ) She suggested that I re-file the complaint to your Agency The NC DOJ file number is : XXXX I will re-state the complaint : On about XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased a deck from XXXX XXXX, ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) to be built at my home in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The project XXXX was XXXX XXXX ) who was in charge of the installation. He signed me up for XXXX 's 24 month, no interest due if paid within that time period. 
There were multiple delays on their part and so as the months went forward and the project was not started, ( but I was being charged and making payments to XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Synchrony ) I asked XXXX to cancel the project. 
I then received a call from XXXX XXXX, asking me to speak to " XXXX '' he said the store XXXX. He said that she had news that I would be glad to hear. I called XXXX and she told me that XXXX would reduce the price of the project {$2000.00}. if I would go ahead with it. So I agreed and they came and built the deck and did a fine job I continued to make my payment when due without fail. 
Then a year ago, last XXXX ( XXXX ) I called Synchrony and asked the Customer Service Representative what the payoff amount would be on the Deferred Interest Account, as I wanted to pay it off. She gave me an amount of {$11000.00}. I told her that I would be transferring that amount to Synchrony to pay off the XXXX XXXX account only. ( Because I had a regular account, ( that is not a Deferred Interest account ) that I was paying on also, that was separate from the Deferred Interest account that I was paying off and I wanted no mistake to be made. I intended that the {$11000.00} be used only to pay off the XXXX XXXX account. I also made a payment of {$210.00}, which was the payment due for that month on the other account. Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally express my dissatisfaction with the handling of my recent concerns regarding my American Express Platinum Card. I believe the practices involved in this matter are unfair, deceptive, and not reflective of the high standards I associate with American Express.

1. Unclear Card Fee : I was charged a card fee that was not transparently disclosed to me. As a Platinum Cardholder, I expect full transparency regarding all associated costs. The lack of clarity surrounding this fee has left me feeling misled and undervalued as a customer ; nor were the restrictions of card feee refunds made clear to me upon r
enewal.

2. Forced Downgrade : When I attempted to cancel my Platinum Card, I was informed that I could not receive a refund for the unused portion of my membership fee. Instead, I was forced to downgrade to another product as the only available option. This left me feeling pressured and trapped in a financial product I did not wish to keep.

3. Denial of Pro-Rata Refund : Despite my efforts to cancel the card outright, I was denied a pro-rata refund for the unused portion of my membership fee. It is unreasonable to charge for a service I no longer wish to use, especially when the decision to downgrade was not made voluntarily but as a result of restrictive policies.

4. Difficult Cancellation Process : The cancellation process itself was unnecessarily complex and felt designed to discourage customers from exercising their right to cancel. This added to my frustration and tarnished my perception of American Expresss commitment to customer satisfaction. Long-winded method to another team, asking multiple questions and not completing the request. 

During this process, I spoke to a representative named XXXX through the American Express chat service. While XXXX attempted to assist me, the outcome of our conversation did not address my concerns adequately and left me feeling further dissatisfied. 

Given these issues, I am requesting the following actions to resolve this matter : 1. A refund of the card fee in question.

2. A pro-rata refund for the unused portion of my Platinum Card membership fee.

3. A review of your cancellation and downgrade policies to ensure a fair and transparent process for all customers.

The inability to cancel outright without financial loss, coupled with the forced downgrade, feels coercive and contrary to ethical business practices. I trust that American Express values its customers and their concerns and will take prompt action to resolve this matter.

I expect to hear back from you within seven business days with a resolution. Please contact me at [ your contact information ] if additional details are required. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I used the website XXXX to reserve a cabin in XXXX, TN for a family vacation at the mountains checking in XX/XX/XXXX, checking out XX/XX/XXXX for the total amount of {$6700.00} that I paid using my Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit Card. When we showed up at the cabin on XX/XX/XXXX we encountered that the cabin was not in the condition promised, to start with, the property manager called me stating that the cabin wasnt going to be ready at the checking time of XXXX as promised so our family we had to hang out somewhere else until they were done cleaning the cabin. Later that day around XXXX we got to the cabin and noticed that I was given the wrong access code to the cabin and we were locked out the place until I called the property manager and she provided her personal code for us to access. We are in the cabin and noticed how dirty it was, trash was still in the trash cans, the floors were filthy and the water to the whole house smelled like rotten eggs. I communicated all of the issues to the property manager and she did resolve some of them but not all. One of the main issues es the water in the hot tub, there was oil floating on top, white flakes floating in the water and even some toenails, I made the property manager aware and she sent someone the next day to overflow the hot tub in order for the oil to spill out, not change the water, only overflow it which did not resolve the issue. Many other complaints were made to the property manager I cant list or explain all of them but I have photos, videos and messages from the property manager to prove all and each of them. A couple of days before we were to check out my sister ( one of the guests at the cabin ) started having a bad headache, we run to the store and got XXXX thinking it was something simple, the next day she got worse and started running a fever, we still didnt think any of it and the next day we were checking out so she planned on going to the doctor when home. The day we checked out since we drove separate vehicles my sister and her family went a different way, we were getting close to home when her husband calls me to tell me that he is taking her to the emergency room because her fever is really high, she is shaking and XXXX is no longer working. I remember talking to her the day before and we were trying to figure out what was going on. She told me that she got in the hot tub and when she was going in, she noticed the tub was slimy and she slipped and fall, she didnt worry about it because she didnt hit herself but she ended up going underwater for a few seconds, she got out and didnt go back in. She made it to the hospital and was told that she had a bad XXXX XXXX because she had XXXX in her ears caused by dirty water, the water in the hot tub, she was at the hospital two days where she was given XXXX for the pain because it was so bad. I immediately contacted XXXX to let them know what was going on and asked for a partial refund so to all the struggles we went through at the cabin and more than anything to compensate for what my sister was going through. I told them I wanted to help her pay the hospital bill since I felt guilty for what had happened to her. It was quite a fight and after back and forward emails with XXXX, unanswered messages to the host/owner XXXX XXXXs and property manager XXXX, XXXX ended up refunding me the service fee of {$770.00}, they were not able to refund the rest because the host/owner used a third party managing company ( XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ) to charge for the rest of the balance which was {$5900.00} so I had to deal with them directly which doesnt not make sense since I used the XXXX platform for the reservation and thought they were the ones handling everything but anyway I dealt with the host as well, I sent several messages through XXXX website because I didnt have a direct number, I didnt have a number for the property managing company, the only thing I have is the phone number to the property manager XXXX but according to her she doesnt deal with refunds, the host/owner XXXX XXXX handles that but he doesnt answer messages and there is not a phone number where I can reach him directly. I also filed a claim through my bank since I could not get a hold of the host/owner but days after Wells Fargo closed the dispute alleging that they provided the service they promised a cabin, I guess the filthy status of the cabin did not matter, it didnt matter that someone ended up at the hospital due to this. I called the bank and argued that XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX didnt provide the service they promised, because they promised a clean cabin, a timely check in time, clean premises with all essentials included and they did not kept the promise sending someone to the hospital. Wells Fargo had proof of everything, photos, videos, messages, descriptions, etc. I argued that in one of the message conversations with property manager XXXX, she even admits that the cabin is not in good condition to be rented and I believe this conversation was not taken into consideration, I believe Wells Fargo back just jumped into the conclusion that a cabin was provided and that was it, they close the case with an unfavorable decision against me. At this time after all the wasted time with the bank I kept fighting with XXXX and this time I didnt want a partial refund, I wanted ALL my money back {$5900.00} we fought for a while and finally on XX/XX/year> I received a message from the host on XXXX website that reads the following Weve processed your refund. It may take up to 15 days for this refund to reflect in your original for of payment. Please contact your bank for further updates. I felt relief and waited for the money to post to my Wells Fargo Credit Card account. The date today is XX/XX/year> and the money is still not in my account. XXXX suggested to initiate a chargeback process with my bank Wells Fargo but they argued that this cant be done because the dispute is being closed. I also messaged the host to find out whats going on and got no answer. According to XXXX, they contacted him as well and they did get a response from him, this is what the email from XXXX reads I am contacting you as agreed in the previous email to inform you that the last request sent to the property manager to confirm the refund has been answered and they, as those responsible for the property, have denied that they will process any refund of the rental payment. After promising a refund back in XX/XX/XXXX, they backed up and now they dont want to refund the money. I am really disappointed, specially with my bank Wells Fargo, I have been banking with them for more than 20 years and they cant even fight this for me. The bank, the host/owner, the property manager and XXXX  are getting away with this, really?? Where are we as customers left in a situation like this? I know that my sisters hospital bill will be higher that the full refund I am requesting, I feel guilty and obligated to help her with the expenses and this refund will definitely help us. Wells Fargo Bank has evidence of all issues with the cabin, including photos, videos, screenshots of conversations with property manager XXXX and with host/owner XXXX XXXX XXXX photos of my sister at the hospital showing dates, they had all the evidence that proved that XXXX violated their Book With Confidence Guarantee mentioned in their website. I want to believe that you will make the right decision in this matter and protect a customer that at this time feels like no one cares about.

I want to know what they are going to do to compensate me for the time and anguish this has caused. 
They need to own their mistake and need to put safeguards in place so this doesnt happen to others.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear PayPal Team, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to express my deep concern regarding the permanent limitation placed on my PayPal account, registered under the email address XXXX. I believe this limitation has occurred due to a mistake and wish to appeal this decision. 

I want to emphasize that I have always strived to adhere to PayPal 's policies and guidelines. To the best of my knowledge, I have not engaged in any activities that would warrant such a restriction on my account. I have consistently used my PayPal account responsibly for legitimate transactions. 

Given the above, I kindly request that you re-investigate my case thoroughly. I genuinely hope that, upon review, you will find that my account was indeed limited in error. If that is the case, I humbly request the restoration of my PayPal account privileges. 

I value the services and convenience that PayPal provides and would like to continue using your platform for my financial transactions. I believe in the fairness and integrity of PayPal 's processes, and I trust that my case will be reviewed impartially. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt response and a resolution that will allow me to continue using PayPal for my online financial needs. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom this may concern, and I'm going to keep this one very short. 

On XX/XX/year>, I applied for U.S. Bank Business Platinum Card. I filled the application form online, completed the process and got this notice " Thanks for applying. You'll hear from us soon. We're looking over your application and may ask you to provide additional info or documents. You'll certainly hear from us by mail once we have a decision, usually in 7 to 10 business days. '' I called U.S. Bank customer support same night to be redirected to business card application however unfortunately their offices were closed. 

I called in today XX/XX/year> to get an update on the application, only to be told by U.S. Bank personnel that my application was denied because I applied with my ITIN and should only apply with an SSN. This didn't make sense to me because the application clearly stated " SSN / ITIN ( Enter your social Security number or Individual Tax Identification Number ''. 

I told him if that's the case, then there shouldnt have been a section for ITIN as this is misleading and should be taken down immediately. The best I can assume a reasonable support personnel would do or say is U.S. Bank would probably investigate this form and probably make necessary corrections or adjustments. As a business owner myself, my websites and application form should not mislead my partners and customers. And if there happens to be some sort of misleading information, I think its worth investigating. 

So, I asked him, what if after submitting my application, then I get a hard pull on my credit reports and I call U.S. Bank and the response is " sorry no ITINs ''. His response was there wasn't a hard pull so that justifies the unprofessional services I has personally received from U.S. Bank Business Section. And then kept saying " there's nothing we can do about your application ''. 

What is more vexing in this matter is that, I applied for a personal secured credit card online around XXXX, XXXX. Filled a form online that also clearly stated " SSN / ITIN ''. Was approved and serving its purpose. 

So, unless this personnel from U.S. Bank this that I am an XXXX or is simply another ignorant banker I have come across during my recent years in the United States. Then that form should state out and request accurate personal information. Otherwise, U.S. Bank collecting ITIN information from all potential business card customer just for kicks is a major problem. 

Please see attached your online application form. Apparently, it turns out my ITIN is not an ITIN and the IRS is confused according to somebody at U.S. Bank Business Application.

I am XXXX  and XXXX  XXXX as a result of a hate crime, a woman sprayed bug spray in my face, and another hit me over the head, I suffered a XXXX XXXX XXXX, and three weeks ago had XXXX XXXX  XXXX in my neck. I was awarded XXXX XXXX from the State of California, yet tonight I am hungry, without food, three weeks after XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 

Chase gives me a hard time every time I make a large deposit, from a music grant I won from the XXXX XXXX  XXXX  and XXXX XXXX in San Francisco, for {$2000.00}, two deposits of {$680.00} from the City and County of XXXX XXXX, and now a {$910.00} check from the State of California. 

After several calls, each with a different excuse, in my last call a manager told me the check is verified, but the State of California hasn't sent the funds. An interesting commentary on our government, but paramount to our discussion, apparently Chase bank is concerned the State of California, the 5th largest economy in the world, won't come up with the money. Chase bank uses terms like " discretion '' as code, so they can make it easier for some, and harder for others. An industry with a history of redlining, and a year removed from the XXXX  XXXX XXXX scandal of purposely overcharging their customers, one of which was me by the way, has not earned trust. 

I am hungry because Chase bank is keeping me from my money in an obvious display of racism. And I protest in the strongest terms.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX I was shocked to see my Capital One 360 Savings account was earning only 0.30 % APY when market rates are much higher. I looked at the Capital One website and saw that their savings account product was earning 4.35 %, so I believed that there was an error on my account that failed to adjust the rate. My interest rate had remainedthe same since around XXXX of XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX I called Capital One and spoke with XXXX. XXXX informed me that my account was earning what a Capital One 360 Savings account should, and that the 4.35 % APY was for the Capital One 360 PERFORMANCE Savings account. She advised how I could open such an account and move the funds. I asked to be escalated to her supervisor regarding the large discrepancy for quite some time. 

XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I spoke with XXXX ( supervisor ). XXXX reviewed communications to me and confirmed Capital One did not communicate to me ( via mail or email ) that my interest rate would be stuck at 0.30 % and that the product was being replaced ( seemingly no longer supporting XXXX increases ). He also confirmed that my APY is variable, and that reasonable consumers expect variable APYs to increase due to the Fed 's interest rate changes and market interest rates. He noted the bank 's website had a feature to compare my current product 's interest rate to new product 's, but that this feature was not available in-app or communicated to me proactively. He also noted interest rates are available in account details when logged in, and on statements ( not currently mailed but available when logged in ). However, he agreed that a reasonable consumer would expect their interest rate to adjust due to the Fed and market rates. XXXX also agreed that 0.30 % is not in line with any savings accounts offered by Capital One or its competitors at this time. 

In short, Capital One created a new savings account with an extremely similar name that has reasonable rates and failed to notify existing savings account customers that this was a different product and that they should no longer expect reasonable rates. Capital One did not offer the ability to roll into the new product or in any way communicate that the customer would stop receiving APY increases if they remain with the 360 Savings account. 

Capital One experienced significant bank gain at the expense of customers for under-providing interest for years by a significant percentage. The bank was also highly deceptive ( violating XXXX ) in its similarly-named product with vastly different interest rates, and caused additional customer harm by acting against reasonable consumer belief by failing to raise interest rates on the older product.

Multiple attempts were made to retrieve funds from chase who stated that I had to receive the funds back from the person despite it being an unauthorised transaction. I then filed a claim with zelle which was closed without sufficient explanation. The funds lost totalled to {$320.00}. 

I am writing to formally express my concerns regarding Zelle 's handling of disputes, particularly in light of the recent CFPB lawsuit highlighting significant issues with the platform. Despite using Zelle numerous times and reporting discrepancies, my financial institution and Zelle failed to investigate my claims adequately. They informed me that recovering lost funds was impossible and that tracking these transactions was unfeasible. The CFPB 's findings indicate that Zelle has not only neglected to protect consumers but has also allowed repeat offenders to exploit the system, leaving users vulnerable to scams. I am extremely concerned about this lack of accountability and transparency.

They turned XXXX down and said there is nothing that can be done. Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
At XXXX on XX/XX/year> I tried to withdraw cash using my XXXX debit card at a PNC ATM in a XXXX XXXX  ( Store # XXXX located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ). When the screen read, card must be removed prior to cash dispensed, I did not remove my card in time. The ATM printed a receipt saying incomplete transaction, contact your financial institution. The money came out of my account but no cash ever came from the machine. 

I filed a dispute with XXXX, they eventually gave me a provisional credit after XXXX weeks, then XXXX weeks later PNC denied my claim, stating the following this transaction was processed correctly. This transaction was valid, the money was dispensed, and based on the ATM audit tape, we have concluded our investigation. I had XXXX appeal their decision, and they denied the appeal the same day. I told XXXX to ask PNC if their ATM balanced during their next cash count. I also asked them to ask PNC to explain how I could receive that receipt if the transaction was processed correctly. XXXX has not advocated on my behalf and even though I am still communicating with them trying to get them to help me, they took my {$400.00} back out of my account. 

I filed a police report since they are the only ones who can get surveillance footage from the XXXX XXXX, but have not heard anything from them nor do I expect to. They are understaffed and overworked. It doesnt seem to me that PNC investigated anything at all. I want to see the ATM records, I want to see the ATM video footage, and I want to speak with PNC directly but they won't speak to me directly I already tried. My only hope is getting surveillance footage from the store to prove my case.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
Having received XX/XX/XXXX email solicitation - " EXCLUSIVE LIMITED-TIME OFFER '' to " open a checking account from Morgan Stanley Private Bank '' advertised as " a special {$250.00} bonus is waiting for you '', I responded and opened " new checking account '' on XX/XX/XXXX, the confirmation " Your new checking account is enrolled in a cash promotion '' was received the same date. 
The confirmation spelled out Teaser Terms of the Promotion : " Here is how to get your {$250.00} cash bonus : Set up direct deposit, each of {$1000.00} or more. Learn how at etrade.com/directdeposit.

Ensure you receive two qualifying direct deposits within the next 90 days.

Get rewarded with a {$250.00} bonus deposit into your new account. Pretty nice, eh? 
Get started now as it may take 1-2 pay cycles for the change to go into effect '', along with " OFFER ELIGIBILITY AND LIMITATIONS : '' " To take advantage of this offer, you must be the original recipient of the offer email from Morgan Stanley Private Bank '' , The confirmation also contained the language of " OFFER RULES FOR ALL PARTICIPANTS : '' which allowed Morgan Stanley Private Bank to interpret the Terms and negate the Requirements : " We reserve the right, in accordance with applicable laws, to rescind or decline award payment for reasons that we, in our discretion, deem to be abusive, excessive or suspicious, including suspected fraud, account abuse, or if suspicious activities are observed. '' There was no hint, of what kind of activities within " '' open a checking account '' and " Set up direct deposit, each of {$1000.00} or more... Pretty nice, eh? '' may constitute abuse, fraud or excess.

The Requirements were met, Morgan Stanley Private Bank doesn't deny that. 
However, the Bank stipulates that " Unfortunately, your account did not meet the offer requirements to qualify for the cash bonus. '' The verbal explanation provided by Morgan Stanley Private Bank Customer Service Representative implies that the Bank 's definition of " suspicious activities '' includes the very basic and common banking practice of maintaining balances on linked Morgan Stanley Private Bank Savings account.

The verbal interpretation of " the offer requirements to qualify for the cash bonus. '' was arbitrary expanded into the Requirement to maintain Direct Deposits Received on Checking Account for 90 days! and the fact that funds Directly Deposited to Morgan Stanley Private Bank Checking Account are transferred and maintained on Morgan Stanley Private Bank Savings Account may be deemed as disqualifying factor of Morgan Stanley Private Bank 's " a new checking account '' Offer

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request for Review of Chase Credit Card Account Closures and Inconsistent Handling To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally request your assistance in reviewing a matter involving JPMorgan Chase Bank and the closure of my credit card accounts. While I take responsibility for an error on my part, I believe Chases handling of my accountsparticularly the issuance and subsequent closure of a third accountraises concerns about their processes and fairness. 

Background I held XXXX credit card accounts with Chase : Account ending in XXXX : Opened on XX/XX/XXXX, and closed on XX/XX/XXXX. 
Account ending in XXXX : Opened on XX/XX/XXXX, and closed on XX/XX/XXXX, alongside the first account. 
Third account : Opened and closed in XX/XX/XXXX, issued through Chases system as a pre-approved offer after the closure of my first XXXX accounts. 
The first XXXX accounts were in good standing, with no missed or late payments. Occasionally, I filed disputes through Chases app when dissatisfied with purchases, and these disputes were often resolved in my favor.

The Incident The issue began when I disputed a {$38.00} charge from an auto mechanic. The mechanic charged me for an incomplete service, and I believed the charge was unjustified. While attempting to dispute the charge via the Chase app, I mistakenly selected the option for an " unauthorized transaction '' instead of accurately describing the issue. 

Following an investigation, Chase determined that this misuse, along with past disputes, violated their policies, leading to the closure of my first XXXX accounts. While I regret the error and accept responsibility, I am concerned about what happened next. 

Concerns About Chases Handling Issuance and Closure of the Third Account : After closing my first XXXX accounts, Chases system pre-approved me for a third credit card, which was automatically approved when I accepted the offer via their mobile app. I applied in good faith, believing this indicated a willingness to continue our relationship. However, Chase closed this account shortly after its issuance, citing the same reasons as the previous closures. This inconsistency is both confusing and frustrating. 

Lack of Transparency : While I understand Chases right to close accounts for policy violations, issuing and then closing the third account undermines the rationale for the initial closures. Additionally, Chase removed the details of this third account from my online banking profile, making it difficult for me to reference it. 

Impact on My Credit Report and Score : The closure of all three accounts has been reported as closed by grantor on my credit report. Despite my excellent payment history and a prior credit score of around XXXX, these closures reduced my score to XXXX. This has negatively affected my ability to obtain new credit, as recent applications to other issuers were denied.

Requested Resolution I respectfully request the following : A formal review of Chases decision to issue and then close the third account after terminating my first XXXX accounts. 
An explanation of Chases internal processes to ensure customers are not subjected to such inconsistent treatment. 
If possible, reconsideration of the decision to close my third account, as its issuance implied a willingness to maintain the relationship. 


I acknowledge the importance of adhering to policies and take responsibility for my mistake in filing the dispute. However, I believe Chases actions, particularly the issuance and closure of the third account, were inconsistent and have unnecessarily impacted my credit score and financial standing. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to your response and hope for a fair resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, NY XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I pre-purchased a XXXX XXXX for {$5700.00}. This was a purchase for an item that was to be delivered between XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. As time passed and I had not received any updates or information from XXXX, I decided to contact them. To my surprise, XXXX did not answer any of my e-mails, calls, voicemails, or online request forms. 

I began getting worried about a fraud situation, so I decided to start a dispute with Discover Card on XX/XX/XXXX. I submitted all of the e-mails, documents, invoice, etc to the credit card company, and to my surprise, the dispute was denied. 

I contacted the credit card company and they said that they needed some sort of document showing that XXXX did in fact owe me a refund. I explained that XXXX is not responding to any form of communication. I went online and found similar cases with XXXX, where the victims were issued a refund by their credit card company. I sent these cases to Discover Card, and still, my dispute was denied. 

I, as a consumer, feel that I was part of a fraud, and should be protected by my credit card company. 

Please help me.

Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally express my extreme frustration and disappointment with the consistently inaccurate information being reported on my credit profile by [ XXXXTransUnion XXXX for the past year. Despite my persistent efforts to rectify these errors in accordance with my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C 1681 ), it is disheartening to note that these issues remain unresolved.

Over the course of the past several months, I have repeatedly exercised my right to dispute the inaccuracies on my credit report, citing the provisions of 15 U.S.C 1681 as a reminder of your legal obligation to ensure the fairness of the information you disseminate. My disputes on all 5 accounts listed below ( In Addition to, an address I have no knowledge of nor have I lived at the address ), each backed by solid evidence of inaccuracies, have been submitted through certified mail and meticulously documented to ensure a clear and traceable record of communication. 

Despite my adherence to the prescribed dispute process and the gravity of the matter, I have yet to witness any meaningful action taken by the companies listed to rectify these erroneous entries. It is disconcerting to realize that my diligent efforts to correct these inaccuracies, backed by the law, have been met with indifference. 

Furthermore, I have discovered that my personal information has been shared without my consent to various third-party entities for financial benefit, a practice that appears to contradict both the principles of privacy and the standards set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act. The unauthorized sharing of my sensitive financial data raises serious concerns about my privacy and security, and it is essential that this practice is immediately ceased. 

I want to emphasize that my intent is not to engage in a confrontational exchange but rather to assert my rights and seek a resolution that upholds the principles of fairness, transparency, and accuracy that the credit reporting system is built upon. 

In light of the continued inaction and indifference to my plight, I am left with no choice but to escalate this matter. I expect an urgent and comprehensive response to this complaint, to rectify the inaccuracies on my credit report and ensure that my personal information is no longer shared without my explicit consent. Failure to address these concerns adequately will leave me with no alternative but to pursue legal avenues to protect my rights and seek appropriate compensation for the damages caused by these inaccuracies. 


Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, I would like to file a complaint against PNC bank Headquarters in XXXX, PA. 
PNC bank did not protect me from the unauthorized transaction even though I informed about it 3 times. Under The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 bank is responible to protect customers from fraud but PNC bank failed. I lost my money for 2 weeks from my checking account. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I noticed on the website XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX that their agent used my PNC debit card information for an unauthorized transaction without my knowledge. That transaction was a car insurancre renewal. I did not agree to extend the car insurance, I do not have the auto pay option. They used my debit card information from a previous transaction on XX/XX/XXXX transaction ID XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I contacted PNC customer service via online chat. I informed about an upcoming unauthorized transaction on the checking account and requested that the transaction be blocked. PNC employee informed me that he did not see such a transaction, so I said that it was an ongoing transaction and I provided all information about this transaction : amount of {$750.00} and the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX PNC employee informed me that once the transaction was completed, I could use the dispute option. I told her this is my checking account not credit card therefore I need this money and I won't wait 30 days for dispute transaction. I told her this is fraud transaction and you are responsible to protect my money. She refused to take any action. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I saw a pending transaction XXXX $ on my checking account from XXXX XXXX XXXX. I called to PNC fraud department and told them about this un autorized transaction. I told them that I reported it 3 days ago and PNC did not stop this transaction. I demanded the immediate cancellation of this transaction but PNC employee refused. She told me to dispute transaction and wait 30 days for my money. I I replied that I will report it to the CFPB and XXXX Next day on XX/XX/XXXX I received a call from PNC fraud department. their employee asked for details of this transaction and offered 30 days to dispute the transaction because she doesn't have any option to stop transaction. I called to XXXX XXXX and demand refund immidietly or I will report to FTC. After 2 weeks I recieved my money back XXXX . For 2 weeks I lost the money I needed because PNC bank refused to block the transaction. They did nothing to protect my therefore I want them to pay for that and hold them accountable. 
Transaction details : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$750.00} on checking account XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: I hired a freelancer on XXXX to deliver a monetized XXXX channel for {$7300.00}, paying {$3600.00} upfront via American Express on [ insert date ]. In clear XXXX messages, the freelancer promised delivery in a few hours after I released the {$3600.00} from escrow ( screenshots attached ). They also signed an agreement stating theyd issue a 100 % refund at any stage, no matter what. I released the funds expecting quick delivery, but no channel was provided. Soon after, XXXX banned the freelancer for a policy violation and closed the project, suggesting fraud. XXXX refused a refund, saying released funds are final, despite their ban preventing delivery. I filed a chargeback with Amex for services not rendered, citing the promise, non-delivery, and refund clause. Amex gave me a temporary {$3600.00} credit but later sided with XXXX, claiming I authorized the payment. My appealshowing the few hours promise, refund agreement, and XXXX banwas denied. Amex ignored evidence the freelancer couldnt deliver due to XXXX actions and breached their own refund promise. This violates my rights under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1666 ) to dispute charges for undelivered services. Now, XXXX demands I repay {$3600.00} for the chargeback, threatening collections, while Amex holds me liable for a fraudulent transaction they shouldve reversed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX I noticed a PPP loan deposited into my wells fargo bank account. I went to retrieve and ask about the money and account, because I had applied for a PPP loan with XXXX XXXX XXXX and had the loan number and all I figured it was my loan that finally got approved and deposited. Upon asking to withdraw funds, the bank automatically froze my account and proceeded to close it out. Without my knowledge or permission. I had dealt with issues in the past with my wells fargo bank account where I lived before this issue. I had seen weird charges on my bank account and decided to call my bank and ask about the charges. When calling the lady asked me if I knew any of these weird people that had been added to my bank account one I vividly remember was the first name XXXX. I told her no, I wasn't aware of anyone added to my account but myself. The lady at the bank said ok, and she said she would remove them. I went to the bank and asked if they could give me a printout of anyone that was falsely added to my wells fargo bank account without my knowledge or consent and the bank manager told me know. It was a privacy issue. But to my knowledge I should of been given that since it was my bank account. 
XX/XX/XXXX I went to the bank to withdraw the funds that I believed was my PPP loan. When I went in the same bank managers that were XXXX ran around whispering and then told me I would have to speak to someone and they gave me the fraud dept phone number to call and that was it. They suspended my bank account then closed it without my knowledge or consent. 
All my funds were kept including the {$20000.00}. They said after 90 days if noone claims the funds I will be sent a cashiers check for the {$20000.00} and anything else left over but nothing ever happened like that, they only sent me {$10.00}. 
When I called the fraud dept to take care of this noone would help me just that the XXXX woman that took my PPP loan and realtered it I assume had worked along with someone at the local wells fargo bank and had the PPP loan deposited and had planned to add their name like the others I was told about and was going to take it and keep it. 
I found the lady who did some of the fraud but have no knowledge of the person she worked with at the local bank. The lady that did some was located in texas and I still today have never gotten my {$20000.00} and my identity today is still being used, my social, my drivers license number and my name. I have filed since then in XXXX a IC3 but nothing has been done apparently. I feel the bank lied to me they said the 90 days things was a lie and I won't get anything that the XXXX XXXX lady would have to claim my money. I have reached out since XXXX XXXX to be called back about the lost money and account and was told in XXXX XXXX someone would call me back. nothing ever happened. Today I called back to the wells fargo executive office and they are as well still trying to locate the tracking and account issues. No one at wells fargo is helping me and was told by california secretary of treasury that wells fargo has my money and they put the money into different accounts at the bank. They keep it.
