Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Capital One has restricted my account, although I have mad every payment in time, and had a growing credit score day by day. 
I was on the phone with agent ROZ102 for 37 minutes ( and before that, with a previous colleague who transferred me to this department ), to ask them about why they have restricted my account, just to learn that 1. they can not tell me why Capital One has randomly blocked my account 2. in order to verify me, and provide me any further information, they need to scan a government issued ID to proceed. 
As a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I do not have such card, and I do not have the legal ability to get one. I explained my situation and told them I can scan a Hungarian ID document ( XXXX is part of the XXXX ), and asked her if that would be acceptable, which she answered with a clear and loud yes. I carefully scanned the card multiple times, upon which she asked me " What ID do you have? '' - I repeat my initial answer and she now tells me that my government issued ID is not valid for Capital One purposes. ( It is a completely valid ID. ) I proceed to ask what documents do they accept from the ones I opened my account with, since the only documents I have are : Hungarian driver 's license, XXXX  ID card, XXXX ID card, address card, XXXX  Passport with XXXX, XXXX card, and XXXX XXXX ID card. They then inform me none of these are accepted. I responded, by explaining that I opened an ACCOUNT with them using these documents, and US immigration law prohibits students on XXXX XXXX ( as well as all other nonresident aliens ) to acquire a U.S. govt. issued ID other than XXXX. The agent repeats : " I need a govt. issued ID. ". Facing a complete lack of basic human intelligence, I ask " then what should I do to re-gain access to my own account? '' - upon which I get the same robotic answer for the next 5-6 times. I tried to explain how absolutely ridiculous these demands sound, since it is completely impossible for me to present such card and she also told me that SSN and Passport will not be accepted. She even put me on hold to consult with a supervisor. Furthermore, I asked whether going in physically to a Capital One office would resolve the issue, upon which she responded that she " can not advise me on that '' and also that " in order to proceed, no matter where, we will ask you to present a government issued ID ''. 

I had the worst experience with Capital One and it will take a long time to restore my faith in the company after this terrible, awful, unmatched and miserable customer service experience. Never in my life have I faced such an incredibly shameful experience, and many other international people have to face the same issues according to online forums. It is completely discriminatory and also leaves many with the only option to close the account, since Capital One locks our money in the account. This would damage the users ' credit scores significantly, which is extremely important if someone imagines their long-term future in the United States and ready to work here or stay for future studies after college. 
I demand Capital One to explain this situation to me and many other victims of this scandal. Do not let people open accounts who will then not be able to access it. I would also like to ask the methods in which you plan to compensate me for facing such a discriminatory, shameful experience, and also losing much of my time and effort that I put in to try fixing these issues. 
With hope that the issue will be resolved soon and peacefully, Sincerely, XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
If I understand correctly, on XX/XX/XXXX an XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  was opened fraudulently in my name through Concora Credit, and charged XXXX on the same day. When I became aware of this I called Concora Credit to dispute the charges and they said they would open an investigation. I was told they were unable to rule in my favor due to the follow reasons : XXXX provided records that confirm delivery at my current or previous address and billing statements have been sent to my current address. 

Concora Credit provided documentation of the transaction and it clearly says that each item purchased was picked up at the XXXX XXXX XXXX - They were not delivered to my house at all, as Concora Credit incorrectly claims. I called XXXX XXXX and I CONFIRMEND this is the case. 

Additionally the email and phone number provided by the perpetrator, are not mine. The signature is also not mine. Also, it's stated on the invoice that an Arizona ID was used. I do not have an Arizona ID card, only an Arizona Drivers license. 

This person had my personal information, which was leaked in a data breach by a major healthcare company. They likely had my name, social security number, address, email address, and phone number. I don't understand how sending billing statements to my house AFTER the card was opened and nearly maxed out is being used as evidence against me. Makes zero sense and should not be used as evidence at all. 

I was told by the fraud department that if I disputed the charges they would find the same result and that if I could provide video evidence that someone else made the purchases they would exonerate me, but I called XXXX XXXX and they told me they don't have security cameras at all. 

Several other credit cards were also fraudulently opened or attempted to be opened on or around that same time. Some of these applications were immediately denied. The successfully opened cards were maxed out immediately, these other credit sources sided in my favor. I would like to use these other instances of fraudulent activity to help exonerate me of these charges.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX our company accounting department found out our customer, XXXX XXXX, through XXXX XXXX, sent several deposits of funds, over an approx. period of 4 weeks via ACH deposit, to an account at Chase Bank, totaling approx. $ XXXX, intended for my company XXXX XXXX. However, my company was not aware the deposits were no longer going to the account that the funds had been deposited in for more than 2 years. My company accounting dept. thought there had not been any payments due until they realized 3 to 4 weeks had passed with no deposits. Upon an investigation with XXXX XXXX we found out XXXX had been sent a fraudulent email letter requesting forms so they could change the location of any future deposits to Chase Bank. They forged my signature and submitted the forms and the funds began getting deposited to the account at Chase Bank. My complaint is that those funds were clearly intended for my company, why can I not get details from Chase bank on when the deposits were made, for how much, and more importantly, who received those funds? 

I have attached a copy of the form sent to XXXX asking for the change to have the funds deposited to the Chase Bank account. This is a forged document. I have also attached our original ACH form, filed with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and you can clearly see that the signature on the forged copy does not match my signature on the form filed XXXX.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Cash App ( Block , Inc. ) due to inadequate customer service and unfair practices, which violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ). Specifically, Cash App failed to take timely and effective measures to prevent and address fraud on their platform, leaving my account vulnerable and unprotected.

Furthermore, their dispute resolution process was unfair and deceptive, as they did not comply with error resolution requirements under the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E. These actions have caused significant inconvenience and financial loss, and I seek appropriate redress for these violations.

I could not do anything. I sent the letter and they signed for it XX/XX/XXXX. The CD has 7 day grace period and it matured on the 27. I can not get anyone to tell me if I will ever get my funds. I am told that I need to drive to branch and show my drivers license. There is no branch in Arizona. 

I have no idea why they would allow people to open CD accounts, knowing that they can not transfer funds in the mobile app and if you call in you need a debit card in order be verified or have a passcode that can not be set up with CD.

Consumer complaint narrative:
What I am currently experiencing all started on XX/XX/XXXX. I will give the back details so that all of this makes sense. I had checked my bank account the morning of XX/XX/XXXX to see that my bank account had been overdrawn by {$120.00} exactly. This overdraft was suppose to be coming from my health insurance on top of their ( {$110.00} ) they also took another ( {$34.00} ) for the overdraft since the money wasn't all in the account. I didn't pay it any mind and was just going to get myself back in a positive when I got paid that Friday. I continued think about how greedy it was of them to take their money and still yet charge me the {$34.00} overdraft fee on top of what they were already receiving from me. I decided to call XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX on that Monday to ask why they still charge me the overdraft fee after getting their money that was owed to them. It was to my surprise that they told me, " We aren't sure who that money is going to, but your premium to us is $ XXXX a month. '' The woman and I talked about these transactions and what were named on my bank statement. She even said they she didn't have any record of me paying anything to them. She contacted the business that it said on the statements and we completed a three-way call. The other lady for the business " XXXX XXXX '' also stated that she couldn't even find an account for me or find anything that says that I had ever paid anything to them. She even expressed that their business is life insurance and not medical insurance. After completing the call with both women, I was advised to get in touch with my bank to dispute these transactions. I spoke to a gentleman through the customer service line at Chase who helped me dispute these charges that went all the way into XXXX of XXXX. He had said that he had never saw things like this personally but had heard about it. I provided a document straight from the insurance company that states that my premium is $ XXXX a month. If I had not been curious of their greed then I would have never found out that all of these charges were fraudulent. It was of course to my surprise when I had check my account today, XX/XX/XXXX, to see that the dispute was being reversed and had drawn my checking account to XXXX. I filed these claims almost two months ago and now they are reversing them, leaving me in a financially hard place. 
I will attach the official letter that was given to Chase by my health insurance regarding all of the claims. I have also attached the screenshots of them reversing all of the payments and putting me into the negatives.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear PayPal Support Team, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to express my deep concern and disappointment regarding the permanent limitation placed on my PayPal account with the email address XXXX. I believe there has been a mistake in this decision, and I would like to appeal for a re-evaluation of my case. 

First and foremost, I want to emphasize that I have always strived to adhere to PayPal 's policies and guidelines. I have not knowingly violated any of these policies, and I take the terms of service seriously. Therefore, I am perplexed by the decision to permanently limit my account. 

I kindly request that PayPal conducts a thorough and impartial review of my account activity. I am confident that upon such a review, you will find no substantial grounds to justify the permanent limitation. I am more than willing to provide any additional information or documentation required to assist in this re-evaluation process. 

My PayPal account has been an essential tool for managing my financial transactions and online payments. Its limitation has caused significant inconvenience and disruption to my personal and business activities. I sincerely hope that this matter can be resolved promptly so that I can regain access to my account and continue using PayPal 's services. 

In conclusion, I firmly believe that my account limitation was imposed in error and request that PayPal re-investigate my case thoroughly. I kindly ask for the restoration of my account if, upon review, it is found that there are no valid grounds for its permanent limitation. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I eagerly await a favorable resolution to this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, California XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX SS # : XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to raise a formal dispute and seek your assistance in enforcing my legal rights as a consumer. I have encountered multiple instances of apparent violations that have negatively impacted my credit report and financial well-being. Through this letter, I hope to provide you with a detailed account of the violations I have experienced and to share a personal story of how these issues have profoundly affected my life. 

XXXX XXXX # XXXX - Late Payment** I have recently discovered a late payment entry on my credit report from XXXX XXXX, account number XXXX. This late payment entry has caused significant distress for me, as I have always been diligent in maintaining a timely payment history. This violation, which I believe is in contravention of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 623 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), has affected my ability to secure favorable terms on credit, leading to increased financial strain. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX # XX/XX/XXXX - Inquiries Inquiries by XXXX XXXX XXXX on my credit report, dated XX/XX/XXXX, are particularly troubling. These inquiries were made without my explicit consent and without any legitimate reason. I am of the understanding that such actions are in violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), which outlines the permissible purposes of consumer reports. The unauthorized inquiries have contributed to an unnecessary decrease in my credit score, causing additional hardship for me. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX # XX/XX/XXXX - Inquiries Similarly, inquiries made by XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX have further compounded the negative impact on my credit score and financial well-being. These inquiries appear to be in breach of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), undermining the accuracy and fairness of my credit report. 

XXXX OF XXXX # XX/XX/XXXX - Inquiries The inquiries by XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX have had similar adverse effects on my credit profile. These actions seem to disregard the provisions of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), which exist to protect consumers from unwarranted and unauthorized inquiries that can significantly harm their creditworthiness. 

Address Discrepancies- XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX | XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX | XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA XXXX I have observed multiple instances of address discrepancies in my credit report. The addresses listed, including XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA XXXX, are inaccurate and not associated with me. I believe these discrepancies are a breach of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Section 807 ( 15 U.S.C. 1692e ), which prohibits false or misleading representations. These inaccuracies have further contributed to the inaccuracies in my credit report, impeding my access to essential financial resources. 

Personal Story : Allow me to share a personal story that underscores the profound impact these violations have had on my life. As a single parent working tirelessly to provide for my family, maintaining a strong credit profile is crucial for securing stable housing, favorable interest rates, and the overall financial stability that my loved ones deserve. The stress and anxiety caused by these violations have taken an emotional toll on my well-being. My efforts to create a secure future for my family are being jeopardized by factors beyond my control, leaving me in a state of constant worry. 

In light of the above, I kindly request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's intervention to rectify these violations and enforce my legal rights as a consumer. I urge you to ensure that the creditors promptly remove the unverified accounts from my credit report, as well as any associated negative impacts on my XXXX XXXX. Your assistance in resolving these matters will greatly alleviate the distress I have been enduring and provide me with the opportunity to rebuild my financial stability. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a timely resolution. Please find enclosed copies of relevant documentation supporting my claims. 

Thank you for your consideration. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Complaint Regarding Billing Cycle Error and Improper Interest Charges by Wells Fargo Credit Card Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . regarding a billing cycle error on my credit card account that has resulted in improper interest charges and a negative account status, despite my consistent on-time payments. 

Background : I have used my Wells Fargo credit card for the past year, primarily to pay my monthly rent. Each month, I charge my rent and pay the balance in full and on time. I have never missed a payment or carried a revolving balance. 

In XX/XX/year>, a billing cycle error occurred : My XXXX rent was charged on XX/XX/year> My XXXX rent was charged on XX/XX/year> The statement closing date was XX/XX/year> Because both rent charges fell within the same billing cycle, the statement reflected a total balance of XXXX  XXXX my typical monthly amount of approximately {$4200.00}. 

I made my standard monthly payment of {$4200.00}. Despite this, Wells Fargo marked my account as past due and began assessing interest on the remaining balance. While a {$92.00} interest charge was initially waived as a goodwill gesture, I was told interest would continue to accrue unless I paid the entire doubled balancean unfair expectation based solely on how the dates fell in the billing cycle.

My Attempts to Resolve the Issue : I contacted Wells Fargo multiple times to explain the situation and request a correction. Representatives acknowledged the nature of the error but indicated there was no way to adjust the account due to system limitations. I was advised to pay in full to avoid further interest, despite the fact that the overlapping charges were caused by the calendar, not by any action or inaction on my part.

Why This Is Unfair : Wells Fargos refusal to correct this issue penalizes responsible cardholders and effectively charges interest on a non-delinquent account. Their system is inflexible in a way that harms consumers who follow the rules.

I am requesting the CFPBs assistance to compel Wells Fargo to : Reverse all interest charges resulting from this billing cycle overlap Adjust the account balance and history to reflect my consistent on-time payments and eliminate the past due designation Review its billing cycle practices to ensure that overlapping charges do not unfairly penalize consumers This situation has caused me financial harm, significant time loss, and emotional distress. It is unacceptable that a consumer should be penalized for making on-time payments simply due to how dates fall on the calendar. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I then called XXXX XXXX directly to see if they would be able to assist, but they tried to coerce me into accepting that I made the charge to send a cancellation email for a final sale which would likely be rejected. This was either a case of identity theft or error on the side of XXXX XXXX charging my Chase credit card.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I deposited {$5200.00} ( + {XXXX} fee ) to Wise for a currency exchange, and due to my mistake, I cancelled it and requested a refund. It stated that it would take XXXX to XXXX business days to process. 

XXXX. On the same day and at the same time on XX/XX/XXXX, I deposited {$3500.00} and submitted a separate currency exchange application. It also stated that it would take 0 to 3 business days to process. 

XXXX. On Thursday, XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX, I confirmed that there was a slight problem with my bank account and a negative balance was posted to my account. I also confirmed that the currency exchange application ( related to No. 2 ) was canceled due to this, and I confirmed that the negative balance issue was resolved in the afternoon of the same day. ( I believe that the account information was updated due to the cancellation of the currency exchange application. ) 4. On Friday, XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX, I confirmed that there were no changes to my bank account. I have confirmed that XXXX. XXXX ( refund of {$5200.00} ) has not been completed yet. 

XXXX. At around XXXX XXXX  on Friday, XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Wise 's customer service center about this. Wise responded that there was a 'technical issue ' and promised to explain it, and I received confirmation that the refund would be processed immediately. At XXXX XXXX  on the same day, I received the following via email, but unlike what the customer service center said, it did not clearly state what the problem was. 

[ Full Email ] -- -- -- -- -- -- # # - Please type your reply above this line. - # # XXXX XXXX, I'm getting in touch with you regarding your pending refund. 

Our relevant team confirmed that the refund for your transfer XXXX will be resumed on XX/XX/XXXX within 30 minutes after XXXX XXXX. 

Once it has been sent out, we'll let you know. Keep in mind that bank debits usually take 1-3 working days to return to your account after we issue the refund. 

If the money doesn't reach you after this time, please download a proof of refund and send it to your bank. 

Learn more about how long refunds take Let us know if you have any other questions. Were happy to help. 

Kind regards, Wise XXXX. 

This email was sent to you by Wise Payments Limited, trading as Wise. Wise Payments Limited is a company registered in XXXX and XXXX with registered number XXXX. Wise Payments Limited is an Electronic Money Institution authorized by the Financial Conduct Authority with firm reference XXXX. By using our services, you agree to our customer agreements Wise Payments Limited XXXX. All rights reserved. All investment services are provided by Wise 's subsidiaries which are authorized and regulated to provide investment services. If you hold a Jar or an account under Assets, any communication about this will be from representatives of the relevant investment entity -- -- -- -- -- -- XXXX. Sunday, XX/XX/XXXX, around XXXX, I confirmed that the refund has not been processed yet. I checked Wise 's application, but there was no message that the refund was in progress. I had set up an email to be sent when the refund was in progress, but this did not arrive either. 

XXXX. Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX. I was very upset that the process had not been completed yet, so I filed a claim with the customer service center, and they said that the process was missed and that I still had to 'wait " until the process was completed. 

I have already waited a week for their stupid processing, and I can quickly transfer the money transfer amount of my credit card usage and borrowed money. 
After a few arguments, I received a reply that they would process it right away, and it seemed to be in progress. They told me that the deposit would be processed in my bank account within a few minutes, but it has been over an hour and the transfer has not been confirmed. 

XXXX. Wise tried to deceive their customers by being complacent about their mistake. There was no compensation, no apology. 
I was seriously considering hiring a lawyer to sue them, but I confirmed that I could do it more mildly, so I am filing a report. 
I hope Wise will be warned and proceed more clearly and cleanly.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I had a business checking and savings account with chase that I did business with regularly. 
On XXXX XXXX XXXX a client of mine did an in branch transfer for an order to be fulfilled. A couple days had gone by and on XXXX XXXX XXXX I had gotten notification that my account had been restricted. That day I called chase and they said they needed to verify I owned the business and for me to bring in a phone bill that has my name and my company name on it. 

I went into the branch with the verification they requested and thats when they changed their story. They stated that my name needed to be listed on the Secretary of State website. I called the Secretary of State in XXXX  and they said that was not possible as they dont list owners on the website only registered agents and I cant be a registered agent unless I live in XXXX  which I live in XXXX. I informed chase about this and they said that was the only way they would release my money. 

After failing to gain any traction with chase I spoke with my clients and they said they have a contact. My client said his contact was an executive vp in compliance for chase. When my client spoke to them the contact stated that I must be lying and that he would not look into the matter. He stated that it was absolutely not a chase policy that I had to be on the SoS website and quoted XXXX  law. 

Since then Ive been trying to resolve this but to no avail. Every banker I speak to is just as baffled about the situation. Ive even had security supervisors at chase put in a request to release the funds because it must be a mistake and its been denied.They refuse to release my funds from my account with no legal reason supporting their actions. Ive confirmed this because Ive spoken to their legal department and they have no belief or accusations of any wrong doing for my account. 

Its now been over a month and theyre still refusing to release my money. My name is XXXX XXXX and my company name is XXXX XXXX out of XXXX. 

This has caused me to lose my largest client resulting in missing out of millions in revenue just from them alone. That customer would have made me up to XXXX monthly. It has tarnished my reputation and standing in this line of work to the point that I have product available for me to broker but no buyers now in a market where supply is ultra limited.

During the following 24 months XXXX provided poor workmanship and caused substantial damage to our home. We had three major leaks from the new patio door and because of poor workmanship and incorrect advice from XXXX, it was installed and reinstalled four times. As a result, we no longer have the brand-new door XXXX agreed to provide us with. As a result of the leaks and substantial delays from XXXX, we suffered major damage and financial harm. We were unable to use our master bedroom for nine consecutive months, whilst mold testing and redecorating were carried out. At great inconvenience, we moved into our guest bedroom. During that period our daughter was unable to visit us, business colleagues were unable to stayover, and my brother, recently bereft of his fiance, had to stay in a hotel for his entire stay. 
We told GreenSky we were in dispute with the merchant several times and also told them not to post any charges to our account until the dispute was resolved. However, GreenSky ignored our complaints and paid XXXX the final payment for the door and charged our credit card. This took away any leverage we had with XXXX to complete the work and bring our home back to a livable standard in a timely manner. 
GreenSky sent an email to me on XX/XX/XXXX ( see attached ) saying that they had conducted an investigation. The rest of the email made no sense to me whatsoever. I responded to this email on XX/XX/XXXX ( see attached ) asking for clarification and also an explanation of the 10 % credit that appeared on my account. I also requested that all further communication be via email. 
After chasing GreenSky for a response to my email, they responded on XX/XX/XXXX ( see attached ) alleging that I had agreed to the 10 % credit in a phone call on XX/XX/XXXX. This is a false claim. I did not agree to anything as a resolution to my complaint and sent an email to respond on XX/XX/XXXX ( see attached ). 
Although I have requested all communication in writing they still continue to call me and only send very sparse emails without detail. 
As you will see from my emails, I have expressly disputed the entire balance of my account due to GreenSky 's mishandling of my account, which caused substantial financial harm and inconvenience.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
About XX/XX/2023 my information from using my card at a gas station was entered into a cell phone. Within 5 minutes a person or persons started on a day long spending spree that spent over {$15000.00}. My card never left my hand. At XXXX the next day I was contacted by Wells Fargo security about some very large transactions being made out of my state. I was on the phone for 45 minutes and the agent said he had turned off my card and a new one would be sent. This was after the card had already been used for many transactions that the fraud department wasn't aware of. He did not turn off the card. Tuesday, I look at my account and find that a person having nothing more than the information on my card talked Wells Fargo bank by telephone into moving almost {$17000.00} from my checking account to my credit card so they could spend more money? This all stopped because Wells was so slow in posting it that the card was overdrawn, and they gave up. 
I went to my bank branch and my banker made a claim for the {$17000.00} and it was moved back from the credit card to my checking account. Done well. I made a detailed study of my credit card charges and paid each item that was mine. One day before I had a XXXX balance, so it was about XXXX items. All of the rest of the charges were made without my card present and were all reported as fraudulent on the Wells Fargo website. This is where it starts getting stupid. It is obvious to anyone looking at the account what happened. Wells Fargo split the case up and I got paperwork from three different places? I filled out the forms and made the signed statements that they were not my charges. It appeared that all of them were covered, however, by this time I no longer had access to the old card information because they had sent me a new card that was {$5000.00} overdrawn. I sent the letters back, two to XXXX XXXX and one to XXXX XXXX. This week I received another request for one of the ones I had returned. I also have now received two more letters. One, dated XX/XX/XXXX, says they have credited me {$1700.00}. They have not done that and there is no disputed transaction for that amount? The other letter dated XX/XX/XXXX says if I don't contact then in 10 days, they will close the case? I called the number today and after spending XXXX XXXX hours on the phone two persons consulting with other persons could not determine who sent the XX/XX/XXXX letter or why the amount on the XX/XX/XXXX letter was not correct. Nor could they Decide what I should do. I have one more letter that came from XXXX, The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX dated XXXX. XXXX, that said they had received my fraud complaint, " However, we need more time to complete our research. '' " We'll follow up with you by XXXX ''. XXXX months? Today I called them at the number on the letter. After giving her all of my information, she tells me that she is in the auto fraud department. and transfers me to another number where the girl says that the only person that can talk to me is not available. I have asked that my call be returned at XXXX XXXX XXXX tomorrow. In the meantime, I hope the person in XXXX XXXX doesn't close my case! This is consumer abuse at its best! The really sad thing here is that about XXXX well-meaning businesses will lose that money and XXXX could have stopped it sooner. This will only cost XXXX a couple of stamps and this customer of 50 years.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Details of the Issue : I am filing this complaint under the framework of the CFPBs new rule regulating money transfer services, which aims to protect consumers from issues like those I am currently encountering. The rule underscores the need for transparency, accountability, and timely resolution of disputes in the remittance process. Unfortunately, my experience with BOSS Revolution illustrates a failure to meet these standards. 

Background : On XX/XX/year>, I used BOSS Revolution to transfer {$2000.00} to my recipients GTBank account in XXXX. BOSS Revolution claims the funds were successfully credited to XXXX on XX/XX/year>. However, my recipient has provided official bank statements confirming that the funds have not been credited to their account. 

I previously filed a complaint with the CFPB ( Complaint # XXXX ), which was closed without resolution. Despite my rebuttal, BOSS Revolution has failed to take meaningful action to resolve the issue.

Failure to Comply with the CFPBs New Rule : The CFPBs recent regulation of money transfer services emphasizes the responsibility of providers like BOSS Revolution to ensure that funds reach the intended recipient and to provide timely, transparent resolutions when issues arise. BOSS Revolution has failed to comply in the following ways : 1. Failure to Ensure Funds Are Credited : While BOSS Revolution claims the funds were transferred, the recipient has not received the money. This contradicts the goal of protecting consumers by ensuring successful delivery of funds.

2. Inadequate Transparency and Support : BOSS Revolution has failed to provide clear proof that the funds are accessible to the recipient. They have also shifted the burden of resolving this issue onto me and the recipient, rather than engaging directly with XXXX to resolve the discrepancy.

3. Dismissive Compensation : In response to my prior complaint, BOSS Revolution offered a promotional code for a free transaction. This does not address the missing funds or fulfill their obligation to resolve the issue.

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XXXX XXXX I noticed a transaction for {$3500.00} that was about to be paid from my business account that I did not authorize. I immediately called Chase Bank and asked them to put a stop payment on this transaction. They said they would and charged me a {$30.00} stop payment fee. I asked them what was the name of the bank attempting to withdraw the money. I was told it was XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. I was given the bank 's number which I immediately called. No one answered so I left a VM. No one has returned my call to this day, When I checked my account the next morning, I noticed that Chase bank paid the XXXX XXXX.I called Chase Bank to ask why they paid the withdrawal when I had put a stop payment on it. They were apologetic but said they had no recourse but to pay it since it was an ACH and I had authorized it. That was not true. I asked for the form where I authorized the payment. I was told I would need to file a complaint to get the form, which I did. 

I was told that my complaint was denied because I had authorized the transaction. I told the person I talked to that I did not approve the transaction. I again asked asked for the document showing my approval of the withdrawal. I received it through the mail. I had never seen this form before and at the bottom right hand corner of the form was a computer generated signature supposedly from me. 

I called the complaint department again and asked if there were any other steps I could take to get my money back. I was told to file a second complaint which I did. My second complaint was denied. Chase Bank told me it was denied because I authorized the transaction. I asked if there was anything else I could do and I was told no. 

I want the money put back in the business account. Interestingly enough while the complaint process was underway, I received an email from an unknown company asking me that if I signed the form they sent me, they would put {$40000.00} in my business account. The form they sent me to sign stated that if I authorized the transfer of {$3500.00} from my account to them, the money would show up in by account. I did not sign the form. When I got back in my office I attempted to download the form, it was gone from my email.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: There is a past-due payment recorded on TransUnion and XXXX of a balance of {$0.00}. A {$0.00} past-due balance is ironic, this means I have no past-due balance. On XXXX, there is no such remark, and my payment history is perfect. You can see even on XXXX and transunion records themselves it says {$0.00} past-due. The inconsistency of these bureaus are so obvious, as for XXXX, on their website it says my BOA is 60 days past-due, and on their mobile app it says 30 days past-due. And on both, it says there is no recent delinquency! Each month 's credit report has different things to say. I have called at least 10 times and disputed 5 times through XXXX and 3 times through XXXX, and all representatives found it peculiar that the past-due balance was {$0.00}. The reason behind this issue I believe : My XXXX  credit card had autopay turned on and never turned off. On XX/XX/year>, I got a notification that there was a past-due payment on my account, and my credit scores from all three major bureaus dropped immediately. I called XXXX right away and asked about the issue and they said there was a {$6.00} past-due balance. This was very strange as I never turned off auto-pay. It was later I found out through XXXX and later confirmed by a representative of XXXX, that XXXX XXXX XXXX ' autopay gets automatically XXXX after XXXX  months of no use of the card. THIS IS RIDICULOUS! and the representative agreed that this is not my fault and therefore dispute it and remove the record off my account. The next day, XXXX and XXXX took it off my record and my credit scores were recovered. I was still waiting on TransUnion. XXXX, XXXX rolled back on that decision and dropped my score again with the record back on their file. However, the only record they had was that there was a late-payment and the late-payment amount was {$0.00}. The account status was " in good standing ''. When I called the XXXX line they said XXXX did not provide them with enough paperwork to reverse the record, which was very weird considering Experian was fixed and never rolled back. So I have a record on late payment of {$0.00} that is affecting my credit score with no reasonable person to talk with on XXXX or transunion other than the offer to just file yet another dispute, which I know will be ruled against, despite the obvious fact that the late amount due is {$0.00}.

Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative:
The issue that I am having is with Venmo. 
I had an issue with an old account because I accidentally used it for a small fundraiser because people didn't have cash. I didn't know that wasn't allowed, I apologized and closed that account. 

I then opened another account and everything has been fine for 2 years. A few weeks ago, I couldn't remember the e-mail associated with my current account, so I reached out to Venmo for help. 
I then receive an e-mail stating that my account was been permanently deactivated! 

I e-mailed back and said if my account is being permanently deactivated, then I want the balance that was in my Venmo account put back into my XXXX XXXX account. 

I followed every request that they asked ( send a photo of my drivers license and a photo of me holding my drivers license ) Venmo has refused to give me my information so I can access my money, and told me that I will need to wait 8 weeks for a check to be mailed to me. 

I really need help getting my money back and I am truly hurt at the way Venmo has treated me as a customer.

Bank State Employees Credit Union Location XXXX, NC At the end of XXXX XXXX XXXX I was hacked. All companies that tried to get funds on the old card were denied until XXXX XXXX when one charge from XXXX was allowed to go through. Then all charges were denied again until XXXX when someone named XXXX at the branch on XXXX XXXX. in XXXX, NC. open the old debit card and allowed it to be charged on once again. I went in XXXX back to XXXX and tried once again to get it straightened out. It wasn't until XXXX that I was able to get this old card that was supposed to be closed since XXXX XXXX resolved. Now I may not get all my funds back because companies did charge on it from XXXX to XXXX Companies I did not authorize or continue service with after I was hacked. 

The cable company, XXXX in XXXX, NC, came to repair the cable right before the card was reauthorized in XXXX. I told them I had cancelled the service in XXXX and even went to the office of the cable company to find out more about why they were trying to fix what I wasn't suppose to have. They said they had been charging the old card. The next day a authorization was put on the old for charges. Although there had been none since XXXX when I called to cancel the cable. The bank informed in XXXX that it was XXXX who had reauthorized the card after I went in to make sure to once again check on the bank account and new card. 

I made repeated phone calls and visits to the bank regarding my accounts which have been changed 4 times now due to this. The original card that was supposed to have been cancelled, but was attached to all of the accounts with new cards issued. One of which I never received. If could not use the card from XXXX, Why then could a business? Why was it reopened in XXXX? Why wasn't it closed in XXXX the first time? Thank you.

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have tried several times to work with Experian ( along with XXXX ) to remove inaccuracies within my credit report, and they have continuously refused to even investigate my claims. Each time, I receive a bogus, auto-generated response - even though I am sending PROOF that the claim is valid. 

Please see their email response below : " We received a recent request regarding your credit information that does not appear to have been sent directly by you or to be authorized by you. As a precautionary measure, we have not taken any action on your alleged request. According to the federal Fair Credit Reporting Act, " '' if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumer 's file at a national consumer credit reporting company is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the company directly of such dispute, the company shall reinvestigate free of charge. '' '' Therefore, you can dispute any inaccurate information directly with Experian for free '' There is NO law that states a consumer can not use a third party, so using that as their excuse is irrelevant. In fact, the United States Congress has found the whole process so overwhelming that they afford consumers the right to use a third party on their behalf if the consumer so chooses. Even so, I have sent these letters myself now on 4 occasions.. the companies are ruining people 's lives and are not being held accountable. Thank you in advance for looking into these issues.

I am writing to formally file a complaint against Marcus Bank ( managed by Goldman Sachs ) regarding two recent transactions involving my savings account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I requested to withdraw {$50000.00} from my Marcus savings account. However, the bank reversed the transfer without providing any explanation. When I contacted the bank for clarification, I was informed that they could not provide any further information regarding the reversal.

Subject : Fraudulent Transaction Report Rejected Multiple Times by Bank Of America To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to complain that my report of a fraudulent transaction to BOA was rejected three times. I requested the cost be removed, but my request was denied. I seek resolution for this issue The story goes like this. 

On XX/XX/XXXX or XXXX, my credit card went missing, and on XX/XX/XXXX, someone began using it fraudulently. Unfortunately, I was unaware of the loss until XX/XX/XXXX when my bank detected suspicious activity on my account. 
I typically do not use this Bank of America card for regular purchases. It is for XXXX charging and minor expenses via XXXX XXXX, which is why I did not notice the unauthorized charges sooner. Because of this limited use, the fraudulent transactions went undetected for five days. 
After receiving a notification from my bank, I immediately suspended the card. Upon reviewing my statement, I discovered that a total of {$1000.00} had been spent across six unauthorized transactions between XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX. 
Even one of these transactions was made at a gas station in XXXX XXXX, a place I have not visited. ( Refer to the history for the fraud transactions below ) On XX/XX/XXXX, {$210.00} at XXXX in XXXXXXXX XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX, {$250.00} at a pet shop in XXXXXXXX XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX, {$210.00} at XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX, {$230.00} at XXXX XXXX in XXXXXXXX XXXX  On XX/XX/XXXX, {$47.00} at XXXX XXXX station in XXXXXXXX XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX, {$100.00} at XXXX XXXX station in XXXX XXXX. 

Out of the expenses listed above, only the XXXX charge of {$210.00} was recognized as fraudulent and removed. I do not understand why only this particular charge was addressed.The bank deducted the remaining {$850.00} from my account. 

When I first reported the issue to the bank ( Claim Number : XXXX ), I was told it couldn't be approved because I had already received the product or service. After filing a police report ( Report number : XXXX, attached ) and resubmitting my claim, I was rejected twice more for the same reason. I also provided proof from my company HR that I did not leave work on the day of the fraudulent transaction. I need to understand why my claim was rejected and request a clear explanation. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious issue. 
Sincerely,

American Express Company XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  RE : Denial of Equity ; Demand for Consideration To whom it shall concern, On or around XX/XX/XXXX I tendered a security, ( Ref : XXXX ) in acceptance to the offer your company proposed in your prospectus, for fair exchange of American Express Company products. I received a response in the mail stating that my application was denied because of a poor XXXX score, however, according to your prospectus dated XX/XX/XXXX, filed pursuant to Rule 424 ( b ) ( 5 ) with the SEC, in the annex section of that document, on pg. XXXX, the first sentence of the passage states, XXXX  scores are based on independent, third-party information, the accuracy of which we can not verify. The question then arises what other factors were used in denying me when I tendered a security that your company will turn into a receivable that you are going to receive payment for. It is unfair and deceptive to rely on information that you can not verify to determine my eligibility for American Express products, this could be construed as violations of UDAAP under federal law. 
To my knowledge XXXX scores are used to determine the potential risks of prospective consumers, I have read and understood the concerns outlined in you guys prospectus in regards to risk and you can rest assured that my account will never be delinquent, there will never be a period of inactivity or dormancy with my charges and my account will be paid on time each and every month because I will be satisfying my obligation by tendering payment with the series of notes that American Express will issue out on the distribution date which is the XXXX  of every month as described in your Prospectus. 
Furthermore, the taking of my application, with my personal identifiable information on its face, i.e. the social security number, and the transferring thereof to a depositor where it was pooled together with other receivables ( eligible investment ) and sold/transferred to a securitization special purpose entity ( trust ) for proceeds which is considered unjust enrichment and securities fraud on your companys behalf because I received no benefit. In addition, because you accepted my security you were supposed to be acting as POA in a fiduciary capacity for the benefit and protection of the investor. Fair exchange has never been robbery, quid pro quo, this was a barter transaction that took place with your company for equal value and consideration neither of which were received by me. Your company is in violation of the securities laws you agreed to follow and if I have to contact the I.R.S to inform them that I bartered to you a security and you decided not to live up to your end of the bargain by bartering back with me, I will have no choice but to notify them, which could have a damaging effect on the American Express Brand if further action is necessary.

Let it be known and allow me to reiterate that the American Express Company owes me valuable consideration ( in the form of an American Express open-end Platinum credit card or its equivalent ) for the exchange of my security, which constituted a bartering transaction, that of which will be filed on a 1099B with the I.R.S if you continue to refuse to barter with me. Ill let the I.R.S handle it. There may have been some sort of misunderstanding with the terms of the contract, but let me reassure you that I intend for this arrangement to be mutually beneficial to all parties involved, including myself. However, as it stands right now, I have been held without equity and American Express Company is in violation of its bank charter, federal securities laws, and their agreements on file with the SEC because pursuant to your prospectus you told the SEC you would not trade securities on the secondary market, or maybe Im misinterpreting what was stated. Anyway, you may have many concerns none of which shall arise from doing business with me and many of which would result from your failure to compensate me for my investment into your company as a silent investor.

IN THE EVENT THAT YOU DECIDE NOT TO COMPLY I WILL BE FORCED TO FILE A COMPLAINT WITH THE OCC, THE SEC, THE CFPB AND THE FEDERAL RESERVE BOARD, SEPARATELY FOR YOUR WILLFUL NONCOMPLIANCE AND BREACH OF CONTRACT. YOU HAVE XXXX ( XXXX ) DAYS AFTER THE RECEIPT OF THIS NOTICE TO RESPOND WITH A DECISION REGARDING THIS MATTER. 
Please tell me what are the factors that the underwriting team used to decide the application reasoning for denial. I gave you my social security number which gave you access to my trust. Several laws have been violated, such as 15 us code 1666b and the violation of the security exchange act of 1934.

UDDAP ISSUE : I currently have a Home Depot credit card issued by Citibank. Every month, I make my payment on time and in excess of the minimum payment due. The excess amount of the minimum due does not get applied to the promotional balance, as setup by myself online and via customer service - multiple times. Because I work for a financial institution, Im very familiar with the CFPB regulations for proper payment allocations. Each month, I have to call in to get the payment adjusted correctly/payment allocation setup again and Citibank keeps telling me theyve fixed it. The agents do not complete the request. I am concerned with consumers that are relying on the system processing payments correctly, as they are probably being charged inadvertently with all deferred interest as they think payments are applied correctly. And when you call, the agents say they take care of the issue but never do. Ive taken all the proper steps but their system still doesnt work correctly. This is deceptive behavior!! 

Ive provided a screenshot of my statement where youll see the prior months adjustment done by an agent for the corrected amount of {$380.00} along with the newest payment made in XXXX for the total amount of {$300.00} applied to my revolving balance, whereas a the min payment dues was {$100.00} - {$200.00} shouldve been applied to the promotional balance.

I am filing a complaint against Cash App ( Block , Inc. ) due to inadequate customer service and unfair practices, which violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ). Specifically, Cash App failed to take timely and effective measures to prevent and address fraud on their platform, leaving my account vulnerable and unprotected.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a copy of the complaint filed with XXXX. I am filing this complaint against Zelle. the Zelle site stated to contact bank. I do not agree with the banks resolution. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from XXXX that XXXX XXXX XXXX was added as a contact to my Zelle account and to contact them If there was an issue. I have never used Zelle in the past and contacted XXXX immediately. The Zelle account is housed under my phone number and email. While on the phone I noticed another email from XXXX timed one minute after the first one received that a XXXX had been sent to this individual. I disputed this transaction and removed information for Zelle access and ordered new debit cards. While on the phone I received texts from XXXX where someone was also attempting to use our debit card numbers. These charges were flagged as suspicious by XXXX and declined. Once I arrived home I went to talk to my husband and found him on the phone with XXXX also disputing the XXXX withdrawal. We pieced it together and he had called a phone number for assistance with a small disputed transaction. This number and the charge were fraudulent. My husband is XXXX XXXX XXXX and when on the phone with the perpetrator he somehow allowed a screen share for assistance and Im not exactly sure what else happened but my spouse is a victim. Hes not sure how he allowed this person access to our accounts and debit card. While on the phone with the person the Zelle transfer immediately came out. My husband then realized he was a victim of fraud. He doesnt remember exactly what he did or didnt do. He is XXXX and on multiple medications and suffers from short term memory loss. He did tell me that the person he was talking to confused him and had him doing all sorts of things on the computer. I told the second XXXX rep this on the phone. I was told that this XXXX would be reported to the crime dept of XXXX and that someone would be in contact with us. No one called at all to discuss this. I called for an update today and was told that XXXX had ruled against us and that the dispute would not be reopened or appealed and was closed. They would not tell me why they determined this outcome other than we would receive a letter in the mail. Here are my concerns. 1. This was obviously cyber crime and elderly crime. Whether its legally considered fraud or a scam doesnt matter. My husband was targeted and victimized. 2. My account was not protected. From the time I was notified that a contact was added to the Zelle account to the withdrawal the lapsed time was one minute. Protections were not put in place. This transfer should have been flagged because the account had never had a Zelle transaction before and the amount of XXXX is excessive for this account leaving under XXXX in it. If there had been a hold placed on the withdrawal until XXXX had my consent that it was legitimate this would have been avoided. XXXX flagged the debit card transactions and declined them yet no such protections are in place for Zelle payments? I request the funds to be replaced. I did submit a fraud report to the FBI with the recipients name. 
Update XX/XX/XXXX XXXX contacted me today regarding this complaint. Per the representative because my husband authorized the transaction we are not entitled to any refund. I explained ( again ) how he was unaware of what the fraudulent person was asking him to do and that it was a mixture of screen sharing and coercion. He also had no clue what Zelle is. I cited his age and issues. I also explained ( again ) that as a first time Zelle transfer I should have been given adequate notice to stop the transaction. I should have been given more than one minute between the email that stated a name was added to Zelle and the issuance of payment. If flags were in place as they are for debit card transactions this could have been avoided. I also referenced an article that stated there would be security features in place for first time Zelle payments ( see pic ). I also stated that from my research Zelle has refunded fraud and scams on a case by case basis. I request that Zelle also be brought into the loop regarding this transaction. Also from my research it is possible to recover the funds from the recipient ( if fraud ). I again stated that their decision regarding this dispute is unsatisfactory. The agent I spoke with used the term fraud multiple times during our conversation which signifies that whether unknowingly authorized or unauthorized the transaction was the result of fraud. Please see the excerpt of the article attached concerning risky Zelle transfers. Where was the tool that would flag a risky transfer in this situation? Per the article the tool would have been implemented as a first time Zelle transfer and should have flagged it as risky. I have also attached the emails with the one minute lapse from the addition of a recipient to the withdrawal sent which illustrates that the tool / procedure that should have been in place per Zelle for a first time transaction was not. I again respectfully request reimbursement.

I wasnt even aware that much money could be pulled out of my account in one day because I had alerts on my account that would notify me if {$500.00} was even pulled. Never once did I receive an alert and I was told that theyd be able to issue me a credit for the money that was pulled but I never received one. I would like my {$2000.00} back and I would like to switch over to another bank.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet

Consumer complaint narrative:
Very early this morning my husband stopped at the ATM at our local branch of US Bank in XXXX Oregon to get some cash as he does every Monday morning. He was not able to get cash, he said the machine didn't even offer that as an option. 

About XXXX am he found the time to call me from work to let me know he could not access our account so that I could find out if there was a problem with our account or if there was a problem with the ATM. 

I spent the next few hours calling the branch to find out and no one answered the phone there. Eventually, someone answered the phone. When I inquired as to why they didn't answer the phone, I was told they were busy with customers in the branch. To which I replied that I am also a customer! I have been in that branch several times and there are ALWAYS more employees in there than customers. 

In fact, more times than not, there are no customers in the branch at all. More and more people are banking online or through ATMs. So, it should be no problem for the branch to answer their XXXX phones. 

This first person I spoke to hung up on me before I could find out if or when the ATM would have funds available. So, I called the 1-800 national number. The person I spoke to also tried calling the branch and no one answered. She kindly offered to send an email to someone at the branch asking them to call me. 

I did receive a phone call from someone who I believe was in management, but can't confirm that as I don't recall his name. He also hung up on me. 

I kept calling because I knew my husband would not be able to make it to the bank before they closed as he works long hours this time of year. So, if there was still no money in the ATM he would have to find another way to get some cash. 

I believe I probably dialed the phone number to the local branch close to 100 times today and only 3 times did someone answer. The third time XXXX answered and he informed me that he was in fact the Branch Manager. XXXX told me that there is a third party that takes care of managing the ATM machines. I asked when there would be funds available in the machines and he couldn't answer that. 

I asked XXXX for the phone number for this third party so I could find out when they would be servicing the machines and he wouldn't give me that information. So, I asked him to call them to find out. I also asked him to call me when he could answer that and not surprisingly, he knew my name and phone number. 

I bring up that XXXX could identify me because I suspect that either they had blocked my number or the other employees recognized my name and number and were choosing not to answer my calls later in the day after I had been hung up on twice. 

I talked to XXXX at about XXXX pm and expected to get a call back from him within XXXX minutes as I didn't believe it should take long for him to get answers from this third party. 

At XXXX pm I began calling the branch again. Knowing that I would need to let my husband know if he needed to stop someplace else to get his cash. No surprise, they never answered the phone. This is when I began to suspect my phone number had been blocked or was being ignored. 

So, I called the 1-800 number again. This person also tried to call the branch and got no answer. I would think that would be one call the branch should be require to answer. I asked her to send an email to XXXX and she replied she couldn't do that. Since I knew that someone else had done so, I asked to speak to her supervisor. While I was on hold waiting for the supervisor, my other line was ringing and I could see it was my local branch, so I hung up and took the call. 

It was now XXXX pm and this call was indeed XXXX the XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX informed me that there was now money in the ATMs and that one of them was having mechanical issues and not working. I asked XXXX if they had blocked my phone number and he said no. So, they continued to ignore customers on the phone pretty much all day long. 

Look, I get that because fewer people are banking in person these days, staffing in financial institutions is inadequate, but this was ridiculous. In what business is it okay to simply ignore their customers trying to get answers or doing business on the phone? 

The few times I have been in the branch there have been at least 4-6 employees and anywhere from 0-3 customers. So, I really don't understand why no one answers the phones. I am XXXX and rarely go out of the house. I only go into the bank or any other brick-and-mortar business if necessary. I do curbside pick-up for groceries, online purchases to be shipped to me, and online banking as well. 

If they are not going to answer the phones, they need to provide a way for their customers to get answers. And that does not mean their 1-800 number for customer service. I think we all know that most " customer service '' doesn't actually provide real customer service. Yes, they also have websites where you can get some questions answered. Whether or not there is money in the ATM is not one of them. 

It took me XXXX hours of persistent phone calls to find that out today. That is RIDICULOUS! Please just answer your XXXX phones!!

I guess I'm going to have to take it there. So, recently I complained about not being able to pay my bill anymore. My login was deleted and my card was no longer showing. I have not been able to pay my bill since XXXX WITH NO FAULT OF MY OWN! I have repeatedly asked for this information. I then realized, as several times this year, I don't know who I am dealing with so I need to make sure I document. 

So let me get this straight. I faithfully and ALWAYS paid my bill timely. You SUDDENLY make it to where I can't pay my bill, and yet you are also adding interest and late fees as though I am avoiding to pay it!? Does that not sound crooked to you? SO LONG AS YOU UNDERSTAND THAT YOU WILL NOT GET A DIME OF WHATEVER FEES YOU HAVE ADDED, THEN FINE. The amount due is {$110.00}. That's it. You've basically given two months free. You're not getting anything extra. This is your fault. 

THIS IS YOUR FAULT! THE BILL WOULD HAVE BEEN PAID ALREADY! 

I REFUSE TO JUMP THRU HOOPS AND ROLL OVER LIKE A DOG FOR YOU! BRING MY LOGIN SCREEN BACK SO I CAN PAY MY BILL LIKE I ALWAYS HAVE! YOU ARE ATTEMPTING TO HURT MY CREDIT! MY FUTURE! THAT IS A FINANCIAL THREAT I WILL NOT TAKE LIGHTLY! 

NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO LATE FEES WILL BE PAID. THIS IS YOUR FAULT! DO I NEED TO GET A LAWYER? DON'T TEMPT ME! 

I have the right to be fed up with this. Fix it.

Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative: I have requested process and timing information for the trust of my grandparents of which I am one of the beneficiaries. We were initially made to wait 2 weeks after her passing for any information to arrive by mail. We were told that no information could be given over the phone or in person and that we had to await the letter. Once we received the letter we were made to wait an additional 2 weeks before we could access the house because our wealth manager and her supervisor were both out on vacation and there was no other person to help us until they returned. Less than a week before my grandmothers passing she, again, as many times before, told me of a folder that contained all of the information for when " the time '' came. The time came and I drove 2 hours to retrieve the packet, only to arrive to the door locks changed and the garage door unplugged so the code and opener I had would not work. I could not get anyone immediately on the phone so made the 2 hour drive home. Once I did talk to someone I was told that they had already gone through that desk drawer and there was no such folder. She was of very sound mind until her last days and I don't believe she lied for years about the folder. Why does Arvest and their vendors have unsupervised access to the house from the day she died, but the family is not allowed? I believe we should be able to have a family representative present when anyone enters, or at least be notified. There are things missing, family heirlooms, that we believe were in the house and Arvest and their " preferred '' vendors have been the only ones with unfettered access without family representation. Once we were granted time to go through the house we were initially told we would have 2 days. Before noon on the first day one of the managers told us that today would be the only day and that she was cancelling the next day because someone wasn't " acting right ''. For her to have that much power over our family matriarch 's possessions and property, when I had let myself in through the garage and sat with my grandmother in that kitchen less than a month before, was devastating. Panic set in before noon and then I learned at XXXX that XXXX was the cut off. 6 hours to go though our grandparents almost 100 years of accumulation, with no thought of being able to ever go back, was heartbreaking for days. She did eventually make contact and grant another day, but multiple trips from 2 hours away could have been avoided had we had a bit more information about how it was going to go beforehand. There is an information vacuum I do not believe my grandparents would have agreed with based on the bullet points on the website that likely sold them on this service. It was less than 1 month before my grandfathers passing and he was onXX/XX/XXXX and heavily medicated when they entered this arrangement. They likely thought that this would be easier on the family, but I also believe they thought we would be informed along the way. I have had to reach out for any information, and in doing so only get the most basic. Timing and process are listed front and center on their list of services provided in the wealth management arena, but they have not produced any information on how they perform the processes nor how long they expect them to take in spite of multiple requests, only that they use " preferred '' vendors. I was able to close out my mothers estate back in XX/XX/XXXXin just under 4 months and I knew nothing of the " process ''. From finalizing credit cards to vehicle and house sale to disbursement of funds to beneficiaries all researched and completed in a timely manner with the peace of mind that is was done with the least expense necessary and the way she wanted. The trust manager told me that being executor and trustee is not an honor, but it does go a long way, in my opinion, towards knowing that your loved ones wishes are being properly and respectfully finalized and that funds intended for beneficiaries is not wasted on unnecessary expenses or funneled away to fees. The 2 times we have been to the house it appears as the HVAC is being kept at a temperature as if someone was actively living there, which we believe is a waste of funds. Arvest insisted on using their " preferred '' lawn crew and the property is tended to more than we feel necessary, which we also feel is a waste of funds. Arvest has retained a large sum of cash from the estate for " expenses '', but have not detailed what those might be. There are fees and disbursements listed on the only 1 statement I have received that are not explained in a way we can understand them and they are quite a large sum for only being half way through the year. Their " preferred '' estate sale company has been busy with others and has not started sorting our grandparent 's estate for sale. It has been almost 2 months since we finished the family tours of the house and signed the paperwork that states we are done and wish for Arvest to proceed with the sale of the contents then the house. We feel another company should be chosen in the interest of time and reduction of continued cost to the estate for an undetermined amount of time while waiting on " preferred '' vendors. I was informed on my last email reach out that there was an appraisal done, but the details remain unexplained. There was question about a vehicle and what we wanted done with it. We suggested it go to a family member, who now, just recently, is a single mother of XX/XX/XXXX due to a death so this is now more important to us, but we have not heard anything about the vehicle and it has been almost 2 months since we made the request.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Office Of CEO at Capital One, I am writing to formally demand immediate remedial action regarding the adverse actions taken against my application. Unless a prompt resolution is achieved, I will seek appropriate remedies, including but not limited to monetary relief for all related damages, including mental anguish, or the issuance of an open-ended charge card, as the account will be securitized and traded in accordance with your prospectus. 

Denying credit or discriminating against an applicant is not only unethical but also unlawful. Such actions constitute an adverse action under Title 15, USC 1691, which prohibits discriminatory practices in credit transactions. Additionally, 15 USC 1681 provides congressional findings reinforcing consumer protections. Under 15 USC 1611, there are provisions for criminal liability in cases of willful and knowing violations. The regulations in 12 CFR 1002.4 specifically address discrimination and discourage adverse treatment between applicants and creditors. 

Moreover, I assert that my application is a digital asset representing a significant component of my financial identity and potential interactions with your institution. The application process serves as a critical touchpoint for customer engagement, data collection, and service delivery. The mishandling or denial of my application compromises not only my financial opportunities but also the integrity of your service platform. 

Furthermore, I expressly state that I **DO NOT CONSENT** to Capital One sharing any personal information with any third parties or agencies. This includes, but is not limited to, addresses, signatures, Social Security numbers, account history, and any other sensitive data. If any agreements have been entered into with Capital One that would permit such actionswhether known or unknownI reserve all rights and demand the immediate rescission of any such agreement unless appropriate remedial action is undertaken without delay. 

I expect a prompt response to this matter and a clear outline of the steps Capital One will take to rectify this situation, including the provision of the remedies outlined above.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My Citi Bank card was charged on two separate times at a XXXX XXXX XXXX that was not done by me. The amounts were for {$210.00}, and for {$55.00}. Both charges were done on the same date of XX/XX/2024. I didn't notice these charges until I viewed my statement some days later. Once I saw them, I immediately filed a dispute via my Citi Bank app. After several more weeks of not hearing any response, I called in and spoke with customer service. I was told that the request was denied due to " lack of information. '' I then re-submitted a dispute with customer service on the phone, providing all information they requested. That I did not loose my credit card, that I never lost posession, loaned, or allowed anyone else to use it, etc. They submitted the dispute, and again weeks went by with no answer. I called them again, and was told that my dispute was again denied. The lady explained to me that they were denieing my claim because my credit card is a " chip '' card, " and is unable to be scanned, replicated, or hacked. '' That is absolutely absurd, and false. Around the same time frame of XX/XX/XXXX, my debit card and another CC were also frauded, and the other company had no issue refunding and correcting the issue. In fact, the bank explained to me they were dealing with lots of " hot '' charges at the time and were aware of RF scanning in our local area, and assured me that even the newest chip cards were unfortunately not completely safe from being scanned at gas pumps, rf scanning devices etc. 
I called Citi Bank again to try to re-open the claim and provide more info, and was told I could not do that. The lady gave me the advice of " the only thing you can do is HAND WRITE a letter to the President of the bank, and ask him for your money back. '' Laughable at best. Not only was the customer service at Citi Bank a joke, but the fraudulent charges have just been collecting interest charges. I don't know what else to do. I've been a resident in this town for 30 years, and have been XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I did not make the charges, and am requesting something be done to correct these issues.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX and this is a formal complaint about chase checking account practices. have been a loyal Chase customer for over XXXX  years. Throughout my time with Chase, I have filed a handful of disputes. Unfortunately, in every instance, Chase has immediately sided with the merchant, disregarding the evidence and documentation I provided. 

Incident XXXX : XXXX XXXX in Hawaii Recently, I encountered a significant issue with a XXXX hotel in Hawaii. The hotel charged my account over XXXX times with different amounts, causing my account to go into overdraft due to multiple reversals and recharges. This resulted in me being charged more than the agreed amount. Despite providing Chase with all the necessary documentation, including confirmation from the hotel acknowledging their errors, Chase still sided with the hotel. 
I also will attach the invoice from the hotel clearly showing they overcharged me and the amount listed should add up to XXXX $ less than what they charged. 

When I called Chase to follow up, the representative informed me that Chase does not cover hotel disputes which is false after reading the policy, it clearly states overcharge or dissatisfaction of the service of hotels is covered. I voiced my concern and the representative shockingly responded, " then walk into a branch and close your account. '' I filed a formal complaint regarding this unprofessional behavior, but I never received a response from Chase. 

Incident XXXX : XXXX  XXXX XXXX More recently, a XXXX  institute charged my account XXXX times with an amount I had not agreed to. Chase concluded that I was right and returned the amounts charged. After XXXX  months chase sent me a letter after the dispute resolution stating theyll take the amount back out because they came to change their minds. Despite providing proof of the incorrect charges, Chase still withdrew the disputed amount from my account. This is incredibly frustrating, especially after reading Chase 's policies which clearly state they should cover such disputes. It is evident that the representative lied to me, and I have no safety or protection when merchants fraudulently charge my account. 

**Overdraft Fees** Additionally, Chase has charged me hundreds of dollars in overdraft fees, sometimes charging me over XXXX times in XXXX day, which amounts to {$34.00} each time. These excessive fees have made it difficult for me to bring my account current, further exacerbating my financial situation. 

I am extremely disappointed with Chase 's dispute resolution process and the lack of professionalism and support from their representatives. It appears that Chase prioritizes merchants over their loyal customers, leaving us vulnerable to fraudulent charges. 

I seek your assistance in addressing these unfair practices and ensuring that Chase implements a fair and transparent dispute resolution process. I am also requesting that Chase reviews and addresses my disputes and the behavior of their representatives appropriately. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
