Consumer complaint narrative:
Chase Sapphire Credit Card advertised XXXX introductory reward points to any new card customer that spends XXXX XXXXXXXX in the first three months. I received my card in XX/XX/XXXX and charged over XXXX XXXXXXXX within the three month time period. To date, the total amount of " New Cardmember Bonus '' points, listed on my monthly statement, is XXXX. Chase is XXXX short of what was advertised. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I called the customer service number, on the back of the Sapphire card ( XXXX ), around XXXX to speak to the representative about my remaining XXXX points. She ( can't remember the name ) requested an address verification to continue her search- I verified. Then, she claimed the system would not allow her into my account without my birthdate- I gave it to her. Then, she said the system is asking for the name of my other Chase credit card - I told her " Slate. '' Then, she requested the three digit CVV number on the back of the Slate card. By that time, I was frustrated, did not understand what any of my information had to do with reward points, and felt uncomfortable releasing any more personal information. She immediately apologized and said her system requires that information, followed by, " I will transfer you to the Escalation dept! '' The phone system put my back in the queue for another 20 minute hold for the next representative. 

At XXXX XXXX answered and said he was the supervisor. I explained the reward points situation and expressed my dismay for being required to answer personal information, and details about my other credit card that had nothing to do with the card that had the points discrepancy. He said the personal questions, " can be annoying, '' and without any further security inquiries, he delve into the situation at hand. Basically, XXXX confirmed that I, indeed, did spend over XXXX XXXXXXXX within the three months period, as stated in the terms and agreement. And, assured he would " send a note to the Marketing and Advertising dept, '' to research and eventually add the XXXX points to my account. It would take two statements cycles, if I were to receive any solution, XXXX concluded.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
BANK OF AMERICA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
XXXX, NC XXXX CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION BUREAU / CASE NUMBER XXXX RESPONSE OF XXXX XXXX XXXX | XXXX XXXX TO BANK OF AMERICAS RESPONSE DATED XX/XX/XXXX : In your response to my claim ( case # XXXX ), it is said : In accordance to our Deposit Agreement and Disclosures, ( the : Agreement ) which comprises part of the contract between us and our clients, we may reject payments orders. We ( BoA ) are not liable to you for the rejection. 

It is also said in your response of XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  : On XX/XX/XXXX, a wire transfer sent by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, in the amount of {$30000.00} posted to your account ending in XXXX. As noted in our Agreement there may be times when the beneficiarys bank may make payment to the beneficiary based solely on the account or other identifying number, even if the name on the payment order differs from the name on the account and we accept. In this instance, this wire was repaired and credited to your account, but that is not a bank standard. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, Bank of America rejected a wire transfer similar on all points to the one sent on XX/XX/XXXX to Bank of America by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX on behalf of XXXX XXXX, account ending in XXXX. 

As justification for the rejection of the wire transfer of XX/XX/XXXX, Bank of America invoked that when the account ending in XXXX was opened on XX/XX/XXXX, it was titled XXXX XXXX XXXX, In Trust For ( ITF ) XXXX and XXXX and XXXX and XXXX and XXXX XXXX. 

Another justification for the rejection of the wire transfer of XX/XX/XXXX, invoked by Bank of America is that : there may be times when Bank of America may decide ( depending of its mood? ) to accept or reject a wire transfer, implying that Bank of America has the unilateral right or authority to modify the terms and conditions of the contract between the bank and its customers. 

A contract is considered bilateral when two parties express their willingness to adhere to the agreement. These two parties commit to each other and modify their legal situation accordingly. 

On the other hand, a contract is qualified as unilateral when an agreement of wills binds only one of the parties. In this case, only one person commits, while the other party has no obligation. A common example of a one-sided contract is an offer of a reward for finding a lost item. 

In short, bilaterality is essential for an agreement to be considered a contract. It reflects the mutual exchange of obligations between the parties, thereby ensuring the validity and effectiveness of the agreement. 

It is important to note that unilateral will can also play a role in the formation of a contract, although the initial preparation is often the work of a single person before both parties formally commit. 

Bank of America issued several booklets of checks under the name of XXXX XXXX who, until today still detains three ( 3 ) booklets of checks under the name of XXXX XXXX ( XXXX # XXXX to XXXX ; XXXX to XXXX ; XXXX to XXXX ) - and no more booklets of checks under the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX - violated its own Deposit Agreement and Disclosures ( the Agreement ) which comprises part of the contract between BoA and its clients, mislead XXXX XXXX XXXX who, especially after the acceptance of the wire transfer of XX/XX/XXXX by Bank of America, could rightfully believe that the name XXXX XXXX written by Bank of America on its checks is legitimately acceptable and usable to carry out wire transfers like any other banking transactions. 

Bank of America could and should have, after repairing and crediting the transfer of XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  to my bank account ending in XXXX - based on the principles of contractual bilaterality and reciprocity, essential to guarantee fairness and trust in contractual relations- inform and warn XXXX XXXX not to use XXXX XXXX for future transfers. 

Based on the above considerations, Bank of America by falling to inform and warn XXXX XXXX XXXX not to use XXXX XXXX for future transfers after issuing booklets of checks under the name of XXXX XXXX and repairing and crediting the transfer of XX/XX/XXXX, acted in bad faith, violated, once again, the contract between the parties and caused harm to XXXX XXXX XXXX | XXXX XXXX at the eve of the XXXX holidays. 

Therefore, XXXX XXXX XXXX | XXXX XXXX reserves the right to take such legal actions as necessary against Bank of America to obtain, right and reasonable compensation for the harm unduly caused by Bank of America, if a reasonable resolution is not reached by the parties.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: My husband and I have been patrons for YEARS with chime mobile banking. We have always had issues with mobile check deposits of varying amounts. This time, our IRS tax refund was MAILED to us ( even though we opted for direct deposit ), FORCING us to use the mobile deposit feature on chime. We file married-jointly so the check has BOTH of our names listed on it from the FEDERAL GOVERNMENT. It stated on the app, that we BOTH had to sign the check, AND WRITE under our signatures " For mobile deposit to CHIME ACCOUNT ONLY '' ( or they wouldnt accept the check ) so we did the stated steps. Our check was DENIED. My husband called chime customer service TWICE ; once to be argued with that his name is not a matching name on the check ( it most definitely is ) and once to get transferred to the escalation department for them just to tell us " chime does NOT have the ability to verify U.S treasury checks '' and to try using a different bank. We can not use ANY other bank now because we HAD to write that it was for " chime account only '' in order for it to be accepted with chime. The refund check is now useless and we can not even ASK for another check to be sent to us until 30 DAYS FROM NOW from the treasury office.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have specifically asked my bank, US Bank on multiple occasions to not enroll me in any programs where overdraft coverages are allowed and then a fee is paid after an overdraft occurs. I did this when I opened my account in person, I did this again in person when I added an additional account holder. I have done this on numerous occasions since, over the phone with customer service representatives. I believe I have banked with them since XXXX. 
Recently I have noticed bank over draft fees coming out of my account but then being credited back and was under the assumption that it was some sort of auto debit and credit that just happened and then refunded, except this week multiple fees were not refunded back and I called my bank. I was informed that I had opted in to this service and that the fees were not to be refunded unless the bank had made an error. My partner is paid weekly by direct deposit so there is always a weekly deposit made in to the bank. I am paid bi weekly also by direct deposit so there are additional monthly deposits. I looked as far back as I could on my mobile app in to over draft fees and since the end of XX/XX/XXXX I have calculated over XXXX fees of {$36.00} that have not been credited back. 
I asked customer service representative to provide me proof of when I opted in to this service and they wont give it to me, I asked for a full accounting of overdraft fees paid to date & to speak to supervisors and was denied. I asked to speak to legal department and was denied. I was hung up on finally. 
I have never opted in to these protections in fact I have specifically asked that if there was not enough money in the account to cover a transaction that it be declined. I have reiterated this request on multiple occasions over the span of I believe 8 years and over and over again this will seem to be the case until they start sneaking them by on me in larger and larger numbers as they have done before in the past until I call and make a stink about it again. 
They keep saying I have opted in to this service but I have never not once done so knowingly in fact I have complained on numerous occasions and asked to have this service removed only to find out some months later that I have yet agian been re-enrolled in this service w/o my consent or knowledge.

I called XX/XX/year> and was told it would be fixed. It was not. I called back XX/XX/year>, was put on hold for an hour, then hung up on. I called back, asked to speak to a supervisor, the supervisor put me on hold for 45 minutes, then hung up on me. I reported this to my bank and they recovered my XXXX payment, but Target XXXX has continued to deduct additional payment from my account without applying them to my balance.

Consumer complaint narrative: I opened a checking account with Citibank on XX/XX/year>. I had no issues up till I tried to put a down payment for {$1500.00} on a vehicle with my debit card on XX/XX/year>. On XX/XX/year> Citibank restricted my checking account due to fraudulent activity I was unable to login or access the funds in the account. I was told by Citibanks security department I would receive a letter in the mail containing a reference code i could give them to gain access to my account. The security department team told me it would take 7-14 business days for me to receive the letter. Two weeks go by and I still have not received said letter. I tried calling and informing Citibank I have not received anything in the mail. All they kept saying is I had to wait for the letter that contained the reference code. I finally talked with a supervisor and he gave me another option to verify who I was. I gave them all information they needed and was told they would email it in to the higher ups, that I would hear back the next day. I never received a call or heard from anyone. I called back to Citibank security team and was told my account was in the process of being closed. It is now XX/XX/year> and have never received anything in the mail or never received a reason on why Citibank is closing my checking account. Everyone I have spoken to is very vague and never has a clear answer to why my account is being closed. I was told it takes XXXX days from the day they restricted my account which was XX/XX/year> to officially close my checking account. I have over {$1200.00} in that account that I have no access to and Citibank is withholding my funds. No one in the customer service department or security department seems to care they are keeping my funds from me. I was told they would be mailing an official check with the funds that are in the account at the time of closing and that would take 30-60 days from when the account was deemed officially closed. I have heard of many people going through the same issue with Citibank. This is not okay. Citibank needs to be looked into and they need to be shut down. It is my money they are not letting me have access to, not their money. I highly recommend anyone who is looking to open an account with Citibank to stay away and look elsewhere for their banking needs.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall-i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the the reinvestigation ; and ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 
Please remove the following items from my credit report, immediately :

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been a long standing customer of JP Morgan Chase Bank Credit Cards. I was XXXX XXXX military for many years, as well as married to an XXXX XXXX military member. I obtained the credit card with a special military interest rate. 

Over the years, our family has trusted chase bank credit cards to get us through hard times. Now out of the military and no longer XXXX XXXX but still a veteran, I got a notice from Chase credit that my interest rate would be increasing 18 % and all previous charges on the credit card would be subject to the 18 % interest increase. 

Because of this, I can literally no longer put food on the table. It ; s an extra {$350.00} a month to keep the card in good standing. I have called them more times than I can count and begged for help, I'm okay with the interest increase, just why am I getting charged the increase every month, on purchases I made for my family WHILE I WAS ACTIVE DUTY.

This is so wrong! Driving my family into bankruptcy. PLEASE HELP! I've paid thousands of dollars extra this year because of this and I sometimes and late on utility bills now or can't feed the family, just so my credit company doesn't send me to creditors. 

I've served this country for a decade and this is just a slap in the face!!!! PLEASE HELP, and help me get back the money that they've taken over the last 6 months from me from this. It's so WRONG! Illegal even, I think ....

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative: on Monday, XX/XX/year> my email and our phone was hacked. I noticed because I started receiving email notifications that someone was requesting pins to reset passwords to several of the apps on my phone. One of those notifications was for XXXX as soon as I started happening, I went into all of my apps and removed the credit card that I had saved on file, but it was too late. The person attempted to charge four different times through XXXX on my Cash app card. My cash app card was locked at the time, but the fourth charge went through according to Cash app the hacker paid using my cash tag even though three transactions were declined. Cash app did not question the fourth transaction. They simply allowed it to go through since XX/XX/XXXX I have attempted to be refunded for that fraudulent transaction. Cash App told me that it would be best to go through XXXX and XXXX sent me back to Cash App both stating that i can submit an appeal to their decision. I submitted the appeal but nothing has been done.I have a pin set to my Cash App for protection. My Cash app card remains locked for protection and yet the hacker was still able to withdraw funds from my cash app account and Im having to fight to get a refund. According to Cash app, my cash tag was used to allow the for transaction to go through, but Ive never added any businesses to my Cash App account. That was all done by the hacker when asked if they have protocol in place to prevent fraud since three of the four transactions were declined the first three transactions. They said yes and provided me with information of all of the things that I can do to protect my account. I have a pin and I keep my card locked I believe I did what I could to protect my account. as for XXXX, the hacker placed the order that immediately canceled it, but I did not receive the refund.

This seems very odd that I could afford a new car for XXXX and somehow cant afford a new credit card limit that probably would have have only been XXXX dollars. 15 US code 1691 states it is illegal to be denied credit. Adverse actions are illegal. It is unlawful for any creditor to discriminate against any applicant with respect to any aspect of a credit transaction. ECOA 1002.6 ( b ) -1 which is the equal credit opportunity act prohibits any creditor from using a prohibited basis in any system of evaluating the creditworthiness of applicants, except as permitted by the act and part 1002. What they are doing is unlawful and they must be fined at least at a minimum XXXX dollars for these unlawful acts they are committing. Thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative:
It all started on XX/XX/XXXX, with an unauthorized charge all the way across the country in a state I have never even been to at a company I have never visited, company being XXXX. The initial charge ( s ) prompted me to lock my cards and reorder them, causing me to contact the bank to resolve the issue by filing a dispute on the original charge it being {$84.00} and placed on my credit card provided by the bank. After re-ordering my card, a second and third charge, was placed on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX in Washington state once again, being {$23.00} AND {$30.00} respectively. These XXXX prompted me to call the bank. Their explanation being, " It was forced through the merchant and has nothing to do with them, '' later denying my disputes and claiming I did indeed somehow possibly spend money at a grocery store XXXX miles away from me. This prompted me to move my money to a new bank account. 

After moving my money on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX more charges at XXXX were placed, {$47.00} and {$42.00} dollars respectfully. This caused more contact with the bank and file more disputes. Additionally, my account had overdraft XXXX, supposedly not allowing my account to be in the negative at this point. Even after initiating an account closure on my credit card on XXXX XXXX and receiving a confirmation Email stating the following : " Weve received your request to close your XXXX XXXX account. Your card is now frozen and you wont be able to use it for future purchases. Well send you your final XXXX XXXX statement at the end of the billing period after your account has been closed. '' Even after being told my account was frozen and making a last stitch effort in closing the credit card account, STILL repeated unauthorized charges across the country appear on a " XXXX '' credit card. 

On XXXX XXXX, a XXXX charge ( {$53.00} ) was yet again processed, which was paid for automatically by my federal tax return being deposited into my account, further losing me money which is rightfully mine. After repeated attempts to rectify this situation and repeated impossible unauthorized charges with the bank, while being told I made the purchases and having my disputes repeatedly closed and denied, losing me hundreds of dollars combined, which I only paid out of fear of negatively impacting my credit, I eventually made the decision to close the checking account as well, being told it would take up to 30 days. 

Leading us to today, XX/XX/XXXX where in {$330.00} consisting on XXXX separate transactions being {$130.00}, {$84.00}, and {$120.00}. All of which are unauthorized and a repeated blatant fraud that is continuously being allowed by my former bank on a credit card in-which I was told was being closed and is frozen. 

All of the about transactions were disputed and denied, minus the XXXX most recent today. which are still considered open because I have just disputed them.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative: I just noticed that Overdraft protection feature on my Charles Schwab Checking account was enabled without my consent. After I talked to the bankers, I was informed that the feature was automatically enabled for all customers unless customers reached out to the bank to remove the feature. Most banks offer the option when customers sign up the account. In addition, customers can check that status on their online banking. However, with Schwab, customers are not offered the option when opening the account. And customers can't check and remove the feature online themselves. Schwab creates extra burdens and obstacles for customer to opt out overdraft feature, which potentially harm customers ' interest.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I filed a dispute with my bank for merchandise that was purchased from bestbuy.com for the amount charged to my card of {$520.00}. 

Wells Fargo investigated the charge and they determined they sided with XXXX XXXX stating the product was delivered. I disagreed with the dispute resolution because I did not receive the product. I was not home at the the time the package was delivered. They stated per terms and conditions of XXXX XXXX Wells Fargo has to abide by their conditions and I told them no that is not correct. You guys don't need to follow any of their terms and conditions specially if they were at fault. If this is the case than you are not allowing for consumers to dispute items that were never delivered and actually prevents customers from disputing charges for items that were never delivered. Just because an item is delivered does not mean it arrived to the receiver of the purchase. 

In this case the laptop was never delivered to me because I was not home at the time the delivery was made. The package required my signature and XXXX did not get my signature. All they did was write my name on the tracking information. XXXX XXXX would not work with me on this either. ( I will file another CFPB complaint with XXXX XXXX ) They continued to ignore my side of the story and never got the chance for me to rebuttal XXXX XXXX claims. Wells fargo just sided with them and ignored my evidence. This is not only wrong but it might be illegal as I have a right to dispute the charge and I have a right to defend my dispute. Wells fargo did not give me that right to defend it. I have a right to get my money back from this as I never received it. I have a good amount of evidence showing I was not home. This includes witnesses as I was attending a family member due to her broken elbow. 

Overall I am filing a complaint as this is not only not fair but illegal if I am not able to contest findings and I feel that I deserve to get my money back from it but instead Wells Fargo refuses. 

I also attempted to dispute unauthorize charges and instead they closed my accounts so now I am out with more money. 

I went with another bank and they told me I would have won this case because there was no evidence a signature wa gathered by XXXX and it is on the seller to obtain signatures and file an insurance claim with the carrier.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Comenity Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX On XX/XX/XXXX, I made a purchase at XXXX via the Comenity Bank Credit Card . The purchase was under a 6 month interest free promotional plan. The payoff needed to occur prior to XX/XX/XXXX. I purposefully scheduled the monthly payments in accurate intervals and ensured the payoff was going to occur mid XXXX. 

When I received the first statement, I noticed that the company began assessing a {$2.00} statement fee. I called on XX/XX/XXXX to have the fee removed. I was told that the only way to remove the fee was by enrolling into online statements. I enrolled into online statements but proceeded to get charged for a statement fee. I called the company again on XX/XX/XXXX and was told that it could take a few billing cycles for the fee to stop. They refunded the second month 's fee as well. I subsequently stopped receiving the paper statements and did not see that the paper statement fees had continued for XXXX more months. 

Irrespective of this, I made sure to make the payoff payment well in advance of the promotion end date. As you can see from the attached statement transactions, I paid off {$1900.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. Out of abundance of caution I called the company on XX/XX/XXXX to confirm that the amount I paid is the payoff for the promotional purchase. The company represented confirmed that the payoff amount was correct. 

Subsequently, when I checked by statement on XX/XX/XXXX, I saw that the company had assessed full interest on the XX/XX/XXXX promotional purchase in the amount of {$1100.00} and there were XXXX charges of {$2.00} for statement fees. 

I immediately contacted the company on XX/XX/XXXX and was told that the promotional balance was not paid off and was short in the amount of {$5.00}, the amount of the statement fees and therefore, it was within their rights to charge the interest. I argued that the company erroneously and in a predatory fashion continued to charge the statement fees and that their company representative misled in her confirmation that no interest would be charged. The company representative noted that there was nothing she could do to assist. 

I then called the company again on XX/XX/XXXX and requested to escalate the matter to a manager and to the compliance team 's attention. I spoke with XXXX XXXX XXXX who stated that I was absolutely correct and that even if the statement fees were assessed and not refunded, those should've been part of the revolver and not added to the promotional purchase. She said that she would try everything she can to correct this error as she believed this to be an unjust situation as well. She requested my cell phone number and said that she will personally call me back after she speaks with her manager.

She returned my call within a few hours saying that her manager too could see what had happened but due to compliance reason could not approve a correction and removal of the interest. When I noted that not correcting is in fact a compliance issue, XXXX XXXX XXXX said that if they fix my account, they would have to do it for others. 

I would like for this predatory lending practice to be reviewed and report that I have been taken advantage of as a consumer by Comenity Bank. I have followed all procedures as described to me and intended not to pay interest and fees. I believe Comenity Bank has purposefully manipulated the account with not stopping the statement fees and then made false attempts in trying to rectify the situation. 

I have been left with no choice but to report this matter to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and if not resolved, will continue to escalate this predatory action to the States Attorney General for investigation. 

Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Cash App ( operated by Block , Inc. ) due to their inadequate customer service, unfair practices, and failure to comply with federal laws that protect consumers from fraud and financial harm. These failures violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ), and Regulation E.

Specifically, Cash App failed to take timely and effective measures to prevent and address fraud on their platform. Despite their obligation to implement reasonable security measures to protect customer accounts, my account was left vulnerable and unprotected, which resulted in unauthorized transactions.

Moreover, their dispute resolution process was unfair, deceptive, and noncompliant with the error resolution requirements under the EFTA and Regulation E. Regulation E mandates that financial institutions must investigate and resolve errors involving electronic fund transfers promptly, typically within 10 business days. Cash App failed to meet these requirements by either not conducting a thorough investigation or by dismissing my claim without adequate justification.

Under the EFTA and Regulation E, consumers are entitled to dispute unauthorized electronic fund transfers and seek reimbursement when fraud is reported in a timely manner. I notified Cash App promptly about the fraudulent activity on my account and provided all necessary details to support my claim. Despite this, Cash App has failed to provide the reimbursement I am entitled to under the law.

These actions have caused significant financial loss and inconvenience. I request the following : Immediate reimbursement for the unauthorized transactions, as required under the EFTA and Regulation E.

A detailed explanation of their investigation process and justification for their decision.

Implementation of stronger fraud prevention measures to ensure other consumers are not similarly affected.

I trust that regulatory authorities will investigate Cash App 's practices to ensure compliance with federal laws and protect consumers from further harm
I opened a bank account with Region 's Bank with the expiations ' of receiving a {$300.00} opening fee within 60 days and was denied funds

On XX/XX/year>, I began receiving notifications that a digital checking account had been opened at Experian in my name. I immediately sought to log into my account, which I had a unique complex password for, only to find that the account had been taken over and was now associated with an email account I did not recognize. 

Attempts to log in by other methods, following the instructions in the XXXX XXXX/company website, were thwarted. Secondary options, including texting my phone number, would not execute. There was no way to cancel, or to speak with a representative. 

It turns out that for years it has been possible for any fraudster to impersonate anyone using information commonly available in data breaches to take over an existing account at Experian - simply by creating a new one using that person 's name. 

All of Experian 's information flow involves a " dark design pattern '' to get you to hang up, and not to talk to a representative. Now fraudsters have access to my entire credit history, and Experian is not accountable, or contactable. 

They also made it impossible to process a temporary fraud alert, suggesting that the best method to respond to my suddenly being shut out of my account and potentially subject to rapid identity theft and financial fraud, was to print some documents and mail them across the country. XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear PayPal Customer Support, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to express my deep concern and frustration regarding the recent permanent limitation placed on my PayPal account, registered under the email address XXXX. I believe that there has been a misunderstanding or mistake in this matter. 

First and foremost, I want to emphasize that I have always strived to abide by PayPal 's policies and guidelines diligently. I have not engaged in any activities that would warrant such a severe measure as a permanent account limitation. This situation has left me perplexed and distressed. 

I kindly request that PayPal conducts a thorough re-evaluation of my account 's limitation. I believe that upon further investigation, it will become evident that there has been no violation of PayPal 's policies from my end. I am committed to resolving any issues or concerns that may have led to this decision, and I am willing to provide any necessary documentation or information to support this appeal. 

My PayPal account has been an essential tool for me in managing my finances and conducting online transactions. Losing access to it has caused significant inconvenience, and I would like to see a fair resolution that restores my account 's functionality. 

I understand that PayPal 's primary concern is to maintain the security and integrity of its platform. However, I respectfully request that you give me the opportunity to clarify any misunderstandings and rectify any potential issues that may have led to this unfortunate situation.

I appreciate your attention to this matter and kindly ask that you expedite the review process to minimize any further disruption to my financial activities. Please feel free to contact me at XXXX if you require any additional information or clarification. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. I look forward to a prompt and positive resolution of this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: I received several calls from representative claiming to be from Bank of America. This happened on XX/XX/year>. They called at approximately XXXX XXXX. The number they called from is XXXX which is the same phone number is the bank of my debit card. They had all my personal information and they said that they needed to assist me because there was fraud on my account. They needed to transfer my money to a new account in order to avoid my funds to be taken due to fraudulent charges. They asked me to sign in to my account and do a couple things on there that I am not familiar with. I told them I was not familiar and I didnt feel comfortable doing that they sent me notifications and they confirmed my information and their phone number so everything seem legitimate. After I got off the phone with them. I received some emails from Bank of America saying we noticed some transactions on your account. At that point I felt something was wrong and I called the bank. 2 hours after receiving the fraud call I called the bank and told them what happened. I told them I didnt authorize and had no knowledge because I was tricked and fooled into logging into my account. The bank promised to freeze my account and place the transaction on hold. They also said that they would contact the other bank to let them know it was fraud. My account had a fraudulent wire transfer for {$1500.00} placed on hold and my account was frozen. How ever the next day the transaction was allowed to go through without my consent and the funds were stolen and taken from my account. I am a single mom and I do t have much. I dont have money for food or for the holidays. I have never used a wire transfer before and I am so confused as to why the bank would allow the transaction to go through after I explained to them that it was fraud because of the representatives impersonation of the bank and the calls I got directly from their phone number. Bank of America is not being helpful. This is all the money I had to pay my bills and this is extremely stressful and upsetting.

To Whom It May Concern at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing this complaint against Wells Fargo Bank due to their repeated failure to provide critical tax documentsspecifically, 1099-INT forms or alternative proof of interest income and tax withholding for XXXX and XXXX my persistent efforts. This issue has prevented me from filing a tax refund claim with the IRS before the XX/XX/XXXX, deadline for my XXXX taxes, potentially causing financial loss. 

Background : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, residing in the XXXX since XXXX. From XXXX to XXXX, I was a XXXX XXXX  and under U.S. tax law, my bank interest income should be tax-exempt. I hold multiple accounts with Wells Fargo, including numerous Time Accounts ( Certificates of XXXX ), with known account numbers XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX However, Wells Fargo did not request a XXXX form when these accounts were opened, resulting in 30 % of my interest income being withheld in XXXX and XXXX. I submitted a XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX to correct this, but Wells Fargo failed to update my accounts, necessitating another submission in XX/XX/XXXX. After the XXXX submission, I successfully received a XXXX refund via Form XXXX, but I still lack the XXXX and XXXX records needed for prior refunds. 

Efforts to Resolve : I have made exhaustive attempts to obtain these documents : Phone Calls : I called Wells Fargos toll-free numbers ( including XXXX ) multiple times, but all calls were answered by automated systems with no option to speak to a human representative, preventing meaningful assistance. 
Branch Visits : I visited two branchesXXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX several occasions, but staff were unable to provide the requested XXXX forms or resolve the issue. 
Online Banking : I attempted to use the Secure Message feature on Wells Fargos online banking platform to request the documents, but the function is currently unusable, leaving me with no viable communication channel. 
Impact : With the XX/XX/XXXX, IRS deadline approaching, I urgently need the XXXX forms for XXXX and XXXX to file Form XXXX and claim a refund for taxes improperly withheld from my Time Accounts interest income. Wells Fargos failure to provide these documentscompounded by their negligence in processing my XX/XX/XXXX XXXX submission and lack of accessible customer supporthas left me unable to meet this deadline, risking significant financial loss.

I noticed an unauthorized ACH transfer of {$9500.00} from my savings account to XXXX XXXX. I called Citizens Bank immediately to report it, and the next day I went to the branch in XXXX XXXX XXXX. However, I noticed the person who spoke to me needed more knowledge to address the situation. The men should've called the fraud department then ; but failed to do so. He told me the bank would investigate the case, which could take 4-8 business days, but they still need to look into it. A couple of days later, I called the fraud department to see the status of my case, and a representative told me the case was closed and resolved. The case shouldn't be closed, because the case was not resolved, and the funds were not back in my account. He made a report and gave me another case number. However, on XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX pm, I called XXXX XXXX to ask them about the unauthorized transfer. They found the account under my name, and the funds were there. I asked them to return the funds ; because I had not opened or authorized a new account They told me they would call Citizens Bank to reverse the funds, and they did. Overall, I noticed a lot of abnormalities from Citizens Bank 's handling of the situation. First, when I called to report suspicious activities regarding a small debit on my account, they stopped sending me further fraud alert messages. After I recovered the funds for {$9500.00}, I took them out of the account and closed it. Yet, when I checked another branch, the account was still open. I tried to close the account several times but it reopened again because someone was still trying to verify the account with XXXX. Due to the closeness of these interactions, I believe that my personal information was stolen from someone within the Citizens Bank. I think that was an employee with whom I got in contact when I asked to remove some fees from my business account because no one had information on my savings routing or account number. Another fact is, that other representatives from the bank confirmed that there were no traces or evidence that online banking was compromised. I've been getting letters with inquiries I didn't make. Another incident is now a {$400.00} and {$260.00} charge to my checking account through XXXX XXXX on the XXXX and XXXX of XXXX of this year. I didn't authorize these transactions, but the bank did without my knowledge. Fraud report #

-HOWEVER- Because of my countless 'phone calls, a second dispute had been opened, A Customer Service Representative XXXX XXXX, told XXXX that my payment of {$32.00} was never received. SB/JCP sent me an undated letter, asking for further documentation. SB/JCP wants : 1. An unredacted bank statement.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern Re : Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to bring to your attention multiple violations of federal laws committed by Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX that have resulted in unauthorized and inaccurate reporting of my personal information. These violations are in direct contravention of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 1681, the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), 15 USC 6801, and associated regulations, particularly 12 CFR 1016.7. 
* Unauthorized Sharing of Personal InformationAccording to 15 USC 6801, it is the policy of Congress that each financial institution, which includes Furnisher of Information to Credit Agencies, has an obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and protect the confidentiality of their nonpublic personal information. Despite this, neither [ Furnisher of Information to Credit Agencies ], nor Equifax and XXXX, obtained my written consent to furnish my personal information. Furthermore, 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) unequivocally states that a consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. As such, any consent provided, whether implicit or otherwise, is hereby revoked.Relevant USC and CFR codes : 15 USC 6801, 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), 12 CFR 1016.7 * Failure to Inform of Nondisclosure Option15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) dictates that a financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how to exercise their nondisclosure option. [ Furnisher of Information to Credit Agencies ] failed to inform me of my right to exercise this option, thereby breaching this legal requirement.Relevant USC and CFR codes : 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) * Reporting of Unauthorized Adverse ItemPer 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ), no consumer reporting agency may include adverse information in a consumer report without authorization, unless it falls under specific exceptions, which do not apply in this case. Equifax and XXXX are reporting adverse information without my permission, a clear violation of the law.Relevant USC code : 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) * Failure to Maintain Reasonable Procedures15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) explicitly states that a person shall not furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Equifax and XXXX are in breach of this provision by furnishing inaccurate information. Furthermore, 15 U.S. Code 1681e mandates that consumer reporting agencies must maintain reasonable procedures to avoid violations of FCRA. Equifax and XXXX have failed to maintain such procedures.Relevant USC codes : 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ), 15 U.S. Code 1681e In light of these serious violations of federal law, I demand immediate action to rectify these issues and ensure that my personal information is not inaccurately reported and shared without my explicit written consent. I am seeking the maximum penalty of {$1000.00} per violation, as allowed by law. 

Per the fcra as a federally protection consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written unwritten verbal non verbal per 15 usc 6802 I am also invoking my right under 12 CFR 1016.7 to opt out of your reporting services with immediate effect. been trying to solve this problem for some time with your agency and the corporations and debt collectors you allowed to put fraudulent inaccurate items on my credit report without permissible purpose. Matter is you continued to report items as well without my permission and not being 100 % accurate under 15 US Code 1681e ( b ). 

I am a litigious consumer Meaning unreasonably prone to go to law to settle disputes and is in the process of taking legal action in this matter to enforce my rights under FCRA and FDCPA. This is my official notice.I look forward to a prompt resolution of this matter. Please acknowledge the receipt of this complaint and inform me of the steps you will be taking to address these violations. 

All violations attached on and circled on Consumer report I been trying to solve this problem for some time with your agency and the corporations and debt collectors you allowed to put fraudulent inaccurate items on my credit report without permissible purpose. Matter is you continued to report items as well without my permission and not being 100 % accurate under 15 US Code 1681e ( b ). 

Remove any old or XXXX Mailable Address only correct resident address is XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX sc XXXX I am a XXXX XXXX  Meaning unreasonably prone to go to law to settle disputes and is in the process of taking legal action in this matter to enforce my rights under FCRA and FDCPA. This is my official notice. 
Sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/1984 Last XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX Chase Bank regarding the forced closure of my credit card accounts and discriminatory restrictions placed on my transactions, which I believe constitute unfair and retaliatory practices. 
Background and Timeline : In XXXX, I submitted a complaint to Chase Bank, providing evidence of what I believed to be fraudulent or unethical conduct by the bank. 
Shortly after submitting my complaint, XXXX forcibly closed my existing credit card account ( ending in XXXX ) without providing a clear or justified reason, other than referencing a vague pattern of abuse of the claims process. 
In XXXX, I was approved for a new Chase Sapphire Preferred credit card. However, I soon discovered that Chase was blocking all of my transactions on XXXX, even though my account was in good standing and my credit limit was sufficient. 
After several declined XXXX transactions, Chase again closed my new account, citing the same unsubstantiated reason as before. 
Evidence : I have attached screenshots showing : My account status as closed with a {$0.00} balance and no available credit, despite pending transactions. 
Multiple declined XXXX transactions, even though my account was open and in good standing at the time. 
The official closure notice from Chase, which references activity reflecting a pattern of abuse of the claims process but provides no specific evidence or explanation. 
My Concerns : Chases actions appear retaliatory, as the forced closures and transaction blocks began only after I reported their alleged misconduct. 
The bank has not provided any concrete evidence or due process to support its claims of abuse of the claims process. 
Blocking all XXXX transactions and then using this as a pretext to close my account is discriminatory and restricts my ability to use my credit card as intended. 
These actions have negatively impacted my credit, caused financial inconvenience, and denied me access to services without valid justification. 
Requested Resolution : I request that the CFPB investigate Chases practices regarding account closures and transaction restrictions, especially in cases where the customer has previously filed complaints against the bank.

I ask that Chase provide a detailed explanation and evidence for the account closures and transaction blocks. I request that my account be reinstated or that I be allowed
to open a new account without arbitrary restrictions or retaliation.

I seek assurance that Chase will not discriminate against me or other customers for filing complaints or using their accounts in a lawful manner.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I am attaching all relevant documentation, including account statements, screenshots of declined transactions, and the closure notice, to support my complaint. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Just because the contract was transferred does not mean the rights to enforce performance was transferred. This is an illegal debt and reporting it has caused me harm. 

3-203. TRANSFER OF INSTRUMENT ; RIGHTS ACQUIRED BY TRANSFER. 
Primary tabs ( a ) An instrument is transferred when it is delivered by a person other than its issuer for the purpose of giving to the person receiving delivery the right to enforce the instrument. 

( b ) Transfer of an instrument, whether or not the transfer is a negotiation, vests in the transferee any right of the transferor to enforce the instrument, including any right as a holder in due course, but the transferee can not acquire rights of a holder in due course by a transfer, directly or indirectly, from a holder in due course if the transferee engaged in fraud or illegality affecting the instrument. 

( c ) Unless otherwise agreed, if an instrument is transferred for value and the transferee does not become a holder because of lack of indorsement by the transferor, the transferee has a specifically enforceable right to the unqualified indorsement of the transferor, but negotiation of the instrument does not occur until the indorsement is made. 

( d ) If a transferor purports to transfer less than the entire instrument, negotiation of the instrument does

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Coinbase Account Locked and Unresponsive Support Summary : Since XX/XX/year>, my Coinbase account has been completely blockednot just restricted, but entirely inaccessible. I can not log in, nor can I contact Coinbase support to open a ticket or inquire about my account. I no longer have access to the funds deposited on the platform, and despite my efforts, Coinbase has not provided a resolution to this issue. 

Timeline of Events : XX/XX/year> : I received an email stating that my XXXX  wallet on Coinbase was deactivated due to eligibility restrictions. 

XX/XX/year> : I received a request for additional Know Your Customer ( KYC ) information. Coinbase gave me 15 days to provide details about my occupation, the source of my funds, and additional documentation. However, I was on vacation and missed the deadline. 

XX/XX/year> : I attempted to log into my account and received an error message stating that I should " try again later '' and that my funds were " safe. '' I immediately opened a case ( # XXXX ) for account access issues, but the problem persisted. 

XX/XX/year> : Coinbase sent another email requesting the missing information and warned me that failure to provide it within 5 days would result in account restrictions. 

My response : I replied to Coinbase explaining that I am more than willing to provide the requested documents, but I can not access my account to do so. I explained that every time I attempt to log in, I receive the same error message. 

XX/XX/year> : I finally managed to respond to their KYC request, providing the requested information and documentation. However, I continued to receive KYC requests and reminders as if I had not submitted anything. 

XX/XX/year> : Coinbase responded to my formal complaint, stating that I had not provided the requested information. However, I had already sent the required documents twiceon XX/XX/XXXX and again in response to their XX/XX/XXXX request. 

Recent KYC Requests : Even after fulfilling their requests multiple times, I continue to receive KYC emails. The last request was on XX/XX/year>, to which I responded again, but no feedback or resolution has been provided. 

Current Situation : I am still unable to access my Coinbase account and the funds within it. I am in the process of relocating from XXXX XXXX to XXXX, but as of now, I am still fiscally domiciled in XXXX XXXX. Despite complying with Coinbase 's requests, I have received no resolution, and I am now seeking external help to regain access to my account. 

Request for Resolution : I am seeking the CFPB 's assistance in ensuring that Coinbase reopens my account, provides access to my funds, and improves their support and communication regarding these issues. I have fully complied with all their requests, yet my account remains blocked without any explanation or way to resolve the issue. 

Thank you for your time and assistance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX received a text from bank about possible fraudulent charges on my debit card. 
I called my bank and discussed charges in question.One of the charges for {$9.00} to XXXX suspicious. The woman at the bank suggested I call XXXX customer service to see what the charge was for. I XXXX XXXX customer service and I found an XXXX website with a phone number. The phone number I called is XXXX. A man named XXXX XXXX answered the phone and said Thank you for calling XXXX, how can I help you? 
I explained I may have fraudulent charges on my debit card and one of them was to XXXX and I asked if he could help me see what the {$9.00} charge was for. I also mentioned my debit card was linked to PayPal and Venmo. XXXX told me he was a specialist for these apps and he was going to help me secure these accounts. XXXX told me to download a sharing app so he could get in to my PayPal and Venmo accounts and look for fraudulent charges. I downloaded the app and XXXX XXXX took control of my phone. I didnt question this because my companys IT department does this routinely and because I had called the XXXX customer service number to ask for assistance. XXXX told me I had multiple fraudulent charges showing on my PayPal account and some of these charges were in XXXX XXXX and in XXXX. He told me he was going to clear these charges from my account. XXXX XXXX told me he needed to get his managers approval to secure my account. He told me his managers name was XXXX XXXX XXXX and that he had to send some test dummy transactions to his manager to secure my account and make sure my account still works. XXXX XXXX did XXXX test dummy transactions- XXXX for {$1900.00} and XXXX for {$2900.00} both to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX He told me this wasnt actual money leaving my account only a test-no money would leave my bank account. He told me my account was secure and we hung up. I was still nervous about my debit card being compromised so I called my bank that night and cancelled my debit card. I removed my debit card and checking account from my PayPal account. 
When I realized money actually had left my checking account I submitted a case with PayPal and it was denied. I went to my bank on XX/XX/24 and explained what happened to the assistant bank manager. She was able to transfer my money back from the PayPal transactions because they were XXXX authorized charges. The bank manager told me to cal PayPal and explain what happened. I called PayPal and appealed my claim and it was denied for a second time. The case ID is XXXX XXXX 
Then I received an email from PayPal saying they have noticed I had been using my account in a questionable manner and to keep my account secure my access is limited. My pay pal account is showing $ XXXX At this point I had contacted life lock to get their assistance with this matter.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to bring to your attention a matter of great concern involving American Express Bank that has caused me significant distress and inconvenience. 

On XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I received a promotional email from American Express Bank. The email was personalized with my name and was specifically targeted at me as a valued card member. The offer was enticing : a {$350.00} cash bonus if I deposited {$25000.00} or more into a new American Express High Yield Savings account by XX/XX/, and maintained that balance through XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Believing in the credibility of American Express and the clarity of the offer, I promptly deposited the required amount into the new account. In fact, my account was credited with {$25000.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, well before the XX/XX/XXXX deadline. I made sure to maintain the balance as stipulated in the offer, expecting the bank to honor its promise. I maintained these funds until XXXX or XXXX, well beyond the required period. 

Despite my numerous attempts to resolve this issue with the bank, I have not received any satisfactory response or the promised bonus. This experience has left me feeling misled and unfairly treated. The bank 's failure to honor its promise and its lack of clear communication regarding the offer 's conditions have caused me considerable stress and disappointment. 

I have reached out to the bank 's customer service multiple times, only to be asked to wait, sometimes for as long as 15 days. Each time, I am given vague responses and promises of escalation to the corporate office, but to no avail. The bank continues to buy more time, leaving me in a state of uncertainty and frustration. It appears that the bank is using delay tactics and providing baseless reasons for not crediting the promised bonus. 

I kindly request your intervention in this matter. I believe that consumers should be able to trust the promotional offers they receive, especially from reputable institutions like American Express Bank. I am attaching all relevant documents, including the screenshot of the exact offer I received, the terms and conditions mentioned in the offer, and my bank statements showing the balance maintained throughout the offer period. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust in your commitment to protect consumers and uphold fairness in financial dealings.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: Sometime last year, I had an issue with a Venmo transaction that was entirely my fault, but caused my account to be suspended. What happened was I transferred {$35.00} to another account and didn't realize that it was my own account because I forgot and I reported it. My account was immediately frozen and when I attempted to resolve the issue, I could no longer transfer money from my bank account into my Venmo account. Then in XXXX of this year, I legally changed my name for personal reasons, so I decided that since I couldn't fix the old account, I would attempt to create a new account under my new name. It seemed to work, but upon receiving my Venmo debit card, my account was immediately suspended. I have since sent numerous emails about the situation to Venmo 's support team and made numerous phone calls. Venmo has failed to unfreeze my account or allow me to add any bank account because my bank account is tied to the other account and my joint checking account with my husband is tied to his own Venmo account. This issue has been escelated numerous times and yet, I still can not use my Venmo account over a matter of {$35.00}, which I told them I would put back into my Venmo account if they would just allow me to add a bank account. I should not have to open a new bank account just to fix an error that Venmo created. It should absolutely not take more than a year to resolve any issue with a financial institution and Venmo customer service further refuses to allow me to talk to someone who can actually resolve the issue. Their customer support team has put me on hold more than once, often leaving me on hold for 45 minutes to an hour until I eventually hang up and call back in. The support team is rude and completely unhelpful and none of them can actually troubleshoot any issues. They are basically just reading from the same articles the help section on their app gives and not actually doing anything to provide any real support to their customers. Oh, and to top it off, they are still insisting on calling me by the wrong name, even though I submitted correct documentation for my name change.

The second crime happened on XX/XX/23 @ XXXX XXXX  at a SchoolsFirst FCU ATM in XXXX, CA XXXX. Someone deposited a fake check under my name for {$1000.00} and then immediately withdrew money from my account with two separate transactions of {$500.00} each. The third crime happened on XX/XX/23 @ XXXX XXXX at a SchoolsFirst FCU ATM in XXXX, CA XXXX. Someone deposited a fake check under my name for {$1000.00} and then immediately withdrew money from my account with two separate transactions of {$500.00} each. I did not do or authorize all transactions. My debit card has always been with me, and my debit card information nor PIN has been shared with anyone. A fraud claim has been reported and opened with my bank SchoolsFirst Federal Credit Union, requesting a credit of {$3000.00} back to my checking account. I filed a police report with the XXXX XXXX Police Department for Check & ATM fraud, identity theft, and forgery ( case # XXXX ). Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I was charged {$640.00} by XXXX XXXX XXXX for my dog 's annual wellness visit, which included an exam, labs, vaccinations, a XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX imaging. 

On XX/XX/year>, during a separate visit to discuss XXXX, I was informed for the first time that the imaging performed back in XXXX had been done on the wrong leg. This was never disclosed to me at the time of service. 

When I confronted the clinic, they acknowledged the error and offered to redo the imaging at no charge. However, by that time, I had lost all trust in their care and declined, as I did not want to subject my dog to another round of sedation and XXXX exposure due to their mistake. 

They also falsely claimed 56 images were taken, but the invoice clearly reflects only 12 were billed. Compounding the issue, I was charged {$340.00} for the XXXX XXXX XXXX, almost double the price quoted by another clinic ( {$170.00} from XXXX XXXX XXXX ). The clinic later admitted they initially billed me incorrectly for a product they no longer carry and attempted to justify the new inflated cost with inconsistent explanations. 

I raised these concerns and disputed the charge with my credit card provider. My card is XXXX but serviced by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I submitted revised documentation via fax and XXXX online portal, including emails from the clinics owner acknowledging the mistakes. 

Despite repeated calls and follow-up, I received no confirmation that my documents were re-reviewed or that the dispute is being reconsidered. I've been bounced between departments with no resolution. 

This dispute was not filed immediately because the error was not discovered until nearly five months later, and that delay was caused by the clinic, not by negligence on my part.

On XX/XX/XXXX Bank of America took {$4600.00} out of my checking account twice on that same day for a total of {$9200.00}. Between the time I noticed this problem late in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX I spoke with XXXX XXXX, the branch manager multiple times to try to resolve this issue. During this time my negative credit card balance moved moved in the positive direction as the last few auto-pay charges were paid. That left the balance at- {$8500.00} still owed to me by the bank which I wanted refunded at that time. XXXX said the amount would have to be mailed to me and it would take 8 to 10 business days for that to happen. I did not want my refund to be mailed but XXXX gave me no choice. 

During the time I was meeting with XXXX she asked me to speak with someone else on the phone. That person insisted that I caused this problem even though I know that I did not and she had no proof that I did. After that conversation I told XXXX that I wanted all of my accounts with Bank of America closed. I gave her a letter stating that and a spreadsheet showing that the bank still owed {$8500.00} to me. I also gave XXXX my credit card. 

It has now been 14 business days since XXXX told me it would take 8 to 10 business days for the {$8500.00} which has essentially been stolen from me by Bank of America to be refunded to me. During the intervening time I have made multiple trips to the bank only to be told by XXXX that my check is in the mail. The last trip was today, XX/XX/XXXX, after checking that the mail had been delivered but there was nothing from Bank of America. I am hoping that your organization will be able to convince Bank of America to pay the money they owe to me.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am fairly certain I made a payment on or about XX/XX/XXXX to Capital One for my business credit card. It was not credited. However, the payment due date is the XXXX of the month yet I did not receive a late notice or penalty, so the payment must have gone through. I called the customer service number but the woman whom I spoke to would not help and ended up disconnecting the call. I then sent XXXX emails to the CEO using a valid address I acquired through the consumer advocate service XXXX XXXX. The emails did not bounce back and therefore I have every reason to believe they went through. Finally I contacted Capital One through its social media team on XXXX, but they refused to respond other than to send me a survey and specifically refused to have a higher-level customer rep contact me although I requested one.

On Wednesday XX/XX/2023 I received a call from pnc over a {$1.00} charge to my account flagged as suspicious activity. They had asked if I authorized any charges and I said no. They then suggested a card replacement I asked how long it would take to arrive and they said 3 days and I would receive it by Saturday the XXXX. I said I CAN NOT be without access to my paycheck that is directly deposited into my account on Friday XX/XX/XXXX and that I do not want to do so if there was ANY possibility I would not have access to my money as this would cause severe and permanent damage to my health and living situation. Against my wishes They proceeded to do so. It was not until Saturday I learned my debit card had been deactivated while trying to buy food and get my prescriptions. At this time the banks had closed for the weekend and I was unable to get an XXXX back to my home 10 miles away. They told to go into a branch to get money and I had to tell them that they closed at XXXX on Saturdays. Next they said I can use cash app and link my bank account. After having to WALK 10 miles home and NOT being able to work my scheduled shift when I tried to link it to XXXX XXXX I it turns PNC dose not allow XXXX XXXX to be used. I have asked PNC to reactivate my old debit card and they said they could not do that. Then I asked them to activate my new card and they refused to do so and gave me " other '' options and every one of those would work but it WILL REQUIRE an active debit card. The last option was to use XXXX and I was able to link my account but it still requires the ACTIVE debit card to proceed. I do not have a car I can not just go to a branch. They have no knowledge of requirements to use 3rd apps and have no current options for account holders to have an ability get their money in emergencies situations or even care for that matter. For them to tell me to ask my friends family or neighbors to borrow money when I have it is not only insensitive, it makes me ask what is the point of using a bank if they claim you will always be able to access your money and trust them, but then destroy your quality of life.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received ( 2 ) text messages from whom I thought was the Chase Bank Fraud Dept. stating that my debit card was used at a XXXX and the amounts had been declined by the bank. I called the number on the text message, instead of answering the yes or no question, believing that I was communicating with Chase bank fraud dept. The scammers used the same type of IA recording that the bank uses and asked the exact same type of questions the bank ask, whenever I call the bank. They sent a text message with a code, and they wanted to know what the code was. My bank also does exact same thing. The scammers said that my debit card would be deactivated, and another one would be expedited and sent to me. They asked if I had been to XXXX Ohio, this is where the card was used at. So, I asked how can someone get my debit card number, and they stated that a scanner was used, possibly at store or gas station to retrieve the debit card number. They kept me on the phone for quite some time stating that they were correcting the issue ( but in actually they were wiping out our savings accounts ). I was also informed that a wire transfer was done and sent to XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was asked if I had authorized this transaction, I stated that I did not authorize any transfers of any kind. They also stated that they would report the crime to the XXXX XXXX XXXX and will continue to monitor my account for any other fraudulent activity. Later that afternoon, I received a total of XXXX different emails from what I thought was from Chase Bank. One of them was telling me that a wire transfer had been completed successfully for another amount that I did not authorize, so this time I contacted Chase Bank Customer Dept. and at that time I was informed that it was not the real Chase Bank Fraud Dept. that I had been communicating with earlier. The scammers also hacked my cell phone and was having all of my calls forwarded to their number at XXXX. The scammers wiped out our savings accounts for a total of {$49000.00}, through Chase online banking. Chase Bank has denied the claim stating that I could have benefited from the items taken, and will not refund our money to us. The money was sent to someone named XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  acct # XXXX in Texas. XXXX XXXX refunded us a total {$740.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. I spoke to a supervisor at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. and I was informed that I had no recourse for the balance due. This person has stolen all of our savings and neither of these banks are willing to help us. I have filed a complaint with the FTC report # XXXX, a police report with the XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. Case # XXXX, the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, and IC3 ( Internet Crime Complaint Center XX/XX/XXXX. 
These scammers are so good, they used the exact same logo as Chase Bank, their IA recording, stating that my call would be recorded and their email address addresses, and Chase bank 's XXXX  text number when they are requesting your XXXX code. They ask me the exact same questions as Chase did when I called them later that day. To the point that I felt like, I was being scammed again. So, on XX/XX/XXXX me and my husband went into the bank to speak to representative at the branch. He stated that our online banking account has been locked and the hackers has changed the XXXX address. The branch could not get into the account. I feel that our money is not safe in these banks with the scammers getting away with wiping out all of a customers life savings with no recourse. Something else needs to be done to STOP this now. Not once were we notified in any way that the accounts had been wiped out no text message of phone call for such a large amount. And XXXX month prior I transfer {$100.00} from my savings to my checking and my husband received a text message regarding this amount, but nothing when XXXX was sent by wire transfer to strangers..

I was shocked. She couldn't tell me why. 

I then for days I tried to get ahold of someone within B of A to try to understand why. They wouldn't tell me. 

I still to this day don't know why a good standing customer 's card would be canceled. 

XXXX person said something about the XXXX XXXX account which I am a volunteer with had something to do with it. But would not tell me what. The whole thing is extremely upsetting and makes no sense. This credit card is mine personal. The association which is called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is a small non profit community association. They have been around for 55 years never a problem. And I am only a volunteer.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, LA XXXX SSN : XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX To Whom It XXXX Concern, I am writing to formally dispute and address several inaccuracies and violations on my credit report, as well as to reiterate my rights under applicable laws. I believe that the accounts listed below have been inaccurately reported, and I am seeking the immediate removal of these unverified accounts from my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I must emphasize the urgency of addressing these concerns. The inaccuracies and unverified accounts on my credit report have had a profound and distressing impact on my life. The financial strain caused by these errors has affected my ability to secure loans, housing, and even suitable employment opportunities. 

To illustrate the emotional toll, allow me to share a personal story. As I stood before my dream home, the culmination of years of hard work and sacrifice, I was met with the crushing reality of the negative impact these inaccuracies have had on my credit score. The lender 's hesitation, the doubt in their eyes, and the subsequent denial of my mortgage application shattered my aspirations. The weight of these errors has caused sleepless nights, overwhelming stress, and has taken a toll on my physical and mental well-being. 

I implore you to take immediate action to rectify these injustices. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), it is my right to have accurate and verified information on my credit report. These unverified accounts not only violate my rights but also contribute to a cycle of financial distress that I am struggling to overcome. 

In light of these circumstances, I formally request that you enforce my legal rights under the FCRA and other relevant laws by : Investigating and verifying the accuracy of the disputed accounts. 
Removing any unverified accounts from my credit report. 
Providing me with written documentation of the investigation and resolution. 
I understand the vital role credit reporting agencies play in our financial system, and I trust that you will treat my case with the utmost care and urgency it deserves. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving a written confirmation of the actions taken to rectify these issues within the legally mandated timeframe. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
