Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally report a recent incident of attempted identity theft and financial fraud involving a fraudulent impersonation of Wells Fargo Bank, and to respectfully request your support in ensuring this matter is properly investigated and addressed. 

On XX/XX/year>, at approximately XXXX p.m., I received a suspicious text message from the number XXXX, claiming to be from the Wells Fargo XXXX Department. The message read : WellsFargo : Did you attempt to purchase on XXXX at XXXX for {$620.00}? Reply YES or NO. STOP to opt-out. Message and data rates may apply. 

Concerned about possible unauthorized activity on my account, I responded NO at XXXX p.m. Within minutes, I received a phone call from the same number. The caller, who identified himself as a representative of Wells Fargo 's Fraud Department, stated that my account had been compromised and asked me to log into my Wells Fargo online banking portal. 

Once I logged in, the caller began asking me to verbally confirm the dollar amounts in my accounts. At that point, the nature of the call appeared highly suspicious. I responded : If this is truly Wells Fargo Fraud Department, then you should already know whats in my account ( s ). You tell me the balances, and Ill confirm them. If you can not do that, then this is clearly not a legitimate call. Im going to hang up and call Wells Fargo Fraud Department directly and see if this is a legitimate call.

Upon stating this, the caller immediately hung up. I then contacted Wells Fargo directly using their official customer service number and reported the incident in detail. A representative from the Telebanking Department confirmed that no legitimate communication had been initiated by Wells Fargo, and that the call and text message were fraudulent. I was assured the report would be recorded in their system. I also submitted a screenshot of the fraudulent text message to Wells Fargo 's phishing reporting email. 

After researching the phone number XXXX, I confirmed that it is not affiliated with Wells Fargo but rather associated with previous phishing scams and spoofing attempts, as reported online. 

This was a clear attempt at identity theft and financial fraud. I took prompt and appropriate action to protect my financial information and report the incident through the proper channels.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On Friday XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated a wire transfer of {$14000.00} to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  PNC bank account, from my bank, XXXX. 

By Saturday XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered that the vehicle I purchased had serious undisclosed accidents and legal concerns, making the transaction a scam. 

Concerned about the legitimacy of the transaction, I contacted XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX ( the following Monday, the next business day of my wire transfer ) to initiate a recall of the wire transfer ( case number : XXXX ). XXXX claimed that they sent the message out to PNC right away and need to wait for PNC to respond. They asked me to follow up within XXXX business days. 

Despite filing the recall request promptly on XX/XX/XXXX, I was informed at the end of XX/XX/XXXX ( Tuesday ) that the funds had been successfully transferred by XXXX. XXXX communicated to me that they had issued the recall request immediately on XX/XX/XXXX, but the recipient 's bank, PNC, failed to respond in time to stop the transfer. 

I seek clarity on whether the responsibility for the failure to recall the transfer timely lies with XXXX or with PNC. This issue is critical as the funds were sent to an entity involved in deceptive practices, even after I had officially requested a recall. 
Given the complexity and urgency of this matter, your guidance and intervention would be greatly appreciated to determine the accountability and to potentially rectify this financial mishap. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your support in resolving this issue.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding my recent experience with Chase Bank, which I have been a loyal customer of for the past 10 years. 

Over the last XXXX months, my account incurred multiple overdraft fees due to an unexpected delay in receiving my paycheck. This was a temporary and unusual situation, and I did my best to address it immediately once I became aware of the issue. Despite this, I was charged overdraft fees totaling nearly $ XXXXincluding multiple {$34.00} chargeseven though I explained the circumstances and requested assistance. 

I contacted customer service several times to explain my situation, emphasizing my history as a long-time, responsible customer. Each time, I was told the system rejected my refund request due to reaching a limit. I then spoke with a supervisor, who repeated the same information without offering any further help or reviewing my account in a meaningful way. 

This response is extremely disappointing and does not reflect the level of customer care I expect from a financial institution Ive trusted for over a decade. The lack of empathy and unwillingness to make any accommodation, despite my clear explanation and financial hardship, has caused me significant stress and financial difficulty. 

I am requesting a full review of my account and a refund of these overdraft fees. I believe this request is fair given my long-standing relationship with Chase and the unusual nature of this situation. 

If this matter is not resolved, I will consider escalating the issue through other channels, including the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant consumer advocacy organizations. 

I appreciate your immediate attention to this matter and hope to see it resolved promptly and fairly.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Disputed Hotel Booking and Unauthorized Charge Request for Immediate Resolution On XX/XX/XXXX, my wife and I booked a hotel stay at the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, Florida, for the total amount of {$3000.00}. The reservation was made through a third-party booking platform, XXXX, and the charge was processed via our Bread Financial XXXX XXXX credit card. 

Our trip was scheduled from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. However, due to Hurricane Milton, all flights into Florida were suspended, and we were forced to reschedule our travel plans. We moved our vacation to begin on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, my wife contacted XXXX to adjust the hotel check-in date accordingly. During that call, a representative confirmedvia a recorded callthat the reservation check-in date had been successfully changed to XX/XX/XXXX. 

Upon our arrival in Florida, my wife contacted the hotel to inquire about early check-in, only to be informed that our reservation had been canceled due to a no-show on the original check-in date of XX/XX/XXXX. Because the reservation was made through a third-party provider, the hotel was unable to assist us or offer a refund. 

Despite multiple attempts to resolve this issue with XXXXsupported by both an audio recording of the date change and a complete chat log of the correspondenceno resolution was offered. To this day ( XX/XX/XXXX ), XXXX has provided no assistance or reimbursement. 

As we did not receive the services we paid for, we disputed the {$3000.00} charge with Bread Financial on XX/XX/XXXX. The dispute was resolved in our favor, and we were issued a full credit for the amount. Bread Financial also mailed us a letter confirming that the charge was deemed fraudulent. 

However, in XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed that the disputed charge had been re-applied to my account without any prior communication. This was particularly concerning as my account had been paid in full and was on autopay, resulting in interest accruing on the re-applied amount without my knowledge. Since then, Bread Financial has refused to speak with us by phone, instead directing us to send a formal Letter of Intent. We complied, mailing a certified letter on XX/XX/XXXX, allowing 10 business days for a response. As of today, XX/XX/XXXX, we have received no reply, phone call, or email. 

Additionally, there are discrepancies in the transaction log. Bread Financial appears to have recorded all three transactionsthe original charge, the credit, and the re-chargeon the same date : XX/XX/XXXX. This is inconsistent with the actual timeline, as the original booking occurred in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Below is a breakdown of the relevant transactions, all showing the same transaction date ( XX/XX/XXXX ), which is incorrect : Original Charge : XXXX, XXXX. XXXX {$3000.00} Dispute Credit : XXXX TRANSFER FRAUD ( XXXX  ) XXXX  - {$3000.00} Re-applied Charge : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$3000.00} ( Note : This description differs from the original charge ) As of XX/XX/XXXX, our credit card account reflected a credit balance of - {$15.00}. In XX/XX/XXXX, a new charge of {$2900.00} appeared ( approximately matching the disputed amount ), reintroducing the same issue without explanation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a savings account with Marcus by Goldman Sachs. I initiated an escrow wire transfer on Friday, XX/XX/year> at XXXX. At that time, the agent told me that it would take XXXX business days for the wire to go through. Because I was scheduled to close on a home the next business day ( Monday, XX/XX/year> ), I asked if the request could be expedited. The agent put in an expedited request and said the funds should make it by Monday. 

On Monday, I called XXXX back and tried to receive an update on the funds. While trying to reach an agent, I was disconnected several times. When I finally reached someone, they said that they needed to verify information with my escrow agent. I connected them to the escrow agent, who verified the reuqested information. When I asked for the timing of when the wire would go through, they could not give me a specified time. I called back and asked again, they said the escrow information needed to be verified again. I again connected them with my escrow agent and then they said the information was already verified. 

I finally got another person on the line who said there was a hold on the wire and it would not go through until XX/XX/year>. This is XXXX business days after I initiated the request. This resulted in significant disruption to my closing. 

Further, when I tried to cancel the wire, they said they could not cancel the wire. Therefore, I do not have access to the funds being transferred ( which total {$180000.00} ), while they are in limbo. It is unacceptable for me to not be able to access these funds for longer than a week period.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/scrub> 2024, I discovered my ex-boyfriend used my Social Security number and drivers license without my knowledge or consent to open a Navy Federal Credit Union ( NFCU ) account and obtain a credit card in my name.

I immediately reported this to NFCU, reset the account access, and I also filed a police report. I provided a notarized letter confirming the identity theft, text messages where he admitted to it, and screenshots showing his contact information under my name on the account details.

A Navy Federal representative accused me of knowing about the card and refused to help me further when I asked for support and understanding of the process out of concern for my safety. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX when he found out I reported him and kept bothering him about going to the bank to fix this and to pay it back.

Out of fear and the need to preserve my credit to move away safely, I paid off the fraudulent debt myself. NFCU denied my claim despite the police report and evidence. They also refused to give me access to account statements, the original application, or transcripts of my calls which I believe I am legally entitled to under FCRA.

Im requesting that CFPB investigate Navy Federals failure to : Properly handle my identity theft claim Protect me as a fraud victim Provide documentation Remove the fraudulent party from the account Restore my credit and/or reimburse me for the debt I paid under duress Navy Federals handling of this case caused emotional trauma, financial loss, and placed my physical safety in danger.

Subject : Appeal of Personal and Business Account Closures Dear Chase Executive Office, I am writing to formally appeal the recent closures of my personal and business accounts with Chase Bank. My personal account was closed last month, and my business account was closed on XX/XX/year> without any prior notice or explanation. This abrupt decision has caused significant inconvenience and concern, particularly because I have always conducted my banking in good faith and have not engaged in any suspicious or fraudulent activities. 

While I did receive notice regarding the closure of my personal account, I was not given any prior communication about the closure of my business account. Furthermore, I had a balance of approximately {$7000.00} in my business account, and I have not received any confirmation regarding the disbursement of these funds. I request immediate clarification on the status of these funds and the expected timeline for receiving them. 

As a long-standing Chase customer, I value the banking services you provide and would prefer to continue my relationship with your institution. Therefore, I kindly request the following : A detailed explanation of the reasons behind the closure of both my personal and business accounts. 

A reconsideration of this decision, allowing me to continue banking with Chase. 

A timeline for when I will receive the remaining balance from my business account, along with confirmation of the disbursement process. 

I respectfully ask for a prompt response to this appeal and hope to resolve this matter amicably. If necessary, I am prepared to escalate this issue through the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant regulatory bodies to seek further clarification and resolution. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response at your earliest convenience. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to bring to your attention a matter of grave concern that has significantly impacted my financial well-being and personal peace of mind. It pertains to several violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ), along with unauthorized credit inquiries, all of which have had an enduring impact on my life.

My journey through this unfortunate ordeal began when I discovered numerous inaccuracies in my credit reports, which I accessed in an effort to manage my financial affairs responsibly. Upon examination, I identified multiple instances where my personal information was incorrectly reported. To my dismay, these inaccuracies have unfairly marred my creditworthiness and financial standing. The addresses listedXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXare entirely unfamiliar to me and bear no relation to my current or previous residences. These inaccuracies, I believe, are a direct violation of the FCRA, Section 607, as they inaccurately report personal information, adversely affecting my financial reputation.

Adding to this distressing situation, I discovered several unauthorized credit inquiries that have been made on my behalf. These unauthorized inquiries, I believe, breach my rights under the FCRA, Section 611, as they were conducted without my consent. These unauthorized inquiries include those made by XXXX on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX  on various dates in XX/XX/XXXX. I can categorically affirm that I have no recollection of authorizing these credit pulls, and I implore your assistance in rectifying this blatant disregard for consumer rights. 

I am also deeply troubled by the inaccuracies in the reporting of certain accounts. Specifically, the entries related to the following accounts contain false information regarding late payments. These inaccuracies are a violation of the FCRA, Section 607, as they misrepresent my credit history and significantly damage my credit score. I have never made late payments on these accounts, and I demand that these inaccuracies be corrected immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX. 
Beyond the financial implications, I wish to share a deeply personal aspect of how these violations have impacted my life. As a dedicated professional striving to build a secure future for my family, these inaccuracies have placed unwarranted obstacles in my path. The emotional distress caused by these discrepancies has been profound. My efforts to secure housing, employment, and even simple credit transactions have been met with unjustified skepticism due to the tarnished image presented by these inaccuracies. The stress and frustration have strained relationships, caused sleepless nights, and undermined my sense of security and self-worth.

I urge you to direct the concerned creditors to diligently investigate the matters I have raised and to correct the inaccuracies within my credit reports. Specifically, I kindly request the removal of the unverified and inaccurate accounts detailed in this letter. It is my fervent hope that by doing so, justice will be served and my faith in the fairness of the financial system can be restored.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Whereas the customer agreed in XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  to make a purchase of {$7100.00} from XXXX XXXX with 12-month interest free financing and monthly payments of {$590.00} through Capital One, using the XXXX XXXX Credit Card. Capital One issued bills to the consumer in XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX for {$3300.00} and {$1200.00}. When the issue was raised by the consumer, Capital One initiated a dispute process that has yet to resolve the issue and resulted in the customer being required to make payments in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX totaling {$3600.00} while they work to resolve the issue. Capital One reiterated to the customer that while XXXX XXXX and Capital One made an error and failed to resolve it properly when first contacted, that the customer is still responsible to pay the incorrect charges while they resolve the issue. 

The sequence of events provided herein describes the actions of the Merchant and Capital One which have resulted in the customer being significantly overcharged in XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX and failed to deliver the promotion to the customer as advertised and agreed upon.

This was the email sent to executives at BMO - On XXXX,2025, I visited your XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA XXXX ) to withdraw {$6800.00}. After verifying my ID and debit card, the teller escalated my request to some department on the phone. After about 10 minutes of waiting I was then informed by branch manager XXXX XXXX that my account was under review due to recent wire transfers, including deposits from XXXX ( an online cryptocurrency exchange ). 

The manager stated the fraud department would take 3090 days to verify these deposits. This would leave me without access to essential funds... not only to pay rent and support my sick mother in Michigan, but also with a baby on the way in less than three weeks!

This situation is untenable. I have never experienced something like this at any previous bank ( XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX ). Furthermore, under the Expedited Funds Availability Act ( Regulation CC ), electronic depositsincluding wiresmust generally be made available in full by the next business day. While there are provisions for reasonable holds on large or suspicious deposits, those apply to checks, not direct electronic transfers like wires.

If BMO is deciding to close my account, I expect the full balance to be issued via cashiers check without delay. I refuse to wait 30+ days while facing eviction and hardship.This situation is not just financially devastating but its deeply personal and degrading. To make matters worse, I cant ignore the feeling that I was treated with suspicion not because of the facts, but because of who I am- a brown man walking into a bank to withdraw cash. Instead of being treated like a valued customer, I was treated like a threat. Ive done nothing wrong. Ive never committed fraud. I have a clean record. Every dollar in my account is hard-earned and legitimate. And yet here I am, being punished for simply needing to use my own funds.

Now, over {$25000.00} of my money is being frozen with no clear justification or timeline for resolution. I am behind on rent. I had to borrow cash from friends just to buy food yesterday. My mother is ill in Michigan and I send her support. I have my first child arriving in less than three weeks. What am I supposed to do? How is this humane? How am I supposed to eat and live? Please think as a human rather than a corporate representative. Ive attached my babys ultrasound to help you understand the seriousness of my situation. In just a couple weeks, Ill be bringing a child into this world and Im truly at a loss. How am I supposed to explain to my newborn that I cant afford basic necessities like food or clothing because BMO has decided to withhold my funds?

This is my only personal checking account, and yet BMO is holding my entire balance XXXX, acting as if I can survive without access to a XXXX XXXX  for 3090 days. Ive never experienced anything like this at XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX, or any bank Ive ever used before. 

I have attached documentation for all recent wires and XXXX withdrawals. I intend to follow up daily at the number provided ( XXXX ), via email, or in person at a local branch, including escalating to headquarters or media outlets if necessary. This treatment feels discriminatory and punitive, especially given my clean record and transparent account activity. I expect to be issued a cashier 's check immediately.

I am writing to express my frustration and seek immediate clarification regarding multiple issues Ive encountered with my personal and business accounts at Chase Bank. These problems have escalated to the point where my funds have been withheld, and my accounts are now closed without a clear explanation. 

To summarize : Deposit Issue : I mobile deposited a check from one of my company vendor partners into my account. The money cleared, but I later received an email stating multiple accounts would be closed due to fraud. 
First Response : When I contacted the bank, I was informed that I was not listed as the owner of the company the check was issued to and that the company was no longer active. I immediately confirmed information was incorrect during phone call and had my name added to the registered site as instructed ( I'm a silent partner in the company ). 
Further Confusion : After providing proof of ownership ( via fax from the company CEO ), I was told that the issue was related to needing further documentation. However, even after these steps, my account was still restricted, and I was unable to access my funds.

Ac

count Closure : Four days later, my savings account was closed. When I followed up, I was told my checking account would also be closed, and the deposited funds would not be released to me. Vendor Verification : The bank then requested that I verify th
e legitimacy of the company that issued the check. However, when I provided two phone numbers for verification, the bank claimed both numbers were not valid numbers based of their number check system. These are the same numbers we have used for years to communicate with the company and receive service requests, so this was highly confusing. 
Escalation Attempts : After attempting to resolve the issue, I had the CEO partner of my company contact the bank to speak directly with a representative. During this call, the representative disconnected without explanation. 
The most concerning aspect of this situation is that the bank has previously processed checks from the same vendor without any issue. Now, I am being accused of fraud despite having the business account being in both my name as well since im the personal guarantor with all the correct documentation. If the bank has allowed these transactions in the past as a courtesy, it raises serious questions about their handling of my accounts and whether I have been wrongfully flagged. 

I request immediate clarification on the following : Why were my accounts flagged for fraud despite providing all requested documentation and verifying my identity? 
Why is the bank now refusing to release my funds after previously processing checks from the same vendor without issue? 
What is the next step I need to take to resolve this situation and restore access to my funds? 
I would appreciate a prompt response and resolution to this matter, as this has now become an urgent issue affecting my personal and business finances. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I attempted to make a pick up order through XXXX logged into my own account. When I put in the card info and it recognized it as a capital one card it redirected me to an imbedded link that took me to their capital one 's website to make the purchase. There I had to log in and submit a code they texted me. I did this several times, logging in successfully with their code but then getting a text saying it was declined and to reply yes if it was me making the purchase. It did this several times, sending me decline texts every time before I gave up and decided to go in store the next day. When I go to do that I see I have a pending charge from XXXX for the XXXX I was purchasing. I check my XXXX profile, no order record, I call the store where the pick up was, no pick up scheduled, I call XXXX customer service, they can not find an order and tell me the charge will not post. A few days later it posts and I file a dispute on XX/XX/XXXX. I get a notice from capital one their crediting my account while they process the dispute. My available credit has not updated. I call in and I'm told it's not actually a credit they just won't charge me interest. That is fine but what I need is the available credit. I had paid the card off specifically for my move and now those funds were gone. I wait and I call and they tell me their waiting for the merchant to reply. I call XXXX into I eventually get escalated to a department that I can email who has to submit a ticket just to track down this ghost purchase. They tell me they confirmed the dispute in my favor. I wait and capital one still says they have received a response. I offer them the email and the proof they told me it was declined. They tell me they can't accept it. I get escalated to a manager and over 2 weeks of calls I finally tell them I will file a CFPB if they don't take real action. The merchant has already agreed to the dispute so they can not refund me. Capital One agrees to send me a link I can provide them information with. I send the documents I have, screenshots of their text proving they're glitchy portal, and the emails from XXXX saying they confirmed my dispute and that I should not have been charged. I get an automated document sent to me replying to the docs saying they've already responded to me and attach a copy of the document saying they're waiting to hear from a merchant and that they've credited my account even though it's not a credit. It's been almost 30 days since the dispute, a week since the merchant first told me they already confirmed the dispute. I'm told if they don't get a response they will side with me on XX/XX/XXXX. This is not an acceptable timeline. There is no access to the people actually processing the support and they do not hear out customers when they try to warn them of glitches in their system and offer no remediation other than to wait while a computer takes 2 months to automate something a person could resolve in a day. Making me do it on their behalf.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Cancellation of American Express Account and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - Case ID : XXXX Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a complaint regarding American Express and the recent cancellation of my American Express XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account XXXX I am extremely frustrated with how they have handled the situation, and I believe their actions have caused undue stress and financial harm. 

Background : I had a perfect payment record with American Express : no late payments, no balance, and no debt at all on the account. 
On XX/XX/year>, American Express cancelled my account without any prior warning or explanation, despite my perfect record. 
At the time of the cancellation, I had accumulated XXXX XXXX XXXX points, which were stored on my American Express account. 

Issues : After receiving the cancellation notice, I was informed in writing that I had 90 days to redeem my rewards points. 
For the past 30 days, I have been diligently calling American Express to redeem these points. Initially, I was told that the points would be converted into a balance that I could request as a refund. This was a suitable resolution for me at the time, but it has yet to be fulfilled. 
I have called American Express five times since then and even have a case open with them under Case ID : XXXX. I was told to wait XXXX business days for the matter to be resolved, but today marks XXXX business days with no resolution. 
When I called back today, I was told by a supervisor that the case would need to be re-opened, further delaying the process. 

Concerns : I believe this situation constitutes fraud. I spent my hard-earned money to accrue these rewards points, and those points have monetary value. American Expresss refusal to allow me to redeem my points, despite their prior assurances, is deeply concerning. 
I am entitled to the rewards that I earned, and American Expresss delay tactics feel like an attempt to withhold these benefits. 

I request the CFPBs assistance in resolving this matter and ensuring that American Express upholds its commitment to allow me to redeem my rewards points. Their lack of follow-through and continued delays have caused significant inconvenience, and I believe they are acting in bad faith. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to your help in getting this issue resolved.

For small-dollar transactions, to purchase groceries weekly for my family, I have had to contact Customer Service , and the Fraud Department , no less than 3 times last week, with the eventual resolution being " unblocking my card for future transactions at the merchant, '' and now twice this week, with no clear answer as to why low-dollar-amount transactions are being denied at this grocery store, while no other bank prevents me from buying groceries with my own money, from the account I have used weekly near the same date, for near the same dollar amount, and that the bank assured me they had noted on the account as not fraudulent. This week, it was assumed by the Fraud Department of the bank I was standing at the grocery store, making a call for their benefit, waiting on hold, so they could fix their error. It was then suggested I return to the grocery store, wait in line, make a grocery purchase, then wait a full 5 minutes while standing at the register, holding up the line, to answer prompts by text, to help the bank I am a customer of to troubleshoot and resolve issues with their fraud prevention system, for free, at the expense of my time and embarrassment with my family, and the expense of other shoppers.

My bank is XXXX where I have a checking account. I have XXXX. I have XXXX XXXX XXXXnsurance through my job. A few days later, I started getting messages that my card had been declined. On Saturday I went to log on to 5/3 website to see what was going in and just got a message saying that I needed to contact customer service. Customer service had closed and was closed on Sunday. I'm finishing up what food I have left by thus point. 

That brings us to today I could tasted customer service and eqas told that my account had been locked for suspicious activity because I deposited a large check from the same place that I have been depositing other checks at for weeks now as I also have short term XXXX insurance that sends me a check every week for {$1500.00}. I told them to ignore the check and let me have access to the rest of my money ( approximately {$5000.00} ) so I could pay my bills and buy food. They told me that it wasn't possible. I told them that ibwanted to close my account and was told that I would need to go to a local XXXX check to do so. 

I got dressed and went to the bank. The woman I spoke with could do nothing but call the same call center that I did. They told her that I couldn't have access to any of my money for XXXX to XXXX business days. They also told her that I couldn't close my account until that time. 

I don't have enough food to last that long. I can't buy more. I can't fill my gas tank or pay anyone to take me to my doctor appointments or XXXX treatments. In a few days I won't even have internet access to check and see what is going on with my account.

Please help me. I need food. I need XXXX. I need to be able to go online. I've got no one else who can do a thing.

During the time of the covid pandemic I righteously made my payments. 
I have reached out to discover every XXXX months to XXXX XXXX  to see if there is a way to lower the interest payments I have paid over {$8000.00} in interest, each time they indicate to me that that is the card I have. 
Recently I reached back out to them Indicating that we are considering filing bankruptcy they offered me a XXXX months interest program which I accepted and completed during that. Of time I also paid {$150.00} over the minimum payment. my card is on auto pay and has been for over XXXX  years.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Huntington National Bank regarding the delayed release of funds belonging to my late brother, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Despite following all required procedures and submitting the necessary documents, the bank has refused to release the money. 

Details of the Case : My brother, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX citizen, passed away on XX/XX/year>. He had a personal account ( No. XXXX ) with Huntington National Bank, XXXX XXXX, with a balance of {$24000.00}. The bank requested legal documents to process the claim, which we provided in full. The case number given by the bank is XXXX. Documents Provided : On XX/XX/year>, I visited the XXXX XXXX in XXXX and submitted the following documents : Death Certificate of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Limitation of Inheritance listing the four legal heirs : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Division Certificate These documents were authenticated by the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX and certified with the U.S. Consular Seal. This confirms their validity for legal use in the United States. 

XXXX XXXX : The bank is asking for a notarized affidavit, but in XXXX, notarized affidavits do not exist. Instead, we have provided officially certified documents, which are legally accepted. The bank has lost the documents twice after we sent them via XXXX. To avoid further losses, I emailed scanned copies directly. We provided a legal reference to the Ohio law [ R.C. XXXX ], which allows the release of small estate funds under {$35000.00} without complex legal procedures. Important Information About the Estate : No funeral costs : The XXXX XXXX covered all burial expenses, so there are no outstanding debts. No other assets : XXXX XXXX did not own any stocks, bonds, vehicles, or real estateonly the funds in XXXX XXXX Bank. No outstanding claims : He left the XXXX over 20 years ago, and all clearances with XXXXXXXX XXXX were completed. Challenges for the Family : All four heirs are over XXXX XXXX XXXX, and one is XXXX XXXX XXXX  making it impossible to travel to the U.S. to resolve this matter in person. The bank failed to advise Mr. Fuad to name a beneficiary, which is why this issue has become complicated. Requested Resolution : Immediate release of funds through cashiers checks, divided equally among the four heirs. A six-month validity period for these checks to allow enough time for collection. Direct contact with the general manager at Huntington National Bank to resolve this issue quickly. 

We have done everything required, followed all legal steps, and provided authenticated documents. Yet, the bank is delaying the process by insisting on documents that are not part of XXXX legal system. This has caused unnecessary frustration and hardship. 

I kindly request your urgent assistance in ensuring the bank processes this claim without further delay. 

Best regards, XXXX XXXX XXXX Email : XXXX Phone : ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX

Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Robinhood regarding the continued restrictions on my account and the subpar customer service I have received in trying to resolve the issue. Despite fulfilling all verification requirements, my account remains locked, and I have encountered numerous problems with Robinhoods customer support. 

Here are the details of my complaint : Account Restrictions and Verification : My Robinhood account was restricted, and I was instructed to provide certain verification documents. I promptly submitted all requested information, yet my account remains inaccessible. I even received an email from Robinhood stating that the restrictions had been lifted, but this was not the case.

Customer Support Challenges : Every time I try to contact Robinhoods customer support, whether by phone ( including when using a landline ) or through the Robinhood app, the representatives either act as if the service is unavailable or immediately disconnect the call. Additionally, they fail to complete support chats within the app, which prevents me from requesting further assistance for hours. This deliberate lack of follow-through has left me unable to resolve my issue and continues to create an impossible situation for me to get any resolution.

It feels as though Robinhood has intentionally set up their system to make it difficult, if not impossible, for customers to have their issues addressed. I am left feeling frustrated and helpless, unable to access my funds or receive proper customer support.

I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and assist me in getting my account fully unlocked and restored. I would appreciate any guidance on how to proceed, as Robinhood has failed to provide a satisfactory solution. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt assistance. 

Issues began on XX/XX/year> and are still ongoing with a over 10 calls and multiple emails and 12 files uploaded. 

Currently they have {$11000.00} of my money tied up and I need it to pay bills.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: Zelle sent money without my permission several times after I declined a transaction and my bank could not refund me back the money and that resulted in me not be able to make my XXXX XXXX  it coused trauma towards my family and my financial situation and I wanted to file an complaint and XXXX XXXX did the same thing with a fraudulent complaint on an account I had for 5 years and it never happened they all are fraudulent companies that pray on the weak we dont have money to waist or throw away

Had an 18 month CD with American Express Savings Bank at a prevailing interest rate. 

Received a letter by mail notifying me that the CD had been automatically renewed on XXXX XXXX XXXX with the following terms of 1.0 %, well below market rates. Market rates are presently in the 5 % range for 18 month CDs. The letter was dated XX/XX/XXXX and arrived in my mailbox XX/XX/XXXX. I immediately called American Express and was told the grace period had expired and was unable to withdrawl without penalty. Even after spending the next two weeks ( with three additional phone calls and faxed form ) my money was still in the CD. Finally, with penalty, it was closed.

First, i have never had a CD automatically renewed at such a below market rate. To me that is a scam to enroll people into below market rates Second, to receive notification after the grace period is ridiculous and i should have been able to close the CD without penalty. 

I find American Express Bank to being engaged in deceptive and irresponsible practices. 

I have closed all my accounts and will never do business with them again, and feel i should be reimbursed the penalty of closing an account that was financially abusive.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/25 I opened an account online with Citibank XX/XX/XXXX I received an email confirming my transfer by XXXX of {$700.00} transaction number XXXX ID XX/XX/XXXX I received an email, confirming my mobile check deposit of {$570.00} The total of these deposits is : {$1200.00} On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email stating that my account would close within 60 days On XX/XX/XXXX, I called Citibank to ask what happened and was told the account was closed. Information would be sent to me and a disbursement check for my balance would be sent to me within XXXX to XXXX  days. 

On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX  I received a XXXX  envelope inside I received a check dated XX/XX/25 check number XXXX in the amount of {$420.00} memo states close out disbursement I decided to collect data before I called Citibank to complain On XX/XX/25 I called XXXX to verify that my {$700.00} deposit went through. They said I would have to check with the institution I sent it from which was my usual Bank. 
I went to my bank in town and verified that the {$700.00} disbursement went via XXXX and XXXX confirmed that they did make the payment On. XX/XX/25 at XXXX XXXX  I called to complain to Citibank that I had made a {$700.00} deposit by XXXX and a mobile check deposit in the amount of {$570.00} For a total of {$1200.00} I also complained that I received a check dated XX/XX/25 check number XXXX in the amount of {$420.00} memo states close out disbursement The clothes out disbursement was nowhere near the amount that I had deposited. I shouldve received a check for. {$1200.00}. 
They told me to call back in XXXX hours. 
I called again on XX/XX/25 at XXXX XXXX  I was told they would have to call whomever issued the check to make sure that it was cashed I reiterated that I have an email verified a receipt of the mobile deposit, but she said nonetheless they still had to call the check issuers Due to the lateness of the hour, they were unable to reach the issues of the check so they told me to call back the next day. 
I called back on XX/XX/25 at XXXX XXXX  the line cut short and I called back at XXXX XXXX  And again at XXXX XXXX  I was told that they did verify the {$700.00} deposit transaction by the transaction number and they did verify that the check was deposited via mobile deposit and accepted I said it was imperative that I have this money right away and she told me she would try and reinstate my account On XX/XX/25 by XXXX  envelope. I received a debit card that I could not Activate because it did not accept my pin On XX/XX/25 at XXXX XXXX  I called Citibank again to complain that the automated system did not accept my pin to activate the card. They told me they could activate it through this phone call. 
They said that they activated it and the amount in the account was {$570.00} ironically, this is identical to the amount of the check I did for mobile deposit however, the check I received for {$420.00} they told me that the first time I use my card in any accepted ATM. I can set my pin. 
I further complained that the debit card had no CVV Card Verification Value printed on card so it would be impossible to use to make any purchases Meanwhile, the total disbursement that they have given me is an account with a supposed worth of {$570.00} plus a final disbursement check of {$420.00} Together these XXXX comprise a total of {$990.00} The difference is that Citibank still owes me {$270.00}. 
I am afraid to withdraw my money or to cash the check that they sent me because I dont want them to have any legal recourse to say that I accepted that as complete payment I need Citibank to either deposit {$220.00} in my account in addition to the {$570.00} that is in the account so so that the account totals {$850.00} Alternatively, they can send me another check in the amount of {$220.00} by overnight courier. 
In the event that I can not get a debit card that I can use with a CVV code printed on the card and/or in the event that I have difficulty withdrawing the full amount I will have to contact you again

Its been a big part of my life recently and I have heard horror stories of peoples accounts being deactivated for having the wrong word inside the description when somebody sent something or all their money being locked out and they say 180 days and it takes way longer. Im having an issue where my account was frozen and then seven hours later from an automated message which I know it was an automated message because there was no customer support or anybody because it was XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and I even had a customer service representative over the phone from the day before on Saturday. Explain to me that there wont be anybody there on Monday and I was told that within 3 to 5 business days, my account should be unfrozen because the biggest reason your account can pretty much be frozen is if you owe funds to a bank or institution of some sort, but for any other reasons, it can be frozen. You have to reach out with email and they can only chat with you Monday through Friday.  I asked them is there anyway we could put a notation on the account to expedite or escalate the situation because Ive been waiting on that money for a long time and were out of food in the house. My animal doesnt have any food we have bills that are past due that need to be paid immediately And on our budget were going to need that money to pay the rent. I will no longer be able to have an account ever again with them and my funds that are in my account which are over XXXX will be held for up to 180 days and that they dont need to divulge any information and thats it. Ive actually heard about consumer finance through XXXX  post of other people that had the same exact issue with XXXXXXXX  I mean many many many people have had the same issue about their vague policies and their vague reasoning and theyre terrible, terrible lockouts, and the activations for no good reasons. Consumer complaint narrative: I made a purchase of a custom ring on XX/XX/XXXX, for {$860.00} which to this day I have not received. While dealing with the seller, at one point XX/XX/XXXX he sent me cheap ring as a gift for being patient while continuing to wait on the custom ring I ordered. After multiple promises to send, and my having not received, I tried to cancel with him which he refused, so I went to paypal to dispute it on my card. Initially, the charge was reversed, But it then was charged back to me, as he had apparently provided the shipping info for the gift he provided, on XX/XX/XXXX, and the dispute department did not look at the date of it, versus the XXXX emails of the continued promises to send the custom ring. So I had the dispute reopened, and resent copies of the emails between the seller and myself, where he clearly says he had not sent it, and at one point states he returned it to the manufacturer.XXXX, I came out of a meeting to a voicemail from a woman named XXXX, who states she is a senior account manager, and declining my refund due to it being a custom ring. I am well aware I ordered a custom ring, as that is what I wanted, but I NEVER RECIEVED IT, and have sent more than sufficient evidence of this. When I attempted to return her call, I am told I can not speak to anyone in that department, and can only reopen a dispute once this one is closed, which can take another 60 days to resolve. If I had received it, I would have already paid this off, which I'm sure can be seen by my account history, but feel it is not right to pay for something I can prove, and have proved to have never received. And to have now been spending this extensive amount of time fighting seems ridiculous. As of today, XX/XX/XXXX, it is now reflecting on my credit report stating I am disputing despite resolution, although it has not been resolved. I have still not received the ring, which I can prove through the emails, and am still being charged for it.

Consumer complaint narrative:
During a recent attempt to use my debit card, I discovered that my XXXX account had been restricted and ultimately closed. After speaking with several representatives, I was told this action was taken because I am listed as a beneficiary on another individual 's account that has been restricted or closed. 

I am not a joint owner, co-signer, or authorized user on that account, and my account is completely separate. I received no notice or written documentation explaining the reason for the closure. 

I am requesting a detailed written explanation for the closure and whether any banking history flags were filed against me. If I do not receive a response within 10 business days, I will explore further legal options to protect my financial rights. 

Please treat this as an urgent matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Based upon an offer provided by my Amex XXXX card to earn a {$200.00} statement credit for booking a stay at an eligible XXXX XXXX, I booked the XXXX XXXX XXXX for XX/XX/year> to XX/XX/year> for {$250.00}. Amex confirmation # XXXX. Hotel confirmation # XXXX After the booking, I inquired with amex why I had not received the {$200.00} statement credit and the promised XXXX Membership Rewards points on the booking. They responded that the hotel stay I booked was ineligible becaus it was not a pre-paid rate. According to the terms of the XXXX statement credit " A prepaid booking is referred to as Pay Now on Amextravel.com and in the Amex App ''. 

During the booking process on amextravel.com, after selecting a room at the hotel, a pop-up is given to allow the selection of " Pay Now '', " Pay with Points '', or " Pay Later ''. I selected Pay Now and proceeded to checkout knowing that I had followed the terms of the credit. What I did not know at the time was that the amextravel website automatically reverted the stay to a " deposit '' based prepaid stay ( even after clicking " Pay Now '' and not " Pay Later '' ) that made it ineligible for the credit. There was no verbiage on the page that said this made the stay ineligible for XXXX or made it a pre-paid rate. Indeed, I relied upon the fact that the selection of " Pay Now '' at the pop-up was following the terms of the credit as any rational person would have done. 

I escalated this issue with amex travel and they refused to honor the credit and said I would need proof of the exact instance happening during booking. Of course, it would be absurd knowing I should've taken a screenshot of an apparent website glitch that I didn't know had happened until days after the booking. 

I contend that the amextravel.com website was performing an extremely misleading bait & switch tactic of making the user think they would select a " Pay Now '' stay and then automatically reverting it to a deposit-based stay and making it ineligible for credit.

I found multiple instances of this happening when I tried test bookings after the fact and took screenshots of the page where it advertised " Pay Now '' only to silently switch to a deposit based stay. These screenshots are attached to this complaint. Note that since the time I took these screenshots reproducing the behavior, it appears amextravel.com has resolved the glitch and I can no longer can find an instance of it happening. At the time it was happening at multiple XXXX XXXX hotels such as XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, etc. However, I also contend Amex is aware of this behavior as XXXX of the chat representatives I spoke with indicated that it was possible for a user to select Pay Now and for it to still revert to a pre-paid rate. My only guess is that Amex is silently switching users to a pre-paid rate when they have no post-paid stays available - certainly this is something they need to remedy to avoid misleading more users. 

I provided this info to the amex global complaint team who provided XXXX attempt at resolution and stated that even if they were aware of such an issue ocurring on their website that it wouldn't be sufficient to provide compensation for the glitch. This is extremely frustrating to have amex promise a credit to entice a consumer to make a booking, and then use an extremely misleading tactic to make said booking ineligible for the credit, and provide XXXX recourse to resolve the issue. 


I have provided screenshots of the bookings showing the behavior I encountered. In addition I have provded a printout of the forum at the following link XXXX XXXX XXXX This forum shows multiple other amextravel users who have encountered the same glitch and the same misleading tactics that resulted in Amex avoiding having to pay out the XXXX credit.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been trying for several months to lower my balance by sending checks to Barclay by MAIL to transfer part of my balance to a 0 % offer my mother received from her bank. She has kindly offered to help me with her offer, using it to pay part of my balance at Barclays. TWICE I HAD CHECKS SENT and TWICE, Barclay screwed up and the payment was not made!! I I am writing so I have a written record of my complaint, and I want to receive an answer also IN WRITING from Barclay, indicating EXACTLY WHERE I HAVE TO SEND THE CHECK AND WHEN IT WILL BE CREDITED. 
I am extremely frustrated and will not waste my time on phone calls anymore! I have spent too many hours over many phone calls with Barclay, since XXXX. I have explained it is impossible for me to keep making payments at Barclay 's high interest rates. I have been in and out of the hospital since XX/XX/2023 due to a serious XXXX XXXX. I am trying to transfer some of my high debt at Barclays to my mothers bank so I can keep my credit rating, but it has been ridiculously difficult to consummate a simple balance transfer. What kind of a Bank are you? 
I first had my mother 's bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) {$2000.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. I spoke to a representative and was told the balance transfer could NOT BE MADE ELECTRONICALLY and I had to send a PAPER CHECK to XXXX 's main US office in Delaware. I was surprised that a bona fide, modern bank would not be able to receive electronic payments but in good faith I complied. 
XX/XX/XXXX : My mother asked XXXX XXXX XXXX to send the {$2000.00} check there by mail on XX/XX/XXXX, which they did right away. 
XX/XX/XXXX : I saw the payment had not been made so I figured it the paper check was lost in the mail. My mother asked XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX to put a stop payment on that check and to issue another check for the amount of {$2000.00}. 
XX/XX/XXXX : I asked where this second check should be sent, since the first check never made it. Barclay gave me a different address in a po box in California. XXXX XXXX XXXX sent the SECOND PAPER CHECK for {$2000.00} by mail to that address. 
XX/XX/XXXX : Seeing the payment was not made by the second check, I again called Barclay. The rep said that was not the right address and offered to give me a DIFFERENT ADDRESS!! That is, place another stop-payment, be charged for it, and then have XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX send another check by mail!!! I respectfully declined and said I would just wait for it to arrive XX/XX/XXXX : My mother received a letter from her bank saying that Barclays SENT BACK the check, claiming it had the wrong account number!! At this point I figured out that Barclay is playing a dishonest game, trying to avoid transferring my balance there is no other explanation. I called Barclays and they said the check was made out for my bank account at XXXXXXXX XXXX, which is the bank I use to pay Barclay monthly. There is no way my mothers bank made out the check made out a check for that account, because my mother does not have my XXXX account number! So clearly, Barclay is either inept or deliberately messed up the balance transfer. 
I am completely at a loss for words. I am livid that a simple balance transfer has been so difficult. I want to maintain my credit score and am trying very hard to lower my balance at Barclays using an honest balance transfer.

To make matters worse, the transactions are usually less than {$10.00} but we are charge {$35.00} for each transaction. This starts a domino effect so more overdrafts and fees follow. I am XXXX and living on a limited income. I receive enough XXXXI that I should be able to pay my bills yet, because of these surprise overdrafts, each month, I seem to have a negative account balance that exceeds {$300.00} plus. This reduces my monthly XXXX direct substantially leaving me in dire financial straights.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, a {$2800.00} charge posted to my Citi XXXX XXXX credit card. 2 days later, I disputed this transaction. The merchant name in question is presented as " XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX '' and the transaction was a Card Not Present - Keyed In transaction that took place in Florida. 

After answering a few questions, the rep on the line informed me that this transaction has been resolved as Fraud and they'd be providing my account with a Credit. I checked in on XXXX XXXX, XXXX to inquire about the investigation, and wasn't provided with any updates. When I reviewed my statement the next week, I called to inform Citi that the charge has not yet been credited, and that my credit card bill was still showing the full balance due. The rep told me not to worry and to ignore the amount on the statement ( " we'll net out the credit and only withdraw that amount '' ). Fast forward to XX/XX/year>, I received a letter dated XX/XX/year> stating the investigation is now closed, and due to not providing enough information, the dispute was not resolved in my favor. Furthermore, I see that they withdrew that FULL amount from my checking account, which was set up for XXXX. 

When trying to get this matter resolved on XXXX XXXX XXXX  with Citi customer service, I was not left assured this " investigation '' was being handled properly. For one, no one reached out to me after the dispute, I was always calling ahead and making sure everything was fine. At every step, they assured me that everything was fine, when in reality, it ultimately resulted in a negative outcome. Secondly, I am under the impression that Citi is deliberately skirting Regulation E by marking the investigation as closed so that the dispute count-down will reset. In any case, I do not think Citi 's internal human + technological systems are adequate for this day and age. Their systems are adversarial to the consumer, and I recommend the CFPB investigating Citi 's adherence to regulations, especially Regulation E, as well as adherence to basic technological standards that protects consumers from Fraud investigations.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising about the credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Chase advertises that their XXXX XXXX XXXX includes both Lost Luggage Reimbursement and Baggage Delay Insurance when their card is used to purchase an airline ticket. On a recent family vacation, our luggage was lost by the airline but was later found. We received some of our luggage more than half-way through our vacation. One did not even make it and was returned back to our airport of origin. Our vacation was so stressful because of this experience. The only consolation was : we used the XXXX XXXX XXXX which carries both lost and delayed luggage protection. In fact, that benefit is the only reason why we chose to get a XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

When we filled a claim through Chase, we were told that we have to file a claim first with the airline. This was a surprise to us as nowhere in their disclosure that we have to claim with the airline first. So we filled a claim with the airline. The airline gave us a very limited compensation ( i.e., not even enough to cover the very stressful situation that happened to us during a family vacation ). We then filed a claim with Chase as they suggested. After weeks or months of producing documents for Chase, we were told that the " event did not result in a financial loss '' and they have to close the case. They essentially added insult to the injury! We wasted a lot of time producing the documents that they were asking for.

Chase advertising that their card carries Lost Luggage Reimbursement and Baggage Delay is highly deceptive. Nowhere on their ads did they say that benefit is applicable only when the airline did not compensate the card user. If we only know this caveat, we would not even use or apply for the Chase XXXX XXXXXXXX. Also, we decided not to purchase any other travel insurance coverage since we were thinking that the Chase card has all the necessary travel insurance benefits. We were deceived by misleading advertisement! We now want to close this card that carries a huge annual fee. Unfortunately, closing this useless card will impact our credit score.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: 15 U.S. Code 1681- Congressional findings and statement of purpose, a ) Accuracy and fairness of credit reporting. The Congress makes the following findings : ( 4 ) There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. Reasonable Procedures. It is the purpose of this subchapter to require that consumer reportingagencies adopt reasonable procedures for meeting the needs of commerce for consumer credit, personnel, insurance and other information in a manner which is fair and equitable to the consumer, with regard to the confidentiality, accuracy, relevancy, and " proper utilization of such information '' in accordance with the requirements of this subchapter. Further, under 15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions : rules of construction, The term " consumer report '' means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency ( Experian ) bearing on a consumer 's credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living... Further, under ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS, it clearly states except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term " consumer report '' does not include- ( A ) subject to section 1681s-3 of this title, any- ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; So for Experian to continue to furnish my transaction history, experiences and other, as it relates to XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Account Number XXXX XX/XX/2023, is against the law. " Reporting Transaction History is ILLEGAL. I have tried to resolve this issue with Experian on multiple occasions with no result. I am not asking for an XXXX general response saying that the account has been verified. Verification is not validation. I the natural person is the only one who can validate the factuality of any transaction as it relates to this account. Im not requesting that you run my name and address through a third party consumer reporting agency that is going to give you a generic generated response, I am asking that this account be updated with removal of all missed payment. the IRS defines charge offs as income and your policy is not to report income. By law it is my right to have this information removed. Validation can only be obtained by recording of me signing an instrument agreeing to the terms of a contract, or a physical contract with my wet ink signature starting that i agree to my transactions between XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX and myself to be reported to Experian and or any other third party data furnisher. I can not make it any clearer, Experian is in violation of my rights as a consumer, as well as the fact that the are selling my data in pools they create with others consumer files which the securitize and trade on a regular basis. This is not being reported to the SEC because Experian is considered a foreign entity. Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX I had a XXXXXXXX XXXX conversation with someone I believed to be XXXX XXXX ( my former neighbor ). Her account had been taken over and " she '' was selling items on behalf of her elderly uncle. I was interested in one of the items and was asked to provide a deposit to hold it. I was given her email address, which had her name in it and I sent {$210.00} from my PayPal account. As the conversation with the fraudster continued I started to get suspicious, and I texted XXXX XXXX to verify if it was really her I was speaking with. At that time, she told me it was not her and that she had been hacked. I had sent the money to someone who's name appeared as " XXXX XXXX ''. We ( the real XXXX and I ) immediately contacted PayPal to try to get my funds back, but could barely understand the person on the phone due to a lot of background call center noise and a language barrier. From what I understood, they'd " look into it '', but I had no protection. I was told I'd receive an email with the case details, but I never did, so I opened a dispute via the app. That dispute was closed in favor of the " seller '' in less than 2 hours. The details say I can appeal the dispute, but upon trying to do that, the website went in circles and kept giving me an error. I tried calling, but the automated system said I could not appeal the dispute at this time, but yet had only 10 days to do it. 
I was taken advantage of by a scammer and PayPal will do nothing to help. I asked them to pull the funds back from the fraudster, or at the very least, put a hold on the account so the money can't be spent while the investigation is underway. This has been the worst customer experience and I'd like them to be accountable to their customers in need. I am attaching screenshots of my conversation with the fraudster, who was NOT XXXX XXXX, for reference. I did try to ask XXXX XXXX to return my funds but he has since gone silent.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have learned that there are strict regulations to protect Consumers such as myself and our personal information, and that every company dealing with a Consumer has agreed that they would follow these regulations. In a gross violation of Numerous of my rights, they have chosen not to and have repeatedly violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Title VI of the Consumer Credit Protection Act, and The Privacy Act of 1974! 15 U.S. Code 1681c - Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. - No adverse item besides the conviction of crimes should be on my report, any item that is a derogatory mark is not allowed into consumer reports this is another violation.- 15 U.S. Code 1681e - Compliance procedures ( a ) Identity and purposes of credit users Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. These procedures shall require that prospective users of the information identify themselves, certify the purposes for which the information is sought, and certify that the information will be used for no other purpose. Every consumer reporting agency shall make a reasonable effort to verify the identity of a new prospective user and the uses certified by such prospective user prior to furnishing such user a consumer report. No consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report to any person if it has reasonable grounds for believing that the consumer report will not be used for a purpose listed in section 1681b of this title. ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. -By violating section 1681b for permissible purpose and 1681c for information contained in consumer reports, they are also violating compliance procedures under this title.- Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S. Code 552a ) Important Definitions ( 4 ) the term record means any item, collection, or grouping of information about an individual that is maintained by an agency, including, but not limited to, his education, financial transactions, medical history, and criminal or employment history and that contains his name, or the identifying number, symbol, or other identifying particular assigned to the individual, such as a finger or voice print or a photograph ; ( b ) Conditions of Disclosure.No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains, unless disclosure of the record would be ( 12 ) to a consumer reporting agency in accordance with section 3711 ( e ) of title 31. -Again they need prior written instruction of the individual to whom it relates.- Section 3711 ( e ) of title 31 States ( 1 ) When trying to collect a claim of the Government under a law except the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 ( 26 U.S.C. 1 et seq. ), the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall disclose to a consumer reporting agency information from a system of records that a person is responsible for a claim if ( E ) the head of the agency has established procedures to ( iii ) get satisfactory assurances from each consumer reporting agency that the agency is complying with all laws of the United States related to providing consumer credit information -Once again, they have violated not only the Fair Credit Reporting Act but also the Privacy Act of 1974! - PART 1016 - PRIVACY OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL INFORMATION ( REGULATION P ) 12 CFR 1016.1 Purpose and scope. ( a ) Purpose. This part governs the treatment of nonpublic personal information about consumers by the financial institutions listed in paragraph ( b ) of this section. This part : ( 1 ) Requires a financial institution to provide notice to customers about its privacy policies and practices ; ( 2 ) Describes the conditions under which a financial institution may disclose nonpublic personal information about consumers to nonaffiliated third parties ; and ( 3 ) Provides a method for consumers to prevent a financial institution from disclosing that information to most nonaffiliated third parties by opting out of that disclosure, subject to the exceptions in 1016.13, 1016.14, and 1016.15. -Every company owes me a privacy notice before they furnish any information to my consumer report, another violation! - 12 CFR 1016.4 Initial privacy notice to consumers required. ( a ) Initial notice requirement. You must provide a clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects your privacy policies and practices to : ( 1 ) Customer. An individual who becomes your customer, not later than when you establish a customer relationship, except as provided in paragraph ( e ) of this section; and ( 2 ) Consumer. A consumer, before you disclose any nonpublic personal information about the consumer to any nonaffiliated third party, 12 CFR 1016.7 Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods. Section ( a ) ( 1 ) Form of opt out notice. If you are required to provide an opt out notice under 1016.10 ( a ), you must provide a clear and conspicuous notice to each of your consumers that accurately explains the right to opt out under that section. The notice must state : ( i ) That you disclose or reserve the right to disclose nonpublic personal information about your consumer to a nonaffiliated third party ; ( ii ) That the consumer has the right to opt out of that disclosure; and ( iii ) A reasonable means by which the consumer may exercise the opt out right. ( 2 ) Examples ( ii ) Reasonable opt out means. You provide a reasonable means to exercise an opt out right if you : ( A ) Designate check-off boxes in a prominent position on the relevant forms with the opt out notice ; ( B ) Include a reply form together with the opt out notice that, in the case of financial institutions described in 1016.3 ( l ) ( 3 ) of this part, includes the address to which the form should be mailed ; ( C ) Provide an electronic means to opt out, such as a form that can be sent via electronic mail or a process at your Web site, if the consumer agrees to the electronic delivery of information ; or ( D ) Provide a toll-free telephone number that consumers may call to opt out. ( iii ) Unreasonable opt out means. You do not provide a reasonable means of opting out if : ( A ) The only means of opting out is for the consumer to write his or her own letter to exercise that opt out right; or ( B ) The only means of opting out as described in any notice subsequent to the initial notice is to use a check-off box that you provided with the initial notice but did not include with the subsequent notice. ( g ) Time to comply with opt out. You must comply with a consumer 's opt out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after you receive it. ( h ) Continuing right to opt out. A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. ( i ) Duration of consumer 's opt out direction. ( 1 ) A consumer 's direction to opt out under this section is effective until the consumer revokes it in writing or, if the consumer agrees, electronically. 15 U.S. Code 6802 - Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information ( a ) Notice requirements Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information. ( b ) Opt out ( 1 ) In general A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. -Once again they must give me an opt out notice for anything that is to be added to my consumer report.- 15 U.S. Code 6805 - Enforcement ( a ) In general Subject to subtitle B of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 [ 12 U.S.C. 5511 et seq. ], this subchapter and the regulations prescribed thereunder shall be enforced by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, the Federal functional regulators, the State insurance authorities, and the Federal Trade Commission with respect to financial institutions and other persons subject to their jurisdiction under applicable law.
